entries.docwu:161: [dismissively] Nightkin prefer to do that. [coldly] I give them chems sometimes. [with bitter resentment] Nobody pays attention to Doctor Wu. They're all assholes! [demandingly] Now, you wanna get fixed up?
entries.docwu:164: [irritably] Idiot! [quickly, under pressure] Cathedral very busy! [stressed] Unity keeps Doctor Wu very busy! [impatiently] Now, you wanna get fixed up?
entries.docwu:165: [with anticipatory glee] Now comes the fun part!
entries.docwu:169: [shouting] Asshole! Shithead! [rapidly] I'm very busy, and you have to bother me! [fiercely] Screw you! [commanding] Get out of here, you puke! [urgently] Now!
entries.docwu:170: [mockingly] You are healthy as a brahmin, but not as bright! [commandingly] Get out of here, you hypochondriac asshole!
entries.docwu:171: [with grudging willingness] You have taken some wounds. [coolly] I can fix that, dickhead, [sternly] if you stay very still!
entries.docwu:174: [with dark humor] Fine. [menacingly] But I hope I perform an autopsy on you by the end of the day!
entries.docwu:179: [with dark amusement] Then leave, asshole! [gleefully] I'll be laughing at your corpse real soon.
entries.docwu:180: [furiously] You little asshole! [with indignant rage] Who do you think you are to bother Dr. Wu? [contemptously] Stupid shithead!
entries.docwu:181: [with grudging willingness] You have taken some wounds. [coolly] I can fix that, dickhead, [sternly] if you stay very still!
entries.docwu:182: [clinically blunt] Five broken bones at least, and you've lost lots of blood. [sardonically] Being an idiot is hazardous to your health! [impatiently] You want to get fixed?
entries.dolgan:115: [with casual approval] Great job on hacking those Rippers. [wryly] What can I do for you?
entries.dolgan:119: [sighing] Sure thing. But it will take most of the day for a little improvement. You still want that?
entries.dolgan:124: [muttering, shaking head] Seems like we let in a fool. [matter-of-factly] Well, if you want to get into their place, there is a slight break in their moat. [deadpan] Look for it and run like mad. You may even make it across.
entries.dragon:112: [with gruff suspicion] What are ya doing roaming around out here?
entries.dragon:116: [gravelly and menacing] Your looking's cost you dearly. What's the story? Tell me the truth, and you may live.
entries.dragon:123: [growling] You found me. Now, [coldly] walk or die!
entries.dragon:126: [leaning in] What's the word on the Rippers?
entries.duc:102: [with a friendly, measured confidence] Well hello, wanderer. My name's Duc, and I'm headed into Shady Sands to do some trading. Perhaps I can interest you in some goods?
entries.duc:106: [with a gesture of openness] Let me show you.
entries.duc:107: [matter-of-factly] Yes, Shady Sands is part of my normal trade route. You can travel there with us for safety if you like.
entries.duc:113: [with genuine curiosity] Not many people brave the wastes alone. Who are you?
entries.duc:118: [warmly, as if greeting an old acquaintance] Hello again! What can I do for you?
entries.duc:122: [straightforwardly, no judgment] What do you want?
entries.dugan:110: [speaking rapidly, trying to sound intellectual] I pontificate on life a lot, and help the Blades understand the true meaning of Nuka-Cola.
entries.dugan:116: [nervously rambling] It is the stuff of life . . . Well actually, if I don't drink it on an hourly basis I get a splitting headache.
entries.dugan:118: [matter-of-factly, a bit defensive] About 5 litres a day.
entries.elder:101: [warmly, with measured authority] I am pleased to meet you. I hope you have found this little village pleasing so far.
entries.elder:104: [with purposeful calm] Excellent. I have a favor to ask of you. I promise that you will be well-rewarded for your services to this community.
entries.elder:106: [with a knowing tone] This is just a demo, but perhaps you will like what I have to say next.
entries.elder:108: [gravely, settling into the weight of it] We have been plagued by Rad Scorpions for some time now. All who have been sent to destroy these monsters have not returned. I will give you weapons and armor if you will follow my guide to their lair and kill them all.
entries.elder:111: [with cold disappointment] That is a shame. Please leave.
entries.elder:112: [with fatherly encouragement] Excellent. Sammy here will guide you to the lair. Take these items - they will come in useful.
entries.falcon1:101: [with weary dismissal] Yeah, whadda ya want?
entries.farli:103: [with military precision] Katja chu nee ka Chak'ra Farli.
entries.fgtcarvn:103: [straightforward, matter-of-fact] So you signed up. Good to hear it. So ya know, we leave just about every ten days. That's the 8th, 18th, and 28th of each month. Right now we're making runs to The Brotherhood, Junktown and the LA Boneyard.
entries.fgtcarvn:112: [with reluctant acceptance] I'll still give you a job, even though... never mind. Are you interested?
entries.fgtcarvn:125: [frustrated, exasperated] Couldn't just leave my stuff alone, could you? Why did you do it?
entries.fgtcarvn:145: [briskly, all business] Well OK then! It'll pay 400 hubbucks. Which route would you prefer?
entries.fgtcarvn:185: [with genuine approval] You did a good piece of work. You want to sign up for another?
entries.fgtcarvn:191: [impatiently] Got all your gear? We're going out today.
entries.fishrman:103: [with a friendly drawl] Howdy sir. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
entries.fishrman:104: [with a friendly drawl] Howdy ma'am. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
entries.fishrman:111: [excitedly] Wait a minute, aren't you that fella who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
entries.fishrman:112: [excitedly] What a minute, aren't you that filly who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
entries.fishrman:114: [rambling, a bit exasperated] No man's ever called me inhospitable, and I don't want to repeat what women call me, but I am trying to fish and I need absolute quiet to catch the damn things, so please try to keep quiet.
entries.fishrman:118: [chuckling, matter-of-factly] Do I look like a scavenger to you? Well, maybe I do, but that's because I spend a lot of time in the Wastes trying to teach my boy to fish and be a man.
entries.fishrman:119: [gravelly, with a note of concern] I haven't done any scavenging in six years. Too many Rad Scorpions. A fella could get killed out there with all them varmints running around.
entries.fishrman:120: [drawling casually] About eight years ago, I sold some chips in Junktown. I don't know what they did. One of them could have been a water chip, though I wouldn't bet on it.
entries.fishrman:122: [with dry humor] Mutant armies? Not in this spot. Just regular armies would be bad enough, heh heh.
entries.fishrman:123: [rambling earnestly] You know there's too much politics in the world. I keep telling my boy that these politicians can't wait to blow up the world again. That's why I'm living off the land, to avoid the politicians! Only way to live.
entries.fishrman:124: [with gruff sincerity] Now that's rather personal information there. I've killed men for asking less, just ask the boy. But I think you look like an honest person, so I'll let it slide this time.
entries.fishrman:125: [sighing with frustration] Well, I've fished this place for the last five years and it keeps getting worse and worse. I think it's Skunk, the three-eyed giant catfish, that keeps scaring everything away from my spot.
entries.fishrman:126: [with determined intensity] But I'm gonna get that fish, just you wait. It's getting personal between us, and only one of us is gonna walk away, believe me. I'm more serious than the Brotherhood of Steel about this.
entries.fishrman:127: [reluctantly, with weary resignation] Now you'll probably kill me, but if I don't stand up to you, I'll be setting a bad example for the boy. See my dilemma? Why don't you just walk away and make it easier for both of us!
entries.fishrman:135: [helpfully] Well, I heard about a big Vault way to the East, and reports of a secret Vault somewhere down south. And there may be some chips in Junktown and the Hub. Hope that helps.
entries.fishrman:137: [shaking head gravely] Mutant armies? Just plain armies would be bad enough. I heard tell that someone's been harassing the ghouls over in Necropolis, but that was a while ago.
entries.fishrman:138: [with self-deprecating humor] Now that's a personal question. My mother's womb, of course, but that's a little too flip. I don't have a home no more. Me and my boy just wander and try to survive.
entries.fishrman:139: [evasively] I do know where some caches are stored, but that's my secret.
entries.fishrman:140: [matter-of-factly] Well, it's kill or be killed - the Law of the Wastes - out here, but I'll tell you what. You keep killing monsters and I'll give you some supplies.
entries.fishrman:141: [with bemused bewilderment] Yeah you are. But what the hell does 'runk' mean? Whatever it is, I hope it's friendly.
entries.fishrman:142: [indignantly, rambling] Now I'm hurt. Here I go, out of my way to be neighborly, and you accuse me of rambling! Well! I don't offend easy, but you just gone and made me mad enough to nuke someone.
entries.fishrman:145: [casually curious] What do you want to talk about?
entries.fishrman:152: [dismissively, with a tired wave] Fine. Take what you want and get out.
entries.fishrson:109: [excitedly, speaking quickly] Hi. Aren't you that person who goes around helping people? You must got lots of interesting stories to tell!
entries.fishrson:111: [with a slight grin] Hi there. I see you're not stupid enough to be fishing here. What's up?
entries.fishrson:112: [hesitantly, voice cracking] Not sure. Dad and I have been wandering the wastes for so long. We had a friend, a scorpion hunter with us, but he went nuts and we had to kill him, and then we . . .
entries.fishrson:113: [nervously, trailing off] Hmmm, maybe I shouldn't talk about that.
entries.fishrson:116: [defensively, mimicking] It sucks. Sorry, I shouldn't use the word 'suck.' Dad thinks that people who say suck all the time are either brain-dead simpletons or inarticulate losers. Dad's always trying to sound smart.
entries.fishrson:119: [earnestly, with a slight wheeze] I saw a big thing like a giant spider with two heads, and one head looked human. Dad thinks I sucked up too much radiation. I dunno. Contaminated water does weird stuff to the brain.
entries.fishrson:126: [breathlessly excited, speeding up] Yeah. Did you ever hear about the raiders who fell into the Rad Scorpion nest and they all got stung and stung and eaten alive, except for the one who ran away with half his face chewed off!
entries.fishrson:128: [shrugging, matter-of-factly] Well he's kind of loud and boring, and I ain't sure he's my real dad. I think he musta stole me when I was a baby. But he feeds me most of the time, so I like him, I guess.
entries.fishrson:129: [seriously, with concern] They're big and they're nasty, and they're getting outta control. Dad said there used to be heroes who'd wander around the wastes and kill them off, but most of them are dead now, I guess.
entries.fishrson:132: [urgently] Big Henry used to go with us, and he was better'n dad and me, until he went insane and tried to strangle me. Dad had to shoot him!
entries.fishrson:136: [with determination, young voice full of admiration] A lot of heroes. The guy who founded the Brotherhood of Steel, Roger Maxim, he was a real good scorpion killer. When I get older, I'm gonna find out where they are and join them!
entries.fishrson:139: [grudgingly impressed] He's okay, I guess. Actually, I saw him hit a Rad Scorpion between the eyes at seventy yards, but it was a fluke shot.
entries.billy:101: [cheerfully, with a nervous edge] Hi there.
entries.billy:107: [talking quickly, anxiously] Why would you want a brahmin? Do you have a caravan? Well, it doesn't matter. I only take care of them. Dan is the one that owns them; he won't sell them though.
entries.billy:112: [fidgeting, nervously] Nothing . . . I mean, I'm taking care of the brahmin.
entries.billy:115: [earnestly, speaking rapidly] What's a brahmin? You must be joking. Why they're one of the major food sources and forms of transportation around here. They haul the caravans. Dan says this is a really important job, but it's the Bone.
entries.billy:121: [with friendly caution] You're not from around here, are you? [more seriously, whispering] I'll give you one tip: Don't get caught stealing!
entries.billy:132: [reassuringly, with a hint of amusement] Dangerous? No, not really. They can give you a really nasty bite, but they're pretty cool. [laughing slightly] They fart and burp a lot. I don't know why.
entries.billy:136: [pleadingly, voice trembling with worry] Please don't talk to me. Dan is going to yell at me again. [voice cracking] He really gets pissed - I mean - mad, when I'm not paying attention to what I'm doing.
entries.billy:143: [defensively, almost shouting] I AM working hard!
entries.billy:154: [whimpering, fearfully] Please don't talk to me, Dan is really mad.
entries.flash:113: [menacingly] No way. The Doc is sleeping. Come back later.
entries.flash:116: [aggressively] Hey, this is private property. You'd better be leaving, now.
entries.flash:119: [scoffing] Don't you know that women are the weaker sex?
entries.flash:122: [laughing mockingly] Take your puny threats and run home to mamma. You're talking to a real man here.
entries.flip:104: [with a deep, menacing growl] So, a human. This is very interesting. You will come with me to the Lieutenant, or you will perish right here.
entries.flip:108: [barking gruffly] Excellent. Come with me if you want to live.
entries.francis:105: [with serene breathy calm] Hi. I'm meditating. Did you notice? Can I help you?
entries.francis:113: [with gentle, meditative warmth] Hello, brother. Can I help you?
entries.francis:114: [with gentle, meditative warmth] Hello, sister. Can I help you?
entries.francis:160: [with eerie placidity] Hello, sir. Can I help you?
entries.francis:161: [with eerie placidity] Hello, miss. Can I help you?
entries.fry:101: [sternly, with menacing authority] I've been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isn't long. [coldly] I'll be playing close attention to you while you're here. Keep your nose clean in my city, [threateningly] I'm just dying for an excuse to get rid of scum like you.
entries.fry:102: [cheerfully, with eager helpfulness] Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.
entries.fry:107: [excitedly] Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! [proudly] You've reached the biggest city on the coast. [with uncertain enthusiasm] Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. [curiously, with slight nervousness] I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in with them?
entries.fry:110: [calmly] I'm not surprised. Most of the new members of our city come in with the caravans, even with the missing caravans we've had. It's a fine city [shifting to stern caution] but be careful who you associate with. [seriously] People like Decker and his thugs can get you into a lot of trouble.
entries.fry:111: [thoughtfully] That's surprising. [with concern] It's been pretty rough out there, especially with the missing caravans. [reassuringly] But you're safe now, [firmly] just stay away from the Maltese Falcon. [with intensity] They're a bunch of trouble makers, Decker and his crew.
entries.fry:117: [with resigned patience] If you say so. [eagerly] So, did you have any other questions?
entries.fry:118: [sadly] It's a tragedy really. [with concern] Some caravans have turned up missing. [helpfully] Butch over at the Far Go Traders is offering a reward for information or something. [encouragingly] You should check at the merchant market if you're interested.
entries.fry:119: [matter-of-factly] He owns the Maltese Falcon in the merchant market, [warningly] but I wouldn't associate with him if you want to stay out of trouble. [with controlled anger] He's nothing but a murdering animal, [frustratedly] but the Sheriff won't let me arrest him without proof.
entries.fry:125: [accusingly, with sharp anger] There you are, you thieving little snake! [shocked] I almost didn't recognize you. [shouting commandingly] Guards!
entries.fry:130: [warmly, with genuine friendliness] Hello again. I hope you like our town. A nice young man such as yourself, is always welcome. [eagerly] If you should decide to stay, I'm sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
entries.fry:131: [warmly, with genuine friendliness] Hello again. I hope you like our town. A lovely lady such as yourself, is always welcome. [eagerly] If you should decide to stay, I'm sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
entries.fry:132: [casually friendly] Hello again. [helpfully] What can I do for you?
entries.fry:133: [slightly impatient, with nervous edge] Yes? I don't have all day. I'm trying to watch the front gate.
entries.fry:141: [hesitantly, with nervous stammering] Really? I, uh, you should talk to the Sheriff. [anxiously] I can't leave my post right now. I've got to . . . uh, [stuttering] fend off any raiders that might come. [self-consciously] Plus, I'm not very good with reports.
entries.fry:142: [apologetically] Oh, sorry. I hadn't noticed. [helpfully] The Children run the Hospital next to the Water Merchants. [clear and informative] Go south past the Merchant market and you'll see it just northwest of the Water Merchants. [warmly] I hope everything goes okay.
entries.fry:143: [confidently enthusiastic] That's hard to miss. [proudly] It's by far the busiest part of town. The Merchant Market is a few miles south of here. [informatively] You'll be most interested in the northern section, that's where most of our locals buy and sell to the public.
entries.fry:144: [helpfully] Why that would be in the Merchant Market, a few miles south of here. Two of the caravan houses are located there, the third is further south. [encouragingly] I'd recommend the Far Go Traders. They pay well and they're not too crazy.
entries.fry:148: [uncertainly] Water Chip? [thoughtfully] Well, I've never heard of one. [helpfully] If it has to do with water, though, you should talk to the Water Merchants. [informatively] Their headquarters are located further south, past the Downtown area.
entries.gabriel:102: [warmly, if cautiously] It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
entries.gabriel:105: [gravelly, frustrated] This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
entries.gabriel:107: [with weary practicality] We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.
entries.gabriel:109: [heavily] We manufacture weapons and ammunition. [pause] We've been at this for the last 30 years. But the last 10 have been hell.
entries.gabriel:111: [gruffly] We've stripped the area surrounding our factory of all the scrap metals that were left after the war. [slowly] Now we have to rely on Adytum to supply us with raw materials.
entries.gabriel:113: [darkly, with controlled anger] At first it was fine. They supplied us with raw materials, we manufactured and sold the weapons. Then 3 years ago Zimmerman hired some mercenaries to help protect Adytum from the deathclaw and the odd random attack by raiders. Those Regulators are cold hearted bastards and are squeezing us for all we have. We make the guns and they get rich off of it.
entries.gabriel:116: [resignedly] We would if we could. But moving is a major undertaking with all the lathes and mills. These are things that aren't just picked up easily moved. [firmly] We could move but the deathclaw make it impossible.
entries.gabriel:118: [with sudden intensity] If you could get rid of the Deathclaws once and for all you could name your price.
entries.gabriel:121: [with grim determination] If you clean out that area we'll be leaving, but we'll leave behind more weapons and ammunition than you could possibly use.
entries.gabriel:125: [nodding gravelly] You clear out the Deathclaws, all of them, and you got yourself a deal.
entries.gabriel:134: [cautiously, measured] We need to be sure. We've killed over 20 in the past 2 years and they always seem to come back. And we could never figure out how. [pause] Let's give it a few days and if they are still gone we'll see what we can do for ya'.
entries.gabriel:136: [simply] Let us know when you've taken care of the Deathclaws.
entries.gabriel:138: [with a heavy sigh] I know, tell me about it.
entries.gabriel:140: [warmly, if cautiously] It's not often that we get visitors, can I help you?
entries.gabriel:143: [gravelly, frustrated] This place isn't very accessible, with a nest of those damn Deathclaw right outside our factory.
entries.gabriel:145: [resignedly] We would if we could. But moving is a major under taking with all the lathes and mills. These are things that aren't just picked up and easily moved. [firmly] We could move but the Deathclaw make it impossible.
entries.gabriel:151: [with relieved practicality] You got it- just take whatever you want. We're pulling out of here in a day or two, but we'll leave more weapons and ammo than you could carry right now. [pause] Just come back here whenever you need them.
entries.gabriel:174: [with shocked relief, then growing excitement] You what?! You've killed them all? [with genuine gratitude] Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum. [with open generosity] You name it and you've got it, my friend.
entries.gabriel:175: [with shocked relief, then growing excitement] You what?! You've killed them all? [with genuine gratitude] Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum. [with open generosity] You name it and you've got it, my friend.
entries.gabriel:178: [firmly] You got it. Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
entries.gabriel:179: [firmly] You got it. Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
entries.gabriel:180: [warmly, with genuine gratitude] Thank you my friend.
entries.gabriel:181: [warmly, with genuine gratitude] Thank you my friend.
entries.gabriel:184: [with satisfied finality] There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
entries.gabriel:185: [with satisfied finality] There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
entries.gabriel:186: [warmly] Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
entries.gabriel:187: [warmly] Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
entries.gambler:102: [with smooth charm] Oye, muchacho, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hernandez, a man of mucho gusto! You look like you are new here. Please, allow me to be your informant to the casino.
entries.gambler:112: [confidently] Perhaps you can spare a few caps? I guarantee success.
entries.gambler:119: [warmly persuasive] My friend, I see you are a man of much taste, as well. Perhaps a simple game of dice?
entries.gambler:123: [matter-of-factly] He gives people a chance to shrug off their cares in the broken world outside. And he brings money into Junktown!
entries.gambler:127: [casually, with a knowing smile] Well, Gizmo runs a pretty good house, although the games are, how shall we say, rather weighted towards the house. It's not like his dealers cheat, though. But unless you have a system, like me, you will need to be very clever.
entries.gambler:136: [with oily charm] Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?
entries.gambler:137: [with oily charm] Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?
entries.ganger:101: [raspy, menacing] What are you doing here? Answer wisely - this could be your only chance . . .
entries.ganger:106: [with brutish slowness] Set ain't here, so git.
entries.ganger:110: [in a gravelly growl] You gots some mental problems to work out. Set's not gonna let some loser like you take 'em down. He's got the guards and he's got the guns.
entries.ganger:113: [slowly, matter-of-factly] Set keeps at least two guards around him at all times, but he can call on more then ten if he needs it. And when he's in his throne room, those ten guards are seconds away.
entries.ganger:116: [gravelly, firmly] I'm supposed to make sure no one goes by. Dis is Zombie house.
entries.ganger:119: [with ponderous emphasis] Not a what . . . A WHO. We are the Zombies. If we do good, Set'll make us one of his guards. Now that's all I'm gonna tell you.
entries.ganger:123: [raspy, dismissively] You crazy. What do you think dis is? You better leave.
entries.ganger:126: [menacingly] I don't think so. Get out before I call the boyz over and dance on your face.
entries.ganger:129: [growling, with brutal certainty] It was. Now it's a fact. ZOMBIES!
entries.garret:101: [with raspy gravel voice] You shouldn't be here during the day. It makes Set unhappy. [growling] Come back at night
entries.garret:109: [gravelly and stern] You had better leave now.
entries.genchant:102: [with bouncy enthusiasm, singing] Hello friend! Will you sing a song of Praise with me? [melodiously] . . . Once I was wandering blind, In a land that was so unkind . . .
entries.genchant:108: [excitedly, with unsettling cheer] He finds you when and where you least expect it! [with fervent intensity] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Praise the world!
entries.genchant:109: [laughing with forced brightness] What a wonderful joke! [with creepy satisfaction] I used to have no sense of humor, but thanks to the Master, I am full of mirth! [cheerfully] Praise the Master!
entries.genchant:110: [in a reverent, bouncy singsong] The one who sits above. The one who sits below. The one who rests within. [with blissful certainty] Praise the Master for such clarity of vision!
entries.genchant:111: [wistfully, with unsettling eagerness] Oh, if only I were so fortunate! [dreamily] Perhaps one day the Master will let me kiss his body parts. [with euphoric devotion] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.genchant:112: [with saccharine sweetness, correcting] Hmm, that's not what I had in mind. [in a perky, patronizing tone] You had better practice, my friend. [with bouncy fervor] Praise to the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.genmutan:104: [with stern, gravelly authority] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
entries.genmutan:105: [with stern, gravelly authority] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
entries.genmutan:115: [in a low, rumbling tone] Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
entries.genmutan:116: [in a low, rumbling tone] Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
entries.genmutan:122: [condescendingly, with a growling sigh] He resides on Level 3, as he must. Why do you ask such a silly question?
entries.genmutan:128: [with suspicion, voice dropping lower] You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteousness?
entries.genmutan:132: [dismissively, with gruff impatience] What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
entries.genpalb:102: [barking sharply] Hold, initiate! What do you have to report?
entries.genpalb:108: [suspiciously] Hold! I recognize you -- you've visited the Brotherhood. Some may trust you, but I do not. [commandingly] State your business!
entries.genpalb:116: [barking a challenge] Hold! Who goes there! [sharply] State your name and your business!
entries.genpalb:128: [with urgent intensity] These are troubled times, Initiate! [barking] Mutants are on the march, attacking caravans! [demanding] We need information, and we need it now! [threateningly] Nothing to report is not good enough!
entries.genpalb:131: [coldly accusatory] This is our land, and here, your business is our business. [commanding] I repeat, state your business.
entries.genpalb:143: [grimly] We found a wrecked caravan about a day's journey to the west. We found one survivor - poor girl. [heavily] She claimed they were attacked by mutant humans with incredible strength.
entries.genraid2:125: [defensively] Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
entries.genraid2:130: [hesitantly] Really? What does she look like?
entries.gensarg:107: [with authoritative gravel] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
entries.gensarg:108: [with authoritative gravel] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
entries.gensarg:114: [growling, demanding] Show me your pass, then.
entries.gensarg:118: [with patient rumble] Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
entries.gensarg:119: [with patient rumble] Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
entries.gensarg:125: [slowly, as if stating obvious truth] Here is here. Why do you ask?
entries.gensarg:131: [with stern, philosophical weight] You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteous?
entries.gensarg:135: [with weary impatience, gravel-deep] What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
entries.gensupr:115: [with gravelly authority] Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.
entries.ghdorgrd:101: [with a raspy growl] Go away! You're not wanted here.
entries.ghdorgrd:105: [barking gruffly] The door is locked. You'll have to come back later when it's dark.
entries.ghdorgrd:108: [menacingly rasping] I told you to leave. Your kind is not wanted here.
entries.ghdorgrd:111: [gravelly and impatient] The doors don't open until dark.
entries.ghguard:102: [with raspy wariness] You shouldn't be here . . .
entries.ghguard:106: [in a gravelly, measured tone] That doesn't sound right. You'd better come along with me.
entries.ghguard:109: [with professional concern, voice grinding] I don't think you want to go to that room.
entries.ghguard:113: [slowly, each word grating like stone] We are here to make sure that people that don't belong in Set's room don't go into it. Not for Set's safety, actually, but for theirs. Anything else?
entries.ghoul:101: [with a raspy bark] Whatta you doing here?
entries.ghoul:112: [snarling through gravel-scraped throat] Donna be in my face likka dat. I runna dis show.
entries.gideon:101: [intensely, voice trailing] Jason is a living god! Only the nullified may pass!
entries.gideon:107: [spacily, confused] The walls also have minds . . . I saw you . . . tomorrow?
entries.gideon:116: [reverently, drifting] Yes, the walls are alive with those that have gone before.
entries.gideon:119: [dreamily, fragmented] Meeting of the soul . . . melded with, to protect, the Master of all.
entries.gideon:125: [whispering, voice trailing off] There is only peace and joining . . . the price . . . the pain . . . one must be blind . . . nulled.
entries.gideon:130: [softly, wobbling] I will anoint you . . . I must give what I must not.
entries.gideon:135: [manically, laughing] You cannot kill the genius of . . . the all . . . you . . . hehf!
entries.gideon:145: [ominously spaced-out, trailing] Those who have gone before . . . must stop your journey.
entries.ian:101: [with gravelly menace] We don't like your kind in these parts.
entries.ian:102: [gruffly friendly] Hello, stranger. You look like you're new here. What's your name?
entries.ian:108: [straightforwardly] Good to meet you. I'm Ian.
entries.ian:111: [dismissively, irritated] Sorry, but I don't have time to waste on morons.
entries.ian:112: [with a raspy cadence] I was a guard for the merchants of the Hub. However, I was shot during a raid by bandits. I've been staying here, since the people have helped me recover. Still, my knowledge of the outside world and my experience make me useful here. Shady Sands is my home now. Occasionally, I even get to visit Junktown or the Hub to do some trading, since I'm the only person here who has ever really left town.
entries.ian:117: [matter-of-factly] Shady Sands is a small but self-sufficient community. The only trouble here is with the bandits and the Radscorpions.
entries.ian:120: [gruffly informative] There are several. They come from various groups. They steal our food and occasionally shoot a few people. Seth organized the guards to help fight them off.
entries.ian:123: [with gravelly urgency] Radscorpions are very dangerous. They have a poisonous stinger in the tail, and they are very quick. Aradesh has been trying to find a way to get rid of them. If you feel brave, you could talk to Aradesh about them.
entries.ian:124: [satisfied] Thanks. It's been healing up well, thanks to Razlo.
entries.ian:125: [with a note of respect] Seth is a very brave fighter. He occasionally goes to the Radscorpion caves to kill a few Radscorpions, but they always wind up coming back. There are just too many for him to fight.
entries.ian:127: [straightforwardly] What can I help you with?
entries.ian:128: [with dry delivery] There are three groups: the Khans, the Vipers, and the Jackals. They pretty much hate each other, but they all raid Shady Sands.
entries.ian:139: [with patient authority] The Hub is a big trading center far south of Shady Sands. It's run by several different caravan groups of merchants: the Water Merchants, the Crimson Caravan, and the Far Go Traders. Junktown is a little south and a ways west. It's smaller, but still a good place to drop in for a drink. It's overseen by a fellow by the name of Killian Darkwater, the local shopkeeper, sheriff, and mayor.
entries.ian:141: [with menacing confidence] I may not be a very good fighter any more, but I'm good enough to best the likes of you!
entries.ian:147: [casually] Well, since you ask, all right. See you around.
entries.ian:150: [with gruff eagerness] Let's go. It'll be good to get back into action!
entries.ian:156: [with a raspy chuckle] Hmm. Tempting offer, since this place gets boring. Tell ya what. Standard rates. 100 caps, and you've got a deal.
entries.ian:161: [dismissively] No, I don't think so. Come back when you have some caps.
entries.ian:174: [with plain confidence] I'm a good shot with just about any sort of pistol, and I can use a submachine gun, too. I also know how to handle a knife.
entries.ian:202: [gruffly considerate] Can I do something for you before I go?
entries.gizguard:112: [annoyed, dismissively] I'm on duty. Make it quick.
entries.gizguard:120: [with a lazy drawl] Gizmo's a fair man. Pay's good, work's easy. Don't make trouble and everyone will be happy.
entries.gizguard:131: [shouting angrily] Get outta here, you moron.
entries.trish:101: [exasperated, defensive] What the hell are you doing in my room?
entries.trish:105: [scoffing, rapid-fire] No way! I'm not into that! Go talk to Sinthia down the hall. She might be available, but she is never free.
entries.trish:106: [sharply dismissive] Yeah, right. Whatever. This is my room. Get the hell out.
entries.trish:107: [exasperated, defensive] What the hell are you doing in my room?
entries.trish:111: [sighing, deflating] I used to think so. Now, I'm not so sure.
entries.trish:114: [sarcastically] So he says. If he did, he wouldn't be doing what he is doing.
entries.trish:117: [snappily accusatory] You would say that. you want to take his place right?
entries.trish:122: [muttering, confused] His fighting, of course. I don't get it.
entries.trish:125: [with concern breaking through the snark] Of course it's his boxing. He's a really nice guy, but he needs to get out of it before it kills him.
entries.trish:127: [coldly suspicious] Hey, I met you at the Skum Pitt. What the hell are you doing in my room?
entries.trish:131: [sharply, fed up] Just leave me the hell alone, you loser. Sinthia might be your kind of woman, but I sure as hell ain't.
entries.trish:132: [tiredly dismissive] You should leave me alone. I really don't want to talk to you.
entries.trish:140: [with surprising warmth] Hey, thanks for helping me out when those Skulz jumped me. There aren't many people willing to do that sort of thing these days.
entries.trish:149: [wistfully, then hardening] Neal owns the bar. He's a good guy, always treated me right. We used to date, but he got a little too serious for my liking. I don't want to be a widow.
entries.trish:156: [briskly professional] Welcome to the Skum Pitt. Can I get you something to drink?
entries.trish:158: [with genuine affection] Saul is my boyfriend. He's really good to me.
entries.trish:160: [coldly] No, as a matter of fact, you can't. If you aren't going to order a drink, then you're in the wrong place.
entries.trish:162: [gravely concerned] Gizmo, well, Gizmo means to take over the bar. And if Neal won't sell, I bet some bad things will happen.
entries.trish:163: [darkly pragmatic] One day, some punk is going to kill Neal for a glass of friggin' water or something stupid like that. In case you haven't noticed, running a bar is tough work these days.
entries.trish:171: [with a knowing smirk] Sorry, it looks like you're already a little gone.
entries.shark:103: [with a nasty sneer] Hey, fresh bait! So, what brings you in to our territory, chum? Here for a little fun? [mockingly] At your expense, of course.
entries.shark:109: [shouting eagerly] We beat up posers like you!
entries.shark:114: [giddy and menacing] Well, for this evening's entertainment, we've decided to thrash this place! [laughing] Heh. Grab what you can carry and let's see some blood run, eh?
entries.shark:119: [dismissively sneering] Ah, you loser. Go run back to your momma.
entries.shark:120: [exasperated and cocky] You again? Geez, some people just don't learn!
entries.shark:124: [with cruel amusement] Not a bad idea. Think I'll have one myself. [darkly] Of course, you always have to wash a beer down with some bloodshed!
entries.shark:125: [sarcastically threatening] I thought you'd get the picture by now, to beat it. [scoffing] Guess I was wrong. [eagerly violent] Well, at least it'll be fun to beat you!
entries.neal:106: [casually] Welcome to the Skum Pitt. What can I do ya for?
entries.neal:120: [quizzically] Haven't you ever seen a bar before, stranger? [with a gravelly chuckle] This is my place, the Skum Pitt. You buy drinks here. And you tip me.
entries.neal:124: [friendly, with a rasp] Yeah, same to you, buddy.
entries.neal:126: [in his bartender drawl] Well, just over there to the west of us is Gizmo's casino. I'd be surprised if you didn't know about it; most of the people here are the ones who just finished losing their money there. [matter-of-factly] Over in the other part of town you got Killian's general store, and Marcelles's Crash House. Killian's a good guy, runs a straight joint, carries everything you need. The Crash House is where you sleep it off when you've been in here for too long. [chuckling] Yeah, that place sees a lot of business.
entries.neal:129: [casually informed] Fella's called Tycho. Apparently a ranger from back east or something. Pretty nasty fighter, from what I hear, but a straight-up character.
entries.neal:131: [matter-of-factly] Oh, them. They're the Skulz. They're a local gang. All the riff-raff. Sometimes they start fights or cause a little trouble. Usually Killian keeps them in line, though.
entries.neal:134: [quietly, with weight] That's not a trophy, it's an urn. It contains my wife's ashes - besides this bar, it is the most important thing in my life.
entries.neal:143: [with genuine gratitude, voice warm] Thank you. You can't know what this means to me. You'll never pay for a drink in this bar again.
entries.neal:145: [with simmering anger] Some slime stole it. [voice heavy with loss] It wasn't a trophy, it was an urn. It contained my wife's ashes - besides this bar, it was the most important thing in my life.
entries.ismarc:108: [sarcastically, through gritted teeth] Oh, great. You don't know how gratified that makes me. Go away.
entries.ismarc:109: [impatiently] Thanks. What can I do for ya?
entries.ismarc:114: [exasperatedly] What?!? I don't have time for this.
entries.ismarc:115: [matter-of-factly, with a hint of annoyance] Yeah, I sing at the Hub sometimes, and I've visited the Brotherhood of Steel and Adytum with the caravans. Why do you ask?
entries.ismarc:120: [snippily] The Hub? Oh, it's just a short distance down south of Junktown. What else?
entries.ismarc:121: [rapidly, irritated] The Brotherhood is a couple days west and a little bit north of here. Don't go there, though. They won't let you in unless you're with a caravan. You need anything else?
entries.ismarc:122: [grudgingly] Hmm. Head southwest of the Hub. Adytum is part of the Boneyard. It's a small, semi-industrial town. I didn't like it much there. What else do you want?
entries.ismarc:123: [with weary gratitude] Hey, thanks. It's hard being a starving artist. You got anything you need to know, you just ask.
entries.ismarc:124: [dismissively, with a tired sigh] I appreciate the thought and all, but you're strapped worse than I am.
entries.ismarc:125: [slowly, reflective beneath the frustration] Ah, I picked it up here and there. Learned a little from an old singer at the Hub, and got some music from the scavs in Adytum, in the Boneyard. You know. Just takes some practice.
entries.gustofer:104: [casually] You might try signing up with Gizmo. I hear he's always looking for new meat to toss in the ring.
entries.gustofer:105: [helpfully] Try again tomorrow. Saul will be boxing then.
entries.gustofer:106: [matter-of-factly] You just missed it. Try again in a couple of days. Saul boxes every three days.
entries.gustofer:109: [with pride] Saul is the local champion. Saul is the current favorite of Gizmo.
entries.gustofer:113: [enthusiastically] So! Want to lay a bet on the fight?
entries.gustofer:118: [apologetically] Sorry, but today's match is already over.
entries.gustofer:120: [with rapid energy, like a carnival barker] Who do you want to bet on, Saul or the challenger? Odds favor Saul winning. Cost is 25 caps to bet; you get 50 if you win betting on Saul, 100 if you win betting on the challenger!
entries.gustofer:127: [dismissively, in a hurry] Sorry, I don't have the time. Maybe later.
entries.gustofer:128: [shouting with infectious enthusiasm, voice jumping higher] Saul, the fastest fist in Junktown! He's a marvel of manly musculature! A pulsating power puncher!
entries.gustofer:129: [warmly, friendly] He's a nice guy, too.
entries.gustofer:132: [conversationally] Gizmo, the casino owner, employs Saul. He occasionally likes to watch a match or two, but mostly it's good money - people will bet a lot on a fight. And nobody has to get killed, unlike those death matches they supposedly have in the Hub.
entries.gustofer:135: [seriously, with a slight shrug in voice] Well, it's just a rumor. But they say there's an underground fighting ring there where you can pay to watch people fight to the death. Not my kind of fight.
entries.gustofer:137: [surprised, mildly annoyed] Hey, what are you doing?
entries.gustofer:141: [awkwardly backing down] Uh, no. Never mind. Forget I said anything.
entries.gustofer:142: [cheerfully, with a big smile in voice] Well, well, looks like you're a winner! Here's your caps.
entries.gustofer:143: [dismissively friendly] Come back when you have enough caps to bet!
entries.gustofer:144: [helpfully] Would you like to wait here until the fight starts at 2:00?
entries.gustofer:147: [sternly cautioning] Okay, but if you miss, the fight, you forfeit your bet!
entries.gustofer:149: [impatiently, irritated] Please don't disturb me while the match is in progress.
entries.gustofer:150: [sympathetically] Well, you can't win them all, my friend. Better luck next time.
entries.gustofer:151: [sympathetically] Well, you can't win them all, my friend. Better luck next time.
entries.gustofer:152: [with a tone of finality] Sorry, one bet per fight.
entries.phil:112: [sarcastically] Mebbe you can talk it to death.
entries.phil:113: [irritably] It won't let us back into our house, that's why.
entries.phil:116: [exasperatedly] It was the 'pet' of a traveller. When the traveller died, this damn dog just plopped its furry ass down on my doorstep and wouldn't leave. [fed up] It's been there for days.
entries.phil:120: [muttering] I don't know. Some guy. [dismissively] He came from the east, he said. [scoffing] Like anyone could get past the deadlands to the east. [bitterly] He ran afoul of Gizmo, trying to interfere with Gizmo's business.
entries.phil:121: [grimly] So, Gizmo had a couple of boys beat him up and throw him from the casino roof. [matter-of-factly] The traveller broke his damnfool neck and died. [muttering] The dog was pissed.
entries.phil:123: [gruffly] Oh, the guy was tall, dark-haired with a little graying around the edges. He was dressed all in black leather, like that's a good idea in the desert, and carried a shotgun.
entries.phil:124: [shrugging dismissively] He had some funny accent. [dryly] The dog was his constant companion, followed him everywhere.
entries.sinthia:106: [warmly teasing] Oh, baby, I understand. You gotta run home to momma. Well, come back here when you need some luvin'!
entries.sinthia:107: [with a sultry purr] Yeah, sweets, same to you.
entries.sinthia:108: [sweetly reassuring] You'll find whatever, or whoever, you're looking for, honey, and that'll make you all better, I'm sure.
entries.sinthia:109: [playfully suggestive] Maybe I can help you with that.
entries.sinthia:112: [with a knowing laugh] Oh, baby, if you got to ask . . . more than you can afford. Maybe next time, sugar. See you around.
entries.sinthia:113: [with a dismissive wrinkle] Oh, sugar, that's just plain disgusting.
entries.sinthia:118: [softly, with genuine warmth] Thank you for what you did. No one ever took care of me like that before.
entries.sinthia:123: [with exasperated sass] Is that all you can think about? Geez. Some people.
entries.sinthia:124: [bitterly] I mean, my boss didn't even send some of his goons to help. You'd think for all the cash I make for that loser, he would at least live up to his part of the bargain.
entries.sinthia:127: [matter-of-factly] Gizmo, of course. He runs all the sin in this town. Killian sure as hell wouldn't put up with me or my kind. If it wasn't for the fact that I make Giz a whole hell of a lot of money, I'd have to do other things to him.
entries.sinthia:128: [with a sour grimace] And, honey, those thoughts just don't do my stomach a whole lot of good.
entries.sinthia:131: [sighing, resigned] You're telling me. But what else can I do? It seems like my life has been designed by someone else. Oh, well. A girl has to make a living.
entries.sinthia:132: [with genuine warmth] But sugar, this one's for free.
entries.sinthia:133: [with solidarity and a smile] Thanks again, honey. We women gotta stick together.
entries.sinthia:134: [listing grimly] Just about every bad thing a person could do in this town. He owns the Casino. He runs me and some of the other gals, even some little kids. I hear he is trying to take over the bar.
entries.sinthia:136: [lowering voice, darkly] Giz wants to take care of Killian, if you get my meaning.
entries.sinthia:137: [matter-of-factly, with practiced ease] Why, honey, I take care of men, and they take care of me in return. Gizmo gets 25% and I supposedly get his protection. You saw how well that went, huh?"
entries.sinthia:141: [shocked and furious] You shit! You killed him! Why did you have to kill him? You bastard! I can't believe you killed him. All he wanted was someone to talk to. You don't care about human life, do you?
entries.sinthia:142: [shocked and furious] You shit! You killed him! Why did you have to kill him? You bitch! I can't believe you killed him. All he wanted was someone to talk to. You don't care about human life, do you?
entries.sinthia:143: [coldly furious] Just get the hell out of my room!
entries.sinthia:144: [devastated] You killed him! I can't believe you killed him. All he wanted was someone to talk to . . .
entries.sinthia:147: [with cold dismissal] Yeah, whatever. Get the hell out of my room!
entries.sinthia:148: [with relieved realization] Oh, sorry. I though he was dead. I though you killed him. He's not such a bad guy, after all. Just a little lonely.
entries.sinthia:150: [professionally pleasant] You again. What can I help you with this time?
entries.sinthia:154: [with a knowing, sultry laugh] Ah, honey, I don't think so. Imagine how the children would turn out.
entries.sinthia:155: [warmly grateful] Doing fine, thanks to you, sugar.
entries.sinthia:156: [briskly businesslike] What do you want to know, but make it short, honey, I'm on the clock.
entries.sinthia:161: [with a knowing chuckle] Hmm. I know about eight, personally, if you get my meaning. I think he has another ten or so.
entries.sinthia:162: [rolling her eyes] Money? How would I know? He only takes my money, he doesn't show me his. I would guess that it's in his bedroom, but for all I know, he could keep it where the sun doesn't shine. And for Giz, that's a big place.
entries.sinthia:163: [with a mocking laugh] Only that he thinks he doesn't have any. Well, that and he's a fat slob, who can't move for a damn. He's got to have his guards help him move around. Even then, they gotta use a little tricycle. Heh heh.
entries.sinthia:167: [with friendly firmness] Honey, you need some more money. I like you and all, but a girl has to make a living.
entries.sinthia:168: [coldly, with finality] I reserve the right to refuse admittance, and honey, you ain't getting nowhere near me!
entries.marcelle:102: [frantically] Thank god you're here! Some crazy guy has Sinthia held hostage. He's threatening to kill her! You've got to help.
entries.marcelle:106: [urgently, voice wavering] Oh, geez, I hope you can do it. He's in her room. Help her!
entries.marcelle:107: [coldly accusing] You are an incredibly cold person. She could die without your help.
entries.marcelle:111: [with genuine warmth] Thank you for helping Sinthia. She's usually not a problem. You deserve a good night's sleep. On me. [dismissively] But don't ask for another freebie.
entries.marcelle:114: [all business] No problem. Room #1. Follow me.
entries.marcelle:116: [with bitter fury] You should have saved Sinthia. It's your fault she died. I hope you are happy with yourself.
entries.marcelle:119: [professionally neutral] Welcome to the Crash House. How can I help you, stranger?
entries.marcelle:124: [matter-of-factly] Yeah, we serve your kind, too. It'll be $25 for the night. A week will cost you $150.
entries.marcelle:128: [briefly cordial] Yeah, you too. Have a good day.
entries.marcelle:129: [practical, slightly stern] Okay, thanks. Your room is room #1. Follow me. Don't be shooting any guns in here, okay?
entries.marcelle:131: [flatly] You need some money before I can rent you a room.
entries.marcelle:132: [dismissively] Then you should try the Skum Pitt. I heard you can get a lot of water in your booze there.
entries.marcelle:133: [in a straightforward drawl] I don't know about that, but I will rent you a room. It's a good place to rest and heal up. $25 for a day, or a week is $150. Most people go for the weekly rate. You should, if you ask me.
entries.marcelle:137: [gruffly, with a shrug in her voice] I'm just a hotel manager, bub. Don't ask too much of me.
entries.marcelle:139: [dryly] I know you're $50 poorer. I don't do the gossip thing, okay? Come back if you want a room.
entries.marcelle:140: [incredulously] What do you think I am? A fool? If you're gonna bribe me, have enough money.
entries.marcelle:141: [casually] Welcome back, what can I do for you?
entries.marcelle:144: [flatly stating the obvious] You're already renting room #1 from me. Do you want me to show you where it is?
entries.marcelle:150: [matter-of-factly] You know the drill. One day is $25. One week is $150.
entries.marcelle:154: [repeating herself with slight impatience] Sure. It's $25 a day, or $150 for the entire week.
entries.marcelle:158: [professionally polite] Okay. Room #1 is yours. Have a nice stay.
entries.marcelle:163: [dismissively cold] I don't like your face. I don't think I'll be renting you a room.
entries.marcelle:166: [laying down the law] Okay. One night. $100.
entries.marcelle:169: [impatiently] Deal with it. Yes or no.
entries.marcelle:172: [briskly professional] Good. Here you go. Room #1. Have a nice night, check out time is 11 o' clock.
entries.marcelle:173: [quietly dangerous] You killed Killian, didn't you?
entries.marcelle:177: [shouting, voice ragged with emotion] Get out! You're too dumb to realize what you did, but my life is hell now!
entries.marcelle:178: [seething with barely controlled rage] You son of a bitch. I can't believe you killed him. He was a good man, and now I get all sorts of hell . . . get out, and don't come back.
entries.marcelle:179: [threateningly, with a gravelly growl] Yeah, whatever you say, but that's not what I heard. You'd better behave around here, or I'll get out ol' Betsy and ram some buckshot up your ass.
entries.vinnie:103: [with a sneering swagger] You're on Skulz turf, stranger. You'd better talk quick.
entries.vinnie:107: [defensively snapping] Yeah, you bet this is the wrong room!
entries.vinnie:108: [boasting loudly] We are the one and only Junktown gang. We have the run of the streets, and we rule the city at night.
entries.vinnie:112: [angrily, through gritted teeth] Get out of here, you moron!
entries.vinnie:113: [sneering with bratty swagger] That slob can't even stand up by himself. We're the muscle in this town. We take what we want.
entries.vinnie:116: [indignantly shouting] What?! You'll pay for that remark!
entries.vinnie:117: [with calculating menace] We don't bother Killian and he doesn't bother us as long as we keep it low-key. You get me?
entries.vinnie:120: [angrily, raising his voice] We don't take that from anybody, least of all Killian! Just because he thinks he's a glorified sheriff doesn't mean that he controls the Skulz!
entries.vinnie:126: [impatiently, with attitude] What do you want now?
entries.vinnie:131: [sneering, sizing you up] You want to join us, huh? How do we know you're tough enough to be a Skul?
entries.vinnie:140: [thoughtfully, then with cruel amusement] If you want to prove you belong in the Skulz, I want you to steal that old bastard's wife's ashes. Heh. [muttering darkly] Let's make Neal suffer for his last couple of hours . . .
entries.vinnie:146: [with bratty confidence] If you're hard enough to do that, mebbe you'd make a Skal after all. Bring it here once you've got it.
entries.vinnie:147: [dismissively, sneering] I knew you weren't Skulz material. Get the hell out of here.
entries.vinnie:152: [laughing cruelly, with menacing glee] Ha ha! Let that old cock suffer until we off him tonight - are you in?
entries.vinnie:156: [annoyed, nasal whining] What are you wasting my time for?
entries.vinnie:157: [with surprised warmth, then voice cracking] That'll show that old fuck. Thanks for taking care of him for us. You're a Skul, now.
entries.vinnie:158: [coolly, with street-punk authority] Uh, all right . . . meet us later, but don't take too long.
entries.vinnie:165: [eagerly, with anticipation] You ready to take out Neal?
entries.vinnie:169: [with cold finality, drawling menacingly] It's too late for that, slick. When you're out, you're way out.
entries.victor:103: [giggling with unsettling delight] New blood. Heh. Heh heh.
entries.victor:107: [with creepy cheerful excitement] No, actually, I think I'll keep you around for a while.
entries.victor:108: [bouncing excitedly] Why do you say that? I'm quite happy. I'm very happy because there are lots of things that bleed.
entries.victor:112: [voice cracking with petulant rage] Don't say that! My mother said that! [whining] I'll make you pay! I'm a good boy, right mommy?
entries.victor:113: [with manic relief] Someone who understands me! At last!
entries.victor:114: [in a gleeful singsong] Hello again, my artistic friend.
entries.victor:115: [cackling with unhinged hysteria] Ha! Ha! Heh heh hee! Ho ho ha!
entries.jtgengrd:110: [drawling, earnestly] You'd better put that away. Junktown is a friendly place, friend, and we want to keep it that way.
entries.jtgengrd:115: [with slight exasperation] Your weapon, idiot. [muttering] Killian won't take your arms away, but you'd better damn well keep them in your holster.
entries.jtgengrd:118: [authoritatively, though uncertain] You'd better behave, since it's the law, and I enforce the law. [firmly] Put your weapon away, don't draw it unless in self-defense, and you won't have a problem with us guards. [threateningly, but without real conviction] Disobey the law, and we will return you to the lawless wasteland - dead or alive.
entries.jtgengrd:121: [hesitantly] Well, uh, fine with me. [warningly] But you'd better be careful.
entries.jtgengrd:122: [settling in, drawling] Good you asked. [matter-of-factly] No weapons can be drawn except in self-defense. If you start a fight, it's your fault. [relaxing slightly] Other than that, it's your right to go around armed. Just don't pull a knife or gun without just cause. Have a good day.
entries.jtgengrd:123: [shouting, exasperated] Hey you, no weapons! [dismissively] And I don't care if your momma dropped you on your head as a kid. No weapons.
entries.jtgengrd:124: [suspiciously, with slight concern] Hey! You! What are you doing sneaking around?
entries.jtgengrd:128: [warningly, with drawl] Whatever you're doing, don't do it in this town.
entries.jtgengrd:130: [sighing with resignation] Well, uh, ok. Whatever. [dully] Just don't do anything out of line.
entries.lars:105: [friendly, with a slight mustache rasp] Can I help you, stranger?
entries.lars:111: [sharply] Hey! You! We know about you, you monster!
entries.lars:112: [matter-of-factly] Plenty, so long as you stay on our good side. We got Killian Darkwaters' store, where you can do some trading. And there's Gizmo's Casino, if you're a gambler. Or if you just want a drink, you can head on over to the Skum Pitt. Just don't get too rowdy.
entries.lars:114: [sternly] Well, you'd best keep yourself under control. We're a free town but we don't tolerate stepping on other people's toes. Don't cause any problems and you won't give cause for me and my men to come down on you.
entries.lars:116: [with gruff authority] Look, buddy, my job here is to keep the peace, and if I have to break a few heads to do it, then a few people are going to be hurting. So just watch it.
entries.lars:117: [settling in, matter-of-factly] Me and my men here work for Killian Darkwater. We keep some order in this town, dealing with all of the murderers, thieves, and other scumbags who come in from the desert. If you want my advice, you'll also stay away from Gizmo. That fathead runs a crooked operation, but we just haven't been able to prove anything. He and his lackeys, the Skulz, are going to take the fall sometime soon, if Killian has anything to say about it.
entries.lars:121: [warmly] Hey, it's our job. But it's good to know that someone appreciates it. Thanks.
entries.lars:122: [sighing with frustration] Got to do it all proper like. We know that Gizmo runs a rigged operation and all, but we need hard evidence to bring him down. Same with the Skulz; they rough someone up, we bring one or two of 'em in, but nothing changes. We just don't have any direct evidence tying them to any of the killings or muggings.
entries.lars:125: [eagerly] Hell, if you think you can get some dirt on either of them, we'd appreciate the help. Killian's the one to talk to if you want to talk about Gizmo. But if you can get some info on the Skulz, just come back to me and me and the boys will take care of them.
entries.lars:127: [introducing himself with authority] I'm the head of the guards here in Junktown. Name's Lars. For that matter, who are you, stranger?
entries.lars:135: [cordially] Good day, traveler. Do you need something?
entries.lars:140: [matter-of-factly] Yes, I'm in charge of the guards here. What do you have for me?
entries.lars:143: [leaning in, interested] So, you have some info on the Skulz, eh? What can you tell me?
entries.lars:146: [dismissively] That's great and all, but I can't just jail them all on one person's say-so. I need hard evidence or inside testimony.
entries.lars:149: [with satisfaction] Excellent. I'll pick her up for a few questions, and I'm sure that I'll get all the information that I need to put them away.
entries.lars:150: [sternly] Look, this isn't a game. People are getting hurt here. If you find some real evidence, come back, but otherwise, don't waste my time!
entries.lars:151: [with a knowing tone] If you're not averse to a little skullduggery, I need someone to get some hard evidence on the Skulz, proving that they're involved in illegal activities here. Or you can talk to Killian; he might have some work for you.
entries.lars:152: [warmly] Thanks for your assistance. Junktown's a little safer now, because of your help.
entries.lars:155: [determined] You ready to help take down Gizmo?
entries.lars:158: [with resolve] All right, let's do it.
entries.lars:159: [protectively] Well, you'd best wait here so you don't get caught in the crossfire.
entries.lars:163: [suspiciously] What? Hmm. We'll see about that. I'll send some men over to ambush them when they try it. You gonna be there?
entries.lars:169: [angrily, with a note of reluctant respect] Wanderer, you just screwed up. We needed evidence so that we could take down Gizmo all nice and legal-like. Look, off the record, I'm happy to have that fat fuck out of the picture, but we can't condone murder. You better leave Junktown and never come back.
entries.lars:170: [coldly threatening] We don't like your kind here. You've got about fifteen seconds before I blow your head off.
entries.lars:171: [warmly] Hello again! What can I do for you?
entries.saul:176: [thoughtfully] I never thought of it that way. I figured that she just didn't like boxing. [with a slight laugh] I suppose I will have to talk to her more about this. Thanks.
entries.abel:110: [growling menacingly] Oh, you gonna get it now!
entries.abel:113: [with brutish slowness] Abel take care of that. [snarling] Then Abel kick yer ass!
entries.abel:118: [through gritted teeth, growling] You again. [snarling aggressively] Abel kick yer ass!
entries.agatha:109: [warmly, with maternal conviction] I know you will do your best, dearie. Find Tandi, help her escape those beasts and return her to Aradesh. You will do this community a favor and build good karma as well.
entries.agatha:116: [with grave concern] You have not heard? Tandi is missing. [worried] I feel she was kidnapped. Aradesh is most distraught. This is a terrible thing . . .
entries.agatha:117: [warmly, with quiet approval] I hear that you have saved Tandi. That was the right thing to do. Your karma is strong. I have high hopes for your future.
entries.agatha:118: [sadly, with gentle compassion] I'm very sorry to hear about Tandi. She was such a bright young woman. She would have done good with her life.
entries.agatha:125: [softly, with caring resignation] You need more help than I can give you, child. May Dharma be with you.
entries.agatha:130: [apologetically] I'm sorry, child, I am tired right now. I need my rest. Please come back later.
entries.agatha:131: How very true. [pausing thoughtfully] It is good for the young to remember, but it is very hard to act within the flow of history. Sometimes, the very course we take is determined by events long ago. May Dharma be with you. [wearily] I must rest for a little while. Come back again, when I am stronger, and we will speak again.
entries.agatha:132: [appreciatively] Thank you for asking. [with quiet resignation] I'm just old, that's all. I cannot sleep at night. I close my eyes . . . [with a long, weary sigh] But I get no rest. Please, it is just my old tired bones . . .
entries.agatha:137: [wearily, with acceptance] I don't sleep well at night, my child. It must be my age.
entries.agatha:143: [with a warm, nostalgic smile in her voice] You definitely remind me of my baby. When she was just a few months old, as a matter of fact.
entries.agatha:147: [with quiet disapproval] You insult your elders. You should know better.
entries.sarah:100: [with shocked accusation] Oh, my god! You killed him!
entries.sarah:105: [through tears] You didn't have to kill him! [sobbing] Leave me alone.
entries.sarah:106: [voice breaking] He was my lover. He was my best friend. [desperately] I can't believe that you did that to him.
entries.sarah:109: [coldly accusatory] He was a human being. The only way he could survive was by being dipped. You killed him.
entries.sarah:113: [confused, slightly concerned] What are you doing out of your protective cell?
entries.sarah:117: [politely firm] No thanks, I already have a boyfriend.
entries.sarah:118: [matter-of-factly, with conviction] You should be in your cell. The guards are keeping us here for our protection. The robots have been programmed to attack unescorted normals. Once I've been dipped, I'll be able to spend time helping the Unity.
entries.sarah:121: [nodding confidently] Of course, it's the best chance humanity has to survive.
entries.sarah:122: [concerned, warily] Wow! I think you could get into a lot of trouble. Please don't hang out near me.
entries.sherry:116: [with dismissive warning] You sorry thing. You should run along. It's not safe here, especially for someone like you who wouldn't understand.
entries.sherry:139: [shouting] Really? We'll see about that! Victor!
entries.sherry:148: [defensively, with edge] Hey, lay off! You sound like Vinnie's parents used to. We all support each other, okay? So back off.
entries.sherry:149: [shrugging off] I guess. I never thought about it much.
entries.sherry:157: [warming slightly, with genuine appreciation] Oh, I'm doing much better, thanks! I do some cooking now at the Skum Pitt and the Crash House. It gets kind of tiresome on some nights, but I do like to cook, and I get to meet all sorts of interesting people. And I get paid, too. Thanks for your help.
entries.sherry:164: [grudgingly conflicted] Hmm. Well, I mean, they are my friends. But I guess that they shouldn't be allowed to hurt people the way they do. And I guess I trust you since you helped me. All right.
entries.sherry:165: [firmly defiant] No, I can't do that! Those are my friends! I may not be a Skul anymore, but I'm not going to turn my back on my old friends.
entries.seth:101: [with commanding authority] You! You've plagued our village for long enough. I'll kill you myself!
entries.seth:102: [coldly, with grim resolve] Nothing good comes of your kind. I will kill you and rid the wasteland of one more monster.
entries.seth:128: [professionally] Ok, just let me know when you are ready to go to the caves.
entries.seth:200: [warmly, with genuine respect] Our entire town is grateful to you for destroying the radscorpions. Thank you.
entries.seth:203: [politely, with measured friendliness] Ok. Enjoy your stay here.
entries.seth:206: [gesturing toward the south, informatively] You should speak to Aradesh, our leader. He likes to meet all of our visitors. He should be in our Town Hall, the building to the south.
entries.seth:310: [with quiet disappointment] I thought you were a good person. So be it.
entries.seth:321: [urgently, with barely restrained fear] Please hurry. Only the gods know what they are doing to her.
entries.scsupmut:110: [with measured authority] With the quickest of haste. Look for Uthern. [coldly] He will set you straight.
entries.rd1init:115: [with friendly concern] Are you all right? [reassuringly] Maybe you need to see the doctor or maybe you just need some sleep. [with a slight smile] Well I better get back to studying. Bye.
entries.rd1init:116: [warmly, a bit eagerly] Oh, by the way, I'm glad you'll be my new roommate. [conversationally] My last one always wore ear plugs, I don't know why. [matter-of-factly] Anyhow, feel free to leave anything you like here, I don't take up much space. [helpfully] Do you want the top bunk? I'll change if you want... [casually] you don't snore do you? [with a lighthearted chuckle] Oh, it doesn't matter. See ya.
entries.rd1init:117: [agreeing, with a nod] Yea, that's what I thought. [warmly] Well, I'm glad you'll be my new roommate. [conversationally] My last one always wore earplugs, I don't know why. [matter-of-factly] Anyhow, feel free to leave anything you like here, I don't take up much space. [helpfully] Do you want the top bunk? I'll change if you want... [casually] you don't snore do you? [with a lighthearted chuckle] Oh, it doesn't matter. See ya.
entries.razor:189: [with quiet determination] I hope that you can find a way to help us. Goodbye.
entries.razor:196: [warmly, with respect] Thank you. May the Gods be with you on your journey.
entries.razor:202: [with a nod of acknowledgment] Well, thanks again for your help. Goodbye.
entries.razor:204: [with cool pragmatism] I don't think that's a good idea, but you're welcome to try.
entries.razor:211: [matter-of-factly] Go ahead. It's your funeral. Without those guns we have nothing to back us up.
entries.razor:218: [with sharp, dark humor] What happened to you—did someone shoot you in the head?
entries.razor:223: [with genuine gratitude and authority] Thank you for helping us with the Regulators. Please feel free to stay as long as you want. You might want to check in with Miles and Smitty, they may be able to help you with your further travels.
entries.razor:229: [with satisfied resolve] You've killed them all? That's not a problem at all. My people can now live free lives with the people of Adytum.
entries.razor:230: [with relief and warm appreciation] I can't believe it. You were able to kill them all. The Blades and I thank you.
entries.razor:237: [with measured respect] Hello again. I've heard that you have been playing with the Regulators. I wanted to thank you for getting rid of them. My people will be able to live with the people of Adytum in freedom now.
entries.razor:239: [with steady confidence] You will? Well if you need help or have done it come back and talk to me.
entries.airgrd:110: [with menacing formality] I will not be spoken to that way. You will be punished.
entries.airgrd:119: [growling, paranoid] I sense the untruth behind your words. You will not be allowed in. This I promise you...
entries.airgrd:124: [coldly accusatory] A true follower of the Master would have that knowledge. You are an intruder!
entries.airgrd:133: [sighing with irritation] You should not try to fool me by playing dumb. I tire of this...
entries.airgrd:140: [with guttural sadness] It is a pity that you act this way, but you will not proceed further...
entries.airgrd:141: [threateningly deliberate] It will be a true shame to see your head on a pike.
entries.alex:109: [with calm authority] I'm sorry, but I can't let you in. Turn around and leave or I'll have to shoot.
entries.alex:112: [matter-of-factly] Try coming back in the morning.
entries.alex:113: [angrily, dropping formality] Oh, that's it. Now the gloves are off!
entries.allnone:106: [with calm efficiency] Great. Here's what I have.
entries.allnone:107: [with genuine interest] Great, always looking for new things.
entries.allnone:108: [politely but firmly] Sorry, I can't understand you. Come back when you get more of a brain.
entries.alya:107: [dismissively] If she is one of those women from Shady Sands, maybe you should look there. [coldly] Now go, I need to finish sharpening my knives.
entries.alya:117: [with measured irritation] I am sorry, but I can't understand you. [sighing] I'm sharpening my knives and would not like to be bothered.
entries.alya:122: [with menacing calm] I didn't ask. But since you obviously don't have any concept of fun, [threateningly] I think I will end your existence.
entries.alya:123: [coldly] Mocking me does not bode well for you. [with dangerous quiet] I suggest you leave my presence.
entries.alya:124: [sharply] Darn straight that it's fair. [commandingly] Now get out of my face.
entries.alya:125: [with focused intensity] I am busy right now preparing for our next raid.
entries.amber:106: [with gentle firmness] I am truly sorry to hear that. The Followers believe in peace at all costs. For that reason, I have renounced violence. Good evening.
entries.amber:119: [with encouraging warmth] That is better now. We will begin your studies.
entries.amber:120: [with genuine care] You are an apt learner. May your trials be light. Go in peace.
entries.amber:121: [thoughtfully hopeful] As you see fit. May the future soften your heart and broaden your mind.
entries.amber:122: [with measured determination] Very well, I will teach you the ways to survive.
entries.amber:123: [with genuine care] You are an apt learner. May your trials be light. Go in peace.
entries.amber:124: [with calm conviction] You do not convince me. I think you seek to use my gifts for ill. Good evening.
entries.amber:130: [with pleased recognition] An astonishing piece of work. I shall grant you an audience.
entries.amber:131: [wearily, but with grace] I must rest. This teaching drains much from me. Good luck to you.
entries.amber:132: [with pleased recognition] An astonishing piece of work. I shall grant you an audience.
entries.amber:133: [wearily, but with grace] I must rest. This teaching drains much from me. Good luck to you.
entries.amber:134: [with pleased recognition] An astonishing piece of work. I shall grant you an audience.
entries.amber:135: [wearily, but with grace] I must rest. This teaching drains much from me. Good luck to you.
entries.amber:136: [with pleased recognition] An astonishing piece of work. I shall grant you an audience.
entries.amber:137: [wearily, but with grace] I must rest. This teaching drains much from me. Good luck to you.
entries.amber:138: [sighing softly, apologetically] I fear I have spent myself far too much. I am sorry.
entries.amber:139: [with patient resignation] Peace and Beauty are all I can teach. I am sorry that those are not appealing to you. Good day.
entries.assblow:121: [with casual authority] Well, uh, fine with me. But you'd better be careful.
entries.assblow:122: [speaking clearly and directly] Good you asked. No weapons can be drawn except in self-defense. If you start a fight, it's your fault. Other than that, it's your right to go around armed. Just don't pull a knife or gun without just cause. Have a good day.
entries.assblow:123: [sternly, with controlled annoyance] Hey you, no weapons! And I don't care if your momma dropped you on your head as a kid. No weapons.
entries.assblow:128: [with firm finality] Whatever you're doing, don't do it in this town.
entries.assblow:129: [sharply commanding] Hey! No shady characters in town! Get out of here before we throw you out!
entries.assblow:134: [with measured warning] You'd better watch your step around here, because we'll be watching you.
entries.assblow:140: [with slight impatience, matter-of-factly] I dunno about that. You might want to check with Killian. He's to the north. That's up that way, OK?
entries.assblow:147: [with professional detachment] Hmmm. OK. It's not our place to ask questions. Have a good day and don't make any trouble.
entries.assblow:152: [dismissively, but polite] Uh, no. Sorry, lady. I got work to do here.
entries.assblow:162: [firmly] Sorry, the rules are the rules. No strangers admitted during the night.
entries.assblow:163: [with slight reluctance, but warming slightly] Well, I shouldn't do this, but you seem like a nice enough person. Come on in, but don't make any trouble.
entries.beca:116: No. These are for real Blades, not some wuss.
entries.bitsbob:125: [flustered] Doc Morbid? All I know is that he's up around Junktown and he's the cheapest source of food I could find. That's all!
entries.bitsbob:134: [shouting, exasperated] Fine! Take your money and get out!
entries.bitsbob:135: [angrily, through gritted teeth] You can stick it! I ain't ever payin' you! Get lost!
entries.bitsbob:136: [sarcastically, with tired frustration] Yeah, sure. Why don't you find someone else to screw over.
entries.bitsbob:137: [shouting] You can't throw crap without getting some of it on your fingers. Get out of here!
entries.bitsbob:160: [with dark humor, barely suppressed laughter] Someone killed Decker. We're in mourning. [snicker]
entries.bitsbob:161: [matter-of-factly] Someone shot Sheriff Greene. Don't know about the deputy, though.
entries.bitsbob:162: [with bitter irony] Daren Hightower was murdered. And all that money couldn't save him. Ironic, ain't it?
entries.bitsbob:163: [nervously, almost to himself] Someone stole a necklace from the Hightowers. Man, did they ever make a big mistake. They're dead for sure!
entries.bitsbob:164: [with sardonic relief] Someone killed Jain over at the Cathedral. I hear she was a real pain in the butt!
entries.bitsbob:165: [sighing, resigned] Well, the only new thing is that the Children of the Cathedral has taken over the Hospital. It's pretty boring around here lately.
entries.bitsbob:170: [with forced cheer] One whole iguana coming up! Anything else?
entries.bitsbob:171: [shocked, shaking head] You know what they're made from and you still want one? You make Decker look like a charity worker! Anything else?
entries.bitsbob:174: [with forced cheer] One iguana prime select choice, coming up! Anything else?
entries.bitsbob:175: [with a smirk] Smart choice. You could stand to lose a few pounds.
entries.bitsbob:183: [coldly, indignant] I don't know what you're talking about, and I don't appreciate your slander! I suggest you don't show your face in here again.
entries.bitsbob:194: [flatly, matter-of-fact] Tough. You want money, I'll give it to you. You want food, I'll give it to you. You want to die, I'll arrange it. But "like" ain't part of the equation.
entries.bitsbob:195: [dismissively, with finality] Nothing I can think of. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a business to run.
entries.bitsbob:221: [threateningly quiet, leaning in] I'd change your mind if I were you, friend. People have died for less in the Hub.
entries.bitsbob:228: [with weary relief] Fine. Maybe it would be good if our paths didn't cross again.
entries.bitsbob:229: [with aggressive confidence] You may be a songbird, but I'm the golden goose. You ain't gonna sing, not when I'm the only goose you've got. Now get out!
entries.bitsbob:230: [with grim satisfaction] First sensible thing I remember you saying. Now get out!
entries.boslori:108: [with professional assessment] Are you injured? Let's see...
entries.boslori:109: [matter-of-factly] That was the problem. There you go. Be more careful out there.
entries.boslori:110: [with clinical patience] Sorry, I can't help you if you won't tell me what's wrong.
entries.boslori:117: [speaking plainly] Radiation is very dangerous; you should be more careful.
entries.boslori:118: [coldly] I don't have the time for games.
entries.boslori:122: [professionally matter-of-fact] Well, I can help make you stronger, more perceptive, increase your endurance, help improve your learning process, and increase your dexterity. Which would you like more information on? I can only do each operation once.
entries.boslori:146: [with mild reassurance] Okay, there you go. I hope the foam didn't irritate your skin.
entries.boslori:153: [routinely] Did you want to ask about another one?
entries.boslori:154: [with deadpan humor] Okay, here goes nothing . . . Just kidding. We can start right away. (She gases you and you slowly slip away.)
