entries.boslori:156: [with dry amusement] So how are we feeling? (You can already tell the difference.) [laughing softly] You're quite a talkative person in your sleep. You're free to go! Good day.
entries.boslori:159: [muttering to herself] Out with the old and in with the new . . . (You drop like a rock into an abyss.)
entries.boslori:161: [with clinical detachment] You look exactly the same, but how do you feel? (All of your senses feel much sharper.) [dismissively] Well, you're taking up valuable bed space. Get going!
entries.boslori:164: [with wry affection] I hope you have a heart . . . (She winks at you as you fall under.)
entries.boslori:166: [observing clinically] Well, you look a little bulkier. (You feel great!) [professionally reassuring] Well, let me know if there are any problems.
entries.boslori:168: [sarcastically] Now where's the brain again? What's this thing supposed to do? (You try to fight the chems but it's a losing battle.)
entries.boslori:170: [with satisfied professionalism] Well, it looks like I got it all back in and everything's running great. (It's as if the pathways of your thoughts have direct links to everywhere in your head and your memories are much crisper.) [calmly] Take it easy.
entries.boslori:174: [cheerfully pragmatic] All right, let's give it a spin. (The chems, are so . . . friendly. Your slumber comes quickly.)
entries.boslori:176: [with commanding pride] Okay you're ready for duty. (You flex your muscles and can feel the increased speed and control.) [with possessive warmth] All I ask of you is to please not damage my masterpiece.
entries.boslori:300: [apologetically professional] I'm sorry but this operation will not help you.
entries.boslori:410: [frustrated, with bitter humor] Damn! It was a failure. Well I didn't have much to work with. [coldly cutting] Sorry, you're just an idiot and will most likely remain an idiot. We can only do the operation once, sorry to say.
entries.boslori:413: [cheerfully efficient] There you go. All better
entries.brenden:108: [thoughtfully] Hmm. Apparently I may not be of assistance.
entries.brenden:127: [with measured earnestness] We must understand our past if we are to recognize our directions for the future . . . [with a hint of condescension] but I'm sure you wouldn't understand that.
entries.bychris:117: [dismissively, with underlying detachment] No I'm not your Mommie. [softening but still distant] Now run along and play.
entries.bymike:115: [Michael hands you some Stimpacks and some caps]
entries.calder:112: [with forced bravado, voice cracking] Okay. I'll be quiet. But I hope the Nightkin get you!
entries.calder:114: [voice trembling with hurt determination] Maybe it was someone else. But if it was you, I'll find you one day when I get older, and I'll make you pay!
entries.calder:133: [in a hollow, rehearsed chant] That's great! May the Master bless you. [handing over a flower with mechanical obedience]
entries.calder:139: [cycling into rehearsed cheerfulness] Sure is. I picked it myself from a grove across town. Well, it was nice meeting you. May the Master bless you.
entries.calder:140: [voice breaking, panicked] What'd I do? What'd I do?!
entries.calder:147: [terrified whisper] I can't tell you that! The Nightkin would eat me!
entries.calder:155: [stumbling over words, distracted] Yeah. It is. Well good-bye_ ur_ may the Master bless you!
entries.calder:156: [voice brightening with desperate pride] But the Nightkin like me! They told me that if anyone bothered me, they'd kill 'em. So there!
entries.calder:157: [speaking faster, anxiety building] I heard there's a secret passage around here, but I haven't found it yet. Supposed to be real dangerous. Only Morpheus and the Nightkin are allowed there. Well, I'd better go. Praise the Master!
entries.calder:158: [with hollow sympathy] That's too bad. May the Master bless you anyway.
entries.calder:165: [voice rising, indoctrinated fervor] But I must! I must! Disbelief is pain!
entries.calder:166: [sobbing, desperate plea] Please don't! He loves me! He's the only one who does.
entries.calder:167: [resigned, drained] That's okay, I guess. May the Master bless you. Bye.
entries.calder:168: [with genuine relief and gratitude] Thank you! Oh thank you! May the Master bless you. Bye.
entries.calder:179: [quietly, almost apologetic] Uh, I really don't know very much. Honest. Bless the Master! Bye!
entries.calder:202: [in a rehearsed, childlike recitation] Father Lasher says I shouldn't talk to strangers . . . until we have Unity, of course; then nobody'll be a stranger. Bye!
entries.calder:208: [voice cracking with self-recrimination] I never do good enough! Never!
entries.caleb:118: [matter-of-factly] Yah, I guess. You got the Blades up north, a pretty pathetic herd of people, and the Gun Runners a little north and a ways to the east through the DeathClaw Playground.
entries.caleb:120: [with measured firmness] Stay out of trouble.
entries.caleb:121: [with a slight nod] You have a good day, too.
entries.caleb:125: [with quiet authority] You'd best keep your weapons put away while you're in town.
entries.caleb:127: [dismissively, with weariness] Sorry, but I don't have time for you. Run along.
entries.caleb:130: [with steady confidence] We are the police force for Adytum. Most folks 'round here know enough not to cause any trouble.
entries.carvlead:113: [dismissively] Man, we're hiring dumb ones these days.
entries.cathshop:105: [with quiet menace] I care not for your lies, neither shall the Master.
entries.cathshop:117: [with smooth conviction] Good, I'd like that. I'd be happy to do business with you.
entries.cathshop:124: [laughing at himself] After a while, crocodile. I can't believe I just said that.
entries.cathshop:137: [with preachy warmth] You're welcome. Have pleasant days for the rest of your life.
entries.ccvan:107: [with practiced warmth] OK. If you need work, just stop by and we'll set you up.
entries.ccvan:117: [efficiently, with a nod] Great. We leave now.
entries.chanter:109: [with fervent zeal] The Master looks above! [passionately] The Master sits below! Watch the Peace and the Unity grow!
entries.chanter:110: [speaking with reverent intensity] There was once a man who was so full of hate that he nearly died. But now . . . [ecstatically] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Praise the Vineyard of Life! [laughing with eerie delight] Whee!
entries.chanter:111: [warmly, with underlying devotion] You are in charge, friend, but the Master is your guide. [with evangelical fervor] Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame that lights our way!
entries.chanter:112: [with unhinged enthusiasm] The Master's vision is much better than any drink, or even sex! [gasping in reverent awe] Ohhhh! [breathlessly] He transcends both vice and virtue! [sighing with spiritual ecstasy] Ahhhh! [speaking with cult-member devotion] The Master is both father and lover to us all!
entries.chanter:113: [with eerie reassurance] No story ends in death, as long as the Master is here to protect us!
entries.chanter:114: [urgently, with religious fervor] But I must praise the Master! [cheerfully, as if leaving] Farewell, my friend! [eagerly] I'll tell the story later!
entries.chanter:115: [urgently, with religious fervor] But I must praise the Master! [cheerfully, as if leaving] Farewell, my friend! [eagerly] I'll tell the story later!
entries.chdguard:115: [with territorial menace] OK. I suggest you get out of here before you get hurt.
entries.chdguard:120: [irritably, sharp] Wasting my time, I see. Get lost!
entries.chdguard:125: [dismissively] Oh, you want candy. Sorry, I don't have any. Goodbye.
entries.chdguard:126: [with weary authority] Oh, a Vault. I'm sure that is very nice. Maybe you can talk to one of my superiors about that. I'm kinda busy right now.
entries.chdguard:134: [with a gruff chuckle] You can try. I'm not sure you will get very far, though. Good luck to you.
entries.chdguard:144: [curtly] Come with me. I'll show you where everyone else went.
entries.chdguard:148: [with a rough laugh] Silly me. I mistook you for someone else. Come with me. I'll show you the way.
entries.chdguard:154: [apologetically, gravelly] I'm sorry. I still don't remember you. Maybe someone else may remember who you are.
entries.chdguard:155: [with sudden menace] Yes, I remember you. We were told to look for you. [growling] Vengeance shall be mine!
entries.chdguard:166: [with dark humor] Good. Just making sure for your headstone.
entries.chdguard:167: [coldly threatening] Then I don't have to let you live. Good night.
entries.chdguard:175: [scoffing] Deathslayer, eh? You look more like worm bait to me.
entries.chdguard:181: [with gruff interest] Really? I think my boss would like to hear more about that. Go look for Orfeo. He'll be able to reward you for your help.
entries.chdguard:182: [with grudging respect] For someone who comes in peace, you do an awful lot of killing. But those Rippers were causing quite a bit of trouble. Orfeo can reward your for your aid.
entries.chdguard:187: [with ominous certainty] I still let you live. I think I better take you in to have you cleansed of these thoughts of destruction.
entries.chdguard:195: [with sudden recognition and rage] That's where I know you from. It's payback time!
entries.chdguard:196: [wearily menacing] It's you again. I thought you would have learned by now. Too little, too late, I guess.
entries.chdscout:115: [threateningly] OK. I suggest you get out of here before you get hurt.
entries.chdscout:120: [dismissively, sharp] Wasting my time, I see. Get lost!
entries.chdscout:125: [condescendingly] Oh, you want candy. Sorry, I don't have any. Goodbye.
entries.chdscout:126: [impatiently] Oh, a Vault. I'm sure that is very nice. Maybe you can talk to one of my superiors about that. I'm kinda busy right now.
entries.chdscout:134: [mockingly] You can try. I'm not sure you will get very far, though. Good luck to you.
entries.chdscout:144: [commanding] Come with me. I'll show you where everyone else went.
entries.chdscout:148: [with gruff authority] Silly me. I mistook you for someone else. Come with me. I'll show you the way.
entries.chdscout:154: [suspiciously] I'm sorry. I still don't remember you. Maybe someone else may remember who you are.
entries.chdscout:155: [with zealous intensity] Yes, I remember you. We were told to look for you. Vengeance shall be mine!
entries.chdscout:166: [coldly] Good. Just making sure for your headstone.
entries.chdscout:167: [menacingly calm] Then I don't have to let you live. Good night.
entries.chdscout:175: [scoffing] Deathslayer, eh? You look more like worm bait to me.
entries.chdscout:181: [with measured interest] Really? I think my boss would like to hear more about that. Go look for Orfeo. He'll be able to reward you for your help.
entries.chdscout:182: [thoughtfully, noting suspicion] For someone who comes in peace, you do an awful lot of killing. But those Rippers were causing quite a bit of trouble. Orfeo can reward your for your aid.
entries.chdscout:187: [ominously] I still let you live. I think I better take you in to have you cleansed of these thoughts of destruction.
entries.chdscout:195: [with sharp recognition] That's where I know you from. It's payback time!
entries.chdscout:196: [coldly disappointed] It's you again. I thought you would have learned by now. Too little, too late, I guess.
entries.childmem:105: [with measured serenity] That is fine, my child. We will examine you now.
entries.childmem:106: [gently, with serene conviction] Blessed are the meek of mind. There is nothing wrong with you, my child. Run along and play.
entries.childmem:107: [with benevolent assurance] You have been healed. Be more careful in the future.
entries.childmem:109: [with quiet satisfaction] You are not wounded. That is good.
entries.childmem:110: [with concerned composure] I see you are poisoned.
entries.childmem:111: [sighing softly, with regretful certainty] Hmm, some radiation poisoning. Unfortunately, we cannot cure that.
entries.childmem:123: [with reverent warmth] Thank you, my son. Let us pray for your healing.
entries.childmem:124: [with reverent warmth] Thank you, my daughter. Let us pray for your healing.
entries.childmem:125: [with peaceful benediction] There you go. Peace and blessings of the Children go with you.
entries.childmem:132: [with gentle, knowing correction] You have more than enough to make the donation. You need schooling in math, my child.
entries.childmem:139: [with patient understanding, slightly distant] We did not ask you. I can tell you are tired of listening to our beliefs. If you need anything else, we will be here.
entries.child:112: [with earnest seriousness] Then you shouldn't carry around a weapon like that.
entries.choctech:113: [with contemptuous certainty] You are nearly a Nightkin now. I hope the dipping will not damage your intelligence further.
entries.choctech:114: [with zealous fervor] I am part of the Unity. I am a glorious servant of our Master. [with intense conviction] I will be the one who sees you become part of the Unity.
entries.choctech:115: [mysteriously] You will find out soon enough.
entries.choctech:130: [with ecstatic religious fervor] I go to join him now, in the holy flames!
entries.chuck:107: [warmly, with gentle reassurance] Hmm. Don't worry, my simple friend, you have great things ahead.
entries.chuck:131: [thoughtfully, with quiet acceptance] If that is how you feel, then I suppose we have nothing more to discuss.
entries.chuck:132: [with measured wisdom] Indeed, we do. And your universe is shaped by your beliefs, while my universe is shaped by my thoughts. [with thoughtful sincerity] We may not share beliefs, but I wish you well in your universe.
entries.cleo:158: [scoffing] Why do you even bother talking to people, moron?
entries.cleo:175: [grimly] I had a friend who worked for him once. When the assignment went bad, he ran back to Decker for reinforcements. Decker called him a fool, and he had him lobotomized as an example to others. [with quiet intensity] We don't like Decker very much around here.
entries.cleo:181: [with a wry edge] Fine. I got secrets, too. Good luck, friend.
entries.cleo:182: [sighing] Sorry I can't be more useful. [dismissively] Oh, and then there's the rumor about the ship from outer space. I think someone's been playing around with too many of Rufus's stupid games.
entries.cleo:188: [soberly] Sorry to hear that. I've lost a couple of good friends in my time, and one of them I found worse than dead, but I'd rather not go into it.
entries.cleo:189: [with exasperated patience] Didn't we already discuss that? You've got a one-track mind, pal.
entries.cleo:190: [matter-of-factly] Not a bad place if you like sand. A little too dry and wilderness for me. [conversationally] At least in the Hub you don't have to worry about wandering Rad Scorpions. We've got enough of our own predators, I suppose.
entries.cleo:191: [skeptically] You're from a Vault? Get out of here! [with disbelief] Don't go feeding me that bull.
entries.cleo:192: [with bemused respect] I don't envy you. [warmly] Of course if you make a name for yourself, you can become one of those wilderness fighting legends like Magnum Tom Goddard or Scorpion Joe Cornelius. [with genuine admiration] Man, that must be something!
entries.cook:104: [with distracted warmth] Why, thank you. [briefly glancing up from her work] I'm sure you will enjoy it. [returning focus to cooking] Thanks for the compliment. [muttering while stirring] I'm going to tell all my friends about you.
entries.cougar:107: [with brutish slowness] You need to talk to my man, Flash, here. He can help you out.
entries.cougar:108: [wincing] Yow! [irritably] Don't talk too fast man. You give the Cougar a headhurt. [gesturing dismissively] Talk to Flash instead.
entries.curtis:118: [with a thoughtful drawl] Huh. Never thought of that. Makes sense, though. Good idea.
entries.dan:115: [indignantly, with a thick drawl] What? Get the hell out of here ya damn Skag! [dismissively] Ta think I was about to waist m'time on a low-life like yerself.
entries.dan:138: [coldly] Bye. And stay away from my brahmin, you dirty little bastard.
entries.dan:139: [coldly] Bye. And stay away from my brahmin, you dirty little bitch.
entries.dan:141: [panicked, shouting] Guards! Police! There's a Mad Man trying to kill me!
entries.dan:151: [casually, with folksy directness] Just go straight down this road. It's smack dab in the center of the Hub -- ya' can't miss it.
entries.dan:190: [with a pause, thoughtfully] Well... maybe yer right, partner. [warming up] I'll keep that in mind but I ain't promisin' ya' anything.
entries.dan:191: [exasperatedly] Are ya' kiddin'? [firmly] That'd just make'm more defiant! My ways may not be perfect but at least I know it'll make'm stronger and more responsible.
entries.dan:196: [with folksy concern, drawling] Well, try not ta solve all yer problems with a gun. [friendly dismissal] Bye.
entries.dane:103: Master, was this what I was supposed to become, Master?
entries.dane:106: You're an idiot, Dane. They're going to kill you soon and you deserve it! Weakling! Weakling!
entries.dane:110: Your poetry sucks, man! It sucks! Sucks! Sucks!
entries.dane:113: I want a horse! I need a horse! Bring me a horse, dammit! A horse!
entries.dane:117: Shut up you son of a bitch! Pull yourself together!
entries.dane:120: You're fools to cry for me. Never cry over spilled milk . . . or damaged goods.
entries.dane:124: . . . I just want to set the world on fiiiiiiiyaaah!!!
entries.dane:127: So are penguins. And gyro buffalo. They shoot them out of great big bison guns. You gotta watch out for those buffalo women. They'll drop a bison on you so fast, you won't know what hit you! Ha!
entries.dane:131: I used to live in Penticton, British Columbia. Or maybe I saw it on a map of the old days. Those were good old days. Wish I'd been alive back then . . .
entries.dane:135: Why can't I be the important one for a change?
entries.dane:138: I'm bored. What's worse, I've been screwed over. It isn't fun anymore. You ever got the feeling you were just strings and they didn't bother to hang you? I'm all over the floor!
entries.dane:142: Son of a bitch, I'm a puzzle! Will you help me put myself together?
entries.dane:146: Why do you think they call him Master?
entries.dane:151: And then there were the ones who lost their minds completely. I wish they were dead.
entries.dane:155: Stop him! Stop him! Stop him! Somebody make him stop!
entries.dane:158: Shut up, asshole! Moral standards! It sure as Hell ain't here!
entries.dane:179: Ooops! I can't keep myself together anymore! Whee! Whee! Whee!
entries.dane:190: MOOOO! MOOOOO! MOOOO! Brahmin Nightkin, coming through! Here comes some sterile milk!
entries.dane:197: Ooops! I can't keep myself together anymore! Whee! Whee! Whee!
entries.dane:206: I used to hurt people bad, too. I was a stud! Hell, Iwas a god! A tough god son of a bitch! But it wasn't enough!I was a goose-stepping fighting machine! But now I'm . . . I'm . . . help me . . .
entries.dane:215: Love is what makes the cactus grow! Love is what makes the brahmin moo! Love is screwing, it's screwing your life! I hate love! I love hate! If the Master hated us, we'd be all right!
entries.dane:219: That is life, man! It's like being drunk; look at it one way, and it's a piss poor embarrassment! Look at it a different way and it feels great! But it's all the same thing! It's all life!
entries.dane:220: Ah ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! You're right! We're all stupid! Don't you get it? Ha! Ha! Ha!
entries.dane:221: I'm a little bitter right now. Like Orange Pekoe left out in the rain. Ha! I like that saying! I think I'll keep repeating it! I'm a little bitter right now. Like Orange Pekoe left out in the rain . . .
entries.darrel:134: [with smug patience] I'm sorry you feel that way.
entries.darrel:167: [dismissively] Your right. It's not any of my business.
entries.dcmutant:110: [weakly, gasping] Father... Where are you father?... Yes Master... [breathing his last, then silence as he collapses]
entries.deadguy:106: [nervously, speaking quickly] Uh, but? You? [sighing with dread] Okay, do it quickly please. I hate pain.
entries.deadguy:114: [pleadingly, voice shaking] No, sorry, sir! Please don't hurt me -- I don't like pain!
entries.deadguy:115: [pleadingly, voice shaking] No, sorry, ma'am! Please don't hurt me -- I don't like pain!
entries.deadguy:118: [exasperatedly] Are you stupid? [quickly, with genuine gratitude] I mean, thanks an awful lot for saving my life, kind sir. [nervously, backing away] I've got to be going now. Bye.
entries.deadguy:119: [exasperatedly] Are you stupid? [quickly, with genuine gratitude] I mean, thanks an awful lot for saving my life, kind ma'am. [nervously, backing away] I've got to be going now. Bye.
entries.dealer:104: [with fake sympathy, chuckling] Oh, I'm sorry, you don't look like you can afford our financing rates.
entries.dealer:125: [dismissively] I'm sorry, we don't have any petrol. Maybe next time. Goodbye.
entries.dealer:126: [scoffing] I'm insulted. I don't have to take that from a customer. Have a good day.
entries.demetre:123: [excitedly, with punchy energy] Damn straight it is! Just go talk to Keri in the next room, she'll let you know when the next caravan is leavin'!
entries.demetre:124: [confused, rapid-fire] Bub? What the hell are you talkin' about? [dismissively] Well, no skin off my back.
entries.demetre:130: [laughing excitedly] Ha! Maybe both! [energetically] Well, go talk to Keri in the next room if you do want a job.
entries.demetre:131: [amused, animated] You're a smart little ass, are you? [excitedly] Well, it doesn't matter to me! Just as long as you defend the caravans I'll be satisfied. Go talk to Keri in the next room if you want a job.
entries.demetre:132: [laughing with enthusiasm] Ha! That's a funny one! [with energetic interest] Well, if you think you can brave the darkness, come see me.
entries.demetre:139: [confidently excited] Of course you will! Go talk to Keri in the next room, she works the schedules.
entries.demetre:140: [sighing, slightly deflated] Hell, that's disappointin', but oh well.
entries.demetre:141: [enthusiastically] Yeah! I like you! You're hired! [energetically] Go talk to Keri in the next room, she'll assign you to a caravan.
entries.demetre:159: [animated, fast-paced] You know, Beth's been yapping about some Death Claw. I would check that out if I where you! [with energetic urgency] I've heard a few rumors from other sources about somethin' creepin' around at night to the northwest.
entries.demetre:174: [disgusted, sharp] Doing chems are we? Hell, it's a good thing we aren't hiring your ass again!
entries.demetre:175: [worked up, rapid, intense] Hell, no! I don't think you realize just how much is at stake! We can't afford to take the risk! [passionately animated] Hell, I don't no how the Far Go Traders are still in business with all those missin' caravans!
entries.demetre:176: [apologetically firm, fast] Sorry, you'll have to see if one of the others' houses will take a risk with you. I can't afford to take another one.
entries.demetre:177: [angrily, with contempt] Get out of here, you make me sick!
entries.demetre:208: [scoffingly animated] You think you're tough? Don't make me laugh!
entries.demetre:210: [impatiently] I already told you. Just talk to Keri in the next room.
entries.demetre:220: [angrily escalating, then with forced calm control] Too late for apologies! Get, before I make good on my threat!
entries.demetre:237: [excitedly enthusiastic] Damn! You're missing out on some good action! [rapidly animated] I'm sure there are lots of people, creatures, and things waiting to attack the caravans! Nothing beats a good fire fight! [handing over the item] Here - take this, it'll give you something to play with until the next caravan is ready to go.
entries.demetre:238: [frustrated, exasperated] Damn! Do our caravans ever leave?
entries.demetre:240: [with rapid urgency] Don't take too long.
entries.demophil:112: [dismissively, muttering] Mebbe you can talk it to death.
entries.demophil:120: [with weary exasperation] I don't know. Some guy. He came from the east, he said. Like anyone could get past the deadlands to the east. [scoffing] He ran afoul of Gizmo, trying to interfere with Gizmo's business.
entries.demophil:123: [sighing, matter-of-fact] Oh, the guy was tall, dark-haired with a little graying around the edges. He was dressed all in black leather, like that's a good idea in the desert, and carried a shotgun.
entries.diana:111: [with a matter-of-fact tone] As you can see, I am much too busy at the moment to grant you your request.
entries.diana:112: [sighing slightly] Garl has me fixing the camp equipment at the moment. I do not have time to fix our gear and that of every stranger who walks in. Sorry.
entries.diana:119: [dismissively] I am busy now. Please go elsewhere.
entries.diana:121: [with a shrug in her voice] Hmm. Your equipment seems to be functional. I have more important tasks.
entries.dolgan:114: [with casual confidence] Now you are a little better at that. Go kick Tangler's butt into next year for me.
entries.dolgan:122: [with a satisfied nod] There you go. You've shown a little improvement. Good luck to you.
entries.dolgan:123: [drawling slightly] Sure thing. Come back when you want more training.
entries.dragon:111: [gruffly, irritated] Get lost! Can't you tell I'm trying to get some rest!
entries.dragon:120: [coldly dismissive] I think I'd be sorry about that, but I don't pay heed to dead people.
entries.dragon:121: [threateningly] Fat chance. Now, get out of here before I send the night guard after you.
entries.dragon:122: [with menacing calm] My, you don't enjoy life much. I'll help you end it.
entries.dragon:130: [curtly] Great. Go take it to Razor.
entries.dragon:131: [sharply, growling] Don't lie to me. Get out!
entries.dragon:132: [barking] Then get your butt out of here and can the bastard!
entries.dragon:133: [with casual approval, gravelly] Yo, homie! Nice job you did on the Rippers!
entries.duc:110: [with a wry chuckle] Oh, sorry -- didn't realize you were that stupid.
entries.duc:111: [with friendly efficiency] It should only take a day or so. Let's go!
entries.duc:126: [speaking seriously, with genuine concern] You should be careful if you're traveling alone. Some people went missing from Shady Sands recently.
entries.duc:127: [warmly, with a nod of approval] Hey, I heard about how you saved that woman from Shady Sands. Good work.
entries.dugan:109: [impatiently, speaking fast] Well, then stop wasting my time.
entries.dugan:119: [jittery, rapid-fire] Razor's the woman you'll want to talk to.
entries.dugan:120: [self-deprecating, manic energy] I am the dumbest person I've ever met - well, [scoffing] besides you. [shouting] Get out of here!
entries.elder:113: [with firm urgency] Please help us as soon as possible. Time is wasting.
entries.elder:114: [coldly dismissive] I don't talk to your kind, stranger.
entries.falcon1:108: [tersely] If ya' don't have the caps, get the hell out!
entries.falcon1:110: [with tired authority] I think you've had enough, buddy.
entries.falcon1:111: [with tired authority] I think you've had enough, lady.
entries.falcon1:112: [muttering, waving hand dismissively] Yeah . . . well beat it.
entries.farli:106: [with clipped authority] Ah, Drake ko mat'chak.
entries.fgtcarvn:118: [casually] Alrighty. Not a problem. Just let me know if you change your mind.
entries.fgtcarvn:120: [matter-of-factly] Come back by if you end up looking for something to do. That's the 8st, 18th, and 28th. Bye.
entries.fgtcarvn:121: [with dry humor] Uh, it ain't gonna work if you can't tell your right foot from your left. Sorry big guy.
entries.fgtcarvn:123: [with genuine concern] Man, you don't seem to be doing well. You should get something in your stomach, just stay clear of Bob's.
entries.fgtcarvn:131: [coldly menacing] So you just spit in my face huh? I guess the only way to get this through your thick skull, is to remove it from that neck of yours.
entries.fgtcarvn:132: [firmly but calm] Fine, but that don't make it right. You still are gonna have to get out of here.
entries.fgtcarvn:133: [angrily, shouting] You think I'd believe that crap? Guards!
entries.fgtcarvn:156: [with measured disappointment] Not sure what happened, but the whole caravan was lost. Funny thing for something like that to happen, and for you to be the only one left standing? Things don't generally fall that way. I just don't think I can hire you anymore because of it. I'm sure you understand why.
entries.fgtcarvn:160: [decisively] Good to hear, I'll round up the rest of the crew.
entries.fgtcarvn:162: [dismissively] Get on out of here. Good luck!
entries.fgtcarvn:163: [matter-of-factly, with a hint of concern] Try to avoid trouble, don't go lookin' for it.
entries.fgtcarvn:164: [with a gravelly warning] You be careful out there, the Boneyard ain't the safest of places.
entries.fgtcarvn:165: [matter-of-factly] That's good. Those black walkways are really strange, but they're great to travel on.
entries.fgtcarvn:166: [with a cautionary tone] They definitely got a bad element out that way. I'd watch who you deal with while down that way.
entries.fgtcarvn:167: [with a shrug, approving] Great. Junktown ain't a bad place.
entries.fgtcarvn:168: [wistfully, chuckling] Oh, and stop on by Killain, and tell him 'Hi" for me. Man, the times we used to have on the caravans.
entries.fgtcarvn:169: [matter-of-factly] Hear some odd doctor is out that way. Deals in the dead, so they say.
entries.fgtcarvn:216: [enthusiastically] Brotherhood of Steel, here we come! Well… I'm not going with you, but you know what I mean.
entries.fgtcarvn:217: [firmly, with growing impatience] Okay, get out of my face already. Those Brotherhood fanatics are waiting for you.
entries.fgtcarvn:218: [with energetic enthusiasm] I hope you like mountains! You're going right into them. You should see lots of action there.
entries.fgtcarvn:219: [upbeat, confident] Ready to go, and you'll be heading straight though the mountains! It should be a blast!
entries.fire:118: [scoffing dismissively] Great. Another stupid one. You have the sound of a Ripper.
entries.fire:122: [with menacing interest] Don't like them much either? Maybe we can use you for a little 'work.'
entries.fire:125: [growling impatiently] Okay, talk to the head wench. Razor'll set you straight as to what ta do.
entries.fire:126: [coldly threatening] Stupid and a chicken. I'll put you out of your misery now.
entries.fire:127: [laughing mockingly] So you are a Ripper! I'd be sorry to hear that, but then I already knew they were stupid. Goodnight!
entries.fire:128: [with brutish contempt] The Rippers. Those inbreds on the other side of town. Never mind. You're too stupid to know anything.
entries.fire:129: [scoffing] You want to be a Blade? Good luck. But, if you can find Razor, talk to her about that. Maybe she'll let you get jumped in.
entries.fire:134: [coldly vicious] Your momma never wanted you, and we don't either.
entries.fire:135: [matter-of-factly menacing] Simple. You'll have to kill someone to get in here. She will tell you who you're gonna need to kill.
entries.fire:138: [growling defensively] No. I can't. I don't lead. I just keep Razor going straight.
entries.fire:139: [with a harsh snarl] Simple. Slaughter our enemies, then we will give Adytum a break.
entries.fire:143: [dismissively] The Rippers. Those Gun Runners are just a pain, but nothing important. They are a bunch of soft-sellers, anyway.
entries.fire:146: [threatening gravelly] If you plan on doing that, you may want to let Razor know. Otherwise, she will have your head before you get out of here.
entries.fire:148: [impatiently] I don't make the deals. I only make suggestions. Talk to Razor if you want to deal.
entries.fire:149: [with dark satisfaction] Then killing you now would save you many years of suffering.
entries.fire:151: [snarling menacingly] Get lost if you want to live.
entries.fire:152: [urgently whispering] Quiet. We are trying to sneak up on the Rippers.
entries.fire:153: [shouting impatiently] If ya' got the head, take it to Razor. She still wants to play soccer. Otherwise, get out!
entries.fishrman:121: [with weary resignation] Anyhow, I need quiet for my fishing, so I'd appreciate it if you'd keep quiet and let me get back to work before me and my boy starve.
entries.fishrman:134: [muttering, a bit flustered] Try some of . . . oh damn, where did I put it . . .
entries.fishrman:136: [exasperated but not unkind] I hate to be inhospitable, but I need quiet for my fishing, so I'd appreciate it if you'd keep quiet and let me get back to work before me and my boy starve. [firmly] And good luck killing those varmints.
entries.fishrman:143: [with tired exasperation] Anyhow, why don't you just get outta here. [shouting] Git!
entries.fishrman:144: [warmly, with a nod] Thank you kindly.
entries.fishrman:150: [apologetically] I'm sorry friend, I don't think I can help you.
entries.fishrman:151: [gruffly, losing patience] 'Runk' ain't the same as keeping quiet. [sharply] Now shut yer yap and get outta here.
entries.fishrman:153: [dryly, with a chuckle] You really aren't very friendly, are you?
entries.fishrman:154: [with quiet firmness] You'll forgive me if I ain't more appreciative, but I think you should just leave.
entries.fishrman:155: [with gravelly concern] I try to avoid them if I can. Their patrols can be pretty nasty if they decide not to take a liking to you.
entries.fishrman:156: [voice rising with protective worry] That's down on the coast. [emphatic] I hear stories about gangs running amok and all sorts of things that I don't want the boy to see, so I'm staying away from that place!
entries.fishrson:118: [apologetically] Sorry. I'm not the one to talk to about supplies.
entries.fishrson:127: [laughing, delighted] Man, that was a good one!
entries.fishrson:131: [scoffing] Yeah, adults always agree with each other. It's just stupid.
entries.fishrson:135: [eagerly] Well that sounds great! [quickly] I'd better get back to fishing though, or we're gonna get so hungry, we're gonna have to eat you!
entries.fishrson:140: [nostalgically, with warmth] He was a guy from down south. Some sort of raider who tried to live off the land, not the people. He was a real great guy, [slowing down, hesitantly] but sometimes he'd go nuts, and one time he . . . uh . . . it don't matter.
entries.fishrson:141: [with determined energy] Yeah. I'm gonna be a he-ro, just like him. [confidently] You bet on it!
entries.fishrson:142: [fiercely] You think living like this is easy? [defiantly] I ain't scared of hardship and there ain't nothing safe out here, so I ain't quitting. [with stubborn resolve] I just gotta get old enough to strike out on my own.
entries.billy:110: [quickly, nervously] Cuz of all the missing caravans. He doesn't have any to spare, the caravans use most of them. The others are sold for food. [with growing anxiety] Well, I better stop talking; Dan will get mad if he sees me talking to a stranger.
entries.billy:119: [uncertainly, with a nervous laugh] Hey, you're one of those skags aren't you?
entries.billy:120: [genuinely pleased but awkwardly] Really? You think so? Gee, thanks.
entries.billy:124: [warming up, speaking faster] Yea, I think I'm starting to agree with you. This job isn't so bad, really. It makes me feel good for some reason. [anxiously] Well, I've got to go before I get in trouble.
entries.billy:135: [explaining patiently] Oh, they can be awfully stubborn when I want them to do something. I just gently stick them to get them to move around . . . [nervously] plus I don't want to get too close; they sometimes kick.
entries.billy:147: [thoughtfully, with a sigh] Yea, maybe you're right . . . actually, he seems pretty cool, but [sadly] I wish he wouldn't yell at me so much.
entries.billy:149: [defiantly, shouting] Up yours, you old fart!
entries.billy:150: [defiantly, shouting] Up yours, you old hag!
entries.billy:151: [excited, speaking rapidly] WOW! I can live on this for the rest of my life! Thanks a lot, mister!
entries.billy:152: [excited, speaking rapidly] WOW! I can live on this for the rest of my life! Thanks a lot, ma'am!
entries.billy:153: [delighted at first, then defensive] WOW! Thanks . . . Well? . . . [worried] You're just trying to get me in trouble again!
entries.billy:165: [gently reassuring] Really? Oh, okay. I hope you didn't hurt him. He's really not so bad. [with resigned acceptance] He just yells a lot.
entries.andrew:111: [with tired authority] You have a good day. And stay out of trouble.
entries.flash:108: [with a gruff authority] Hold on a second, I gotta check with the Doc.
entries.flash:114: [dismissively] I dunno, why don't you talk to him yourself.
entries.flash:125: [with a sneering laugh] Whoa! If you really want to see him, go right ahead.
entries.flash:127: [impatiently] The doc sees patients from 8 to 5. Now get outta here.
entries.flip:103: [with authoritative growl] You should be in the control room. Do not tarry.
entries.flip:111: [with gravelly menace] You think me moronic, like many of my kind. You are sadly mistaken. It is a terminal problem, I understand.
entries.flip:112: [growling, low and threatening] We meet again. You will not escape me this time.
entries.francis:142: [calmly, with serene certainty] Hello, brother. No, I've been meditating like a good initiate, waiting to be christened by the Servitors. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about.
entries.francis:143: [calmly, with serene certainty] Hello, sister. No I've been meditating like a good initiate, waiting to be christened by the Servitors. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about.
entries.francis:147: [gently, almost amused] Is this a trick question? It's the Master, right?
entries.francis:150: [with breathy serenity] Why brother, nothing so impure profanes the Cathedral. I would let the high priests know if such sins were being committed.
entries.francis:151: [with breathy serenity] Why sister, nothing so impure profanes the Cathedral. I would let the high priests know if such sins were being committed.
entries.francis:152: [thoughtfully, with zen acceptance] I am armed, of course, if reason will not sway our enemies, but I do not arm myself to excess. Is there no ammo in the Gift Shoppe?
entries.francis:153: [softly, with gentle dismissal] Oh no, brother, I do not require assistance. Please excuse me.
entries.francis:154: [softly, with gentle dismissal] Oh no, sister, I do not require assistance. Please excuse me.
entries.francis:157: [peacefully, as if stating obvious truth] I don't know. Perhaps he will reveal himself in time.
entries.fry:120: [proudly] No problem. Believe it or not, our city is quite safe and our police are all very highly trained peace keepers. You shouldn't have any problems, [with a slightly nervous edge] just avoid the Maltese Falcon.
entries.fry:121: [helpfully] I'm sorry, I don't understand. Maybe you need healing? The Children of the Cathedral are south. [speaking clearly and deliberately] Head straight down past the Merchant Market down to the Water Merchants. They're right next to the Water Merchants.
entries.fry:122: [coldly, with barely restrained anger] I'm still watching you, child killer.
entries.fry:124: [voice breaking, devastated] I can't believe the Sheriff's dead . . .
entries.fry:145: [hollowly, in shock] Dead… they're all dead . . .
entries.gabriel:168: [dismissively, gruff] Sorry I can't talk to you now, I'm very busy.
entries.gabriel:182: [with a gravelly sigh] Sorry I can't talk to you, friend, but we're busy getting this place packed up to move. Help yourself to whatever you need.
entries.gabriel:183: [with a gravelly sigh] Sorry I can't talk to you, friend, but we're busy getting this place packed up to move. Help yourself to whatever you need.
entries.gabriel:188: [curtly] You need to talk to Zack about buying things.
entries.gambler:106: [smoothly charming] But of course! This fine establishment is run by the famous Gizmo. A true visionary and a very wealthy man.
entries.gambler:116: [with a friendly smile] Sorry, mi amigo. Hey, let me show you a neat game . . .
entries.gambler:117: [eagerly persuasive] Thank you very much, mi amigo! In a few days I shall be able to pay you back, with interest. My system is slow, you see, it requires much patience, but it will most certainly reap great profits!
entries.gambler:118: [confidently] Very well, but I guarantee success! If you want to get in on the riches just waiting, come back soon, or I will find another partner!
entries.gambler:122: [with nostalgic reverence] Gizmo had a dream of setting up a place where people could meet and enjoy themselves. He had the ambition to make it happen. The result is the casino you see here.
entries.gambler:126: [dismissively condescending] You obviously don't share Gizmo's brilliance. This place is a respite from the harshness of everyday life.
entries.gambler:132: [reassuringly, but unconvincingly] My system is developing slowly. I have living expenses and such, you know, but it is working!
entries.gambler:135: [with sudden hostility] So, you think you have tumbled to me, eh? Well, you won't get anything from me!
entries.ganger:115: [with a gravelly rasp] I ain't telling ya' that. [dismissively] Whadda ya' think I am, stupid? [threateningly] Now git . . .
entries.ganger:122: [growling] I said dat's all I'm gonna tell ya'. [shouting] Now git.
entries.ganger:130: [with menacing slowness] Stay away from dis place if you value yer life.
entries.ganger:131: [shouting excitedly] HEY, ZOMBIES, WE GOT US A PUNCHIN' BAG!
entries.garret:113: [with raspy menace] You need to leave here . . . immediately.
entries.garret:115: [gravelly and threatening] I hope not, for your sake. Set was not too happy to have to use you. It might be a good idea to leave Necropolis . . . soon
entries.garret:116: [growling impatiently] I told you to leave.
entries.garret:118: [grunting slightly] Perhaps. Hmm. Here, take this as well.
entries.genmutan:110: [with a deep, threatening growl] What manner of treason is this?!
entries.genmutan:114: [gruffly commanding] Hurry on your task then, but be warned, I'm watching you.
entries.genmutan:120: [with gravelly impatience] I am sorry, but you will have to find the way to Unity yourself.
entries.genmutan:121: [bellowing] You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
entries.genmutan:131: [with a dismissive rumble] When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
entries.genmutan:137: [growling, then shouting] Just who are you? Let me see . . . Argh! An intruder . . .
entries.genmutan:138: [with gruff authority] Move along. Do your part for the Unity and stop bothering me!
entries.genmutan:140: [with stern finality] Move along. Do your part for the Unity.
entries.genpalb:115: [barking sharply] Hold! I recognize you and I do not trust you. [menacingly] I give you fair warning: if you make trouble for us, you will be shot dead. [clipped] Now move!
entries.genpalb:124: [shouting commandingly] Halt! These lands belong to the Brotherhood of Steel. [threateningly] Leave now, or we will shoot you as a trespasser.
entries.genpalb:125: [curt, approving] Very good. Carry on, Initiate.
entries.genpalb:126: [with measured coldness] I see. Carry on, Initiate.
entries.genpalb:127: [barking orders] There are reports of large mutant humans attacking travelers, so we're increasing our vigilance. [urgently] Keep a close eye on the area and retreat to the compound if necessary. [snapping] Initiate, dismissed!
entries.genpalb:129: [shouting with contempt] Get your sorry ass out of here, and bring us back some useful intelligence! [barking] Initiate, dismissed!
entries.genpalb:130: [scoffing] Oh yes, I heard about you. [dismissively] Not much of an IQ, but a helluva fighter. [with cold finality] Too bad.
entries.genpalb:136: [grimly] A friendly face? [growling] It won't be mine. [tersely] I would recommend leaving.
entries.genpalb:137: [matter-of-factly] As are we all. [cautiously] As long as you do not act against the Brotherhood, you will not be harmed, but tread carefully.
entries.genpalb:138: [coldly] It depends on whether or not you consider us vermin. [tersely] If you attack our enemies, you will be permitted to travel in our territory. [menacingly] If you offend us, you will die. [sharp, deadly calm] Consider yourself warned.
entries.genpalb:139: [curt approval] That's a reasonable request. [barking] Fall in.
entries.genpalb:140: [incredulous, scoffing] Water chip? [sharply dismissive] I hope you're not serious! [with contempt] You'd be better off struggling on the surface than enslaving yourself to a single piece of machinery.
entries.genpalb:141: [nodding agreement, gravelly] As are we. [analytically] The most common theory is that they come from the Glow, but [skeptically] I doubt even mutants could survive there for long. [tersely] If you find out something, let us know.
entries.genpalb:142: [roaring with outrage] How dare you accuse me of such a thing! [shouting with fervent conviction] The Brotherhood of Steel has never forced anyuone to serve us against their will. [pounding conviction] That goes against everything we believe in. [barking fury] Get out of my sight!
entries.genpalb:144: [gravelly, concerned] We've heard enough reports that we're . . . concerned. [with grim warning] I would walk cautiously, if I were you.
entries.genpalb:145: [with dangerous calm] I'm going to have to teach you some manners, boy. [menacingly] This should make for some light entertainment.
entries.genpalb:146: [with dangerous calm] I'm going to have to teach you some manners, girl. [menacingly] This should make for some light entertainment.
entries.genpalb:147: [with pitying contempt] Your mind is completely gone. [sadly shaking head] Poor creature.
entries.genpalb:151: [tersely, coldly] Then I suggest you leave.
entries.genraid2:109: [eagerly, but with underlying fear] I'm waiting for Garl to crush Shady Sands. I want some loot.
entries.genraid2:111: [stiffly polite] I'm glad that you could return for a visit.
entries.genraid2:116: [blustering, uncertain] So, you think you're tough, huh? [voice cracking] Mess with me and we'll both find out.
entries.genraid2:117: [dismissively, but nervous] I don't like your looks.
entries.genraid2:123: [hurriedly, glancing around nervously] Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
entries.genraid2:132: [nervously, speaking quickly] Yeah, she's here. She's in the big house. You know, if we tell Garl, then he would want a piece of the bounty. [warning tone] You might want to think about that.
entries.genraid2:133: [suspiciously, but edgy] You don't sound like you mean it. I think that you are up to something. And if you are telling the truth, then I'll bag the reward for myself.
entries.genraid2:134: [whispering, terrified] I . . . I can't say any more or Garl will kill me.
entries.genraid2:135: [defiantly, but with a nervous edge] Bite me!
entries.genraid2:136: [backing away, nervous] I don't like your looks. You'd better get away from me.
entries.gensarg:113: [with righteous fury] What manner of treason is this?!
entries.gensarg:117: [growling menacingly] Hurry on your task then, but be warned -- I'm watching you.
entries.gensarg:123: [with gravelly dismissal] I am not one to guide you on the path to Unity. Leave!
entries.gensarg:124: [thunderously] You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
entries.gensarg:130: [with deep reverence] Praise to the Unity.
entries.gensarg:134: [in a low, patient rumble] When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
entries.gensarg:140: [with booming authority] You are obviously an intruder!
entries.gensarg:141: [growling irritably] Get out of my face.
entries.gensarg:142: [with grinding impatience] I don't have time for you. Stop bothering me.
entries.ghdorgrd:104: [with gravelly authority] I'm on duty. If you want to see Set, you gotta do it inside.
entries.ghdorgrd:116: [sighing raspily] I wish I could help you, but Set would tan my ass if I did. [muttering] You know how it is . . . always gotta do what the big guy says.
entries.ghguard:101: [with gravelly authority] We're going to take you to Set. [raspy and menacing] I think he'll want to talk to you, personally.
entries.ghguard:112: [growling, barking] I think you'd better be leaving.
entries.ghguard:115: [dismissively, with a raspy grunt] Nah. Thanks.
entries.ghoul:109: [with gravelly menace] That's what I thought you say. Getta outta my house.
entries.ghoul:110: [rasping dismissively] Oh, nonna dat around here. Maybe uppa da temple or atta water place. Getta going.
entries.ghoul:111: [crackling with alarm] Ack! Donna you be exploring any my stuff. [growling] Getta out! I mean it.
entries.ghoul:115: [muttering frantically] Ack! OK, I concede. I leave.
entries.ghoul:116: [sputtering with indignant rage] You no biggie to order me like dat. Take some of dis and shove it!
entries.bullbord:101: [in a matter-of-fact tone] NEED WORK?  The Far Go Traders are currently filling the following positions:
entries.bullbord:102: [continuing matter-of-factly] 1. Caravan Guards.  Must be in good physical condition and dependable.
entries.bullbord:103: [same neutral cadence] 2. Special Position.  Must be observant and willing to travel in dangerous territory.
entries.bullbord:104: [with a slight businesslike finality] Own weapons and ammo required for all jobs.  Inquire with Rutger at the Far Go Traders office.
entries.bygreg:110: [nervously defensive] Jumpy, I'm not jumpy. [quickly] Just careful. [muttering] They all say I'm paranoid, but I'm the one that's gonna be here when they come to get us.
entries.bygreg:113: [with rising panic] Well they are... [frantically] You know don't you... The disease was just the start. Now they're going to come and take us all. But you are just like all the rest. You won't believe me, and you'll be doomed. You mark my words. [shrieking with unhinged intensity] I'LL STILL BE HERE, and ALL OF THIS, INCLUDING YOU, WILL BE TAKEN. TAKEN. [gasping, voice cracking with terror, clutching head]
entries.bygreg:114: [suspiciously hissing] Medication... Oh so you're one of them, trying to get me to take my medication again... [voice cracking with defiance] Well you won't get me to. [shrieking frantically] I WON'T TAKE IT, NO, I WON'T. THE VOICES, NO I WON'T, YOU CAN'T MAKE ME. [whimpering and muttering, voices overlapping]
entries.cabbot:214: [nervously] Um, ya know, I really don't have time to sit here and repeat myself over and over again. [defensively] You can understand, can't you?
entries.cabbot:231: [with forced confidence] Go talk to Mathia. [trailing off slightly] She'll tell you more about that.
entries.folguard:110: [suspiciously] Who travels the halls of the Followers?
entries.folguard:117: [condescendingly slow] OK. I can see that you are a little slow. Who you?
entries.folguard:125: [dismissively] You want to help? I think you will need to talk to Nicole or Jake if you want to help us. They have more time for dealing with slower people.
entries.folguard:126: [curtly] OK. Just stay out of trouble around here.
entries.folguard:127: [with forced patience] Do you see to end the evil of the Children?
entries.folguard:132: [with grudging approval] Excellent! Go talk to Nicole and she will be able to tell you how you can help us.
entries.folguard:133: [with righteous conviction] The Children are an occult group who worship some dark god. Personally, I think there is something about them that reeks of evil.
entries.folguard:138: [flatly confident] They are a strong lot, but I think with someone of your skills, you will be able to get in and help us destroy them.
entries.folguard:141: [coldly dismissive] Suit yourself. If they take over the wastelands, don't say we didn't warn you.
entries.folguard:142: [matter-of-factly] If you talk to Nicole, she will be able to tell you more of what can be done to stop them.
entries.folguard:144: [impatiently correcting] Not children. We wouldn't think of harming them. No. These are the Children of the Cathedral. A nasty group of people.
entries.folguard:148: [with official pride] We are the Followers of the Apocalypse. We are trying to bring peace to the wastelands.
entries.folguard:152: [patiently lecturing] We are working to bring about tolerance to those in the wastelands for those few unfortunates who have been mutated by man's destructive nature.
entries.folguard:156: [begrudgingly] You are right in saying that we, as humans, have been close-minded. However, there is always hope.
entries.folguard:159: [coldly dismissing] Be that as it may, your opinion was not requested. Goodbye.
entries.folguard:160: [with resigned tolerance] A cynic in our midsts. I am sure you have your reasons. Regardless, I am certain we can bring about some type of understanding.
entries.folguard:162: [suspiciously musing] I've heard that the Children have been able to get some of our secrets. I wonder how that is happening?
entries.folguard:166: [thoughtfully vindicated] Truly? I thought as much myself, but feared that I would never have been able to get much support on the theory.
entries.folguard:170: [helpfully condescending] Not really. The only thing I can think of is that the person would have to have access to some information and have access to the outside. You might want to look to the initiates or scouts.
entries.folguard:172: [with satisfied certainty] Nicole will be pleased, then, to know that I killed the agent.
entries.folguard:173: [accepting correction] You must be right. Thank you for setting me straight.
entries.folguard:174: [menacingly accusatory] I think you are the double agent. Trying to trick me, I see. Well now you DIE!
entries.folguard:175: [with genuine satisfaction] Great job on wasting that agent. Now we might have a chance against those Children.
entries.folguard:178: [warmly eager] Would you? That would be wonderful.
entries.folscout:110: [questioningly, slightly smug] Who travels the halls of the Followers?
entries.folscout:117: [condescendingly, nasally drawl] OK. I can see that you are a little slow. Who you?
entries.folscout:125: [talking down, with forced politeness] You want to help? I think you will need to talk to Nicole or Jake if you want to help us. They have more time for dealing with slower people.
entries.folscout:126: [dismissively, condescending] OK. Just stay out of trouble around here.
entries.folscout:127: [questioningly, slightly condescending] Do you see to end the evil of the Children?
entries.folscout:132: [pleased with himself] Excellent! Go talk to Nicole and she will be able to tell you how you can help us.
entries.folscout:133: [knowingly, with superiority, nasally] The Children are an occult group who worship some dark god. Personally, I think there is something about them that reeks of evil.
entries.folscout:138: [with condescending praise] They are a strong lot, but I think with someone of your skills, you will be able to get in and help us destroy them.
entries.folscout:141: [smug and superior] Suit yourself. If they take over the wastelands, don't say we didn't warn you.
entries.folscout:142: [instructing, talking down] If you talk to Nicole, she will be able to tell you more of what can be done to stop them.
entries.folscout:144: [correcting, exasperated, nasally] Not children. We wouldn't think of harming them. No. These are the Children of the Cathedral. A nasty group of people.
entries.folscout:148: [proudly, slightly preachy] We are the Followers of the Apocalypse. We are trying to bring peace to the wastelands.
entries.folscout:152: [self-righteously] We are working to bring about tolerance to those in the wastelands for those few unfortunates who have been mutated by man's destructive nature.
entries.folscout:156: [patronizingly, fake-friendly] You are right in saying that we, as humans, have been close-minded. However, there is always hope.
entries.folscout:159: [dismissively, coldly] Be that as it may, your opinion was not requested. Goodbye.
entries.folscout:160: [indulgently, with fake understanding] A cynic in our midst. I am sure you have your reasons. Regardless, I am certain we can bring about some type of understanding.
entries.folscout:162: [thoughtfully, smugly curious, nasally] I've heard that the Children have been able to get some of our secrets. I wonder how that is happening?
entries.folscout:166: [smugly vindicated, nasally] Truly? I thought as much myself, but feared that I would never have been able to get much support on the theory.
entries.folscout:170: [knowingly, explaining] Not really. The only thing I can think of is that the person would have to have access to some information and have access to the outside. You might want to look to the initiates or scouts.
entries.folscout:172: [pleased, smugly satisfied] Nicole will be pleased, then, to know that I killed the agent.
entries.folscout:173: [with reluctant agreement] You must be right. Thank you for setting me straight.
entries.folscout:174: [accusatorily, outraged, nasally] I think you are the double agent. Trying to trick me, I see. Well now you DIE!
entries.folscout:175: [with smug satisfaction] Great job on wasting that agent. Now we might have a chance against those Children.
entries.folscout:178: [enthusiastically, with fake warmth] Would you? That would be wonderful.
entries.genmerca:100: [warmly, with eager friendliness] Hello! What can I do for you?
entries.genmerca:116: [apologetically, nervously] Sorry, this company is already full.
entries.genmerca:117: [hesitantly, with cautious concern] Sorry, but I don't think I can trust you.
entries.genraidr:109: [eagerly aggressive] I'm waiting for Garl to crush Shady Sands. I want some loot.
entries.genraidr:111: [flatly] I'm glad that you could return for a visit.
entries.genraidr:116: [trying to sound threatening] So, you think you're tough, huh? [nervous laugh] Mess with me and we'll both find out.
entries.genraidr:117: [snappily dismissive] I don't like your looks.
entries.genraidr:123: [impatiently] Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
entries.genraidr:125: [defensively] Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
entries.genraidr:130: [with forced casual interest] Really? What does she look like?
entries.genraidr:132: [with calculating menace] Yeah, she's here. She's in the big house. [dropping to a lower tone] You know, if we tell Garl, then he would want a piece of the bounty. You might want to think about that.
entries.genraidr:133: [with sharp suspicion] You don't sound like you mean it. I think that you are up to something. And if you are telling the truth, then I'll bag the reward for myself.
entries.genraidr:134: [fearfully, voice shaking] I . . . I can't say any more or Garl will kill me.
entries.genraidr:136: [threateningly] I don't like your looks. You'd better get away from me.

entries.gretch:102: [curiously, wheezy] What you down here for?
entries.gretch:120: [matter-of-factly, breathing heavily] Body parts almost ready to go to Hub.
entries.gretch:124: [happily, speaking slowly] Iguana man Bob send you . . . he happy, lots of good meat . . .
entries.gretch:128: [simply, with a wheezy chuckle] For Bob to sell . . . to eat . . . why you ask what we use for?
entries.gretch:132: [confusedly, scratching head] Me have trouble thinking, too . . . what we talk about?
entries.gretch:137: [dismissively, turning away] I don't talk to you any more.
entries.gretch:138: [proudly, matter-of-factly] Yes . . . Doc Morbid has best human bodies around. None better.
entries.gretch:140: [with finality, breathing heavily] I go back to work now.
entries.gunther:102: [warmly] Welcome to my humble house. What can I do for you?
entries.gunther:107: [helpfully] Sure, what else would you like to know?
entries.gunther:108: [gesturing conversationally] It is a sprawling city, the largest I have seen in my life. The center of the town lies to the south, with the other areas branching off in each direction from there.
entries.gunther:113: [with a friendly drawl] I get everything that I need from Mitch down by the Maltese Falcon. Just head on south from here.
entries.gunther:114: [chattily] I occasionaly do a stint on one of the caravans that head out from here. If you're looking for that kind of work, just talk to one of the trading houses. I'm partial to the Far Go Traders, but I've worked with all of them.
entries.gunther:115: [recommending] Well, I buy most of my stuff from Beth over in the Weapon Store. Got a pretty good selection.
entries.gunther:118: [leaning in conspiratorially] I've heard there is some guy over in Old Town that deals in stuff with a little more punch.
entries.gunther:119: [with a knowing chuckle] Probably not, she's sweet on her bodyguard Sid. But, you might want to try Butch, he runs the Far Go Traders - which owns her store.
entries.gunther:120: [matter-of-factly] I get by. I hire on with the caravans when I'm a little short on cash, and work for the farmers down south a bit.
entries.gunther:121: [helpfully] Well, you probably passed Deputy Fry on your way down here. His boss is Sheriff Greene, and you'll find him in the Police Station most of the time.
entries.gunther:123: [sympathetically, shaking head] I'm sorry, but you're not making any sense. Maybe Dr. Thorndyke with the Children can help you.
entries.gwen:101: [with a sneering growl] I am Gwen. I'm one of Garl's advisors. Who are you?
entries.gwen:107: [threateningly] As an advisor, I make sure that no low-lifes cause any trouble for Garl.
entries.gwen:112: [dismissively, sneering] Hmpf. If you're nobody special then I won't bother talking to you. Go away.
entries.gwen:113: [angrily] I keep idiots like you from bothering Garl. Go away!
entries.gwen:114: [with menacing calm] I have ways to make certain undesirables are no longer here.
entries.gwen:118: [with a raspy growl, excitedly] It's been so long since I've had a good fight. Too bad you are going to lose. Here is proof of my skills!
entries.gwen:119: [coldly threatening] You'll regret that remark. It will be your last!
entries.gwen:120: [with contemptuous slowness] If that is the best you can do, then I will be doing the world a favor by killing you.
entries.gwen:122: [with barely contained rage] You annoy me. Leave before I become truly angry.
entries.harry:191: [with a deep, gravelly growl] You're not taking me anywhere!
entries.hbeth:101: [warmly, cheerfully] Hi there. How can I help you?
entries.hbeth:117: [excited, gossipy] Well, I'm not one to gossip, but I heard that Decker's death is somehow related to the assassination hit on Jain.
entries.hbeth:118: [leaning in, whispering eagerly] Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but I know someone who knows someone that says that they saw three extremely large robed figures go into the Maltese Falcon right before the murders.
entries.hbeth:119: [leaning in conspiratorially] Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but someone killed Jain, the High Priestess of the Children of the Cathedral. I don't care for them myself, but I don't know what she could have done to deserve that.
entries.hbeth:121: [conspiratorially, quickly] Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but a merchant friend of mine saw a group of mutants wandering around in the desert up past the Brotherhood of Steel, far to the Northwest.
entries.hbeth:122: [urgently, with concern] Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but the Children of the Cathedral have been asking people where you are. I'd be careful. They're a strange bunch.
entries.hbeth:123: [excited, gossipy] Well, I'm not one to gossip, but I heard that Decker's death is somehow related to the assassination hit on Jain.
entries.hbeth:124: [leaning in conspiratorially] There is something else. I know someone who knows someone that says that they saw three extremely large robed figures go into the Maltese Falcon right before the murders.
entries.hbeth:125: [leaning in with hushed concern] There is something else. Someone killed Jain, the High Priestess of the Children of the Cathedral. I don't care for them myself, but I don't know what she could have done to deserve that.
entries.hbeth:126: [leaning in urgently] There is something else. A merchant friend of mine saw a group of mutants wandering around in the desert up past the Brotherhood of Steel, far to the Northwest.
entries.hbeth:127: [urgently, with warning] There is something else. The Children of the Cathedral have been asking people where you are. I'd be careful. They're a strange bunch.
entries.hbeth:134: [kindly, gently concerned] I'm sorry, I don't understand. Please come back when you are feeling better.
entries.hbeth:135: [matter-of-factly, helpfully] Well I'm not hiring but there's a job post in the center of the Merchant Market, you might want to check there.
entries.hbeth:137: [with a knowing grin] No, nothing good at least. Give me a chance to do some digging. [winking] Anything else?
entries.hbeth:140: [warmly, helpfully] What else can I do for you?
entries.hbeth:141: [cheerfully, with a friendly laugh] Of course you can, don't be silly.
entries.hbeth:142: [warmly, eagerly] Why sure, I'd be happy to help. What did you need to know?
entries.hbeth:143: [warmly, politely] All right. Well it's been nice talking to you, have a nice day.
entries.hbeth:144: [brightly, cheerfully] No, that's all. Was there something else you wanted to talk about?
entries.hbeth:147: [warmly, invitingly] Well come back soon. Don't be a stranger.
entries.hbeth:148: [lowering voice, nervously] Now there's someone you don't ever want to mess with, he scares me. He 'owns' the Maltese Falcon.
entries.hbeth:151: [sadly, nostalgically] Sorry, it just reminds me of a friend that used to own it before him. Decker wanted it really bad, but my friend wouldn't sell. Two days later they found him dead in a back alley of Old Town.
entries.hbeth:155: [passionately, angrily] My friend was a clean freak. He wouldn't come within a hundred yards of Old Town. He was shot with a Magnum; no one in Old Town could afford one of those. Plus, he was shot once in the head and twice in the back. Does that sound like a robbery? My friend was just trying to get his life back.
entries.hbeth:160: [seriously, with emotion] You probably don't understand, but most of us look forward to the day when we own our own lives. When our lives don't belong to the merchants or the money lenders.
entries.hbeth:164: [cheerfully, helpfully] Is there anything else I can do for you?
entries.hbeth:165: [sharply, defensively] Well, excuse me. YOU asked.
entries.hbeth:166: [gravely, warning tone] He's the deadliest person in the Hub; most say that he runs this place, not the merchants or the police. If you ever cross him, watch out.
entries.hbeth:167: [angrily, with conviction] That gives him no right to kill anyone.
entries.hbeth:168: [coldly, with barely contained rage] You make me sick, please leave. I'm sure he's missing your company.
entries.hbeth:169: [quickly, matter-of-factly] Well, there are three main merchant groups. There's the Water Merchants, the Crimson Caravan, and the Far Go Traders. They also run the city council. What do you want to know about?
entries.hbeth:177: [dismissively, with distaste] They're in charge of all the water. Greedy people, I wouldn't want to work for them. Their pay is the worst and the jobs are just as bad.
entries.hbeth:182: [brightly, invitingly] What else would you like to know about?
entries.hbeth:183: [settling into explanation mode] No. From what I've heard, a while back a group of merchants seized control of the water tower and proclaimed that they were the water merchants and people had to get water from them. The merchant war raged on for years until a man named Roy Greene - yeah, Justin's Grandfather, that's it - helped to negotiate an agreement that ended the war.
entries.hbeth:188: [getting heated, then catching herself] Well he set up the city council and set a limit on the price of water. Personally I think they should have beat the tar out of them - oh, sorry. I mean they should have showed them who's boss.
entries.hbeth:192: [apologetically, sheepishly] Sorry I tend to get carried away with myself. Was there anything else you wanted to know about?
entries.hbeth:193: [with concern, shaking head] The Crimson Caravan are a bunch of crazy people. They will do any job, no matter what the risk. I'm surprised they aren't missing more caravans than they are.
entries.hbeth:198: [continuing matter-of-factly] They will pass right through an area known to be attacked by raiders. They charge a lot so they can hire extra hands. The pay's great but you have to be alive to spend it, right?
entries.hbeth:202: [thoughtfully, with a shrug] Actually all the merchants have had a few caravans disappear. The Far Go Traders are just unlucky, I suppose.
entries.hbeth:206: [warmly, with pride] The Far Go Traders pay well and their jobs aren't too deadly. Butch owns this shop, a good man. They're fair and let me do as I please with the place; I like working with them. Plus you get a discount on anything you buy here if you work for Butch.
entries.hbeth:207: [dismissively] Personally I don't think so. I think it was the Deathclaw or maybe the Brotherhood of Steel.
entries.hbeth:215: [firmly, with doubt] Some people think the Water Merchants are responsible, but I don't think so. I think it was that darn Deathclaw, or maybe the people over at the Brotherhood of Steel.
entries.hbeth:216: [with conviction, slightly nervous] Well, I thought that it was destroying the caravans, but I guess not. It's still out there though. There are too many rumors floating around for it not to exist.
entries.hbeth:217: [adamantly] I think that's what's taking the caravans. It could also be the Brotherhood of Steel; they're a strange bunch. Some people think it's the Water Merchants, but they're wrong.
entries.hbeth:219: [matter-of-factly] Because, like I've been telling everyone, they've had a few caravans disappear too. Nothing like what's happening to the Far Go Traders, but they are being affected.
entries.hbeth:226: [sharply, defensively] Excuse you! You're awfully quick to judge, are you afraid of the truth?
entries.hbeth:227: [settling in, matter-of-factly] There are six representatives two from each of the main merchant groups. Everything needs at least four votes to be passed. They can never agree on anything.
entries.hbeth:228: [passionately, thoughtfully] Good thought, but I highly doubt it. They've been sabotaging each other for years, but this is not their style. They wouldn't spend that much money to take out the caravans. Plus all the caravans are very heavily guarded. You would think someone would escape. They don't have the man power or the cash to pull that off. There would have been at least one survivor.
entries.hbeth:233: [philosophically, with a shrug] Bad luck? I don't know, maybe they're traveling along different routes than the others. Maybe because they aren't as heavily guarded as the Crimson Caravan but . . . they might have better cargo than the Water Merchants. Who knows. There doesn't seem to be any clear difference between the three.
entries.hbeth:239: [sharply, with irritation] Excuse me! You're free to leave at any time. If you didn't want the answer you shouldn't have asked.
entries.hbeth:240: [leaning in, urgently, almost afraid] The Deathclaw is the most evil thing to rise out of the ashes after the War. Some say it's a powerful ghost from the war that haunts the land. It's no ghost, it's as real as you and me. It's 20 feet tall with teeth as big as your arm. It's some kind of demon that found it's way here when the world was engulfed in fire.
entries.hbeth:245: [excitedly, with amazement] Well, I know this old mutant in Old Town named Harold. He's seen it. He's the 'only' one that's seen it and lived.
entries.hbeth:252: [dismissively, shaking head] Uncle Slappy over in Old Town talks about it sometimes, but he's just a crazy old fool.
entries.hbeth:257: [animatedly, with a laugh] Yeah, pretty amazing isn't it. It's down to the southwest somewhere. There's an old mutant in Old Town named Harold who actually saw this thing in its lair. Nicest Skag I know.
entries.hbeth:266: [uncertainly, trailing off] Well, um. I don't remember, but who ever it was wouldn't lie . . . I mean, it might be true! You should be careful just the same.
entries.hbeth:271: [lowering voice conspiratorially] Why, you don't know? I heard that they make human sacrifices and do all sorts of other terrible things!
entries.hbeth:276: [coldly, accusingly] Like you don't know. You're obviously one of them, walking around in that metal suit. You're all a bunch of sick people.
entries.hbeth:283: [nervously, stammering, flustered] Uhh . . . well, yeah . . . umm You . . . I . . . Is there anything else you needed?
entries.hbeth:284: [seriously, with concern] You never know what a person's really like behind closed doors. You've got to be careful with who you associate yourself with. Was there anything else you needed?
entries.hbeth:285: [flustered, backtracking quickly, nervous laugh] You're a . . . ? I mean. I didn't mean . . . Umm . . . Lovely day we're having. Don't you think so? So, was there anything else I can do for you?
entries.hbeth:289: [resigned, dismissively] Sure, whatever you say. Was there anything else that I can do for you?
entries.hbeth:297: [brightly, matter-of-factly] Oh, that's right. You're working for Butch, you get the 15% discount.
entries.hbeth:330: [extremely excitedly, with delight] Did you hear? He's dead! I'm overjoyed! That's the best thing that's ever happened to this city.
entries.hbeth:331: [with relief, almost giddy] I already told you. He's dead! Let's just forget about him, his name brings back bad memories.
entries.hbeth:334: [bursting with joy and gratitude] You did it? Really? I love you! [to Sid, warningly] Don't even think about it wise guy . . . Here, to show my gratitude . . . [gratefully] It's not much, but I really appreciate it!
entries.hbeth:335: [warmly, enthusiastically] You did it? Really? You're the best! You have no idea how happy I was to hear that he was dead. Here take these . . . [gratefully] It's not much, but I really appreciate it!
entries.hbeth:399: [urgently, with warning] Oh yes. You ought to stay as far away from the Maltese Falcon as you possibly can. Decker and his greasy lapdog Kane are bad news. They'll eat you alive if you're not careful. I'd also give Lorenzo at the Friendly Lending company a wide berth.
entries.hchdgrd:110: [with menacing calm] I'm a hired hand. If anyone bothers these space cadets, I kill em. You got a problem with that?
entries.hchdgrd:117: [sharply] Something called a Holy Flame. [scoffing] Don't listen to this bullshit, it'll rot your brain!
entries.hchdgrd:122: [slowly, gravelly] Water chip? Do you mean like ice chips? Up in the mountains, maybe.
entries.hchdgrd:127: [with a knowing sneer] Yeah, I heard about him. He's a real bastard, but he pays his bills. Phillips worked for him a few times.
entries.hchdgrd:132: [gruffly satisfied] Yeah, this is the only one I'd want in a fire fight. What can I do for you?
entries.hchdgrd:138: [firmly] Sorry pal, but I'm on duty. No small talk.
entries.hchdgrd:139: [threateningly] Get the Hell out of my face before I kill you.
entries.hchdgrd:140: [sarcastically biting] Way to go, Rocket Scientist! Who else could I be, Doc Morbid? Jeez!
entries.hchdgrd:141: [scoffing sharply] The priest bitch. Who else did you think? Jeez!
entries.hchdgrd:142: [with a gravelly shrug] I hate to admit it pal, but I've been out of the loop for weeks. You better ask someone else.
entries.hchdgrd:143: [with disdainful amusement] Room and board and not much else. These religious types are cheap!
entries.hchdgrd:144: [with aggressive readiness] Then let's solve it!
entries.hchdgrd:145: [grudgingly] Fine. Because nobody likes a problem around here.
entries.hchdgrd:146: [mockingly] It's gotta be a scam. Nobody's really dumb enough to believe all this religious shit. Could they?
entries.hchdgrd:147: [with contemptuous dismissal] Yeah. It's a good thing that they aren't paying me to agree with them. Holy flame, my ass!
entries.hchdgrd:148: [seriously, with grudging respect] I dunno. I can tell you one thing, whatever you can say about the religion, they're not amateurs. They came in and organized this place like clockwork. This isn't just another band of mindless zombies.
entries.hchdgrd:149: [with sharp disbelief] Jeez, I thought only Vaults used that sort of crap!
entries.hchdgrd:150: [threateningly] Watch your mouth, asshole. These people may believe in peace and love, but I don't!
entries.hchdgrd:152: [matter-of-factly] Nah. The higher you climb, the worse the radiation gets.
entries.hchdgrd:153: [with a gravelly chuckle] Uh, if you like psychotic, stone cold ruthless bastards, then he's the man.
entries.hchdgrd:154: [curtly informative] My partner. The guy who's guarding Jain.
entries.hchdgrd:155: [with casual menace] It depends on how much risk you like. My life's been kinda busy lately, so I came here to lie low. But if you like action, sure. Just don't screw up or you're dead, that's all.
entries.hchdgrd:156: [with a knowingness] I hear the Water Merchants are always packing the best shit. But people will say anything about the Water Merchants. It ain't here among this crowd, that's for damn sure.
entries.hchdgrd:157: [with growing intensity] I been trying to get a good read on these guys for weeks. At first I thought they were fools, but now… [with serious conviction] I ain't sure. They're organized, and they've got a plan. I can smell it!
entries.hchdgrd:158: [with a gravelly sneer] I hear Decker's got some action, but man, it's shitty work and if you screw up, you're as good as dead.
entries.hchdgrd:159: [matter-of-factly] Water purification chip? You don't use well water? Good lord! I heard tell of a Vault near Shady Sands where you might find one, but that place is completely caved in. I don't think I can help you.
entries.hchdgrd:162: [with aggressive urgency] Hey! What do you think you're doing!
entries.hchdgrd:167: [threateningly] None of your business! Get outta here!
entries.hchdgrd:168: [with satisfaction] Good! Now get outta here!
entries.hchdgrd:169: [with cold finality] Get lost! If you pull this sort of shit again, I'll kill you personally!
entries.heather:101: [sharply, interrogating] What are you doing here?
entries.heather:107: [suspiciously] Really? And what might you be looking for?
entries.heather:112: [coldly, dismissive] Thank you, but I am already spoken for. I think it is time for you to leave.
entries.heather:113: [with frustrated exasperation] Yes, the spy. I have heard of that bothersome pest. I really wish we could catch him.
entries.heather:118: [muttering darkly] I bet it was the braggart Neil that said as much. I'll have to have a talk with him later.
entries.heather:122: [with grim certainty] I am almost sure of it. I just need some proof.
entries.heather:126: [tersely] Thank you. You don't know how much this means to me. Once you get proof, kill him.
entries.heather:127: [matter-of-factly, clipped] What is there not to know? He has access to the Children. He works during the night when most are asleep. It has to be him.
entries.heather:130: [coldly threatening] I am truly sorry that you think that way. I cannot have someone think I am a spy. I will remove you from service.
entries.heather:131: [with hard certainty] He has access to the Children during the night. No one ever sees him on duty. It must be him.
