entries.heather:134: [suspiciously calculating] I am not certain as to who it is. I think it may either be a guard or a scholar. They keep sneaking into the Children's Cathedral at night.
entries.heather:138: [curtly] Not really. Just that I think it is a male and probably a scholar or guard.
entries.heather:140: [grimly] True. We scouts do many raids on the Children, and to much loss lately. This spy costs us dearly.
entries.heather:144: [sharply defensive] Why would one of us do that?
entries.heather:148: [with growing suspicion] Sounds like a good thought. I've noticed Peter never gets attacked much in the raids. I think he may be the one.
entries.heather:151: [taken aback, dangerously quiet] You think that it is me?
entries.heather:154: [clipped, dismissive] Then wonder somewhere else. I must get back to work.
entries.heather:155: [muttering anxiously] I think he thinks I am the spy. But I'm not.
entries.heather:158: [defensively] Because I am the new scout. I've only been here for about a year and the trouble started about five months ago.
entries.heather:161: [coldly firm] Then look elsewhere. This is no place for you.
entries.heather:162: [with a knowing edge] If you need information, look to Nicole. She thinks she knows everything.
entries.heather:163: [offering a deal, calculating] I can be persuaded to tell you something that's going on. For a price.
entries.heather:167: [flatly mercenary] Three hundred caps and the information is yours.
entries.heather:170: [briskly businesslike] There will be a raid on the south end of the Children's stronghold. Now go.
entries.heather:171: [furiously] Trying to cheat me? I'll show you!
entries.heather:172: [coldly formal] I'm sorry you feel that way. But, good day to you.
entries.heather:173: [with bitter practicality] I need to get by somehow. Now, do you want in or not?
entries.higheld:101: [clipped and commanding] Greetings Initiate. I need to speak with you.
entries.higheld:111: [sharply] Good. First go talk to Maxson if you haven't already. Report back to me when you've checked the northern territory. After that, we'll decide what to do with Maxson.
entries.higheld:113: [with impatient snap] Have you explored the entire northern territory?
entries.higheld:116: [tersely] And what do you have to report?
entries.higheld:118: [biting] I didn't think so. You weren't gone for very long. Now, get back out there and don't come back until you have a FULL report.
entries.higheld:120: [formally] I will inform the Elders. We will wait for Maxson's word on what to do. Go inform him on what you've found. Thanks for your help, Initiate.
entries.higheld:122: [with cold authority] Then you will make time to hear me out.
entries.higheld:126: [measured but direct] I understand. If you do travel up into that area and find anything, please, let me know.
entries.higheld:128: [with gruff satisfaction] Good work with the mutants. We already heard that you destroyed their production facility. Thanks for taking care of that problem for us.
entries.higheld:130: [sharply incredulous] Err? What kind of response is Err? Leave! Now!
entries.higheld:139: [cutting through the air] And what did these mutants look like?
entries.higheld:142: [calmly methodical] As you may know, our Head Scribe, Vree, has done an autopsy on a creature very similar to what you have just described. Do you believe these are the same?
entries.higheld:144: [pointedly] What threat do you assume these "mutants" pose?
entries.higheld:146: [coldly logical] Frankly, your report has not shown us any proof that they are a threat to us. What proof can you give that they have hostile intentions.
entries.higheld:149: [pressing forward] So, by these actions they are taking, it is feasable that they will eventually come here?
entries.higheld:151: [skeptically] I don't believe that shows hostility. They could simply be protecting themselves from attack. Even we have to deal with the occasional attack.
entries.higheld:154: [with dry skepticism] What do you suggest? A preemptive strike at their military base?
entries.higheld:157: [with finality] So be it. You shall have three Paladins of my choosing to meet you at the Military Base to help you get inside. Elders, thank you for your time. Best of luck to you Initiate.
entries.higheld:162: [with finality] So be it. You shall have two Paladins of my choosing to meet you at the Boneyard Cathedral. Elders, thank you for your time. Best of luck to you Initiate.
entries.higheld:164: [with cold disgust, speaking to the Elders] Obviously we made a mistake. Elders, I am sorry for wasting your time. Would someone please remove this mental abomination?
entries.hightowr:101: [angrily, spitting] Who are you?!?  And [sneering] who let you in?
entries.hightowr:109: [coldly, dismissively] I have no friends.  What is your message?
entries.hightowr:114: [shouting contemptuously] Tell me something I don't know, you moron!
entries.hightowr:121: [with greedy satisfaction] I don't know any Bob, but I'll take the 100 caps and you can leave.
entries.hightowr:125: [sarcastically, dripping venom] Think nothing of it.  I always enjoy strangers coming into my home and giving me money.  [shouting imperiously] Leon, show this fool the door! [threateningly] Come back again, and my guards will have your head!
entries.hightowr:126: [shouting imperiously] Leon, show this fool the door!  [threateningly, with barely restrained rage] Come back again, and my guards will have your head!
entries.htwrgrge:101: [with casual smugness] Can I help you?
entries.htwrgrge:106: [dismissively] Mr. Hightower doesn't see just anyone.
entries.htwrgrge:112: [threateningly, leaning in] I know all of Mr. Hightower's associates and I've never seen you before, so you'd better leave. [coldly] Now.
entries.htwrgrge:113: [with a smug chuckle] Oh, man are you in trouble! [mockingly] Mr. H hates it when his appointments are late. [with grim satisfaction] I'll let him chew you out himself. Go on in.
entries.htwrgrge:114: [aggressively blocking] You're not getting in here. [shouting] Beat it, skag!
entries.htwrleon:101: [threateningly flat] What is your business here?
entries.htwrleon:105: [curtly] Ok. [with cold warning] But I'm watching you. [matter-of-factly] He's in his office.
entries.htwrleon:108: [growling] I don't like your attitude. [coldly] I'm going to have to ask you to leave.
entries.htwrleon:112: [with impatient dismissal] Whatever it is, you can tell me. [flatly] Mr. H is busy right now.
entries.htwrleon:116: [with menacing simplicity] You can tell me, or you can leave.
entries.htwrleon:121: [scoffing] Again? [disgusted] What a fool Decker is. [impatiently] Well?... [with contemptuous slowness] I guess he's not as big a fool as the guys he hires for these jobs. [with cold pride] See here, check out my gun.
entries.htwrleon:123: [coldly explaining] Each one of these marks is for a past attempt on Hightower's life. [flatly menacing] I bagged each and every one of them. [with harsh curiosity] Tell me... do you know what this fool Decker hired looks like?
entries.htwrleon:127: [with forced civility] Thank you for the advance warning, but [coldly] Mr. Hightower doesn't like strangers hangin' around. [threatening] I'm going to have to ask you to leave.
entries.htwrleon:130: [shouting curtly] Mr. Hightower is not taking any visitors. [barking] Now leave!
entries.htwrrick:106: [shouting menacingly] Get back over to the Eastside, you hop head!
entries.htwrrick:109: [gruffly, with irritation] Make it quick. I'm not supposed to be talking on the job.
entries.htwrrick:113: [threateningly] You'd better watch your step and your mouth, punk!
entries.htwrrick:116: [coldly, matter-of-fact] If you don't know, you probably shouldn't be here. This is the Heights. Mister Hightower lives here and he only sees people on appointment.
entries.htwrrick:120: [with gravelly authority] I'm here to make sure nobody messes with Mr. Hightower.
entries.htwrrick:125: [aggressively] I don't like your attitude. You'd better leave.
entries.htwrrick:128: [with menacing calm, slowly] After sundown nobody is allowed in this area. The other guards won't even give you a warning. If they catch you they'll attack. You'd better get back downtown while your head is still attached to your neck.
entries.htwrrick:133: [scoffing, with disgust] Man, you are rock-stupid, aren't you? Take a hike!
entries.hubflrcd:103: [eagerly, with peppy enthusiasm] Would you like a flower, mister?
entries.hubflrcd:104: [eagerly, with peppy enthusiasm] Would you like a flower, madam?
entries.hubflrcd:115: [whiny, exasperated] Do you want the flower or don't you!
entries.hubflrcd:121: [speaking rapidly, almost breathlessly] It's a Unity Rose. It's the color of the Holy Flame, and represents the peace and harmony we'll have when the Children of the Cathedral helps everyone in the whole world become friendly and strong! [nervously hopeful] Uh, do you want one?
entries.hubflrcd:129: [excitedly, speaking fast] It's free. We don't believe in money. The Holy Flame takes care of all of our needs! It's so wonderful! You should join us in our Cathedral of Happiness! [with uncertain eagerness] Uh, do you want one?
entries.hubflrcd:135: [delighted, with manic energy] Thank you, oh thank you! I gave away a flower! Isn't that great…
entries.hubflrcd:136: [voice cracking with childish rage] You're mean! I hate you! I hope you get eaten by the Holy Flame!
entries.hubflrcd:137: [excitedly, speaking fast] They sure do! Have one! I gave away a flower! Isn't that great…
entries.hubflrcd:138: [bratty and vicious] You're stupid! I hope the Holy Flame kills you before you can say anymore stupid things. [urgently calling out] Mother Jain, watch out for the stupid man!
entries.hubflrcd:139: [with fervent, breathless intensity, speaking quickly] We're the Children of the Cathedral. We've been commanded by the Holy Flame itself to feed the hungry and heal the sick. We're going to spread peace and unity everywhere…and everything will be soooo good! [enthusiastically] Here, have your flower!
entries.hubflrcd:140: [whining, with hurt disappointment] I don't think you want a flower at all. You're being mean to me!
entries.hubflrcd:141: [giggling condescendingly] Roses won't do that, silly! [speaking earnestly, fast] Only people can change the world. And with the Holy Flame as our master, we'll be sure to make everything nice and special! [hopefully] So would you like a flower…
entries.hubflrcd:147: [with intense, manic conviction] That's the fire that cleansed the world, and if we obey it, it'll never do it again! It wants us be smart and peaceful and unified and stuff! [hopefully] So would you like a flower?
entries.hubflrcd:152: [dreamily, speaking with childish wonder] It's a wonderful place near the ocean, where people spend all their time praising the Holy Flame and being good. And everyone there is kind, except maybe Father Lasher. [nervously] Uh…would you like a flower?
entries.hubjake:101: [warmly, with a friendly smile] Hi! Welcome to Jake's. I've got some great merchandise in stock. Feel free to look around.
entries.hubjake:109: [enthusiastically] I deal with high end arms. The best stuff you can find this side of the Brotherhood, and since the Brotherhood doesn't deal with outsiders, I've gotta' say I'm the best. [getting more animated] I have a Sniper Rifle, and you would be hard pressed to find Flame Thrower fuel anywhere else in the wastes. [with genuine excitement] Oh yeah... I've got a Geiger counter, too. Very rare.
entries.hubjake:114: [warmly, with good-natured excitement] Man, you do like the rare stuff! Where were you when I was selling some depleted uranium rounds a few years back? [matter-of-factly] I don't do chips, though. Ain't a market in it. Anything else?
entries.hubjake:118: [reflectively, a bit nostalgic] Well, I've been around. Used to be with the Union of Atomic Workers. Sort of like the Brotherhood, but less friendly. They wanted to keep to themselves, and I... [with a hint of pride] well, I wanted to see the world and be my own boss, so I left.
entries.hubjake:123: [with knowledgeable pride] Ahh, the DKS is a fine long range weapon. It was originally .308, but we rechambered it for the more common .223 round. We tuned the barrel, too. [really driving home the point] Most importantly, check out this trigger. [inviting them to feel it] Smooth, huh? The trigger breaks perfectly now. [confidently] Overall, this is a good choice for hunting any type of animal...
entries.hubjake:127: [with playful incredulity] What do you need a Gieger counter for!? [laughing warmly] Though it's been 80 years or so since the bombs fell, there's still radiation around, you goof. You can't see it, never could, but it's there. [conversationally] Heck I'm willin' to bet you got some counts on you now. Everyone that lives in the wastes has a few RAD counts.
entries.hubjake:132: [with a more serious, cautionary tone] Well, some call it the Phantom Death, 'cause that's what it is. You can't see it, you can't hear it, you can't even smell it. [gravely] It basically builds up in your system. You never feel it until it's too late. The more trips you make to Hot Spots, the more it builds up and it will never leave your system. Ever. The Rads just keep building up. [with a slight pause] Well... unless you can get a hold of some Rad-Away.
entries.hubjake:138: [matter-of-factly] It's pretty simple, actually. You use it and it tells you how many Rads you have. [instructively] As long as you keep your Rad count under 100, you should be fine. Go above 100 and you're in some trouble. [with a note of concern] The worst part is you won't even know you've been sucking up Rads until a few days later. Get over 1000 and you're cooked [with emphasis] - unless you get a hold of a whole lot of Rad-Away.
entries.hubjake:148: [coldly, with a warning edge] I don't want any trouble. If you want to do business then let's do it. If not, get out.
entries.hubjake:155: [with a helpful tone] I don't carry it. Any I find I keep for myself. [gesturing down the street] Right up the street here, there's a guy that may be able to help you. His name is Vance. [cautiously] Don't ask too many questions of him. Let's just say this is his area of expertise. [reassuringly] Just tell him Jacob sent you and he should do you up just fine.
entries.hubjake:162: [with a resigned, matter-of-fact tone] The mutants wiped 'em out about ten years ago, so I guess I made the right decision. [reflectively] I eventually settled down here. The cops don't like my trade and I've been rousted more than once, but [with a hint of pride] I'm a helluva lot more honest than most of the merchants here.
entries.hubjake:163: [warmly, like greeting an old friend] Hey, how's it going my friend? Lookin' to buy somethin'?
entries.hubjake:164: [warmly, like greeting an old friend] Hey, how's it going my friend? Lookin' to buy somethin'?
entries.hubjake:166: [helpfully] Well, you might try the Gun Runners over in the Boneyard. They'll probably have something to suit your needs. [conversationally] I've heard the guys at the Brotherhood of Steel pack some pretty powerful hardware too, so you might check them out.
entries.hunter:106: [threateningly] We don't appreciate wise guys here. Buzz off.
entries.hunter:107: [with dangerous calm] That joke wasn't even funny the first time. You're about to discover why I'm one of the most fearsome bounty hunters in the wasteland. [growling] And I won't even get paid for it.
entries.hunter:109: [dismissively, barking] Well, go poke around somewhere else.
entries.hwmhost:105: [scoffing, with exasperation] Man, you're dumber than a bag of hammers, aren't you? Get outta' here.
entries.hwmhost:106: [matter-of-factly] You're in the south end of the Hub. If you look around you'll find the Water Merchants and a small hospital.
entries.hwmhost:110: [bitterly] Those bastards. [growling] They think they own the damn Hub just because they have control of the Water Tower.
entries.hwmhost:113: [grudgingly respectful] The Children of the Cathedral run a small hospital here in the Hub. They seem like a decent bunch.
entries.irwin:101: [exasperatedly] Oh boy, can't you leave me alone? I have enough problems on my hands already.
entries.irwin:105: [sighing, wearily] Hmm... I don't know. It takes a different caliber of hero than you. Listen, why don't you come back when you have a little more experience under your belt?
entries.irwin:106: [voice cracking with emotion] This is a tragedy, believe me. Nothing is the way it used to be. I have a small farm outside town and a few days ago a bunch of Raiders appeared out of nowhere and now use my home as their camp. They killed Pugsley, my donkey and they threatened to kill me if I ever dare to come back.
entries.irwin:109: [hopefully, but hesitantly] Really, you would do that? You know, I don't dare to go there any more. Why don't you come back and let me know when it is safe to go back home again?
entries.irwin:110: [voice shrill with indignation] Listen freak, I told you to let me alone in the first place. Now beat it!
entries.irwin:111: [muttering bitterly] I knew you would chicken out. Everyone does when it comes to the Raiders.
entries.irwin:112: [eagerly, almost pleading] So, have you been able to teach those Raiders a lesson? Is my home safe again?
entries.irwin:115: [gratefully, voice cracking] Oh, thank you so much. I am sorry I don't have any riches to give to you, but here, take this rifle for saving my home.
entries.irwin:116: [desperately] You're trying to fool me, right? Please don't play with me. Come back and let me know when it is really safe to get back into my home, will you?
entries.irwin:119: [irritably, dismissively] Look, I don't have time for idiots. Come back when you've got some smarts.
entries.jain:161: [nervously, in a rush] Relax, I didn't mean it!
entries.jake:102: [warmly, with false charm] Welcome, my friend! How might I help you today?
entries.jake:107: [dismissively, becoming condescending] You want to help. I don't think you are good enough to help me out. Go talk to Neil.
entries.jake:108: [scoffing] I would love to fight you, but I am much too busy helping Nicole right now.
entries.jake:112: [defensively snippy] Hey. Just because I don't want to fight doesn't mean I'm a wimp. I just don't feel like it.
entries.jake:114: [speaking as if to a child, smugly] Some of us will use our brains to get further in this world. A lot can be settled with peace and thinking.
entries.jake:117: [coldly, with finality] That's it. I'm not going to talk to you anymore.
entries.jake:118: [back to friendly, almost eager] That's better. Now. I have a problem with a spy around here. Will you help me?
entries.jake:121: [impatiently explaining] I just said we have a spy around here. I think it may be one of the guards that is the spy. Though it could be a scout. Those are the only two groups that have access to the Children.
entries.jake:125: [dismissively cheerful] Thank you very much. Now go!
entries.jake:126: [with condescending patience] Nothing really. The only things I really know about is that a lot of low level information is getting to the Children. This is not good. Heather thinks it is either Neil or Peter.
entries.jake:129: [threateningly calm] I can't let you leave then.
entries.jake:131: [gravely, matter-of-fact] We are having trouble with some of our information slipping out to the Children. I think it is a spy.
entries.jake:136: [coldly dismissive] Currently, I can't tell you anything. Good day.
entries.jake:137: [irritably] I am trying to sleep. Don't bother me.
entries.jake:138: [urgently, with sharp intensity] Hurry up and find that vile scum!
entries.jake:139: [bitterly, with a bitter laugh] I knew it was Heather all along. She was deceitful from the start. I should have told everyone what I thought at first.
entries.jake:140: [coldly scornful] I never did learn anything from you. Your training was useless.
entries.jake:142: [with polite brevity] Hmm. I see. Thank you.
entries.jarvis:105: [weakly, with desperate gratitude] Thank you so much for helping me. My name is Jarvis, and I'm Seth's younger brother. Please, if there's anything you need to know, just ask.
entries.jarvis:106: [hoarsely, with effort] Hello again. Can I help you with something?
entries.jarvis:110: [raspily, with admiration] Seth's a very good fighter. He's very determined. A little too much, sometimes. [with weary affection] Still, he's devoted to the welfare of our village.
entries.jarvis:111: [speaking carefully, as if reciting] Well, Shady Sands was founded by a great ancestor of our current leader, Aradesh. [with a slight wheeze] He could tell you more of the story. [with quiet pride] We have a well and irrigation, so we do well for ourselves.
entries.jason:102: [eagerly, speaking quickly] Hey, are you from really far away? Have you had a lot of adventures?
entries.jason:108: [deflating, slightly embarrassed] Oh. I thought someone who'd been through the wastes outside would be, well, smarter. Never mind.
entries.jason:109: [excitedly] Miles says that now that you got those parts, he can get the farms working, so that we don't have to sell bullets to the Hub. I never thought much about it until Smitty pointed out that the bullets he made were
entries.jason:110: [thoughtfully] sold to the Hub, who sold them to the gangs. I guess you found a good solution.
entries.jason:111: [voice cracking with emotion] I never thought that we would be able to stop fighting the gangs. My father told me how you got them to promise to leave us alone. You know, I thought I always wanted to go adventuring, but I think that I like . . . well, the
entries.jason:112: [with quiet relief] feeling of security here now. No more worrying about the gangs suddenly attacking and wondering who's going to be killed.
entries.jason:113: [with curious wonder] Lorraine says that there was a Vault south of here, where a lot of my grandparents lived. What's it like living in a Vault?
entries.jason:116: [hopefully] Oh. Well, you must have had some adventures after leaving, right?
entries.jason:120: [with casual interest] Huh. The Hub merchants talk about radscorpions and stuff.
entries.jason:123: [excitedly] Really? What kinds of monsters have you fought?
entries.jason:125: [with wide-eyed enthusiasm] Yeah, the Hub guards said that there are lots of radioactive mutant things living in the desert. Monster hunting must be a real blast!
entries.jason:128: [wistfully] I wish that I could go adventuring sometime.
entries.jason:129: [defensively] I never though about that. I rather like having clean water and a place to stay.
entries.jason:130: [thoughtfully, hesitantly] I thought that living in the wasteland would be . . . you know . . . rugged, and dangerous, and everything. But I suppose we have enough to keep us busy here, with the gangs and all.
entries.jason:131: [indignantly] What, are you some kind of weirdo or something? Caleb never should have let you in the gates!
entries.jason:132: [dismissively, with teenage frustration] That's cool. All we have here is this stupid well and those underground farms that Miles keeps trying to get working.
entries.jason:133: [with sympathetic curiosity] Yeah, I noticed that you don't have a bedroll or anything. It must get pretty dirty and uncomfortable out there.
entries.jason:134: [warmly] Hello again. Have any interesting stories to tell?
entries.jason:137: [eagerly] Well, if you do anything interesting, tell me all about it!
entries.jason:139: [frantically, voice shaking] Thank goodness you're here! Please help me get out of here!
entries.jason:146: [tearfully, frantically] I thought that it would be fun to leave Adytum and explore the world. But the Rippers caught me and have been holding me here. Please, help me!
entries.jason:149: [anxiously hopeful] I hope we get out of here soon!
entries.jchidmem:100: [with syrupy condescension] We offer healing of the body to heal the spirit. Can I help you?
entries.jchidmem:105: [in a slow, fake-soothing tone] That is fine, my child. We will examine you now.
entries.jchidmem:106: [sweetly patronizing] Blessed are the meek of mind. [chuckling softly] There is nothing wrong with you my child. Run along and play.
entries.jchidmem:107: [with false warmth] You have been healed. Be more careful in the future.
entries.jchidmem:109: [with mock concern] I see you are poisoned.
entries.jchidmem:110: [sighing regretfully] Hmm, some radiation poisoning. [shaking head slowly] Unfortunately, we cannot cure that.
entries.jchidmem:118: [firmly, with eerie calm] The Children do not haggle. Now, will you accept our price?
entries.jchidmem:121: [with oily reverence] Thank you, my son. Let us pray for your healing
entries.jchidmem:122: [with oily reverence] Thank you, my daughter. Let us pray for your healing.
entries.jchidmem:123: [with false blessing] There you go. Peace and blessings of the Children with you.
entries.jchidmem:124: [with syrupy manipulation] You do not have enough money. If you donate all you can, we will heal you. [leaning in closer] Is this acceptable?
entries.jchidmem:127: [with syrupy manipulation] If you donate all you can, we will heal you. Is this acceptable?
entries.jchidmem:130: [with condescending slowness] You have more than enough to make the donation. You need schooling in math, my child.
entries.jchidmem:131: [speaking carefully, as if to a simple child] We are the Children of the Cathedral. We live and work amongst those unfortunates living in the wasteland. If you ever get to the Boneyard, stop by the cathedral.
entries.jchidmem:134: [with measured, serene condescension] We are the healers and teachers of peace. We heal the body to heal the spirit. All we ask is a small donation to pay for our healing supplies.
entries.jchidmem:137: [with dismissive calm] We did not ask you. I can tell you are tired of listening to our beliefs. If you need anything else, we will be here.
entries.jchidmem:138: [with fervent, unsettling certainty] It is the most holy of ideas. We are working towards ultimate peace in the wasteland. All creatures shall live as one.
entries.jchidmem:140: [with reverent slowness] They donated this house to us, in order that we might spread the word and perform our duty as healers.
entries.jchidmem:143: [coldly dismissive] Whatever that heathen soul feels is no concern of the Children. We are here to do our duty, and it shall be done.
entries.jchidmem:145: [with pleading, fake concern] Why are you doing this? We will do you no harm!
entries.jchidmem:146: [with patronizing gentleness] You do not have any condition that needs assistance.
entries.jennifer:104: [with a warm, professional greeting] Good day, Initiate. How may I help you?
entries.jennifer:112: [helpfully] Maxson, the High Elder, can be found on the Fourth Floor. If you take the other elevator down to level four, he should be either in the Council Room or the Elders's rooms.
entries.jennifer:113: [patiently] You can ask one of the guards on that level; they should know where he is at the moment.
entries.jennifer:116: [thoughtfully] You should talk to Talus. He might be able to help you, or at least tell you who to talk to.
entries.jennifer:117: [politely informative] During the day, Talus is normally supervising in the training hall. Do you know where that is?
entries.jennifer:121: [speaking clearly, as if giving directions] The training hall is right around the corner. Just go down this corridor, make a left, go through the door at the end of the corridor and it will be through the door on your right.
entries.jennifer:127: [with polite concern] Excuse me? Is there something wrong?
entries.jennifer:129: [sympathetically] I'm sorry, I don't think I can help you. You should go see the doctor. She's on the second level.
entries.jennifer:130: [with confident pride] Of course there are. Two of our five Elders are women, our master scribe is a woman, and we have many other women in all the different ranks.
entries.jennifer:131: [matter-of-factly] The women of the Brotherhood are also called Brothers. We don't call the women Sisters. This is the Brotherhood of Steel, after all, not the Brother and Sisterhood of Steel.
entries.jennifer:135: [thoughtfully] I do not know. That has been our name all of my life. I'm sure there is a reason for it.
entries.jennifer:138: [with a slight, reflective smile] That is strange. I've never really put much thought into it. We've been the Brotherhood of Steel all of my life. Our ancestors must have had a reason for naming it so.
entries.jennifer:141: [warmly] So, is there anything else I can help you with?
entries.jennifer:145: [matter-of-factly, without offense] No, we're very strict when it comes to tradition. I don't think it could ever be changed. It doesn't bother me at all to be addressed as a Brother. That is curious, though.
entries.jennifer:146: [thoughtfully, with interest] I think I'll have a talk with Vree. She might be able to give some insight as to why our ancestors decided to call us the Brotherhood of Steel.
entries.jennifer:148: [informatively] Vree's the Master Scribe. She is the one you should talk to if you have any technical questions, but don't disturb her during her meditations at night.
entries.jennifer:149: [continuing matter-of-factly] She almost always stays in her room, which is also occupied by the mainframe on the third floor.
entries.jennifer:150: [with sharp disapproval] Hole? How dare you talk like that about the Brotherhood. You are a member of our order now, and should be proud to be a member of the Brotherhood of Steel.
entries.jennifer:154: [with a sympathetic, knowing chuckle] Well, I guess we all do sometimes.
entries.jennifer:157: [straightforwardly] Maxson, the High Elder. He's on the fourth floor.
entries.jennifer:163: [with flustered politeness and a warm laugh] Well, you are cute . . . but I don't think so. I don't think it would be a good idea to get involved with an outsider, anyways. You are cute, though, and somewhat attractive.
entries.jennifer:164: [with slightly exasperated patience] I don't know if it's because you're an outsider or because of your extreme . . . lack of tact? So, 'honey', is there anything else I can do for you?
entries.jennifer:169: [laughing despite herself, then catching herself] That's . . . pretty funny. You are joking, I hope? Actually . . . don't answer that. I don't think I want to know.
entries.jennifer:173: [apologetically] I'm sorry. It's just that you outsiders have such a strange way of talking to people sometimes. Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.jennifer:177: [with amused disbelief] Are you for real? I haven't heard such a pitiful line in all my life!
entries.jennifer:181: [regretfully] Well, yes, you are a member of the Brotherhood, but the Elders have put a hold on all training of new Initiates.
entries.jennifer:184: [explanatorily] There are rumors about some kind of army. I think the Elders want to concentrate their resources on the ones that are already far enough along in their training to make a difference if we do have a big battle on our hands.
entries.jennifer:185: [with measured conviction] We strongly believe that training a few fighters extremely well is better than giving mediocre training to a bunch of fighters. Saving lives is one of our primary objectives.
entries.jennifer:186: [encouragingly] You could probably get quite a bit out of the training just by watching. Brother Thomas is the best trainer we have ever had at the Brotherhood.
entries.jennifer:191: [with apologetic honesty] Well, I'm only repeating what I was told. If you talk to Thomas or Talus they might be able to make an exception.
entries.jerem:102: [nervously polite] Excuse me, brother. You startled me. How may I serve the Master?
entries.jerem:105: [quickly, matter-of-fact] Ah, yes, a super mutant in training. I will return to my tasks.
entries.jerem:106: [defensively, getting flustered] If you do not know, it is none of your concern. If you are inquiring about something you should not know, then I will have to report you to our supervisors. You should know better.
entries.jerem:111: [businesslike, matter-of-fact] Transferring the reports, of course.
entries.jerem:115: [politely dismissive] Very well, then. Peace be with you.
entries.jerem:116: [apologetically] I apologize. How may I be of service?
entries.jerem:121: [suspiciously, with growing unease] It is obvious you do not belong here. Who are you?
entries.jerem:126: [cautiously] I transfer the human purity reports for the surrounding areas. But you should know this. [accusingly] Who are you?
entries.jerem:131: [nervously, frowning] That's rather odd... I've never heard of you.
entries.jerem:134: [stammering nervously] Please forgive me. I apologize for questioning you. Please carry on about your business, and if I can be of any service let me know.
entries.jerem:135: [firmly, rising panic] I do not know who you are, and you do not belong here. Guards!!!
entries.jerem:136: [alarmed, voice cracking] Who are you and what are you doing down here?
entries.jerem:141: [authoritatively, but nervous] You are not allowed in this area. Only Servitors and higher allowed down here. Return to the Cathedral proper.
entries.jerem:145: [scoffing, then shouting] Morpheus would not send a slag like you on such a mission. Guards!!
entries.jerem:146: [angrily, shouting] You idiot! You are not allowed in this area. Return to the Cathedral proper at once!
entries.jerem:150: [coldly, with patronizing calm] I transfer records for the Master. That is all you need to know, my child. Now, you must leave.
entries.jerem:154: [frantically] How did you get in here?! What are you doing sneaking around?
entries.jerem:156: [sharply dismissive] No, you may not ask me any questions. Now leave.
entries.jerem:157: [shouting] Stop! You have no business being here!
entries.jerem:163: [confusedly] No, I have not seen anyone. What did he look like?
entries.jerem:168: [stammering, voice cracking with panic] Um... I... I... You don't actually think it's m... me? How ridiculous. I've never!
entries.jerem:172: [politely subservient] Yes, my brother. How may I be of service?
entries.jerem:173: [politely subservient] Yes, my sister. How may I be of service?
entries.jerem:178: [matter-of-factly] I transfer the human purity reports for the surrounding areas.
entries.jerem:187: [suspiciously, voice rising] You act very strangely. I do not believe that you are who you say you are. Guards!
entries.jerem:188: [irritably, with building suspicion] You ask too many questions. I do not believe that you are who you say you are. Guards!
entries.jerem:190: [demandingly] You ask too many questions. Who are you?
entries.jerem:192: [nervously polite] Excuse me, sister. You startled me. How may I serve the Master?
entries.jnkscout:108: [warily] I'm on the watch for raiders and monsters.
entries.jnkscout:109: [tersely] That would be Junktown. It's not far from here.
entries.jon:105: [nervously] I might . . . [with growing urgency] Have you ever dealt with a vicious murdering band of thieves before?
entries.jon:109: [anxiously] Uh . . . You've dealt with gangs before ?
entries.jon:113: [with menacing intensity] Good, then you know how ruthless and bloodthirsty they can be. The Blades are the worst of them all, I'm afraid. [softly, trembling] We're a humble, god fearing town that is only trying to survive, and these . . . these . . . monsters . . . prey on us . . . [whispering desperately] and our children . . .
entries.jon:117: [strain in voice] Well, the Regulators keep them from attacking us outright, but it's all they can do to keep our little community safe. They try to sneak in at night to kill our citizens, or to, to kidnap our children . . . and . . . [taking a shaky breath] Just last week one of them burst through the north gate in the middle of the night with dynamite strapped to his body to blow up the Regulator's barracks . . . no doubt to weaken us enough so that they could launch a full scale attack.
entries.jon:120: [with grim satisfaction] Luckily, the Regulators killed him before he could complete his plan. [coldly] I saw his body myself.
entries.jon:123: [voice rising with rage] I'll give you 2000 caps to kill their leader! [shouting] I want that bitch's head!
entries.jon:127: [voice trembling with hatred] They'll fall apart without her . . . her . . . vile influence.
entries.jon:131: [breaking with emotion, voice cracking] She had my son kidnapped, tortured and killed. They left him impaled on a post right outside the gates.
entries.jon:134: [with desperate urgency] Thank the gods. Finally, my son shall be avenged. The Blades camp is to the north of here. Come back when you've done the job.
entries.jon:135: [defensively] It was the middle of the night, as I told you. I was asleep. Luckily, the Regulators usually catch these barbarians before they even make it inside our town.
entries.jon:138: [shouting angrily] Get out of here then! If you won't help Adytum, Adytum has no need for you!
entries.jon:139: [dismissively, with irritation] I have no time for idiots. Get out of here.
entries.jon:140: [with calculated smoothness] I might just ignore that remark if you've come here to solve my problem for me.
entries.jon:143: [impatiently] Have you ever dealt with a vicious, murdering band of thieves before?
entries.jon:148: [with seething intensity] What would be convenient would be to put an end to their foulness once and for all!
entries.jon:152: [warily, exasperated] What?! You again? What do you want now?
entries.jon:156: [cautiously] The Blades camp is to the north of here. Come back when you've done the job, and I'll pay you 2000 caps.
entries.jon:157: [impatiently] Why haven't you taken care of it yet?
entries.jon:161: [urgently, harshly] Well, work faster. Don't bother me again until you've ended her miserable life!
entries.jon:162: [desperately, voice cracking] Have you done it?! Is she dead? Is she dead?
entries.jon:166: [with joyous relief] Thank the gods!!! Here's your money. You'll always be welcome in Adytum, my son.
entries.jon:167: [voice trembling with satisfaction] Finally she knows the taste of hell fire! Bless you, my son. [wiping away tears] Here's an extra 500 caps for putting in the extra effort. You'll always be welcome here.
entries.jon:168: [desperately, voice cracking] Have you done it?!? Is she dead? Is she dead?
entries.jon:171: [furiously] I've had enough of your impudence! Is she dead or not?!
entries.jon:173: [voice shaking with rage, words hissed through gritted teeth] I'll kill all of you fucking bastards!
entries.jon:177: [gruffly, annoyed] Yeah, what do you want?
entries.jtbob:101: [desperately, whining] Please don't kill me! I swear I'll get you your money!
entries.jtbob:106: [shrieking in panic] Ack! You must be Dumb Fred, Merciless Killer of the Dirt. [pleading] Please don't kill me!
entries.jtbob:107: [frantically, voice cracking] Here. Here. Take this. It's all I have.
entries.jtbob:108: [nervously hopeful, hesitant] You mean you're not here to kill me?
entries.jtbob:115: [sighing with dread] Geez, I thought you were from the Casino. Sure as sand in the desert, I owe them a lot of money.
entries.jtbob:120: [defensively, talking fast] They cheat. I played a little slots and some poker. But I'm a better player than that. I swear those machines are rigged. [voice cracking with frustration] I lost a lot of money.
entries.jtbob:124: [bitterly, muttering] Some goons. They say they work for the Casino Boss, but I never saw him. One was called Izo, I think, and the other was some big Guido looking guy. [angrily] Damn cheaters.
entries.jtbob:128: [anxiously rambling] Oh, not too much. A couple thousand. I only played for four or five hours. Well, maybe a little longer. [nervous laugh] They gave me some markers, and I don't have enough here to cover it. I gotta get back to the Hub and get some cash. [fearfully] I'm afraid they'll beat me up if I try to leave.
entries.jtbob:133: [startled, pitch high] Hey, what are you doing in my room? [suspiciously] Are you from the Casino?
entries.jtbob:138: [sighing with relief] Oh gosh. I thought you were from the Casino. You scared me.
entries.jtbob:141: [quietly, ashamed] Well, I got into some trouble there. I owe them a lot of money.
entries.jtbob:146: [nervously] Oh, it's you again. You scared me for a moment. [cautiously] You haven't seen anyone from the Casino around here, have you?
entries.jtbob:151: [with desperate confidence, talking fast] Good, good. I just need a couple more days, and I'll make their money back and much more. [boastfully, unconvincingly] I'm a better gambler than they think.
entries.jtbob:152: [shrieking] Ack! Ohmygawd! I'm in trouble! [panicked, running] Bye.
entries.jtbob:153: [darkly self-aware, with nervous laugh] Go ahead, shoot. [muttering to himself] Oh, bad choice of words, Bob. Bad choice of words.
entries.jtraider:101: [frantically] That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
entries.jtraider:106: [whining, paranoid] What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
entries.jtraider:107: [spitting with contempt] Any why not? She's just a whore.
entries.jtraider:109: [voice cracking, frantic] No. No way. Not this bitch.
entries.jtraider:110: [voice rising to a shriek then dropping to a creepy whisper] What world do you live in? Out here in the real world, blood flows, man. Blood flows, and it's gonna spill all over this room if you don't get out of here.
entries.jtraider:113: [laughing nervously, unhinged] Geez, that's funny. Who says I want help?
entries.jtraider:115: [muttering to himself, twitchy] I gotta think about this. Give me a moment.
entries.jtraider:116: [with menacing calm] Yeah. Don't try anything, or she gets it.
entries.jtraider:119: [jeering, challenging] Oh, big man. Let's see you try. But first . . .
entries.jtraider:120: [jeering, challenging] Oh, big woman. Let's see you try. But first . . .
entries.jtraider:121: [pleading, shaky] Stay back . . . I don't want to hurt her, but I will.
entries.jtraider:124: [voice dripping with threat] Try it, and she dies first. Now, what were you saying?
entries.jtraider:129: [rapid-fire, twitchy] I'll keep talking as long as you do, but try anything tricky, and she'll take the fall.
entries.jtraider:130: [mocking, with bitter laughter] I don't have to do anything. You got to do it, and you ain't doing so hot.
entries.jtraider:131: [voice cracking with rage] She laughed at me. They all laughed at me. I'll make 'em pay, I swear.
entries.jtraider:136: [surprisingly vulnerable, almost hopeful] You sound like an all right kind of guy. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
entries.jtraider:137: [surprisingly vulnerable, almost hopeful] You sound like an all right kind of gal. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
entries.jtraider:138: [voice rising to a shriek] Just leave me alone. I hate you! You are the devil. I won't listen to you.
entries.jtraider:142: [screaming, unhinged] There you go again, threatening me. Die!!
entries.jtraider:143: [paranoid, hissing] I won't listen to you. You're just going to trick me with your words. I don't believe you. Go away.
entries.jtraider:144: [cautiously intrigued] You might have a point. Prove it to me.
entries.jtraider:145: [uncertain, searching] Where do we go from here?
entries.jtraider:147: [desperate, trying to sound reasonable] I want some money, and I want to get out of here peacefully. No one follows me.
entries.jtraider:152: [voice cracking with betrayal] You lied to me!
entries.jtraider:153: [demanding, with panicky urgency] Ok. I want $100. Then we walk out of here. No one follows me, and I'll let her go when we get to the edge of town.
entries.jtraider:156: [cold, matter-of-fact] Then I guess she gets it.
entries.jtraider:158: [paranoid, suspicious] I don't like it. What stops you from just shooting me in the back when I walk out of here?
entries.jtraider:161: [voice shrill with panic] No way! I don't trust you!
entries.jtraider:162: [darkly amused] All right. We'll see what happens, won't we.
entries.jtraider:165: [voice rising, demanding] I want my money. I want $200.
entries.jtraider:168: [spitting with contempt] You seem like a liar and a cheat to me.
entries.jtraider:174: [shrieking, indignant] No! Don't tell me what to do! You can't tell me what to do!
entries.jtraider:175: [growling with psychotic glee] Yeah, I'm gonna show you.
entries.julianna:110: [sighing softly] I do what Caleb asks. But I am really only able to do a little farming. I don't have the skills to help Smitty or Miles out.
entries.julianna:112: [with a hint of resignation] We survive, and the Regulators make sure that nothing happens to hurt us. Mostly by not letting us out of here.
entries.julianna:113: [matter-of-factly] Well, Miles does chemistry, and he makes bullets and things. Smitty is a craftsman who builds things like pots and knives.
entries.julianna:114: [excitedly] You have a message from Romero? What is it?
entries.julianna:118: [breathlessly, voice trembling] No . . . it can't be true . . . I . . .
entries.julianna:122: [giggling, dreamily] How romantic! Oh, I must see him somehow! If only . . . perhaps . . . maybe Lorraine can bring him a message . . .
entries.julianna:123: [with breathy joy, warmly] Oh! Thank you so much for your help! We have decided to live here now, with the Followers, in peace. Thank you for supporting our love.
entries.kane:107: [dismissively, with controlled menace] I guess the reports must have been wrong, beat it. We don't hire skags.
entries.kane:108: [calmly, matter-of-fact] It's not skag work. You'll need to do 'it' quick and clean. [with quiet intensity] The boss'll give you details, but it's more money than you'll make in a month working for the caravans, but only if you're good enough. We don't take kindly to failures, if you know what I mean.
entries.kane:113: [with smooth, lethal charm] I'm sure you're familiar with our sort of business, so let me just say it would be in your best interest to keep this to yourself. Shall we?
entries.kane:114: [coldly] I hope for your sake that that was an attempt at humor. [threateningly calm] Do not cross us, you will regret it.
entries.kane:117: [with quiet menace] I don't think you understood me. Let me clarify. [deadly serious] If you don't watch your manners, you will find yourself dead, tough guy.
entries.kane:118: [with quiet menace] I don't think you understood me. Let me clarify. [deadly serious] If you don't watch your manners, you will find yourself dead, tough gal.
entries.kane:123: [mockingly] Oh, please do. We'll be holding our breath.
entries.kane:124: [politely threatening] But of course, good day.
entries.kane:125: [skeptically] Don't need the money? [with a knowing smirk] Surely you're jesting, but from what I've heard about you, you might enjoy the work I had in mind for you.
entries.kane:129: [lowering voice, carefully] It's... Would you like to accompany me down stairs? There are too many ears around.
entries.kane:138: [with cool appreciation] I've heard of you. They say you're one mean son of a bitch. [smoothly] If you're looking for some work, I might be able to set you up with someone. Are you interested?
entries.kane:139: [with cool appreciation] I've heard of you. They say you're one mean bitch. [smoothly] If you're looking for some work, I might be able to set you up with someone. Are you interested?
entries.kane:140: [with dark amusement] I've heard of you. You're the one that took out Killian in Junktown, nice going. Gizmo must have paid you well for that one. [curiously] What brings you to the Hub, looking for some work?
entries.kane:141: [with dark amusement] I've heard of you. You're the one that took out Gizmo over in Junktown. Killian must have paid you a good sum for that job. [smoothly] Are you here for some work, maybe?
entries.kane:142: [with dark amusement] I've heard of you. You're the bitch that took out Killian and Gizmo. Now that's the way to solve a problem... [with quiet approval] So, what brings you to the Maltese Falcon? Looking for some work?
entries.kane:143: [with dark amusement] I've heard of you. You're the bastard that took out Killian and Gizmo. Now that's the way to solve a problem... [with quiet approval] So, what brings you to the Maltese Falcon? Looking for some work?
entries.kane:144: [with measured interest] I've heard of you. You're making quite a name for yourself. What brings you to the Hub?
entries.kane:156: [dismissively] A water chip? Never heard of it, we only sell drinks. Go see Bob's Iguana Bits, if you're hungry.
entries.kane:161: [irritably] Do I look like a merchant? Stop wasting my time.
entries.kane:162: [helpfully, though with edge] You might want to check with the Water Merchants. They're south of the Merchant Market. You can't miss them. They surround a big water tower.
entries.kane:200: [with dark humor] Cleansing? That's quite nice of you, but 'evil' is very subjective. What or who you might consider to be evil could very well be the opposite to someone else.
entries.kane:204: [dryly] I certainly hope so. We have enough problems in the world without having a blind fanatic running around killing everyone.
entries.kane:205: [coldly] A pity. A blind fanatic is a dangerous person indeed. I hope your stay here in the Hub is not long. [with quiet warning] We don't take kindly to murders that aren't auth... to murders of any sort. Good day.
entries.kane:209: [with dangerous calm] Moron? Do you have any idea who you are talking to? For your sake I hope not. I don't 'run' the Maltese Falcon but I AM the one in charge. [icily] What do you want before I lose my temper.
entries.kane:212: [with mock pleasantness] We'll see. Have 'nice' day.
entries.kane:213: [with quiet threat] If you don't know, you shouldn't ask. It can be bad for your health.
entries.kane:218: [with menacing calm] Don't push your luck, buddy, or you'll meet Decker in a bag. This way, and watch yourself. I'll be watching.
entries.kane:219: [with menacing calm] Don't push your luck, lady, or you'll meet Decker in a bag. This way, and watch yourself. I'll be watching
entries.kane:220: [coldly] I think it 'does' concern me and I don't think I'll be showing you anything... that's if you're lucky. Now get lost.
entries.kane:221: [matter-of-factly] Sorry, but anything you have to tell Decker can be told to me. I'm his right hand man and there's nothing that goes on here that we both aren't fully aware of.
entries.kane:224: [with finality] Well, then you're not going to see him.
entries.kane:234: [with controlled anger] Get out of my face. I don't have time for your games.
entries.kane:235: [with finality] Then you'll see no one.
entries.kane:236: [with quiet menace] Tell our friendly Sheriff Greene that Decker's schedule is looking a bit busy and that he should try back in a few months. I'm sorry, but I think you should leave... for good.
entries.kane:237: [coldly] I don't think she sent you here. Please leave.
entries.kane:238: [with measured interest] Did he now? Are they ready to come under our protection? Are you one of them?
entries.kane:243: [dismissively] Are you? Well you came to the wrong place then, the Hub is anything but honest. Go back to whatever hole you crawled out of. You'll be happier there.
entries.kane:244: [with dark approval] I agree. Well then, follow me and we'll see how useful you are to us. [with quiet threat] Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you to yourself.
entries.kane:245: [with cautious interest] That might be. Are you a member of their 'Thieves Circle?'
entries.kane:248: [coldly] Well, I'm sorry, but we don't work with your little friends. We barely tolerate their existence and we would never work with them.
entries.kane:249: [with quiet approval] Well then. You might be useful after all. [with menacing calm] Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself
entries.kane:250: [neutrally] He might. What kind of work were you looking for?
entries.kane:255: [dismissively] Why don't you try the merchants. I hear they pay reasonably well.
entries.kane:256: [politely] No, I think we're fine. Have a nice day.
entries.kane:257: [with genuine warmth, then cold again] Now, that's what I like to hear. I think we might be friends after all. Let me show you down. [with menacing calm] Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself
entries.kane:258: [calmly] Good. Follow me, but keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself.
entries.kane:259: [with dangerous quiet] Sure he did, goodbye... Oh, and by the way. Don't ever lie to me again, I don't like it when people lie to me. [coldly] Not many people live to hear this advise.
entries.kane:260: [with approving nod] A man of action. I like that, even if you are screwed up in the head.
entries.kane:261: [with approving nod] A woman of action. I like that. Even if you are screwed up in the head.
entries.kane:262: [sharply] Yeah, what do you want? It better be good.
entries.kane:278: [with cold precision] I understand that you are responsible for the death of a merchant and his wife. I don't know what quarrels you had with them and I don't care.
entries.kane:282: [with quiet menace] That is not what you should be concerned about. No one makes a hit one anyone without our okay. [threateningly calm] I think it would be best if you left our city, while you still can.
entries.kane:283: [coldly] I'm afraid you do and if you know what's best for you, you should leave this city while you still can.
entries.kane:284: [with strained patience] I didn't think you wanted the job. I hope it was just a misunderstanding. I'll pay you half, and be grateful that I'm giving you anything. [Kane gives you 1500 hubbucks]
entries.kane:289: [calmly] We'll see. Downstairs, Decker wants to talk to you.
entries.kane:291: [coldly] I don't know what game you're playing but if you know what's best for you, you should leave this city while you still can.
entries.kane:292: [with cold disappointment] You said you didn't want the job. I'm surprised you came back here. [threateningly] You made a bad mistake to do it on your own. I suggest you get out of town while you still can.
entries.kane:293: [with cold satisfaction] I understand that you are responsible for the death of Jain, the High Priestess. I don't know what quarrels you had with her and I don't care, but we're very grateful nevertheless. (Kane gives you 1000 hubbucks)
entries.kane:297: [coldly] That is none of your concern and I'm afraid we can not deal with you. [with dark irony] You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.
entries.kane:298: [with menacing calm] I'm afraid you do, lying can be a very unhealthy habit. [coldly] You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.
entries.kane:299: [with quiet menace] I don't know what game you're playing, but I'm not amused. [coldly] You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.
entries.kane:301: [matter-of-factly, with sinister detail] The merchant and his wife live over to the west from here. They're on the corner of Barter Street and Thunder Ave. in the Heights, he'll probably have guards. Try to be quiet about it and be sure you aren't seen, but if anyone does happen to see you [with quiet menace] make sure they don't live to tell anyone about it. [coldly] Once you've finished your little errand come back here. One more thing. [with dark emphasis] Don't even think about going to the police, that's the worst mistake you could ever make. If you can, try not attract their attention when doing your work, they can be quite a pain sometimes. [Kane gives you 500 caps]
entries.kane:302: [with approval] Good work. Here're your scripts for the completion of the first job. [Kane hands you 2500 hubbucks].
entries.kane:303: [with quiet satisfaction] Nice work on the merchant. I'm expecting the same results on your next job. [matter-of-factly] Here's your last payment for the first job and the first payment for the second. (Kane hands you 3500 Hubbucks). [coldly] I'm sure you already know, but the Children of the Cathedral are down south just north of the water merchants. Again, no 'live' witnesses.
entries.kane:304: [with mild amusement] Were you in a hurry to get out of here? You didn't get your scripts. Here's your money, initial payment and the completion bonus for the first job. (Kane hands you 3000 Hubbucks)
entries.kane:305: [warmly] Hey, good work! You forgot to pick up your initial payment for the job, so here it is with the completion fee. [with approval] You've proven yourself to be quite useful.
entries.kane:308: [calmly] Here's your starting pay. (Kane hands you 1000 Hubbucks) [matter-of-factly] I'm sure you already know, but the Children of the Cathedral are south, just north of the water merchants. Again, no 'live' witnesses.
entries.kane:309: [with dark satisfaction] Damn, this is a lot of cash. Decker really wanted that bitch dead, here're your scripts. (Kane gives you 4000 Hubbucks) [with approval] You've proven yourself to be quite useful.
entries.kane:310: [irritably] What the hell do you want? I thought you didn't want to meet with Decker.
entries.kane:317: [coldly] We don't hire skags. Now leave before I become annoyed with you.
entries.kane:324: [with dark amusement] Are you now? That should prove to be quite amusing.
entries.kane:326: [with disgust] What are you some kind of freak? Get the hell out of here!
entries.kane:327: [with mock assurance] Oh, I'll be sure to tell him. I'm sure he will be very interested to hear that... praying did you say? [coldly] You have my 'word', he'll get the message.
entries.kane:328: [with strained patience] I thought I told you to get lost! My patience is wearing thin! [sharply] Are you going to tell me why you wanted to see Decker or not?
entries.kane:335: [matter-of-factly] When you're off the chems come and see me.
entries.kane:336: [with cautious allowance] I'll let you see him, but you better watch your mouth... after you?
entries.kane:338: [with menacing certainty] That's a secret you'll be taking to the grave. Decker will never talk to a skag like you.
entries.kane:339: [with finality] Then I suggest you leave.
entries.kane:408: [dismissively] You can want all you like, now take a hike.
entries.kane:415: [sharply] Why isn't 'it' done yet. [with dangerous intensity] You better get it done. I don't want to see you again until you have some good news, otherwise we'll have a problem. [coldly] You better not disappoint us.
entries.kane:417: [with impatience] Well... are you going to do the job or not? [pointing] They're right over here (Kane points again at your PIPBoy town map display.) [threateningly] You better hurry up, the boss is expecting this to be done soon.
entries.kane:418: [explosively] WHAT THE HELL... (Kane looks around then whispers.) [whispering, dangerously quiet] What the hell are you doing here? You better finish the other one off, and there better not be 'any' witnesses.
entries.kane:420: [quietly] You haven't finished your little job. [whispering, intensely] You know what's at stake here. You do it and you get rich and we're all happy. Fail and no one's going to be happy.
entries.kane:426: [with mock sympathy] You won't? Now that's a shame. [coldly] We can't have people giving their word and then breaking it. I'm sorry we couldn't work together. Have a 'nice' day.
entries.kane:429: [with certainty] Oh, I'll have it. Don't worry.
entries.kane:453: [with lethal cold stare, then slowly] Well then... I'll try to get you in to see him sometime soon. [with sinister quiet] I'll be sure to show you to him 'piece' by 'piece'.
entries.kane:454: [with mock sympathy] I'm sorry you feel that way. [with venomous calm] I hope you 'enjoy' the rest of your stay here in our wonderful city.
entries.kane:456: [after a long pause, with quiet finality] All right. I'll give you one last chance to see him. Follow me.
entries.kane:457: [coldly] You missed your chance. Beat it.
entries.kane:458: [explosively] What the hell are you doing back here?!?! [with scathing contempt] You must be an even bigger idiot than I thought. I knew Decker shouldn't have hired an unknown.
entries.kane:461: [lowering voice, with furious intensity] You cocked up the mission, you moron! You were supposed to kill both of the Hightowers, not wound them for Christ sake! [rapidly, angrily] The second you left the Heights they ran off with their guards. Believe me, they didn't waste time packing either. God knows where they are now!
entries.kane:464: [coldly] Sorry doesn't cut it. You've put Decker at an unacceptable risk. [with finality] You can consider yourself an enemy of the Underground from now on. I don't ever want to see your face in here again.
entries.katja:102: [sizing you up] You're not from around here. Who're you?
entries.katja:107: [with interest] And what, may I ask, are you doing in the Boneyards?
entries.katja:112: [matter-of-factly] You learn to be careful out here. So what are you doing here?
entries.katja:113: [gruffly] All right, fair enough. I'm called Katja. What's it matter to you?
entries.katja:117: [sharply] You might, but you're on my home turf, not vice-versa. So put up or shut up.
entries.katja:119: [dismissively] A water purification chip? Sorry, don't know anything about that. Don't see much of that kind of tech here in the Boneyards, except maybe the stuff Miles works on.
entries.katja:123: [skeptically] Just a traveler. I've heard that one before. Nobody comes to the Boneyard except those Hub merchants and people looking for a quick death at the hands of the gangs. What are you really here for?
entries.katja:126: [matter-of-factly] Damn straight. But that's a two-way street.
entries.katja:127: [studying you] Maybe. You definitely aren't one of those gangland shiv-shovers. What do you want?
entries.katja:137: [informatively] Miles lives in Adytum. He's a scientist, mostly working with chemistry. If anyone could scrounge up a water chip or make a replacement, it would be him.
entries.katja:139: [reflectively] Adytum is my original home. A little too boring for me, though. It's a fenced-off and self-sufficient town in the south end of the Boneyard, but not as far as the Cathedral. We trade sometimes with the Hub.
entries.katja:140: [with a knowing tone] I've dealt with them before. They're not too bad, as far as gangs go. They have a hide-out in an old club, with some outposts. If you're careful you might even be able to get some of them to talk.
entries.katja:141: [urgently] The Rippers are just plain ferocious. They're an inbred bunch that delights in torture and murder. I stay away from them, and you should, too. They actually put fuckin' land mines around their fortress.
entries.katja:142: [matter-of-factly] The Gun Runners used to be a real gang, but they went soft. They started setting up a deal where they trade weapons that they get from their victims or buy from the Hub. Since nobody here is up for the trip to the Hub personally, they do pretty good business, even though their prices are high.
entries.katja:143: [sarcastically] The Followers of the Apocalypse are a group of peace-preachers who live in a large library near the heart of the Boneyard. Why they haven't been wiped out yet I can't say. They are lousy combatants and have no understanding of the real world, but other than that they are polite and well-educated.
entries.katja:144: [with resignation] The Boneyard is a pretty hostile place. I've never had the opportunity to leave, though I suppose I'd take it. Let's see . . . just south of here you have the Cathedral. There's some sort of cult there, but I stay away from them. Something sinister is going on there. Also, I've heard about the trading center called the Hub, and caravans occasionally show up, but I've never been there.
entries.katja:148: [eagerly] No kidding. If you're looking for another hand, I'll sign on. Better than spending the rest of my existence in this hellhole, right?
entries.katja:152: [quickly] This area's overrun with the three gangs - the Blades, Rippers, and Gun Runners - as well as serving as home for the Followers and for my own home, Adytum.
entries.katja:153: [with determination] All right, looks like we've got a little ass-kicking to do!
entries.katja:154: [seriously] Look, 90% of the people in this city fall into one or more of three categories - rapists, murderers, or thieves. I'm a thief and you actually seem polite, so that makes me wonder, okay? Call it a survival instinct.
entries.katja:159: [with dry humor] Huh. Guess I can't argue with that logic. So waddya want?
entries.katja:169: [impatiently] You again? What're you back for now?
entries.katja:178: [matter-of-factly] I learned how to be a scrapper from my time in the Boneyard. I'm good with knives and submachine guns. My favorite is throwing knives, of course.
entries.katja:179: [with a slight edge] All right, although I don't feel right without a good knife.
entries.katja:191: [coldly dismissive] I'm sorry but I just don't understand you. Good bye.
entries.kenny:103: [with barely contained emotion] There you are. I've been waiting for you to return. [voice cracking] We heard the Sheriff was killed during the battle. [sadly] It's hard to believe he's really gone. [softly, grieving] He was like a father to me.
entries.kenny:104: [clearing throat, composing himself] The Sheriff gave me instructions to carry out in the event that he did not return from the mission. [professionally, though strained] He asked me to give you the remainder of your reward. I believe it was 1000 caps. [handing over the caps] Here you go.
entries.kenny:105: [with solemn respect] This city owes you a debt of thanks. [voice wavering slightly] I only wish the Sheriff could be here to thank you himself. [quietly, emotionally drained] Goodbye.
entries.keri:103: [with cocky assurance] So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh? [appraisingly] Well you must be one tough bitch. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do. [matter-of-factly] We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th. [skeptically] Can you handle that? [with gravelly intensity] We go to all the local hot spots: the Brotherhood of Steel, Junktown, Necropolis, and the Boneyard.
entries.keri:104: [with cocky assurance] So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh? [appraisingly] Well you must have balls of steel. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do. [matter-of-factly] We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th. [skeptically] Can you handle that? [with gravelly intensity] We go to all the local hot spots: the Brotherhood of Steel, Junktown, Necropolis, and the Boneyard.
entries.keri:118: [with gravelly dismissal] I'll still give your sorry ass a job, if you're interested?
entries.keri:124: [mockingly] Ha, I thought you were a coward! [with grudging respect] Well… if you brave'n up, stop by and I might still give you a job. [casually] We leave on the 3rd and 17th, you can just show up that day if you like. [matter-of-factly] We can always use more guns.
entries.keri:126: [dismissively] Whatever. [with gravelly temptation] If you get the urge for some action come back and I'll hook you up on the next caravan out.
entries.keri:127: [exasperatedly] Hey! [with a raspy sigh] I know you can get some good chems here, but I'm not supposed to hire you unless your sober.
entries.keri:130: [slowly, with gravelly intrigue] Well now… I hate to say it but… I've heard of you. [with cocky curiosity] Are you as tough in private as in public? [with a knowing pause] Let's see… [leading confidently] (She leads you around a corner)
entries.keri:131: [with a raspy chuckle, slipping you items] (On the way back she slips you a few things.)
entries.keri:132: [with gravelly amusement] Well, you can last for QUITE a while.
entries.keri:133: [appraisingly, with gravelly challenge] Well, you 'are' interesting and 'very' different from most people… [with cocky provocation] show me what you've got tough guy. [leading confidently] (She leads you around a corner)
entries.keri:136: [loudly, callous] Hey Pops, looks like we've got a thief here! [with accusatory harshness] What do you have to say for yourself, you scum?
entries.keri:144: [with weary understanding] Well… I know how easy it is to be tempted to steal, but… [with gravelly firmness] Hell, I'll give you a chance. [threateningly] Don't show your face around here again and I won't call the cops. [dismissively] Now beat it.
entries.keri:145: [with smug certainty] Oh we'll make sure of that, won't we Pops?
entries.keri:155: [with cool dismissal] Intriguing, but you're not my type.
entries.keri:156: [matter-of-factly] Good. Like I said before we pay 600 scripts. [businesslike] Which route did you want to take?
entries.keri:168: [shouting with adrenaline] Lock and load! [with gravelly intensity] We're out of this joint!
entries.keri:169: [muttering with irritation] Let me know if anything cool happens, Dad's making me stay around the warehouse.
entries.keri:170: [with gravelly enthusiasm] Great! The other psychopaths are ready. [matter-of-factly] We'll leave right away.
entries.keri:171: [casually] Cool, it'll just take a few minutes to get the psychos together.
entries.keri:172: [excitedly] Brotherhood of Steel, here we come! [with sardonic drawl] Well… I'm not going with you, but you know what I mean.
entries.keri:173: [irritably] Okay, get out of my face already. [threateningly] Those Brotherhood fanatics are waiting for you.
entries.keri:174: [with cocky amusement] I hope you like mountains! [with gravelly intensity] You're going right into them. [with grim prediction] You should see lots of action there.
entries.keri:175: [excitedly] Ready to go, and you'll be heading straight though the mountains! [with gravelly excitement] It should be a blast!
entries.keri:176: [dismissively] Junktown's pretty tame. [with gravelly preference] I prefer the more dangerous routes.
entries.keri:177: [casually informative] I hear there's some crazy doctor there, you should check him out. [matter-of-factly] His name's Doc Morbid.
entries.keri:178: [reassuringly] Junktown's a short trip, you should be back soon.
entries.keri:179: [with warning gravelly tone] Watch your ass, Necropolis isn't a very friendly place.
entries.keri:180: [matter-of-factly] Set's the leader of the town. [with raspy shrug] At least he was the last time I was there.
entries.keri:181: [with gravelly contempt] That town's full of skags! [briskly] Well, I better get you going.
entries.keri:182: [with casual approval] LA's pretty cool. [with a knowing grin in her voice] You'll like it, but just be sure not to leave the caravan until it arrives. [seriously] It's not to safe, for the caravans that is.
entries.keri:183: [with raspy interest] Hope you get a chance to see it, there's also a cool church just a few miles to the south of it. [dismissively] The people are whacked, though.
entries.keri:184: [with gravelly musing] I'm told the Boneyard used to be a place called LA. [uncertainly] I don't know what the person's initials stand for, but it's a cool place.
entries.keri:198: [with approving nod in her voice] You did good on that last job. [matter-of-factly] Are you looking for another one?
entries.keri:204: [briskly] Ready to go? [with gravelly intensity] We're leaving today.
entries.krupper:102: [with a deep, menacing growl] You should not be here. This area off limits to Children.
entries.krupper:106: [growling dismissively] You too stupid to be a Child. You must be intruder!
entries.krupper:107: [with brutish pride] This prisoner cell block. Here we hold humans until you dip them. Good stuff, huh?
entries.kyle:102: [leaning back] Ahh...So you're the one, huh?
entries.kyle:105: [matter-of-factly] Nothing. It's just that no one has ever made it back from the Ancient Order.
entries.kyle:109: [with a dry chuckle] Heh, heh. I guess they just wanted to get rid of ya, huh? Well, the jokes on them.
entries.kyle:113: [dismissively] I fix stuff, run maintenance checks, that sort of crap.
entries.kyle:117: [off-handedly] Power armor and anything else that needs fixin'.
entries.kyle:119: [scratching head] I'd give ya this power armor right here, but it's missing it's Systolic Motivator. It's useless without it.
entries.kyle:122: [sighing, exasperated] Well, they've got more than enough up in the supply room, but Michael and his damn forms say that this particular suit isn't up to specs. Damn bureaucrats.
entries.kyle:125: [pointing] You see this eye-piece right here? I had to re-solder it in place, and it don't look as pretty as it needs to for inspection, I guess.
entries.kyle:127: [sharply] Get the hell out of here, buddy.
entries.kyle:128: [with a slight laugh] Whoa, wait a minute there, fella, that would take a good coupla hours. I'd loan you a manual and my tools, but you'd hafta repair it yourself.
entries.kyle:131: [shrugging] Heh, well, Rhombus has a couple of 'em. I wouldn't ask him for one, though. Only "the Honored" are supposed to wear these here power suits. Besides, I think he has an unnatural attachment to them.
entries.kyle:133: [matter-of-factly] I don't think so. Don't even know what one is.
entries.kyle:137: [nodding] The moniker's Kyle. I've never met a myth before.
entries.kyle:141: [rolling eyes] To hear Maxson's stories you'd think it was the ninth level of hell.
entries.kyle:143: [correcting] Not General Maxson, his grandfather, Roger Maxson. I heard you brought back a disk that told what happened to the guys who rebelled against him and went down there to recover the lost technology.
entries.kyle:147: [shaking head] Yeah, lousy bastards. I can't believe they sent you down there like that.
entries.kyle:149: [casually] Hey, initiate, got anything for me?
entries.kyle:153: [scoffing] No shit. And here I thought you was smart. I told ya that guy had official forms for brains.
entries.kyle:158: [reluctantly] Wella... I got to give you credit for that. But I think you blew your chances with getting it from the supply room. You'll just have to find another way to get it. Or find yourself Power Armor somewares else.
entries.kyle:163: [perfunctory] Hello, were you able to get that part?
entries.kyle:166: [with focus] Great! Here just let me install this into the unit.
entries.kyle:167: [straightforward] OK you're all set to go. Here take this manual. If you have any kind of aptitude with repairing things you should have no problem. Good Luck.
entries.kyle:168: [settling in] After all that? Okay, just let me know when you want me to put it in. Then you can get started on repairing it.
entries.kyle:169: [honestly] Well, I don't know what to tell you. I guess you need to polish up your repair skills a little. I'll keep the unit here for ya.
entries.kyle:171: [friendly] Hello agin. Can I help you?
entries.lance:102: [menacingly] Just stay where you are. We've heard about you in Shady Sands and we want no part of you.
entries.lance:110: [gruffly] Yeah? What d'ya want this time?
entries.lance:116: [cautiously] Hello, stranger. What brings you out in the wastes? Where are you from?
entries.lance:126: [growling with menace] I ain't your friend. And if you make a wrong move, I'll spill your innards. You got that?
entries.lance:139: [irritably] That was then, this is now. What have you done for us lately? I think you better leave before I get ornery.
entries.lance:140: [harshly] We like it too. Especially when you're not in it. Now get!
entries.lance:141: [with a gravelly laugh] Man, you musta spent too much time in the Glow!
entries.lance:142: [flatly] I don't know what a water chip is. Sorry.
entries.lance:145: [grimly] The raiders got her. I'm part of one of the search parties. I think she's at the raider camp south of Shady Sands, but the Khans have the place sealed up like a fortress.
entries.lance:150: [begrudgingly] Uh, yeah, but we're handling it a little better since the Khans got their bloody nose. I understand we have you to thank for that. We're grateful.
entries.lance:158: [settling] Okay, I'll trust you. I'm from Shady Sands. We're a community not far from here.
entries.lance:163: [curtly] Well, you keep your secrets, I'll keep mine. Good bye.
entries.lance:164: [sarcastically] Maybe it is. A pity, though.
entries.lance:165: [thoughtfully] I've been to Junktown. I think it's southwest of here, but I've been traveling for so many days it's hard to tell.
entries.lance:166: [suspiciously] Yeah, right. All the Vaults were destroyed, as far as I know. Tell me another one.
entries.lance:167: [frustrated] That's not what I was asking . . . oh, never mind!
entries.lance:168: [with accusatory contempt] That's not an answer. They call you assassin, thief, grave-robber. They say you'll kill anyone who gets in your path. Is it true?
entries.lance:173: [with accusatory contempt] They call you assassin, thief, grave-robber. They say you'll kill anyone who gets in your path. Is it true?
entries.lance:174: [coldly threatening] Okay, I'll do it. But if you keep acting like a raider, you'll die like a raider.
entries.lance:175: [with grudging respect] I'll give you the benefit of the doubt, for now. But a man's only as good as his reputation, and yours could use some work. I hope you'll do something about it before we meet again.
entries.lance:176: [with gruff invitation] Just heading back to town. You wanna come along? I could use the company.
entries.lance:179: [matter-of-factly] A little bit of scavenging. We've found a few abandoned raider bases that haven't been picked clean; I suspect they've been attacking each other. We can always use more ammo and chems.
entries.lance:180: [muttering grimly] I'm going to regret this.
entries.lance:181: [threateningly] Get out of my sight before I come to my senses.
entries.lance:182: [with gravelly weariness] We're still seeing a few; they must be migrating from the high desert or the Glow. But it's a lot better now than it was last year, thanks to you.
entries.lance:185: [gruffly resigned] Man, I must be out of my mind. But I'll take you. Let's go.
entries.lance:186: [with dark humor] Have a good suicide, friend. And for what it's worth, good luck.
entries.lance:187: [wearily] I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
entries.lance:188: [grudgingly generous] Well, I don't have much, but what's mine is yours.
entries.lance:189: [wearily] Not that I can think of. I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
entries.lance:190: [wearily] We will. I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
entries.lance:192: [warningly] I won't lead a possible enemy home. If you do make your way to Shady Sands, keep your nose clean.
entries.lance:193: [matter-of-factly] Small. We make our living herding Brahmin. It's pretty rough country around here, and pasture land is rather precious.
entries.lance:194: [incredulously] In a Brahmin herding backwater? You've gotta be crazy! There's probably not a working piece of electronics within two hundred miles.
entries.lance:195: [seriously] You got a point. I think we should play things cautious and go our separate ways. If I were you, I'd do something about those stories. Unless you like people hating and mistrusting you.
entries.lance:196: [with lethal coldness] I should kill you right now. You cross my path again, and I will. Now get.
