entries.lance:198: [with dry amusement] Let me guess, someone told you about my snoring. Oh well. You take care of yourself.
entries.lance:199: [wearily] It is. Well, I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
entries.lance:200: [dangerously] Just you stay where you are. I don't know if you're in league with those mutants, but if you are, I'll kill you.
entries.lance:206: [despairingly] The mutants overran Shady Sands. Must of us are dead. I guess it's only a matter of time before they get the rest of us.
entries.lance:207: [unhinged, laughing hysterically] I don't care what you say, what you ask. We're all dead! All of us! And I thought the raiders and the rad scorpions were bad . . . they were nothing! Ha! Ha ha ha!
entries.laryknig:101: [eagerly] Hello Initiate. I'm Larry, how may I help you?
entries.laryknig:106: [excitedly, talking faster] Uh, yea. These things are great. It's range is... well, as far as you can see. (Larry continues to talk for what seems like hours, but you seem to pick a few things up about the use of energy weapons.)
entries.laryknig:107: [confused, then eagerly] Huh? But she knows these aren't ready yet... Oh, she must have meant show. Yea, I can show you. You see it runs off of energy cells that are constructed out of... (Larry goes on for what seems hours but you seem to pick a few things up about energy weapons.)
entries.laryknig:108: [coolly, dismissively] Sure she did. I think you should leave outsider.
entries.lasher:101: [indignantly] I know who you are. You are a wicked, evil man and you must be punished.
entries.lasher:102: [shrieking with righteous fury] I know who you are. You are the devil in woman's form, but your shape will not save you.
entries.lasher:103: [with building outrage] I know who you are. Your wickedness precedes you. You send the souls of children to Hades, before they can be cleansed of their perfidy. It is a black evil that you do, [shouting] and you must be punished for it.
entries.lasher:104: [thunderously] I know who you are. You are walking death, a plague in human form. Where you step, blood flows like a river. [with passionate conviction] But such iniquities can be ended by a righteous soul!
entries.lasher:105: [shrieking indignantly] How dare you disturb me! Don't you know how important my position is? [shouting] Get out!
entries.lasher:106: [with menacing superiority] You are unwise to draw your weapon on me. The Master's shield is upon me, and I may not be touched without retribution!
entries.lasher:114: [coldly] Why have you come, initiate? You know that I do not like to be disturbed.
entries.lasher:122: [shrieking] How dare you enter my sanctuary with a weapon in your hand! [scoffing] Oaf! [shouting] Get out!
entries.lasher:123: [outraged] Who do you think you are, entering my sanctum with a drawn weapon. [shouting] Get out!
entries.lasher:131: [sternly] My quarters are not open to those who have not been consecrated. I must ask you to leave at once.
entries.lasher:138: [with theatrical authority] That is a privilege reserved for only the most faithful servants. Only baptism is a higher honor.
entries.lasher:144: [dismissively scoffing] I see no reason to converse with a fool. Away with you.
entries.lasher:145: [matter-of-factly] You should speak to Father Morpheus. He is in the tower, but it is unlikely that the Nightkin will allow you to pass.
entries.lasher:151: [with zealous fervor] The rod is a holy instrument, through which I instruct my charges. Pain clears the mind of evil thoughts and allows them to better comprehend the glory of the Master.
entries.lasher:155: [passionately ranting] I instruct the children. It is my duty. All children are wicked beasts. It is my duty to force them into evolve into human beings. Perhaps you have heard that I do not tolerate frivolity. This is true. [with relish] I want my charges to suffer as much as possible.
entries.lasher:161: [shrieking with absolute fury] You filthy brainless abomination! How dare you defile my presence! [shouting] Get out! Out! Now!
entries.lasher:162: [with patronizing condescension] You are a woman, and therefore you are always troubled. It is an endemic condition of your breed. Tell me your problem, madam, and I will resolve it for you.
entries.lasher:163: [admonishing] If your heart was not so full of wickedness, sir, you would be at ease. A righteous heart knows no cares. Tell me your problem, but be quick!
entries.lasher:168: [with intense, zealous conviction] Learn to embrace pain as your closest friend, for pain is the most instructive force in the universe. Break yourself until you can exist no longer as an individual, then remake yourself into the Master's tool. That is the solution to all of your problems.
entries.lasher:174: [scoffingly] Beasts chatter without meaning. Human beings think first, and then they talk. You must evolve into a human being before I will wish to speak you. Be gone.
entries.lasher:175: [with slight approval] Your words are true. Very well, I will help you. But be quick.
entries.lasher:181: [with finality] There comes a time when you must find the answers to life's questions yourself, and that time is now. Begone!
entries.lasher:182: [coldly] That is not my duty. Now begone.
entries.lasher:186: [proudly, then impatiently] I have not consulted him, but I am certain he is pleased with the righteous souls I have brought him. It is difficult work, but I do it well. Unfortunately, it is also quite time consuming, which is why I must order to you to leave right now.
entries.lasher:187: [shrieking] A flatterer's tongue is in the mouth of a devil! A devil such as you! [shouting] Get out of my sight!
entries.lasher:188: [outraged] You foul mouthed beast! [shouting] Begone! Learn some manners before you return.
entries.lasher:189: [with authoritative approval] A reasonable request. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass.
entries.lasher:190: [curtly] I cannot help you with that. Begone.
entries.lasher:191: [matter-of-factly] He is our leader. He is close to the Master's counsels and knows many of his purposes. Is that all?
entries.lasher:197: [with zealous intensity] They serve the Master. They bring the pain of healing to the world. Angels in the Night, who redeem the world by bloodshed. [warningly] Curiosity is a foolhardy emotion, but doubly so when it comes to the Nightkin. That is your only warning. [dismissively] I have much to do now. Away with you.
entries.lasher:198: [with cautious approval] Your courtesy does you credit. Perhaps you are worthy to talk with Morpheus. If the Nightkin stops you, show them this symbol. Now, away with you!
entries.lasher:199: [scoffing] You are a fool if you think petty subterfuge will defeat the Nightkin. [shouting] Get out of here!
entries.lasher:200: [pontificating] Decadence and ease prevents evolution, evolution that is necessary for survival in a harsh world. Fortunately, I am a hard man who cares nothing for seductive pleasures. [dismissively] I see that you disagree with me. I do not care about your opinion. [shouting] Get out of here!
entries.lasher:201: [with heated conviction] Mutation is nothing to fear. Every birth is a mutation of our parents' DNA. We are all mutants. The only thing that matters is that the mutant is guided on a moral and productive path. This is my job. [curtly] And this also ends this discussion. Leave me now.
entries.lasher:202: [coldly matter-of-fact] I deal out pain. If the animal is worthy and can learn from it, it evolves into a righteous soul. If it does not, it does not deserve to exist. On rare occasions, the animal is removed the genetic pool, although not as often as I would like. This happens more often with failed grown animals.
entries.lasher:209: [with menacing warning] You are an evil girl. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. [shouting] Now begone!
entries.lasher:210: [with menacing warning] You are an evil man. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. [shouting] Now begone!
entries.lasher:211: [with fervent authority] Righteousness is attained through struggle, trauma, and recovery. We are animals who must be continuously be broken until we accept the Master's truth without hesitation. [dismissively] Now that you have heard the truth, seek it with the body of your experiences. Get out of here.
entries.lasher:212: [shrieking] Your tongue is a wicked thing that is beyond redemption. [shouting] Get out of my sight!
entries.lasher:213: [scoffingly superior] The Cathedral teaches many things which an undisciplined mind is incapable of comprehending. Now I have other duties to perform. Away with you!
entries.lasher:214: [coldly] As do I. It appears we have many things in common, but unfortunately, you irritate me beyond my ability to tolerate. [shouting] Get out of here. Now.
entries.lasher:215: [with detached coldness] It is not my place to judge. You must persuade the Nightkin. Good luck. You will need it.
entries.lasher:220: [dismissively] You were not particularly welcome here in the first place. Good riddance to you.
entries.lasher:221: [with bitter resentment] Once I did, but many of methods were abandoned in favor of the loud noises you hear in the Auditorium amphitheater. It is a source of bitterness for me. Fortunately, I can still instruct the children. [impatiently] Now if you will excuse me, I have to prepare for their lessons.
entries.lasher:222: [hastily] Uh… it is of course, a rare event, and the animal is given every chance to evolve. [shouting] Now leave here! Leave here at once!
entries.lasher:224: [with authoritative approval] This may be of some use to you. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass. It will allow you to see Father Morpheus.
entries.laura:309: [sighing with exasperation] Well, as I said . . .
entries.laura:311: [with condescending patience] Well, as I said before . . .
entries.laura:312: [through gritted teeth] As I said before . . .
entries.laura:313: [sighing heavily] Well, I'm quite certain I told you this already, but . . .
entries.laura:314: [sharply] Okay! I already told you this . . .
entries.laura:315: [with weary sarcasm] Ah, once more? Well, I said . . .
entries.laura:317: [coldly dismissive] Oh dear, this is most disturbing. I simply will not say it again.
entries.laura:318: [incredulously, then shouting] Are you . . . Okay! Okay! Are you deaf? Read my lips, I'm not gonna to say this again.
entries.laura:319: [firmly] I believe that's quite enough. I'll not say it again.
entries.laura:320: [mockingly] Not listening, huh? Too bad, I'm not gonna say it again.
entries.laura:321: [with disgust] Oh, those are dreadful people. I'm not going to talk about them at all!
entries.laura:322: [conspiratorially, then with a pointed aside] Nicole probably told you about us. We're trying to knock some sense into those thick-skulled, gun-toting, violence-mongering nitwits . . . Oh, present company excepted, of course.
entries.laura:323: [dismissively] Well, I don't know who you're talking about.
entries.laura:324: [approvingly] She leads the Followers. Pretty strong-willed. I trust her.
entries.laura:325: [warmly] The others are all so nice! It's wonderful here. We belong, we do good work . . .
entries.laura:326: [with contempt] Oh, they're like a . . . blight on the world. Most are a waste and a few are just plain evil.
entries.laura:327: [matter-of-factly] Adytum, isn't that a town west of here?
entries.laura:328: [informatively] Adytum's a bit west from here. And the people there . . . well, they're a little paranoid, so don't expect a hospitable welcome.
entries.laura:329: [glowingly] Oh, he's wonderful. He leads us. You should talk to him!
entries.laura:330: [coldly] He preaches peace and enlightenment and all that crap, but he's scum. No two ways about it.
entries.laura:331: [with affected modesty] Oh, I can't begin to describe him. Morpheus leads us. He can do justice to your question.
entries.laura:332: [dismissively] Ah yes, the Master, he's the god these nuts worship. Personally, I don't think he's a god, just somebody into manipulating everyone.
entries.laura:333: [confused] Nightkin? I don't know what you're talking about.
entries.laura:334: [matter-of-factly] They're the big, ugly enforcers of the Master and Morpheus.
entries.laura:336: [sarcastically] What, you couldn't figure out that's the Master?
entries.laura:337: [eagerly] It's the big place at the north end of the church, where Morpheus does all his ceremonies. I've been there, it's wonderful!
entries.laura:338: [coolly] It's at the north end of the church. I've watched Morpheus perform his little circus act there.
entries.laura:339: [dismissively] Oh, you cannot go there. That's where Morpheus contemplates.
entries.laura:340: [flatly] That's where Morpheus and his cronies hang out. No one's allowed up there, though.
entries.laura:341: [somewhat smugly] They have proven themselves to the Church. The rest of us aspire to that.
entries.laura:342: [sarcastically] Oh yeah, these are the guys who've survived torture and who knows what else. Totally brainwashed and will do anything they're told.
entries.laura:344: [uncertainly] Ah, those are the high priests. So far I think there's only 13, but I'm not really sure.
entries.laura:347: [with tired irritation] I'm sorry. I simply don't have time for this.
entries.laura:348: [sharply] We don't have time to talk about that! Just keep to business.
entries.laura:349: [dismissively] I'm not sure why you want to talk about that.
entries.laura:350: [coolly] Keep to the subject at hand, friend.
entries.lemmy:102: [casually, with a scheming tone] So'a, whatcha doin' in the Hub?
entries.lemmy:107: [nervously dismissive] Not really sure big fella. I'll see ya around.
entries.lemmy:109: [quickly backing away] No sweat off my back. Just seein' if I could be neighborly like. [turning away]
entries.lemmy:110: [fast-talking, ingratiating] Well, you look like a businessman. And I'm a businessman, and I thought we could, ah, discuss, ah, business.
entries.lemmy:114: [smoothly persuasive] Well, we all got needs. I might be able to help with some of 'em. So what sort of needs do you got?
entries.lemmy:119: [with a weaselly smirk] I do a little bit of this, and a little bit of that. I get things and information for people, whatever they might need or be lookin' for.
entries.lemmy:128: [eagerly ingratiating] Not a problem. If there's anything else you might be wanting, you come and talk to Lemmy first.
entries.lemmy:129: [fast-talking, rubbing hands together mentally] So, you're lookin' for information, huh? Being a respectable businessman, I gots overhead, so I'll need a few caps to tell you what you need to know. Now that we got that straight, whattcha' wanna' know about?
entries.lemmy:130: [shrewd, with a nervous chuckle] So, you think I might know a little more about those Water Chip things, huh? Well, you might be right. It's gonna' cost you, though. I think 500 bottle caps oughta' do it.
entries.lemmy:135: [defensively, with wounded pride] Now, now. I wouldn't be the man I am if I gave information away for less than it's worth. Come back when you've got the caps.
entries.lemmy:136: [whiny, nervously blustering] Trying to intimidate poor old Lemmy, huh? Well, I's not afraid of the likes of you. I'll just be seein' you around.
entries.lemmy:138: [appeasingly, with relief] Well, that's fair enough. I'll take that instead.
entries.lemmy:139: [nervous laugh, backpedaling quickly] Ok, Ok, Ok, see I was just kidding about paying for the info. Good joke, huh?
entries.lemmy:140: [warming up to his story, fast-talking] Well, so here's what I know about the Water Chips. The thing I've heard is that they all used to come from the Vaults. So if I was lookin' for one, I'd find out where the rest of these Vaults were. I'm not sure where all the Vaults are exactly, but I've heard that there are about 4 around here somewhere's.
entries.lemmy:143: [eagerly] Sure, what else do you want to know about?
entries.lemmy:149: [seriously, with an edge of fear] Now, normally I don't mind selling information, but you're not gonna' get anything outta' Lemmy about Mr. Decker.
entries.lemmy:152: [cautiously intrigued] Missing caravans, huh? Well, I might be knowin' a bit about those. It's gonna cost you 300 caps, though.
entries.lemmy:157: [hesitantly, with nervous qualification] Well, I'm not really that sure, but what I's heard is that it ain't what everybody thinks. Some new guy is getting into the action with some kind of mutants or something. But don't quote me on that.
entries.lemmy:161: [defensive whine] Now, you might be insinuating that Lemmy ain't a stand-up guy. Well, you's right. But Lemmy is an ALIVE type of guy.
entries.lemmy:165: [helpfully scheming] Stuff for needs, huh? Well, I knows a guy over in Old Town that can probably fix you up with some stuff like that. But you know what? He needs to know who you are before you show up at his doorstep.
entries.lemmy:168: [with calculated smoothness] Exactly. So I'm thinking... only for you of course... 1000 caps so youse can talks to this guy without him blowing your head off first.
entries.lemmy:173: [matter-of-factly, as if doing a favor] Well, what you gotta' do is find your way over to Old Town. Over there is a guy named Vance. Just talk to him. Like I said, I'll let him know you're coming.
entries.lemmy:176: [hurriedly, with fake friendliness] Sorry man, got things to do. Nice chattin' with you, though.
entries.lemmy:177: [with greedy warmth] Well, you've come back to talk to your old firend Lemmy, huh? What's it I can help you with?
entries.lemmy:178: [fast-talking, ingratiating] Well, you look like a businesswoman. And I'm a in business, so I thought we could, ah, discuss, ah, business.
entries.loneraid:103: [with a gravelly sneer] I don't know who you are, but I'll give you a fair warning: anyone who messes with the Khans, dies messy.
entries.loneraid:116: [growling dramatically] You are an enemy of the Khans! You attack our warriors and take our women! [menacingly] Give me a reason why I shouldn't cut out your heart!
entries.loneraid:121: [suspiciously, growling] Are you one of them? One of the mutants?
entries.loneraid:126: [with measured calm] Perhaps. If you wish to fight, I'll fight. If you wish to go in peace, you have my word as a Khan that I will not attack.
entries.loneraid:130: [slowly, with bitter shame] You are too strong for me, and I am tired by many days in the wastes. I do not wish to die. Though it shames me, [heavily] I surrender.
entries.loneraid:131: [coldly, with finality] I agree. I give my word that you may go in peace, provided that you do not provoke me. Do not trouble me again.
entries.loneraid:132: [snarling with disgust] I don't want anything that belongs to a coward, including your life! [shouting] Get out of my sight!
entries.loneraid:133: [with menacing relish] You stupid animal. I shall enjoy killing you.
entries.loneraid:135: [with theatrical satisfaction] I shall enjoy hearing them. Farewell, brother!
entries.loneraid:137: [growling with greedy fervor] Really? Then I must have it for my own!
entries.loneraid:140: [slowly, weary and haunted] I am tired and weary from a journey many days longer than I expected. Rad scorpions killed my companions. [with longing] I long for the comforts of the camp and the healing caress of our women.
entries.loneraid:143: [with dread, voice breaking slightly] They have destroyed Shady Sands. They kill anyone in their path. I never dreamt such ferocity existed. [heavily] We are all doomed . . .
entries.loneraid:145: [with fearful intensity] No, but it is hard to tell. I have heard that they cloak themselves in night, that they cloud men's minds, and take the form of beautiful women! [desperately] We are all doomed!
entries.loneraid:146: [with fierce determination] That is good. I long to avenge our dead, and even the dead of Shady Sands. [snarling] Any mutant that crosses my path will die! [shouting triumphantly] Go forth, friend! Go forth and kill! Death to the mutants!
entries.loneraid:147: [with volcanic rage] You will die for those words!
entries.lorenzo:103: [with oily menace] You're overdue on your loan. Please pay it now or I will become very upset. [coldly] I dislike being upset.
entries.lorenzo:109: [with a smarmy smile] Hi. So you've come to pay off your loan?
entries.lorenzo:115: [warmly, spreading arms wide] Well, if it isn't a potential customer! I'm Lorenzo the Munificent, at your service. I give out loans. [listing casually] Only ten percent daily interest, a maximum of ten days to repay. [with practiced sincerity] You won't find a more generous lending institution anywhere in the Hub!
entries.lorenzo:118: [dismissively] Well, I suppose. What do you need to know about?
entries.lorenzo:125: [flatly, with edge] Sorry. I don't do rumors. Don't ask me again.
entries.lorenzo:126: [threateningly] I warned you I don't do rumors. If you think I was just blowing smoke, you're wrong. [coldly menacing] Get out of here and don't come back, punk.
entries.lorenzo:127: [with patronizing calm] Sorry pal, but I don't do more than one loan at a time. You want more, you gotta start paying. [as if explaining to a child] This is a business, not a charity.
entries.lorenzo:128: [warmly] Fine. A pleasure doing business. Anything else?
entries.lorenzo:129: [exasperated, scoffing] Idiot! You don't have enough to pay it off! [muttering] Maybe you were thinking of something else…
entries.lorenzo:133: [warmly persuasive] Sure! Feel free to drop on by. We're always willing to help.
entries.lorenzo:134: [angrily, shouting] Why don't you go run along and runk somewhere else. Get out of here! [with finality] And don't come back.
entries.lorenzo:135: [with faux politeness] Hey, no threats! We're all civilized around here. [calling to his men, coldly] Guido, Leone, why don't you show this gentleman how civilized we can be.
entries.lorenzo:136: [with faux politeness] Hey, no threats! We're all civilized around here. [calling to his men, coldly] Guido, Leone, why don't you show this lady how civilized we can be.
entries.lorenzo:138: [with a knowing smirk] You're lucky, friend.
entries.lorenzo:143: [with finality] Fine. [in business mode, matter-of-fact] You have no loans outstanding with us. We lend in units of two hundred Hub Bucks, with a maximum of one thousand Hub Bucks. [with a warning edge] Remember, though, I'm not gonna lend you the big bucks until you've proven you can repay the smaller loans.
entries.lorenzo:152: [to his men, coldly menacing] Guido, Leone, why don't you show him what ripping off really means. [with brutal clarity] Start with his arms.
entries.lorenzo:153: [with finality, dismissively] Sorry pal, but idiots are too big of a credit risk. Get out of here.
entries.lorenzo:154: [with dread] Deathclaw. It's got to be the Deathclaw. [fearfully] No one's safe anymore!
entries.lorenzo:161: [warmly] He's a great guy. A good source of jobs to pay off my loans. [with friendly encouragement] Tell him I sent you, you might get a bonus!
entries.lorenzo:168: [enthusiastically] They're great guys! [reasonably] It's true we have the occasional misunderstanding, but I think they're a credit to their species… [sotto voce, snidely] …whichever one that is…
entries.lorenzo:175: [indignantly] I can't say I'm too impressed. [with offense] I run an honest, respectable business, and they accuse me of being a thief! [scoffing] The nerve of those people. [mockingly] They think a vow of poverty gives them the right to judge me!
entries.lorenzo:182: [with pride] I'm just a respectable businessman, that's all. [with nostalgic reverence] We Giovannis have been respectable businessmen since the days before the holocaust – now that's tradition!
entries.lorenzo:189: [enthusiastically] You should try Mr. Decker. [with energetic salesmanship] Exciting work at great prices! The best in town! [with casual persuasion] And he's just across the street! [with a smile] You can't get better convenience than that!
entries.lorenzo:196: [coldly dismissive] Forget it, you're too big of a credit risk. Get outta my sight and don't come back.
entries.lorenzo:197: [matter-of-factly] Fine. One thousand bucks. [with finality] You've got 10 days to repay it.
entries.lorenzo:198: [matter-of-factly] Fine. Eight hundred bucks. [with finality] You've got 10 days to repay it.
entries.lorenzo:199: [matter-of-factly] Fine. Six hundred bucks. [with finality] You've got 10 days to repay it.
entries.lorenzo:200: [matter-of-factly] Fine. Four hundred bucks. [with finality] You've got 10 days to repay it.
entries.lorenzo:201: [matter-of-factly] Fine. Two hundred bucks. [with finality] You've got 10 days to repay it.
entries.lorenzo:202: [warmly] Too bad. Feel free to employ our services at a later time.
entries.lorenzo:203: [with awe and concern] Man, some of the stories they say about that thing are just… [trailing off] well, they're something!
entries.lorenzo:210: [with a chuckle, reassuringly] Well maybe not a bonus. But he's a great guy, trust me on that one!
entries.lorenzo:217: [with indignation] Can you believe someone accused me of extortion? [warmly] Fortunately, my good friend Decker set them straight!
entries.lorenzo:224: [with sneering contempt] I'll bet their leader, this Morpheus character, he's not broke! [triumphantly] No sir! [with knowing bitterness] I'll bet that over in the Boneyard, he's just living it up!
entries.lorenzo:231: [with menacing calm] You don't show us respect, you get hurt. [with a dark chuckle] How much more respectability can a man ask for?
entries.lorenzo:238: [with enthusiasm] Adventure, danger. [with a smirk] You can really make a killing!
entries.lorenzo:245: [with casual friendliness] See you around, pal!
entries.lorenzo:248: [coldly impatient] I'm sorry, but I don't have the time for this. [matter-of-factly] If you can't pay the full amount, give me what money you do have and our business relationship will be terminated permanently.
entries.lorenzo:257: [shouting with rage] You're full of crap! [accusingly] You've been holding out on me! [with brutal menace] I'm gonna to beat that money out of you!
entries.lorenzo:258: [with cold regret] What a pity. [with menacing finality] I guess we'll just have to put some caps into you instead. [calling to his men] Guido! Leone!
entries.lorenzo:259: [with stern finality] All right. [with controlled anger] I suppose this will have to do. [coldly] You do realize I can never deal with you again? [with icy threat] If I see you in here again I will be forced to exact a much more severe penalty upon you.
entries.lorenzo:260: [with disgust and rage] You make me sick. [shouting] Give me the money and get out! [with menacing coldness] Don't ever let me see you in here again!
entries.lyle:106: [nervously] We're doing all right here. But I hope that you find the water chip soon. [with growing worry] Everybody's on edge and we don't have much time.
entries.lyle:108: [sighing heavily, worried] Not so good. Ever since I had one of my water rations stolen the other day, things have been going downhill. [voice cracking slightly] Everybody is getting scared and nobody knows what to do.
entries.lyle:111: [weakly hopeful] Yeah, I hope so too.
entries.lyle:112: [pleadingly, with barely contained panic] Thanks. I sure hope you can get to the bottom of this. And please hurry and find a new water chip. [voice trembling] This craziness wouldn't have happened at all if we had a working chip!
entries.macrae:108: [warmly, with a thick Scottish brogue] Well, I'm MacRae. I help the Blades some against the Deathclaws and that Regulator bunch. Teach'em a bit about protectin 'emselves against those nasties.
entries.macrae:113: [gruffly, matter-of-fact] Well m' specialty is fightin with my fists, and takin a punch or two more than the guy throwin 'em at me.
entries.macrae:117: [firmly, with an edge] Well if that's how you be feeling, you can just turn yourself around and walk away.
entries.macrae:122: [with gravelly intensity] I was thinkin the Deathclaws were the spawn of an unnatural act, but 'em Regulators are evil. Come once a month or so and they shows their ugly faces and drag a father away from is wee ones.
entries.macrae:128: [warmly, with a hearty chuckle] Thanks to you, the Blades are going to live a better life. So, what can an old Scotsman do for ya?
entries.macrae:133: [with a wry, rueful tone] Well it's been a wee bit quiet since the Blades helped out Adytum with the Regulators. Me teaching services haven't been in such demand.
entries.macrae:139: [warmly] You be a quick learner. Hope that helps you in your travels.
entries.macrae:140: [with a heavy sigh, nostalgic and slightly weary] Well I used to be helpin the Blades out by teachin them a few things about protectin themselves against the DeathClaws and the Regulators. Now with you takin care of all that, things have been a wee bit on the boring side lately.
entries.madsci:101: [with unsettling politeness] Good evening, brother. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
entries.madsci:102: [with unsettling politeness] Good evening, sister. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
entries.madsci:107: [with manic irritation] You, again? And why are you disturbing the Master's glorious future this time?
entries.madsci:112: [frustrated, speaking quickly] It's not going well. I've been injecting the FEV directly into the pineal gland, but I'm not getting the results I'd hoped for.
entries.madsci:117: [nervously eager, almost fawning] I beg your forgiveness, sir. How may I be of service?
entries.madsci:118: [nervously eager, almost fawning] I beg your forgiveness, ma'am. How may I be of service?
entries.madsci:120: [manic excitement building] The Master's truth is revealed, resulting in increased psychic ability. [sighing with dark resignation] But the poor souls become terminally insane and must be sequestered and nullified to keep them from harming themselves or others.
entries.madsci:124: [matter-of-factly] In a room northwest of here. Is there anything else I can help you with?
entries.madsci:128: [shrieking with exasperation] I have no time for your tomfoolery!
entries.madsci:129: [cackling with unhinged excitement] What an intriguing idea! I must try it at once!
entries.madsci:133: [barking orders with manic urgency] Vincent! Prepare our newest volunteer!
entries.madsci:134: [indignant, then suspicious with creeping dread] What? That's the most ludicrous thing I've ever heard! [eyeing you suspiciously] Who are you, really?
entries.madsci:141: [cackling triumphantly, voice rising] Ah ha! An interloper! Just as I suspected. Vincent!
entries.madsci:142: [muttering curiously, slightly unsettled] Who are you? And why are you wearing that suit? [with distant unease] I haven't seen one of those in a long time.
entries.madsci:147: [speaking quickly, almost rambling] Oh, you know, when we got that last batch of pure-strain humans in... I think there is still one in the holding pens. Why do you ask?
entries.madsci:150: [with weary resignation, shaking head slowly] Alas, the poor souls become terminally insane and must be sequestered and nullified to keep them from harming themselves or others.
entries.manager:101: [gruffly, with a harsh rasp] Whatta you doing here?
entries.manager:109: [sharply] That's what I thought you say. [barking] Getta outta my house.
entries.manager:110: [dismissively, gravelly] Oh nonna dat around here. Maybe uppa da temple or atta water place. [impatiently] Getta going.
entries.manager:111: [shouting hoarsely] Ack! Donna you be exploring any my stuff. [furiously] Getta out! I mean it.
entries.manager:112: [threateningly, with a gravelly growl] Donna be in my face, likka dat. I runna dis show.
entries.manager:115: [grudgingly, rasping] Ack! OK, I concede. I leave.
entries.manager:116: [angrily, wheezing] You no biggie to order me like dat. [menacingly] Take some of dis and shove it!
entries.manager:117: [muttering irritably, with a harsh cough] I don wanna talk to you.
entries.manager:119: [exasperated, coughing] I'm a ghoul. Haven't you ever seen a ghoul before?
entries.manager:122: [scoffingly, with a raspy sneer] Musta been a pansie undergrounder. They letta you live so's you could pester me. [barking gruffly] Now getta outta my house.
entries.manager:123: [sharply, coughing] Well now you have. [shouting harshly] Getta outta here!
entries.marney:104: [warmly welcoming] Welcome. How might I help you today?
entries.marney:108: [gently concerned] Yes, I see that you are suffering from some damage. [soothingly] This may take some time. Would you like me to try to mend your wounds?
entries.marney:113: [with gentle reassurance] There you go. That should have you all set. [kindly] Please be more careful out there.
entries.marney:116: [warmly encouraging] I can teach you a little. But it will take several hours. [gently] Are you willing to stay?
entries.marney:119: [with proud warmth] You are a very good student. [hopefully] I hope you remain on our side. [softly] Good bye.
entries.marney:120: [warmly supportive] As you wish. Good luck out there.
entries.marney:121: [gently patient] I can teach you a little, but not much. It will take some time. [softly] Are you willing to stay?
entries.marney:124: [with warm approval] You are an excellent student. [encouragingly] Good luck to you.
entries.meander:100: [suspiciously, voice cracking] What do you want?
entries.meander:101: [eagerly, slightly deranged] Hey, you gonna eat that dead rat?
entries.meander:103: [distressed, muttering] Have you seen my dog, Elvis? He's around here somewhere.
entries.meander:107: [threatening, voice hoarse from screaming] I'm gonna gnaw your bones!
entries.meander:109: [conspiratorial whisper] Hey, did you hear that Set was offed?
entries.meander:110: [obsessive repetition, muttering] Set's dead. Set's dead. Set's dead . . .
entries.meander:111: [rambling, tone shifting] There's enough water to go around for everyone. Set makes sure of that.
entries.meander:112: [paranoid, scratchy voice] I heard that the mutants got ran out of town.
entries.meander:113: [with nervous relief] Ever since the mutants left, it's been better.
entries.medic:100: [with disappointed concern] I can't believe the things that you have done.
entries.medic:105: [with worried urgency] Oh my, you're seriously wounded. Here, let me help you.
entries.medic:111: [warmly, with gentle care] Ah. Yes. Here, I found these. Try them when you need a boost.
entries.medic:112: [encouragingly] Good, keep up the good work. And let me know if you need anything.
entries.medic:113: [warmly] What can I do for you?
entries.medic:119: [apologetically] I'm not authorized to give you any. Sorry.
entries.medic:122: [apologetically] Sorry, I can't give them to you.
entries.medic:123: [speaking quietly, conspiratorially] Well, since you put it that way. But don't tell anyone that I let you have these. They cause cravings and they are dangerous to use.
entries.medic:125: [matter-of-factly, with gentle concern] Stimpaks are being rationed. You are welcome to what we have in the medical container on the wall. Take as many as you need, but use them sparingly. It will be a while before we can get you some more.
entries.medic:126: [with professional care] Hmm. Let's see if you are hurt.
entries.medic:127: [reassuringly] You seem ok to me. Come back if you need some healing.
entries.medic:128: [with urgent care] You look hurt. Here, let me help you.
entries.medic:129: [helpfully] If you need healing, come back here to me or use some of the stimpaks we have. You can get more stimpaks from the wall.
entries.medic:130: [gently] Lie down here, and we will start the healing process.
entries.medic:131: [with satisfied approval] You are fully healed. Take care of yourself in the future, but come back if you need any more healing.
entries.medic:144: [with a resigned sigh] It's your body.
entries.medic:156: [warmly, with relief] Ok, you should be feeling much better. Be careful out there.
entries.medic:157: [with genuine warmth and gratitude] I heard what you did, saving the Vault. Thank you.
entries.michelle:116: [with menacing calm] A moron. I think that you'd best get out of here. Otherwise, you may become target practice.
entries.michelle:119: [growling] Nothing, eh? I think you're hiding something. Out with it before you see your guts.
entries.michelle:124: [scoffing, then coldly] Everyone knows there are no such things as Martians. All real aliens are from Venus. Now, you die!
entries.michelle:125: [sarcastically] Sure, and I'm the Queen of Mexico.
entries.michelle:129: [gruffly] If you're here to do that, then you'll need to try and find Razor. She'll let you know what we think of that.
entries.michelle:132: [angrily] Mock me, will you? I guess I should expect as much from a child. Oh, by the way. Here!
entries.michelle:133: [with a gravelly rasp] Fancy talk will only get you so far. Here, it will get you about six feet under.
entries.michelle:134: [threateningly] If you are up to nothing, then we will put you up to something. I think 'target' makes a good something.
entries.michelle:135: [menacingly, with urgency] You looked. Now, what do you want? Think quick. It may mean the difference between walking out of here and becoming a permanent resident.
entries.michelle:141: [coldly] We never said anything about living. You would just reside here. Indefinitely. Enjoy your stay.
entries.michelle:144: [with brutal finality] Not so fast. The only way someone leaves here is if they are a Blade, or in a bag.
entries.michelle:148: [dismissively] Fat chance. But, he's a test. If you can find Razor, then you can talk to her about that.
entries.michelle:149: [menacingly] Big enough to stuff your body parts in when we finish.
entries.michelle:150: [growling, with lethal calm] I am not Sleeping Beauty. I do not need to be awakened. Get out or die.
entries.michelle:151: [with a harsh laugh] Hear you're out for the bastard's head. Give him an extra knife twist for me.
entries.michelle:152: [grimly welcoming] Welcome back. The Hole is open and ready to house you once more.
entries.mike:106: [scoffing] Ha. Just another Junkie. Go crash somewhere else, Junkhead.
entries.mike:107: [with a gravelly drawl] Yeah. You must be lost. Most people wouldn't be caught dead in this part of town. This is the Eastside, or some call it Old Town. The Wastes of the Wastes.
entries.mike:110: [mockingly, sneering] Water Chip? What are you? On dope? A chip made of water?
entries.miles:102: [politely] I don't believe we've met. I'm Miles. What can I do for you?
entries.miles:106: [warmly] Well, enjoy your stay in our little town.
entries.miles:112: [matter-of-factly] Yes, although Smitty is the one who actually casts the bullets. I just refill the brass casings.
entries.miles:117: [apologetically] Oh dear. I'm afraid I can't help you.
entries.miles:119: [with a resigned sigh] Yes, well, we have to make a living. Since the hydroponic farms aren't functioning, we have to buy food from the merchants, and bullets are the only thing we have to sell.
entries.miles:122: [excitedly, voice squeaking slightly] Really? That would be wonderful! We're just missing a few parts, but I'm sure that if you could scrounge up the right pieces, we could be self-sufficient! Sammael might be able to give you some help.
entries.miles:123: [hopefully] Have you found the parts yet?
entries.miles:126: [helpfully] You'll need to talk to Sammael. You'll usually find him in a tent down by the farms during the day.
entries.miles:127: [examining the parts carefully] Those are them, but it looks like Smitty is going to have to do a little work on them. Can you take them over to him?
entries.miles:130: [gratefully] Sure, I appreciate you finding them for us.
entries.miles:133: [warmly] Oh. I almost forgot. Here is some stuff, for your trouble.
entries.miles:134: [hopefully] Were you able to take the parts over to Smitty?
entries.miles:135: [pleased] Looks like Smitty did a great job on these. Thanks for the help, and here's some stuff for your trouble.
entries.miles:136: [with satisfaction] (This line contained only a stage direction—converted to audio tag)
entries.miles:137: [cheerfully] If you ever get back this way, you might want to look me and Smitty up. We might be able to help you out with some adjustments to some of your equipment. Smitty can work wonders with certain weapons, and I can help out with certain sorts of armor.
entries.miles:138: [with genuine scientific interest] Looks like you found some Power Armor. I've heard of a chemical process that I could use to harden the surface of the armor. However, I'm missing some information which could give me the last few clues to the formula and reagents necessary. I've heard the Librarian in the Hub, Mrs. Stapleton, has some journals and books that might be of use. If you could get those from there, I could probably test the process on your armor.
entries.miles:141: [understandingly] Well, if you ever change your mind, just go see Mrs. Stapleton and then head on back here.
entries.miles:142: [curiously] Had a chance to get to the Hub yet and visit Mrs. Stapleton?
entries.miles:145: [absorbed in concentration, mumbling thoughtfully] Hmmmm. Yes, hmmmm. Well, I think I can figure it out, but it will take a full day for the bonding to occur. Is that acceptable?
entries.miles:148: [reassuringly] Well, when you have the time, come back and I'll do the process on your armor.
entries.miles:150: [delighted, with a note of pride] Well, I think it worked! Hope it helps you out.
entries.miles:151: [regretfully] What happened to your power armor? I can only help you out if you have power armor.
entries.miles:153: [apologetically] Nothing I can do with that type of armor. Sorry.
entries.missbro:101: [raspy, gratefully] Thank you stranger! [breathing heavily] I don't know how many weeks, perhaps months, those thugs have had me here. [with effort] I'm very grateful for your help, and I'm sure the Brotherhood of Steel is also.
entries.missbro:108: [weakly] You haven't heard of us? [with a pained laugh] I'm really surprised. [slowly, struggling for breath] You must not leave the Hub very often. You should get out more. [raspy] We're northwest of here, on the west side of the mountain range.
entries.missbro:109: [voice cracking with emotion] I really appreciate you helping me, but [more forcefully, hoarse] why are you trying to lie to me? [raspy, insistent] Do you not think I know every member of our order?
entries.missbro:113: [gratefully, voice wavering] Thanks again! [with effort] If you stop by the Brotherhood, I'd appreciate it if you could let Talus know I'm okay. [softly] I'm sure he's worried. Bye, and take care.
entries.missbro:114: [weakly] Oh, I'll be fine now, thanks. [slowly] I have some friends here that I can stay with while I regain my strength. [raspy, determined] I'll try to send word to the Brotherhood to let them know that I am safe now, thanks to you. Bye
entries.missbro:115: [confused, raspy] How… [sighing with realization] Oh, I'm sorry. [weakly] You must have passed that "test" the Elders made up. [with effort] I completely forgot about that. [gratefully, voice cracking] Well, my thanks goes even deeper. I'm glad you never gave up. [voice trembling] My life could have been in jeopardy at any moment. [slowly, breathlessly] It must have taken you a while to hunt me down. This city is huge. [trailing off] The obstacles you must have overcome.
entries.missbro:120: [quietly, raspy] Oh… [sighing] Well, I'm still very grateful.
entries.missbro:121: [weakly] I guess so. [hoarsely, with faint approval] that was some fine handy work you did.
entries.missbro:124: [raspy, appreciative] Well, thanks again. [slowly] I am going to stay with some friend of mine until I regain my strength. [whispering, urgently] By the way, I'd watch it around here. [weakly] I heard my hosts talking about some Thieves' Circle. [struggling] I guess we're close to their territory or something. [breathlessly] I think that might be why they were talking about moving to a different location. Bye.
entries.missbro:125: [quietly, raspy] Well, I'm glad your luck held out. [with effort] I've heard some bad things about Old Town. [voice dropping] The skags are creepy, [hesitantly] I think it's something else.
entries.missbro:126: [hoarsely, with quiet intensity] Whatever you say. [slowly] I'm just grateful to be free again. [voice cracking] I don't take well to torture.
entries.missbro:130: [weakly, struggling] Maybe not. [raspy, troubled] I've been having trouble remembering things. [with effort] I think it was something they fed me.
entries.mlprison:108: [with venomous disdain] Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
entries.mlprison:112: [spitting the words] Do not mock me.
entries.mlprison:113: [hoarsely defiant] I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.
entries.mlprison:114: [growling] I refuse to tell you any information. Leave me alone.
entries.mlprison:118: [scoffing bitterly] Don't you remember that you tried that trick last week? I didn't fall for it then, and I'm not going to start now.
entries.mlprison:119: [sneering] What? No cowl to hide behind? Your traitorous nature is self-evident.
entries.mlprison:122: [rawly anguished] You are cruel. Leave us alone.
entries.mlprison:123: [with grim intensity] I won't spill the beans about my people. You cannot force a man to betray himself, you can only force a man to stop living.
entries.mlprison:127: [muttering darkly] From the mouth of a man comes the serpent's words.
entries.mlprison:128: [raspy exasperation] Right, I could guess that. Go away, and leave us alone.
entries.moatgrd:101: [with officious authority] What is your business here?
entries.moatgrd:107: [coldly threatening] I have no patience for jokes. If you do not leave this area now [shouting] I will shoot you!
entries.moatgrd:113: [warming up, friendly] Ahh, very good. Customers are always welcome. Come in but please keep your weapons holstered. [relaxed, gesturing] Go find Zack, he can set you up with anything you need.
entries.moatgrd:116: [casually] Oh, ok. Gabriel will talk to you. [nodding toward the door] Go on in.
entries.moatgrd:117: [with a slight nod] Yeah, I remember you. [unbothered] Go on in.
entries.morbid:101: [with oily politeness] I'm Doc Morbid, can I help you?
entries.morbid:107: [with a thin smile] Well, ok, then. Do come back.
entries.morbid:108: [with predatory patience] Well, if not today, then perhaps sometime in the near future.
entries.morbid:111: [with clinical interest] Hmm, lets have a look.
entries.morbid:112: [with cold precision] You seem to be in nearly perfect health. That will be $10 for the examination.
entries.morbid:115: [coldly, with menace] I never joke. Especially when it comes to physical trauma. You will pay or I'll have to resort to other forms of compensation, many of which are much more painful then just paying my fee.
entries.morbid:118: [with dark authority] Have it your way. Cougar, Flash. Show our 'patient' to the lab.
entries.morbid:119: [with false warmth] Thank you for your business. Come again.
entries.morbid:120: [coldly, almost amused] You do not have enough money. I have a very special way of dealing with debtors - I don't. Flash and Cougar, take our new found source of income to the lab for processing.
entries.morbid:121: [with sinister satisfaction] Ok, I have your test results:
entries.morbid:130: [dismissively cruel] No. I don't loan anyone, and I mean anyone, any amount of money. Go away, you pauper.
entries.morbid:132: [with a sinister chuckle] Excellent. Let's begin. This might hurt a little . . .
entries.morbid:133: [with hollow cheerfulness] There you go. Come back again!
entries.morbid:134: [with feigned surprise] Oh, back so soon. What can I help you with?
entries.morbid:138: [annoyed, dismissively] Please make it somewhere else, I'm busy.
entries.morbid:139: [with predatory charm] Hmmm. I don't like your looks, stranger. But what can I do for you? I never, ever turn away a paying customer.
entries.morbid:144: [with dark amusement] Oh, It's you again. I like your style, even if I don't like you. What can I help you with, now?
entries.morbid:148: [with false enthusiasm] Oh, It's a customer! What can I help you with?
entries.morbid:153: [with veiled desperation] My business has dropped off recently. I'm happy to see any customers, these days. Not that I mind your company, of course.
entries.morbid:157: [with oily confidence] Well, if you do need anything, please stop by. No one can beat my service!
entries.morbid:163: [with sinister delight] Ahh, a repeat customer. Excellent these days! How can I help you?
entries.morbid:167: [coldly irritated] I hope you have a good reason for disturbing me. My time is extremely valuable.
entries.morbid:171: [coldly] I don't find your humor funny. Please leave so I can return to my work.
entries.morbid:172: [with clinical detachment] Hmm. Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps you need some rest. Try the Crash House, around the corner. Good night.
entries.morbid:173: [with contemptuous weariness] I'm sorry, I don't treat idiots at this time of night. Something about full moons and lunacy, I suppose. Have a good night.
entries.morbid:174: [with icy patience] You again. I hope you have another good reason for disturbing me . . .
entries.morbid:196: [coldly irritated] I hope you have a good reason for disturbing me. My time is extremely valuable.
entries.morbid:200: [coldly] I don't find your humor funny. Please leave so I can return to my work.
entries.morbid:201: [with clinical detachment] Hmm. Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps you need some rest. Try the Crash House, around the corner. Good night.
entries.morbid:202: [with contemptuous weariness] I'm sorry, I don't treat idiots at night. Something about full moons and lunacy, I suppose. Have a good night.
entries.morbid:203: [with icy patience] You again. I hope you have another good reason for disturbing me . . .
entries.morbid:204: [sharply outraged] Trespasser! This is a private room!
entries.morbid:210: [with menacing intensity] Don't try to talk your way out of this one!
entries.morbid:214: [with desperate fury] No! I won't let you shut down my operation! Gretch, get
entries.morbid:223: [with bitter surrender] Fine. Have it your way!
entries.morbid:224: [with cold calculation] I will take something from you. And then we will be even.
entries.morbid:229: [with greedy triumph] Now, half of what you have just seen is mine again.
entries.morbid:231: [with reproachful coldness] Now, now. Watch your language.
entries.morbid:234: [with feigned innocence] Wh . . . what could you possibly mean?
entries.morbid:236: [shifty and defensive] That proves nothing. Gretch is a little . . . slow in the head. No one listens to him around here. You had best leave.
entries.mrhandyc:107: [with cheerful mechanical whirring] Unit #462 online. Self-test. Adjusting unit location data. Fixed. Rebuilding memory file. Fixed. [with a sad beep] Error - task incomplete.
entries.mrhandyc:112: [in an overly helpful synthesizer voice] Unit #462 is a cleaning model. Must finish cleaning and maintenance of this level.
entries.mrhandyc:115: Vat Control Room. [with a satisfied mechanical beep] End of list.
entries.mstmerch:102: [quickly, distracted] ...I don't care what they say. We need new parts... [catching herself] Oh, yes. Sorry. What can I do for you?
entries.mstmerch:107: [rapidly] Sure, great. You're hired. [pausing uncertainly] Wait. What position? [realizing] Oh, caravan guard right? Yeah, sure. You can work for us. You look okay. Anything else?
entries.mstmerch:111: [dismissively, rushed] Sorry, no time for nonsense!
entries.mstmerch:112: [thoughtfully] Water chip... hmm. [with recognition] Oh, those old Vault purifying control chips. [matter-of-factly] Well, I'm sure I speak for the entire town when I say you won't find one here. Without the proper equipment they're worthless. Only a Vault, or maybe Necropolis would have any use for one. [curiously] Why do you ask?
entries.mstmerch:117: [businesslike] Really? Well as you probably have heard, we supply a great deal of water throughout the area. I am sure we could arrange to send a caravan up to your Vault for a fee.
entries.mstmerch:122: [apologetically] Then I'm sorry, I don't think I can help.
entries.mstmerch:123: [indignantly] Can't trust me?!? [emphatically] I'm routinely trusted to deliver water to people far more paranoid than yourself! [scoffing] What do you think we are? Terrorists?
entries.mstmerch:126: [with intrigue] Well, if you change your mind let me know. I'm very curious now.
entries.mstmerch:132: [rapidly] Sure, great. You're hired. [pausing uncertainly] Wait. What position? [realizing] Oh, caravan guard right? Yeah, sure. You can work for us. You look okay.
entries.mstmerch:133: [impatiently] We already went through this. Are you willing to pay the price to have the water caravans start?
entries.mstmerch:137: [matter-of-factly] Well, it's just a guess really. [explaining] We tried to start a caravan route to Necropolis once, but they refused to trade with us. Nobody in their right mind refuses water these days unless they have a reliable supply. I figure they must have their own purifier or they would have died out a long time ago. [pressing] So are you looking to have us go up to your Vault?
entries.mstmerch:140: [matter-of-factly] Well, it is quite a distance away. [stating plainly] 2000 caps should cover the initial caravan, and I'm sure your Vault will have stuff to trade to keep us going for a while. However with our current reserves, I'm guessing that we will only be able to keep your Vault going for an extra 100 days or so.
entries.mstmerch:147: [briskly] Ok, I can start sending the caravans up to your Vault today. [with a warning tone] Now you ought to know, the caravans are pretty visible going across the desert. So, sending the caravans out that way is going to paint a pretty good picture for anyone that might be looking for your Vault. [pressing] Are you still sure you want them sent out that way?
entries.mstmerch:150: [matter-of-factly] That sounds fair enough. The technology from the Vaults can fetch a pretty good price down here in the Hub.
entries.mstmerch:151: [firmly] Sorry but I can only accept full payment.
entries.mstmerch:152: [matter-of-factly] That sounds fair enough. The technology from the Vaults can fetch a pretty good price down here in the Hub.
entries.mstmerch:153: [firmly] Sorry but I can only accept full payment.
entries.mstmerch:155: [with finality] Ok, they'll start off in a few hours.
entries.mutant2:101: [with a slow, gravelly rumble] Take him to Harry. He'll know what to do with him.
entries.mutant2:102: [with brutish slowness] We should take her to Harry. [growling possessively] He has plans for all the women.
entries.neil:114: [irritably] I am sorry, but I can't understand you. Now, what are you doing here?
entries.neil:118: [coldly commanding] If you are doing nothing, then I suggest that you leave. Now!
entries.neil:119: [with grudging assessment] You wish to help? Maybe I can use you.
entries.neil:122: [bluntly] You are simple enough to find this person that others are too smart to find. There is a spy around here who is giving our secrets to the Children. Find the spy. Kill the spy. Go.
entries.neil:123: [dismissively] I thought as much. Be off with you.
entries.neil:124: [with bitter certainty] Figures that Jake doesn't think that I can get the job done right. He's the only one who could have sent you. Then you know about the spy.
entries.neil:128: [flatly] My guards are no fools. They sent you to the right person. There is a leak in here, and we need to find out where it is and seal it.
entries.neil:133: [gravelly and matter-of-fact] The only thing that we know so far is that the person has to have access to the Children's Cathedral. I think it may be one of our scouts.
entries.neil:137: [firmly] I am quite certain. They only have access to the halls of the Followers. They are not allowed outside.
entries.neil:141: [with tired insistence] That is why I am asking you to look around and see if you can find someone. Will you help?
entries.neil:144: [gruffly] Thank you. This means a lot to us.
entries.neil:145: [darkly] Then I must detain you from warning anyone.
entries.neil:146: [with weary resignation] How he ever became second in command is beyond me. Since he was so scarce in words, I will fill you in. We have a leak who is feeding the Children some of our movement patterns.
entries.neil:151: [sharply] You don't even know? I guess you wouldn't; most people in here don't. Someone is sneaking information of our movements to the Children. We need that person gone.
entries.neil:155: [coldly practical] How much are you willing to offer?
entries.neil:162: [curtly] What would you like to know?
entries.neil:168: [with weary disdain] Our leader is Nicole. Really nice person, but a bit flighty. Anything else you want to know?
entries.neil:173: [gravelly and ominous] The Children are not what they appear to be. They are hiding something. Something related to those Nightkin. Anything else?
entries.neil:178: [suspiciously] There is the Children's healer, but I don't trust them. We also have a doctor or nurse on duty here at all times. Anything else?
entries.neil:183: [stiffly formal] I am truly sorry to hear that. Pieces be with you!
entries.neil:189: [dismissively scornful] A bit sure of yourself. I have no need for you. Talk to Nicole if you wish to offer your services. Good night.
entries.neil:190: [with curt direction] Then you will want to search out Nicole. She can help you better with that. Good evening.
entries.neil:192: [with grim satisfaction] Good job on finding and removing Heather. Her meddling nearly got everyone killed. I wish there was something more we could do.
entries.neil:198: [tersely appreciative] That would be wonderful. Thank you.
entries.officer:100: [sternly commanding] You! Stop right there and face the law!
entries.officer:101: [with fake politeness] Thank you for returning the water-chip. It's really going to help morale, and keep people from breaking vault law.
entries.officer:102: [with practiced courtesy] Good to see you again. Is there anything that I can do for you?
entries.officer:107: [dismissively] Hmmm. I think you should be somewhere else besides here. Have a nice day.
entries.officer:108: [puffing chest out] I'm in charge of Vault security and law enforcement. You might not know it, but the Vault wouldn't run as well if it wasn't for me.
entries.officer:111: [self-importantly] It is. Without proper adherence to the laws, the Vault would soon be a lawless place, with no direction. That would jeopardize the safety of us all.
entries.officer:114: [condescendingly] Well, even if weapons are required on the outside world, don't display them in a threatening manner in here. Other than that, I can't think of anything in particular.
entries.officer:116: [smugly] You see, I knew that would happen. People obeying law is the only thing that has saved the Vault from misery and destruction. Keep up the good work.
entries.officer:117: [apologetically stern] The Overseer has not authorized me to open the armory and get you more weapons. I'm sorry, but I can't help you.
entries.officer:122: [matter-of-factly] To keep the weapons away from those who don't have access to them.
entries.officer:125: [with hollow wisdom] Life isn't fair, sometimes. But our law is. Have a nice day.
entries.officer:126: [flatly listing] The Overseer, myself and my security team. That's it.
entries.officer:129: [impatiently] Yes, it is. I have to get back to work.
entries.officer:130: [with officious certainty] Yes, only people with need can get in.
entries.officer:132: [apologetically firm] I'm sorry, it's a good argument, but I can't let you in.
entries.officer:133: [with sudden understanding] Hmm. Now that you mention it, it sounds like you do. Here, let me get the door for you.
entries.officer:139: [dripping with sarcasm] Great. Your intelligence staggers me. I can't possibly think anymore.
entries.officer:140: [dismissively] Sorry, you've gotten all we can spare. Good day.
entries.officer:141: [with disdain] I don't like your kind. Rabble-rousers. You should be ashamed.
entries.officer:144: [threateningly formal] Watch your language, or I'll bring you in for failure to respect a law enforcement officer.
entries.officer:147: [somewhat sheepishly] Hmm. Possibly. It should be my job to be impartial, but I might have stepped over the line this time. I'll try and do better in the future.
entries.officer:148: [gruffly] Hmm. No. Probably not harsh enough.
entries.officer:149: [stiffly encouraging] Good luck. I hope you can do the job.
entries.officer:150: [with stern warning] You'd better not let me down.
entries.officer:151: [commanding sharply] Put your weapon away, right now.
entries.officer:152: [loudly incredulous] What do you think you are doing with that in here?
entries.officer:156: [voice hardening] Be careful what you call me. And don't draw a weapon inside. This is the Vault for god's sake.
entries.officer:157: [threateningly] You'd better not be practicing it in here. Me and you will have a serious problem if you do it again.
entries.officer:158: [knowingly accusatory] I knew that outside life would get you into trouble.
entries.orfeo:101: [with creepy warmth] Ah. A new convert. Welcome.
entries.orfeo:105: [with measured menace] Then we shall take care of that problem shortly.
entries.orfeo:106: [with smooth, practiced charm] We must first cleanse you from the impurities of the wastelands. Come.
entries.over:101: Ahh, you're here. Good. Well, only good that you're here. We've got a problem. A big one. The controller chip for our water purification system has given up the ghost. We can't make another one and the process is too complicated for a work-around system. Simply put, we're running out of drinking water. No water, no Vault. Now we both know we've had our differences as you've grown up. You've got the wanderlust in you - desires for things the Vault just can't satisfy. And you know I think this just might be the last safe place anywhere so I'm always worried about those who want to take off on adventures. Hey, if everyone left, I'd be out of a job! Seriously, this is crucial to our survival. And frankly, I think you're the only hope we have. You need to go find us another controller chip.
entries.over:104: One month . . . two . . . four . . . five . . . six . . .
entries.patrick:102: [warmly, with friendly curiosity] Greetings, traveler. What brings you out this far?
entries.patrick:108: [with a knowing smile] I see. Much like myself, then.
entries.patrick:113: [indignantly] It's not junk! It's trade goods!
entries.patrick:116: [inquisitively] Hmm. Haven't seen one of those before. What seems to be the trouble?
entries.patrick:119: [cheerfully] I wander from place to place, making a living with music and a little bit of tinkering work.
entries.patrick:123: [settling into storyteller mode] Using the coastline as a referent, you've got Shady Sands about a week inland, and Junktown a few days south of there. Hub's just another couple days south of Junktown. Avoid Necropolis to the east of those, though. [warningly] Not worth the trouble.
entries.patrick:128: [apologetically] I don't think I could help you with that. I never had much of a chance to study pre-war Vault technology.
entries.patrick:129: [modestly] Mostly a little electrical and mechanical tinkering. I helped Junktown with their lights and showed the people in Shady Sands a better design for their stoves.
entries.patrick:131: [fondly] Oh, mostly old folk songs and some Celtic music. It's a change of pace.
entries.patrick:134: [warmly, with admiration] Shady Sands is a small, self-sufficient community led by Aradesh, a kind man and strong leader. They are peaceful and hard-working. They are probably the best chance for a new civilization here.
entries.patrick:135: [wistfully] Shady Sands is a small farming community. They were led by a good man named Aradesh, but I've heard he's gone. It's a pity. Without him I don't know if they'll survive.
entries.patrick:136: [with understated respect] Junktown? A small trading city. Strange place until you get used to it. They are run by mayor Killian Darkwater, a hard but fair man.
entries.patrick:137: [dryly] Junktown? A small trading city. Strange place until you get used to it. They are run by Gizmo, a gambling mogul and crime-lord.
entries.patrick:138: [casually] Junktown? A small trading city. Not too remarkable.
entries.patrick:139: [with enthusiasm] The Hub is a major trading center. It's said that you can find anything there, and I'd say that's not too far wrong.
entries.patrick:140: [gravely] Necropolis is the city of the dead. It's inhabited by ghouls, the descendants of humans who sought shelter in a Vault there. Story goes that the Vault failed somehow, so now the only inhabitants are carrion-eating monsters.
entries.patrick:141: [warningly] It was overrun by an army of mutants last I heard. I'd stay away from there, if I were you.
entries.patrick:143: [cautiously] Possibly, but I for one wouldn't risk the ghouls. Latest word is they've some sort of powerful new leader.
entries.patrick:144: [brightly] Why, certainly. Would you like to hear it?
entries.patrick:148: [pleasantly] Hello again. Can I help you?
entries.paul:101: [warmly welcoming] Ahhh, so you're the new initiate. Welcome aboard. What can I do for you?
entries.paul:109: [proudly] I'm Paul, head of Energy Weapons Development.
entries.paul:112: [excitedly] Laser, Plasma... you name it, I've built it.. or at least re-built it.
entries.paul:115: [matter-of-factly] You would have to see Michael to be issued a weapon. He can't authorize you for one though, for that you would have to see Talus.
entries.paul:118: [helpfully] They are both on the first floor of the base. Talus is usually in the training room and Michael does his duty just outside of the storage room.
entries.paul:121: [eagerly] Sure. What can I help you with?
entries.paul:127: [with eager enthusiasm] Yes. The latest in hand held laser technology. [He takes a small pistol from a work table and hands it to you]
entries.paul:130: [with a dismissive wave] That one won't do you much good. It's still lacking the lenses and amplifier. [He takes the pistol back from you and puts it on the work table] If you really want one, go talk to Talus or Michael.
entries.paul:134: [surprised] A Water Chip? The ones from the old Vault-Tec shelters?
entries.paul:136: [knowledgeably] No. Those things were junk, they were prone to failure. We don't deal with purifying our own water here. We have water delivered by caravans from the Hub.
entries.paul:139: [with technical fascination] In the hands of a skilled warrior, it could cut a person in half. The beam will shear flesh faster then you can run your finger through sand.
entries.paul:141: [definitively] No. I only work on Energy weapons. You should go see Kyle if you have questions about Power Armor.
entries.paul:144: [apologetically] Well, I can't help you with that. Sorry.
entries.paul:156: [exasperatedly] Um.. please leave before you drool on something important.
entries.peasantc:105: [nervously, pleading] I hope you're not going to kick me out of here.
entries.peasantc:109: [stammering, anxiously] Oh, well, if you want to stay a while, go right ahead. I think we are safe here.
entries.peasantc:110: [with cautious concern] Well, you gotta be careful these days. I hope you're having a better life than I am.
entries.peasantc:111: [fearfully, speaking quickly] Well, it's true. After what happened to my friends, I gotta protect my turf. I just hope you're not gonna kill me.
entries.peasantc:123: [pleading desperately] I hope so, I really hope so.
entries.peter:101: [irritably, talking fast] What are you doing around here? Can't you see we are busy?
entries.peter:106: [exasperated] Great. I'm busy, and I get a moron tailing me. [dismissively] Go look for Jake if you need someone to talk to.
entries.peter:107: [snippily] Sure. You can start by getting out of my way.
entries.peter:111: [coldly impatient] Yes. You can get out of here.
entries.peter:112: [sighing heavily] Fine. It doesn't look like I will get rid of you any other way. [with weary frustration] It seems that we are having a security problem. You want to help, you find the problem.
entries.peter:116: [urgently, clipped] Look, we have a breach in security. We need to find this breach and end it.
entries.peter:119: [scoffing] Do I look like a guide. [impatiently] Go talk to Jake if you are looking for a guide.
entries.petrox:101: [with a swagger and false charm] Greetings! I am Petrox. I am one of Garl's lead raiders. Who are you?
entries.petrox:106: [casually boasting] As a raider, I get to travel to many parts of the wasteland. In my travels, I get supplies for the camp.
entries.petrox:110: [growing heated, dismissively] Well, it's nice that you think that you are so important that you don't need a name to go around here. But, I will at least tell you a little about us. We are the toughest people in the wastelands. No one can stand against us. [scoffing] Not even those wimps from Shady Sands or Junktown.
entries.petrox:113: [coldly, with menace] I am sorry, but I don't have time to waste on those who are slow. Good bye.
entries.petrox:114: [with sleazy rationalization] We never steal. We just take the extra that others have and redistribute it among our hungry people.
entries.petrox:117: [drawling, matter-of-factly] I've been to many places in the wastelands. The closest places that I've been to are Shady Sands and Junktown. Not much happens in those places, but they are always full of information and supplies.
entries.petrox:120: [threateningly] You are starting to become annoying now. I think I will end that slight problem.
entries.petrox:121: [with a leering tone] Shady Sands is a fertile community. They are happy to, um, [pause] share their bounty with us.
entries.petrox:123: [with obvious interest] Junktown is a little bit south of here. They have many good women.
entries.petrox:124: [with sleazy charm and interest] Junktown is a little bit south of here. They have many good women. Say . . . [leaning in] I can show you around sometime, maybe we can get to know each other better . . . whaddya say?
entries.petrox:128: [firmly, with finality] I have told you all that I am permitted. Please go.
entries.radio:101: [over crackling static] Command to patrol, command to patrol. What is your status? Over.
entries.radio:106: [professionally] Understood, patrol. We are sending assistance now. Over.
entries.radio:107: [with sharp suspicion] Who is this? What is your purpose?
entries.radio:111: [calmly authoritative] Understood, patrol. What are your coordinates?
entries.radio:115: [formally signing off] Understood, patrol. Command, out.
entries.radio:116: [decisively] Understood, patrol. We are sending reinforcements.
entries.radio:117: [with realization] Ah, that explains it. We are sending help now.
entries.radio:118: [urgently, barking orders] Roger, patrol. We're sending help now! Hold on!
entries.radio:128: [through radio static] Command here, go ahead patrol.
entries.radio:131: [shouting urgently] Intruders in the base! Sound the alert!
entries.raidgrd:123: [quickly, trying to sound tough] Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
entries.raidgrd:125: [defensively] Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
entries.raidgrd:130: [with uncertain interest] Really? What does she look like?
entries.raidgrd:132: [speaking faster, getting excited] Yeah, she's here. She's in the big house. [slowing down, cautious] You know, if we tell Garl, then he would want a piece of the bounty. You might want to think about that.
entries.raidgrd:133: [suspiciously] You don't sound like you mean it. I think that you are up to something. And if you are telling the truth, then I'll bag the reward for myself.
entries.raidgrd:134: [stammering fearfully] I . . . I can't say any more, or Garl will kill me.
entries.raidgrd:136: [with hostile unease] I don't like your looks. You'd better get away from me.
entries.raidpris:101: [desperately, voice cracking] Hey, you! Get me out of here!
entries.raidpris:105: [pleading frantically] I don't care. Get me out of here please!
entries.raidpris:106: [through trembling breaths, hoarsely] My name is Jack. I'm from Junktown. These monsters killed the rest of my caravan and put me here.
entries.raidpris:109: [voice breaking with desperation] Please, just help me out.
entries.raidpris:110: [agonized, gasping] Ow! My leg. It's hurt. I think it might be broken. Please help me!
entries.razlo:101: [dismissively] I'm sorry but I can't help you.
entries.razlo:104: [with clinical concern] You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
entries.razlo:107: [sighing sympathetically] Tandi is gone? That is a terrible thing. I hope they find her.
entries.razlo:108: [muttering skeptically] Hmmm, Tandi is gone? I find this hard to believe, but maybe she ran away with Seth. I know that they have been eyeing each other lately. Aradesh was always a little bit of a prude, perhaps it was too much for her finally.
entries.razlo:112: [with worried emphasis] How awful! If that is the case, I hope she is not hurt. Who is looking for her?
entries.razlo:115: [sighing, with genuine concern] I hope she is found before it is too late.
entries.razlo:116: [handing over supplies, urgently] If she is hurt, it could be bad. Here, take these . . . I hope that you won't need them.
entries.razlo:120: [matter-of-factly] I'm Razlo. Can I help you?
entries.razlo:124: [scoffing, with dry humor] Hmmm. I think I've seen Brahmin with more brain cells then you. Well, let's see if you're wounded.
entries.razlo:125: [dismissively] Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps later, then?
entries.razlo:127: [coldly] I have already given you as much as I can. Good luck.
entries.razlo:128: [disdainfully] Hmmm, I don't like your looks. I hope that you have come for business, and will be moving on shortly . . .
entries.razlo:131: [politely professional] Hello, again. How can I be of service?
entries.razlo:135: [curtly] It was nice seeing you again. Have a good day.
entries.razlo:136: [with exasperation] Of course. It's you again. Now what?
entries.razlo:148: [regretfully] Sorry, I can't cure any poisons. I don't have the proper ingredients to make a decent anti-venom.
entries.razlo:150: [with satisfied certainty] Yep, just as I thought. Let me get the cure.
entries.razlo:151: [matter-of-factly] You seem fine, now. Be careful in the future.
entries.razlo:152: [dismissively] Stop by again, but stay healthy next time.
entries.razlo:153: [with scholarly frustration] Not too much. They seem to be extremely large versions of the north American Emperor scorpion. Contrary to my medical knowledge, their poison has grown more potent, not diluted, as I would expect. Seth has been hunting them, which helps some of my tests.
entries.razlo:154: [in a tone of bewildered wonder] And how such a large creature can even be possible by natural evolution, or even radiation induced mutation is beyond me.
entries.razlo:158: [thoughtfully, with academic precision] They seem to be sensitive to light. Nocturnal. If I could get a sample of their poison, especially the venom production sac located in their tail, I could create an anti-venom.
entries.razlo:160: [defensively, with dry wit] Doc Morbid in Junktown taught me some. And just because we live in stone huts, does not mean we are less intelligent or educated. Have a nice day.
entries.razlo:161: [excitedly] Let me see the sac! Yes, I can do something with this.
entries.razlo:162: [proudly, with measured enthusiasm] Here, take this as a free sample. It seems to work well against radscorpion stings, of course, but it shows much potential as a general anti-venom and poison cure.
entries.razlo:163: [irritably] It's late. Come back in the morning.
entries.razlo:168: [groaning, exasperated] Hnn?! What is that? Great, I get awakened by the great mumbling beast of the north. Come back in the morning.
entries.razlo:169: [blearily, checking for injuries] Are you hurt?
entries.razlo:172: [threateningly] You will be, if you keep me from my sleep. Now come back in the morning.
entries.razlo:173: [with sudden realization] Great Brahmin! Why didn't you say so?
entries.razlo:175: [dismissively] You're barely hurt. I suggest a good nights sleep and some rest; you will heal naturally over time.
entries.razlo:176: [scoffing rudely] You're barely hurt, you wimp. Come back in the morning.
entries.razlo:177: [examining clinically] Ouch, that does look a little painful. That will be $25.
entries.razlo:180: [with alarm] Oh Great Brahmin! That is very, very serious. It will cost $50.
entries.razlo:183: [horrified, with dark humor] How can you still be walking?! This looks extremely serious. We'll need some special prayers for this one and a lot of luck. Not to mention $100.
entries.razlo:186: [coldly matter-of-fact] You don't have enough money! I'm sorry, but my work ethic doesn't permit me to heal for free, you know. Come back when you have enough money.
entries.razlo:190: [with exasperated condescension] Why would I be able to help you kill radscorpions? I'm a doctor, not a warrior. For that you should see Aradesh, or even Tandi, or her boyfriend, Seth. Leave me.
entries.razlo:192: [pointedly] If I had a sample of their poison, I could create a cure.
entries.razlo:196: [with paternalistic warmth] This will take a little bit of time. Come, relax in the back. You might have a slight headache from the junja juice, as well. Come, come . . .
entries.razlo:197: [coldly] I have already given you as much as I can. Good luck.
entries.razlo:306: [excitedly] Let me see the sac! Yes, I can do something with this, as well as heal you for this great gift.
entries.razlo:307: [with paternalistic warmth] This will take a little bit of time. Come, relax in the back, while I work with the sac. You might have a slight headache from the junja juice, as well. Come, come . . .
entries.rebel:116: [brightly, with forced optimism] Hello! How goes the search?
entries.rebel:120: [with a dismissive sigh] Well, that's good to hear. Keep up the good work, I guess.
entries.rebel:122: [nervously] We knew that there was no hope. I don't think we'll get a new chip in time. [more earnestly] I think that some of us should move outside before it's too late.
entries.rebel:125: [urgently, with an edge of desperation] Please hurry.
entries.rebel:127: [quickening, with a nervous enthusiasm] Maybe you should come to one of our meetings. Theresa has some good ideas. We meet in her room on the second level, at five o'clock each evening.
entries.rebel:130: [with weary confidence] That's what Theresa thinks. She's got it all worked out. [more uncertainly] We're thinking of leaving the Vault soon.
entries.rebel:133: [sarcastically, rolling eyes] Why did the Overseer pick you? [mockingly] It's obvious you couldn't find your shoelaces, much less a new water chip. [sighing with exasperation] Oh well.
entries.rebel:135: [sharply, with impatience] Don't you have a job to do? [urgently] Hurry and find the chip!
entries.rhombus:185: [with barked authority] Talus is my second-in-command.
entries.richie:102: [nervously, voice cracking] You're not supposed to be here. Do you realize I'm supposed to kill you?
