entries.richie:111: [whining, exasperated] It's about time! It's hot in here! Boring too! If I didn't need this job to feed my family, I'd tell Lorenzo to stick it. See you tomorrow.
entries.richie:112: [desperately] I'm not supposed to leave this place and you're not supposed to be here. [raising voice] Get out!
entries.richie:113: [working up into a rant, voice rising] You Hub officials make me sick! Inspecting my bosses' vault! What's next, higher taxes? Can't a man earn an honest living anymore without you bureaucrats trying to control everything? [with false bravado] One of these days we're going to take a stand. Yeah, one of these days the common man is going to give you fatcats a knee to the balls like you deserve. One of these days we'll get you real good… [voice trailing off, losing steam] I can't wait… [suddenly meek, backtracking] By the way, it's not meant personal. I know you're just doing your job. [deflating] I'll get out of your face while you do your inspection. Bye.
entries.richie:114: [frantically] Don't give me this crap! [voice cracking with false aggression] Get outta here now or I'll have to shoot you!
entries.richie:115: [voice cracking, forced toughness] Oh yeah. Well no one pushes around Richie Glowsteader and gets away with it!
entries.richie:116: [nervously boastful] Oh just about ten thousand Hub Bucks. [anxiously] Hope you weren't thinking of stealing it. I'd have to kill you. [with uncertain bluster] I almost killed someone once, so you don't want to mess with me!
entries.richie:117: [irritably] Man, you're stupid. [quickly backpedaling] Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. [speaking faster, agitated] Now let's try this again. "Yes" means I blow your head off. "No" means you get your butt out of here. Which is it going to be?
entries.richie:121: [voice breaking, conflicted] Man, I can't do it! [with reluctant sadness] It'd be like shooting a dumb animal. [pleading desperately] Just get outta here, okay?
entries.richie:123: [speaking quickly, thinking out loud] Maybe one runk means "yes" and two runks mean "no". [hesitating, making it up as he goes] Okay, "runk" means I kill you. "Runk, runk" means you leave. Okay?
entries.richie:127: [defeated, muttering] Three runks. [frustrated curse] Shit, this isn't working. [sighing defeatedly] Maybe I'll just ignore you and you'll wander off…
entries.ripppris:101: [frantically, voice cracking] These people are crazy here. Help me get out of here!
entries.ripppris:105: [tearfully, with desperate gratitude] Oh, thank you. Thank you. Good bye!
entries.robctrl:102: [mechanically] Reprogramming complete. Initializing voice communication subsystems. Initializing personality subsystem. [click] How may this terminal be of service?
entries.robctrl:107: [with robotic precision] Input error. Command not in set. Please restate.
entries.robctrl:113: [in a flat, measured tone] This terminal is an Artificial Intelligence. This terminal is part of a WLAN matrix network to optimize remote unit operations.
entries.robctrl:117: [droning] This terminal is responsible for the operation of all General Atomics International industrial robots in this facility.
entries.robctrl:120: [with mechanical cheerfulness] The style of industrial robots are commonly referred to as 'Robobrain'. [click] General Atomics International has the finest industrial robots in the world. Buy two or more GAI robots and save! Special deal on 'Mr. Handy' models! [click] Advertising applet terminated.
entries.robctrl:122: [listing matter-of-factly] Current applications are: Facility Maintenance v2.1, Movement v4.8b, Repair v0.8a, Pest Control v1.4, Hearts v1.0 and Sensors '76.
entries.robctrl:128: [attempting to comply] Attempting to terminate. [click] System error. Failure to terminate application. Delete rights not available.
entries.robctrl:134: [in a flat instructional tone] Current application: Movement v4.8b. Current setting: [maximum/half rate/minimum]. Change to: maximum, half rate, or minimum.
entries.robctrl:138: [in a flat instructional tone] Current application: Sensors '76. Current setting: [full/minimum]. Change to: full, or minimum.
entries.robctrl:141: [with electronic precision] Current application: Pest Control v1.4. Current setting: [click] unauthorized. Change to: [click] all, none, small living, large living, or unauthorized.
entries.robctrl:147: [announcing tonelessly] Application Hearts running. User Wins. [click] Thank you for the game.
entries.robctrl:148: [announcing tonelessly] Application Hearts running. This terminal wins. [click] Thank you for the game.
entries.robctrl:149: [confirming monotonously] Program parameter changed. Current applications are: Facility Maintenance v2.1, Movement v4.8b, Repair v0.8a, Pest Control v1.4, Hearts v1.0 and Sensors '76.
entries.robctrl:155: [listing matter-of-factly] Current applications are: Facility Maintenance v2.1, Movement v4.8b, Repair v0.8a, Pest Control v1.4, Hearts v1.0 and Sensors '76.
entries.robctrl:161: [mechanically] Initializing voice communication subsystems. Initializing personality subsystems. [click] How may this terminal be of service?
entries.robctrl:168: [coldly declarative] This terminal cannot perform that function. Request denied.
entries.robctrl:173: [with digital distortion] This is the -- classified [click] [click]
entries.robctrl:176: [with electronic pause] [click] This is the FEV production control facility. This terminal online 2074. Final pre-production process 2075. It is currently under final construction, and is due to open 2078. [click]
entries.robctrl:179: [explaining mechanically] FEV is Forced [click] Evolutionary Virus, a product of the Livermore/Broansoun Laboratories. It is designed to increase the genetic complexity of a DNA/RNA series in a shorter period of time.
entries.robctrl:186: [with increasing electronic distress] Correcting. [click] Error. Attempting self-diagnostics.[click click] ERROR! FATAL SYSTEM ERROR. SYSTEM CORRUPTED, ATTEMPTING RECOMPILATION. [with long pause]
entries.robctrl:189: [with finality] Cannot process request. Terminating dialogue.
entries.romero:116: [aggressively, in-your-face] I ask the questions here. What are you doing here?
entries.romero:121: [snappily] Then you're looking in the wrong area. Get lost.
entries.romero:122: [threateningly, all bluster] You must be one of those wimpy little purple robes. Get out of here before we blow you away.
entries.romero:126: [scoffing] Hmm. If you are really from Adytum, then you are still a loser. [sneeringly] There can never be peace while those Rippers are still around.
entries.romero:129: [dismissively] Ask Razor. She'll explain about those bloodthirsty inbreds.
entries.romero:131: [hesitantly, dropping the tough act] Hey, now that you are a Blade, I need to ask you a favor.
entries.romero:135: [earnestly] Great. Take this locket to Julianna. Tell her that I hope to see her soon.
entries.romero:136: [vulnerably, almost softly] It seems that I have fallen for a girl in Adytum. [struggling] Because of the Regulators shooting us on sight, I can't get close to her.
entries.romero:140: [pleadingly] If you take this locket to Julianna, I would be in your debt.
entries.romero:143: [mockingly bitter] With allies like you, who needs enemies? Good bye!
entries.romero:144: [uncertainly, with quiet worry] I think she loves me too, but I don't know. The Blades won't risk letting me try to break into Adytum.
entries.romero:147: [joyfully, with relief] Thank you! She sent me a note. We are going to meet at the Follower's place and get married.
entries.romero:149: [gratefully, with genuine warmth] Thank you so much. We will stay here with the Followers now, where we can be happily married.
entries.rutger:101: [professionally smooth] Hello and welcome to the Far Go Traders. How may we help you?
entries.rutger:108: [sharply dismissive] We don't hire Skags! Get out.
entries.rutger:109: [sarcastically] Hmmmm. It's a shame you don't have the brains to go with that brawn. We could have used someone like you.
entries.rutger:110: [matter-of-factly] Well, we 'can' transport water, but it will cost you. How much do you need and where is it going?
entries.rutger:114: [exasperated] A whole vault? Are you nuts? We don't have that kind of access to that much water. Plus, I wouldn't want to go into those mountains. We've had enough missing caravans.
entries.rutger:119: [dismissively] Oh sorry, you're not from around here. The Water Merchants handle all the damn water in this town. I wouldn't even bother trying to deal with them. They're a bunch of vultures.
entries.rutger:122: [matter-of-factly] You can't miss them. They're south of here, all barricaded in with that damn water tower.
entries.rutger:125: [with measured authority] I'm in charge of the...I mean, I help run the Far Go Traders. If anyone messes with us, I'm the one they will answer to. We trade wares between all the different settlements.
entries.rutger:126: [with slight irritation] I already told you. Butch and I run the Far Go Traders. Now what did you want?
entries.rutger:131: [with casual confidence] Why, we trade just about everything you can think of: chems, tires, guns, bullets, food, brahmin, dirt, even scraps of metal.
entries.rutger:134: [matter-of-factly] You'd be surprised at what's in demand out there. Something that's taken for granted in one place may be a highly sought after commodity in a settlement 10 miles away.
entries.rutger:139: [with interest] I hear that you're a little crazy, but that might be what we need right now. You'll need to talk to Butch. He likes to meet all the new recruits. He's in the room right behind me. Go on in.
entries.rutger:140: [coldly] I don't think I want a child killer on one of my caravans.
entries.rutger:143: [skeptically] I guess accidents do happen. It is a pretty messed up world out there. I'm still not sure I trust you. Go ahead and talk to Butch. He's in that room right there.
entries.rutger:144: [angrily, through gritted teeth] My ass it was an accident. I know your type. Think you can do whatever you want. Well, not around here, buddy. Go ahead and talk with Butch, but I'll be keeping an eye on you. He's right through the door right behind me.
entries.rutger:145: [angrily, through gritted teeth] My ass it was an accident. I know your type. Think you can do whatever you want. Well, not around here, lady. Go ahead and talk with Butch, but I'll be keeping an eye on you. He's right through the door right behind me.
entries.rutger:146: [threateningly] You are one ruthless son of a bitch. We might need that, but that doesn't mean that I agree with your ways. Just don't touch a child around me, [growling] or you'll be the wet spot on the wall. Go ahead and talk to Butch. He's in the office right behind me.
entries.rutger:147: [warmly approving] You're looking for work? I've heard good things about you. We can always use someone of your reputation. Go on in and talk to Butch. He's through the door behind me.
entries.rutger:148: [casually assessing] You're looking for work, are you? You look alright. Well, you should probably talk to Butch. He's through the door behind me.
entries.rutger:149: [with sharp impatience] I thought you didn't want the job. What do you want?
entries.rutger:154: [sharply aggressive] Get out of here you damn Skag!
entries.rutger:155: [with exasperation] Fine. I wish you would make up you mind, I'm a busy man...Let me give you the details.
entries.rutger:156: [coldly] You're full of crap. Get the hell out.
entries.rutger:165: [matter-of-factly, with an edge] Well, I didn't say it was going to be easy. Otherwise, we would have solved the problem a long time ago. Ask around. Get rough if you have to, but don't draw blood. At least, not in public.
entries.rutger:166: [firmly concerned] I'm telling you, lay off the chems. They'll mess you up.
entries.rutger:167: [businesslike] The job pays 500 Hubbucks when you can tell Butch exactly what has been happening to all of the caravans that have disappeared recently. So, collect any proof you might find. I personally think it's those damn Water Merchants or those gun freaks at the Brotherhood of Steel. Butch thinks it's some Claw of death or something. Check with Beth, she would know more about that.
entries.rutger:168: [dismissively] Ok, but I don't know what you missed. There's not much to it.
entries.rutger:169: [with dry curiosity] I thought for sure you were from there. I was just testing you. If you're not from there, how the hell did you get that suit of steel they all traipse around in?
entries.rutger:172: [with surprised respect] Damn, you must be good. I'm glad you're on our side. I don't know how you couldn't know, but the Brotherhood is a strange bunch that worship technology, or something like that. They're just a little to the northwest from here.
entries.rutger:178: [with casual dismissal] Well, whatever. I'm sure you've met them before. They're a strange bunch that worship technology or something like that. They're to the northwest of here.
entries.rutger:179: [matter-of-factly] They are really strange. They worship technology or something like that. They have a hell of a lot of fire power. They could easily take out a caravan. They're to the northwest.
entries.rutger:180: [with measured wariness] I knew you had to be one of them. You had to be with that steel suit. I hope you're right, and I hope it's not a mistake hiring you, but you're not the only one we've hired so, it's ok.
entries.rutger:185: [with dry humor] Well, that's reassuring. I think.
entries.rutger:186: [with mild concern] I hope you're right.
entries.rutger:187: [sternly] A hunch isn't good enough. We need proof.
entries.rutger:188: [matter-of-factly] Beth's right out that door and to the right. She runs our weapon shop. Tell her you're working for us, and you'll get a 15% discount.
entries.rutger:189: [dismissively] Oh, yeah, Deathclaw, whatever. They're all crazy. It's just people's imagination getting carried away. There's no ghost or monster or whatever it's supposed to be. Just stick with reality, and you'll be fine.
entries.rutger:190: [professionally pleasant] Yes? How can I help you?
entries.rutger:195: [with sudden realization] Really? So, who are the bastards? The Water Merchants?
entries.rutger:200: [sharply] You forgot? Funny, man. Now, get lost.
entries.rutger:201: [sharply] You forgot? Funny, lady. Now, get lost.
entries.rutger:202: [with angry satisfaction] I knew it was them. Did you bring proof? I'm going to make those bastards pay.
entries.rutger:206: [firmly businesslike] Well, I can't do anything unless I have proof. I wouldn't want to start another merchant war. If you can bring me proof, I'll bring it to the law, and we'll wipe them out.
entries.rutger:207: [coldly dismissive] You're full of crap. Get out of my face.
entries.rutger:208: [incredulously] What? How? That's impossible. You're gotta be joking? You are joking, aren't you?
entries.rutger:211: [skeptically mocking] A whole caravan? Really? What, do I look that gullible? Get out there and find out what's really happening to our caravans.
entries.rutger:212: [with heavy skepticism] Some huge mutants are destroying my caravans? That's almost as good as this Deathclaw story.
entries.rutger:218: [with shifting relief] Hey, I know how to use one of those. Butch got some gizmo from some scout from the Brotherhood a long time ago that can read these things. Let's see.……[genuinely apologetic] Sorry, I didn't believe you. This does not bode well for the good guys. [with grudging gratitude] Well, here's your 500 Hubbucks. Hell, make it 800, and thanks for the information! If you need anymore work you will always be welcome.
entries.rutger:219: [with concerned caution] Please, don't add to Butch's paranoia. He's a little bit touchy when it comes to the Deathclaw. Now tell me, did you actually find anything out? Was it the Water Merchants?
entries.rutger:224: [with exasperation] Rats, huh? So, did you find anything out or what? It's those damn Water Merchants, I know it!
entries.rutger:229: [with heavy skepticism] Mutants destroyed our caravans? That's almost as good as the one about the Deathclaw.
entries.rutger:234: [matter-of-factly] So, do you have any proof about who's been messing with my, I mean, our caravans?
entries.rutger:239: [with thoughtful suggestion] Well, if this Deathclaw really does exist, you might want to examine it's lair. It might have a clue.
entries.rutger:240: [professionally pleasant] Hi. How may I help you?
entries.rutger:243: [with genuine appreciation] Hey! I heard you killed the bastard in charge of those mutants. Good going. You probably saved the lives of everyone in the Hub; but I wonder where they were coming from.
entries.rutger:250: [warmly casual] Hey there, buddy. How are things going?
entries.rutger:252: [warmly casual, with a hint of charm] Hey there, gorgeous. How are things going?
entries.rutger:253: [with affectionate familiarity] How's my favorite lady?
entries.rutger:257: [with genuine warmth] Things are great! There are no more raids from those damn mutants, and trade is back to where it was. Actually, trade is much better than it was. Thanks for asking.
entries.rutger:258: [with genuine admiration] Hey, I heard you destroyed some base where all those damn mutants were hanging out! Good job! Too bad you couldn't track down their leader.
entries.rutger:265: [matter-of-factly] Well, I heard that some people saw some scattered groups of mutants way up to the northwest. Way passed the Brotherhood of Steel.
entries.rutger:266: [with concern and intrigue] You know, since the mutants were destroyed, the Children of the Cathedral have been acting 'very' strange. I actually overheard one talking about you. They seem to be looking for you desperately.
entries.rutger:267: [with disappointed frustration] Actually, things are not going so well. Those mutants are still causing problems with our Caravans. We've had to put almost all of our caravans on hold. Thanks for asking though.
entries.rutger:268: [with casual offer] Sure, we could use you in one of our caravans. Do you do guard work? The pay's standard, 400 hubbucks. Interested?
entries.rutger:271: [sharply] What? What about the missing caravans?
entries.rutger:275: [with casual indifference] Okay, but let me know if you change your mind. Most of the time it's easy money.
entries.rutger:276: [positively] Great, just talk to our caravan driver by the front door to see when the next caravan's scheduled to leave. Just as long as you do a good job our drivers will hire you.
entries.rutger:279: [coldly firm] You've got to be joking? I may be very grateful for what you've done, but I'm afraid that doesn't change the past. I think you should leave.
entries.rutger:280: [curtly] Didn't you hear me? We won't hire you. Please leave.
entries.rutger:281: [skeptically] I don't think that will be very affective, but you can work on one if you like.
entries.rutger:285: [with casual encouragement] Great. Be sure to ask around.
entries.rutger:286: [cooperatively] Well, okay. Just talk to our caravan driver by the front door when you're ready to go. Just as long as you do a good job our drivers will hire you.
entries.rutger:287: [dismissively friendly] Of course! You don't need to talk to me. Just talk to our caravan driver.
entries.rutger:289: [reassuringly matter-of-fact] Well sure, we may be losing a lot of caravans, but it is a very small percentage of our total business. The chances of you being on a caravan that is attacked by whatever is 'completely' capturing or destroying our caravans is very unlikely. Who or what ever is doing this must have a pretty large force, or a very deadly one.
entries.rutger:292: [with friendly casualness, catching himself] Hello again. What can I do you for… I mean do for you?
entries.rutger:311: [sharply angry] You pissed off the boss. Get the hell out of here!
entries.rutger:313: [with satisfied approval] That's great! Go tell Butch what you've found and he'll let me know if you've earned your reward.
entries.sammael:102: [with casual interest] Hey, I don't believe we've met. You are?
entries.sammael:107: [friendly, with a slight smirk] The pleasure's mine. I'm called Sammael.
entries.sammael:111: [matter-of-factly] I'm a Scav -- a scavenger. My job is to search out all of the Boneyard for useful items and information. Dangerous work.
entries.sammael:116: [with a knowing chuckle] See you around. If you see me. Heh.
entries.sammael:117: [darkly] Well, you got the DeathClaws out there, and then you got the Regulators back here in Adytum. Both ain't the most forgiving types.
entries.sammael:121: [gravely] We only work at night, and we're good at what we do. But I'll admit not everyone always comes back. [concerned] I sent a guy out last week to look for some parts for Miles, and we haven't heard from him since. The last transmission I got from him was that he'd found the parts, and was on his way back.
entries.sammael:122: [obligingly] I've done a little scouting. Who do you want to know about?
entries.sammael:129: [with sardonic disdain] The Blades are a pretty sorry sight for a group of people. They get by though, and some of them end up here in Adytum if they agree to what the Regulators offer them to do.
entries.sammael:130: [warningly] Well if you haven't seen them before. They're mean as all hell, and like nothing more than to rip a poor Scav's heart out.
entries.sammael:131: [cautiously] I've heard there's a nest of them somewhere to the east of the Blades, but I haven't seen it myself.
entries.sammael:132: [with grim resignation] The Gun Runners moved into a big factory up to north-east not long ago. Can't tell you much because they have a moat filled with radioactive sludge, and you gotta get through the Deathclaws to get there.
entries.sammael:133: [with wry amusement] The Followers preach peace and tolerance. Nice idea, but impractical. They live in a big library to the north-west of us.
entries.sammael:134: [with unsettled intrigue] The Children of the Cathedral are based out of a big church a ways to the south of here. There are some strange things going on there. I've seen creatures that can't be human coming in and out of there.
entries.sammael:135: [ominously] And if the stories are right, the church is built over an old Vault, which Adytum's predecessors lived in.
entries.sammael:136: [casually] Heya. We see each other once more. What's up?
entries.sammael:139: [quickly, departing] Oh, I see. Right. Bye!
entries.slappy:108: [excitedly, bouncing] Oooh, pretty, pretty stuff. [with childlike wonder] Why is the moon?
entries.slappy:114: [rapid-fire, panicked] All bright, it's all bright, the bright comes down, and then we are doomed.
entries.slappy:116: [gleeful chanting] Deathclaw, Deathclaw, Dah Dah Deathclaw.
entries.slappy:120: [rambling, sing-songy] Do, I, do, then you do, then we all do.
entries.slappy:123: [matter-of-factly, still bouncy] Problems are like Soup Bowls, wide and shallow.
entries.slappy:125: [fearfully excited] Deathclaw scary, really scary. [brightening up] Looks neat though. [with eager curiosity] Wanna' see it?
entries.slappy:128: [excitedly, rapid] Yeah, Deathclaw, Deathclaw, going to see the Deathclaw.
entries.slappy:131: [rapid-fire rambling] I do this, then I do that. [suddenly distracted] You see Harold? [admiringly] Harold's fun, his hair falls out, falls in the wind. [trailing off, dreamily] There it goes... wind, wind.
entries.slappy:133: [rhythmically pounding, insistent] Pound and Pound, and Pound and Pound.
entries.slappy:135: [babbling, stream-of-consciousness] Beth, Beth, shoo sha Beth. [excitedly] Like Harold, you talk Harold. [expectantly] Harold tell you story. [eagerly] Slappy help then.
entries.slummer:101: [with sincere concern] You have committed many sins. I will pray for your redemption.
entries.slummer:102: [excitedly, with evangelical fervor] Hail the Master! Hail the Holy Flame! Hail Peace and Unity!
entries.slummer:103: [gently, with paternal warmth] Hello my child. Why do you hold a weapon? Perhaps you need instruction in the ways of peace?
entries.slummer:119: [warmly, with genuine friendliness] Hello friend. It is good to see you. Put down your weapon, you are among friends here!
entries.slummer:127: [politely concerned] Hello stranger. Forgive me, but you should not draw your weapon in the Cathedral.
entries.slummer:133: [gently encouraging] Hello stranger. If you have come here to be redeemed, you are welcome here, but I would suggest you put away your weapon.
entries.slummer:141: [excitedly delighted] Hello friend! I'm so glad to see you've joined our cause!
entries.slummer:148: [cheerfully helpful] Hello stranger. May I help you?
entries.slummer:156: [apologetically] Forgive me stranger, but I have many duties. Please excuse me.
entries.slummer:157: [with zealous enthusiasm] Hail the Master! Hail Peace! Hail the Holy Flame! Hail Unity!
entries.slummer:163: [with gentle resignation] I would suggest that you find Brother Lasher. He is a hard man, but the Master works in mysterious ways. Farewell.
entries.slummer:165: [confused, but sincere] But we have no guards, except for the Nightkin. What are you talking about?
entries.slummer:171: [cheerfully pious] My apologies. Praise the Master, and have a nice day.
entries.slummer:173: [with naive optimism] I do not believe we have any. Praise the Master, I'm sure this is for the best.
entries.slummer:177: [with menacing gentleness] Many have tried to kill the Master, and all have failed. However, if you attempt this vile act, the Master may forgive you and find a good use for you. I shall pray for you.
entries.slummer:181: [earnestly] You have come to the wrong place, friend. This place is not about power. This place is about peace.
entries.slummer:182: [excitedly proud] I hear that our Crusade goes well. Soon we shall bring Peace and Unity to the Boneyard, and all the surrounding communities Isn't it great?
entries.slummer:187: [helpfully matter-of-fact] The person that you seek is Father Morpheus. He can be found in the tower. Is that all?
entries.slummer:191: [gently attentive] Is there something else on your mind, my child?
entries.slummer:198: [with warm amusement] You have a very good sense of humor, my child. Just don't tell jokes to Brother Lasher.
entries.slummer:205: [with concerned pity] I fear you may have had too much sun. I hope you find healing here. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.slummer:206: [with pitying warmth] Your words are full of such pain and hate! I pity you, my friend, but pity can be turned to joy. Seek Father Morpheus in the tower. He is a wonderful man, and can open your heart to love again.
entries.slummer:207: [with passionate conviction] Have you never been to the Cathedral before? This is a place of Peace and Unity. This is a place where differences are forgotten and we seek a future of unity and prosperity for all. A future where the horrors that our ancestors inflicted on us can never happen again!
entries.slummer:214: [with zealous righteousness] Our enemies slander us! People are so easily frightened, especially when someone tells them what to do! But since I follow the Master and the Holy Flame, I don't have to be afraid any more. The Master told me not to be afraid!
entries.slummer:220: [with infectious enthusiasm] Just praising the Master. I never get tired of praising of the Master. Why don't you praise the Master with me, friend?
entries.slummer:226: [with cheerful obviousness] You know, the one that's in your hand?
entries.slummer:229: [with breathless excitement] I don't know much. The mind of the Master is so great.. I do know that the Children are marching north. We will take control of all of the settlements, and baptize everyone! The baptism will change us and bring us closer to God, so we can have peace and unity, and there will never be war or destruction again!
entries.slummer:235: [with devout cheerfulness] Praise the Master! Peace be with you! Enjoy your stay at the Cathedral.
entries.slummer:236: [with idealistic warmth] This is a sanctuary, where those who wish to build a peaceful future can go, in order to realize their vision.
entries.slummer:242: [with encouraging sincerity] I'm glad to hear you express an interest in peace. Talk with Father Morpheus and Brother Lasher. They can instruct you further.
entries.slummer:243: [with apologetic deference] I'm afraid I can't help you. Only Father Morpheus communes with the Master. You can find him in the tower.
entries.slummer:247: [with fervent zealotry] I am more than willing to be reborn for my cause. Kill me if you must, but I will be redeemed and you will die.
entries.slummer:252: [nervously uncertain] Well... Uh.. Peace be with you.. I think... Farewell..
entries.slummer:253: [with bewildered sincerity] Look around you? Do you not hear the messages? How can you doubt the Master's sincerity?
entries.slummer:260: [with reverent admiration] He is Keeper of the Holy Flame, one who strives to wipe away all divisions, all hatreds. He wields both sword and plowshare, but would rather build than destroy. Hail the Master! Hail Unity!
entries.slummer:261: [with triumphant exultation] I hear that our Crusade goes well. We are marching north, and as the Master promised, the forces of the Dark Age are no match for an army of the Enlightened. These are glorious times! Lift up your head, friend, and shout with praise!
entries.slummer:266: [with sincere apology] I did not mean to insult you, nor to interfere in your duties. Please accept my apologies. May the Master bless you for your service.
entries.slummer:267: [cheerfully pious] My apologies. Praise the Master, and have a nice day.
entries.slummer:268: [with sorrowful understanding] Yours is a sad soul, my friend. I can only guess what horrors you've seen that makes you close your mind. Open it now, and find peace. Watch the screens, listen to Father Morpheus, and praise the Master.
entries.slummer:269: [nervously evasive] I know nothing, my friend, nothing! You shall have to find someone else to answer your inquiry. But it is not wise to ask about the Nightkin.
entries.slummer:274: [with sudden aggressive fervor] Nightkin! Nightkin! Kill!
entries.slummer:275: [with regretful enthusiasm] This has been a wonderful talk, but I am falling behind in my praises. Farewell. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Let us sing the sacred songs..
entries.slummer:276: [with dismissive politeness] If you do not like it here, you can leave. Praise the Master, and have a nice day.
entries.slummer:277: [with pitying disdain] I pity the Wastes, if that is a sample of the warped humor it breeds. I would not share it with the others.
entries.slummer:283: [warmly final] Not that I can think of. Farewell, friend.
entries.slummer:284: [with apologetic finality] I do not believe that I can help you, my friend. Farewell, and have a nice day. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame..
entries.slummer:285: [with polite excuse] I can't help you with that, I'm afraid. Well, I must meditate on the glories of the Master. Please excuse me. Hail the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.slummer:286: [with gentle enlightenment] Everyone here is filled with love! But it's hard for some people to express their love, and the Nightkin find it extremely hard to express it. But you shall discover this on your own. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.slummer:287: [with resolute conviction] We must submit to the Master and the Holy Flame. When we have proven ourselves, we shall become baptized and closer to God. When all have been baptized, we shall be as one, a Unity under the Master!
entries.slummer:293: [with passionate urgency] We have a right to survive. The ancients tried to survive and keep their freedom, and look at what they did to us! We must not make the same mistakes. Unity is the only solution. It's the only way to save what humanity has become!
entries.slummer:299: [with unquestioning faith] The Master has said that it was lack of Unity, so it must have been. Seek his high priest! Father Morpheus will correct the lies you have been told.
entries.slummer:300: [with jubilant relief] We're not zombies! When I was a member of the Fighting Flesh street gang, I was a psychotic fool who did anything that the higher-ups told me to do! Praise to the Master that I am no longer so blind! Oh, praise the Master! Let's praise him together, shall we?
entries.slummer:306: [with rapturous wonder] Isn't it wonderful that the Master would unite humans and mutants? He transcends hatred and prejudice. Can't you see, this proves that he wants what's best for everyone!
entries.slummer:313: [with meditative gentleness] Open your heart. Open your mind. Listen to what people are saying, and you will find enlightenment.
entries.slummer:320: [with solemn pity] How sad. I will pray for you.
entries.slummer:321: [with hopeful reverence] Unfortunately, I have never been privileged enough to see the baptismal font. Perhaps if I offer enough praise to the Master, I will receive a blessing. Hail the Master! Hail the Holy Flame! Hail Peace and Unity!
entries.slummer:322: [with absolute certainty] Of course he won't. He's the Master. He would never do that to his disciples. It is his holy power through baptism, and the Holy Flame, that will transform us. The virus is an evil of the old time, which I'm sure will be cleansed.
entries.slummer:323: [with compassionate resignation] We have no desire to bring you distress. If we cannot comfort you, please find another place where you can deal with your torment. This is a place of peace.
entries.slummer:327: [with serene acceptance] You will have to find the answer to that question yourself. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
entries.slummer:328: [with transcendent vision] The baptism will change us all, and bring our physical forms closer to God's own image. When we have all become God, all our differences will disappear, so we can have peace and unity at last, and there will never be war or destruction again!
entries.slummer:334: [with chilling benevolence] Once people understand the Master and what he stands for, everyone will want to be baptized. The only people who would not wish to be baptized are the insane, and they should be put out of their misery for their own safety, poor wretched things.
entries.slummer:340: [with warm invitation] Friend, if you look for the truth with an open mind, you will find us waiting for you. Praise the Master! I wish you well on your quest for enlightenment.
entries.slummer:341: [with humble faith] We must become closer to God, mutant and human alike. I'm not sure what the Master means with this particular part of the message, but it must be true. Praise the Master, he is so wise!
entries.slummer:347: [with earnest apology] We're forging a world that's better for everyone. That's all. I'm sorry if you don't understand yet. I pray that someone wiser than I can change your mind. Farewell, my friend. Praise the Master! Praise Peace and Unity!
entries.slummer:348: [with philosophical warmth] The world holds many surprises, my friend, some pleasant, some unpleasant. Farewell, my friend, and praise the Master!
entries.smitty:117: [regretfully] I'm sorry, I don't think I can help you. Try Zimmerman.
entries.smitty:122: [confidently] Yes, I can fix this. Give me some time.
entries.smitty:123: [warmly] Here you are. [handing over the fixed parts]
entries.smitty:124: [matter-of-factly] I already fixed the parts. You need to give them to Miles now.
entries.smitty:125: [with friendly pride] Thanks for fixin' the farms. If you ever find yourself a plasma rifle, bring it on back here. I know a few tricks that I can pull with the injectors.
entries.smitty:127: [with enthusiasm] So you found yourself a plasma rifle!
entries.smitty:128: [eagerly] Hand it over and I'll take a look at it. [taking the rifle and settling in to work]
entries.smitty:129: [satisfied] There, I think that does it. [handing back the rifle] Try that out for size.
entries.smitty:130: [helpfully] Like I said before, if you get yourself a plasma rifle and bring it back here, I can tweak it some for you.
entries.sophia:301: [with false politeness, slightly annoyed] Greetings. I have not seen you here before, are you lost? May I be of service?
entries.sophia:307: [exasperated, muttering] I can't believe the kind of people we accept as initiates these days. God help us.
entries.sophia:308: [speaking down to you, matter-of-factly] This is the library. Here we keep records of all technical data on weaponry and technology, and, of course, the history of the Brotherhood.
entries.sophia:314: [dismissively] I am Vree's assistant. Vree is over there.
entries.sophia:317: [with barely concealed irritation] My area of expertise is the history of the Brotherhood. It sounds like a manufacturing problem, perhaps you should ask Vree?
entries.sophia:322: [coldly, with forced politeness] You must speak with Vree, the head scribe, about that. I have more important things to do.
entries.sophia:326: [speaking slowly, as if to someone unintelligent] We have many holo-disks here in the library. They are divided between history, technology and weapon design.
entries.sophia:331: [sighing with frustration] My area of specialty is the Brotherhood's history. It seems that some people around here have forgotten the importance of our history.
entries.sophia:336: [with pointed sarcasm] Like keeping the history of the Brotherhood. It seems some people around here have forgotten just how important our history is.
entries.sophia:337: [huffing indignantly, then speaking with academic superiority] Vree seems to think that the research of new weaponry and the information gathered from Mutant autopsies is more important than our history. She has forgotten that our history is a vital part of our lives. It has gotten so bad that many of the new initiates don't even know who Roger Maxson is or what exactly he did for us.
entries.sophia:343: [with a sniff of displeasure] You need to speak with Vree about things of that nature.
entries.sophia:344: [curtly, with a hint of smugness] These are things that only Scribes and Paladins have access to. Vree may be able to help you.
entries.sophia:348: [with conditional approval, then muttering nastily] Well, it's good to see someone interested in our great history. Unlike others around here. Here you go. This is a disk of some of our earliest writings.
entries.sophia:351: [sweetly sarcastic, with a bitter undertone] Our history is available to everyone. So that they may learn of our great history...Not that any one ever looks at them.
entries.sophia:359: [scoffing dismissively] You didn't get far with that did you? Vree is to busy with her "experiments" to care about history any more.
entries.sophia:364: [with strained politeness, nasally] How can I help you?
entries.sophia:374: [explaining slowly and condescendingly] I gave you the disk with some of our early writings on it. Just load it up into your PIPBoy 2000 and you will be able to read it.
entries.sophia:377: [coldly hostile] I don't like your attitude, and I choose not to talk to you.
entries.sophia:380: [with thinly veiled disdain] I accept your apology. Now how can I help you?
entries.ssguide:101: [with a forced smile] I am unarmed, please put your weapon away.
entries.ssguide:107: [patiently] Normally, I would agree with you. It is very dangerous to travel unarmed. [more gently] But this is Shady Sands, and we are a peaceful people. There is no need for weapons here.
entries.ssguide:109: [firmly, with an edge] If you don't put your weapon away, I will not talk with you. [matter-of-factly] There are many people like me. You should only use force if the situation calls for it.
entries.ssguide:111: [warmly welcoming] Welcome to Shady Sands, traveler. [with practiced charm] My name is Katrina. My job is to greet strangers and help them understand our village. [pointedly] We find that there are fewer problems if you listen to what I have to say.
entries.ssguide:119: [with barely concealed exasperation] It is a pity that you are dimwitted. [sighing] We will have difficultly understanding each other. [with reluctant hope] I hope the others in your Vault are not like you.
entries.ssguide:121: [knowingly] Yes, I can tell you are from a Vault. You have that look about you. [more gently] I came from Vault-15, to the east. [sadly] But I had to leave my home and now I live here. [with measured kindness] Hopefully you will find what you are looking for, even if it is just another place to live. [with a slight edge] I hope that your Vault did not kick you out due to your wits. [softly] I do hope there is another reason.
entries.ssguide:123: [with patient resignation] You will need to find another way to get your answers, as you cannot communicate well enough. [earnestly] I hope that you do not hurt too many people in your journey. [warmly but firmly] Please be nice to the people here, we mean you no harm.
entries.ssguide:144: [with genuine warmth] Hello again. [friendly] I hope you are doing well. [helpfully] Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.ssguide:146: [lightly amused] Well, I take catnaps when you are not around. [contentedly] Besides, I find the desert air very invigorating and healthy. And I never tire of looking at the stars. [wistfully] Can you imagine never seeing the night sky for your entire life? [with gentle irony, pausing] Oh, I guess you can.
entries.staple:102: [warmly welcoming] Hi, Welcome to the Library. I don't think I have seen you around these parts before. What might you be looking for in the way of knowledge?
entries.staple:103: [pleasantly] Good to see you again. What might you be looking for today?
entries.staple:107: [helpfully] Well, let me show you my selection.
entries.staple:108: [informatively] Well, in my studies I have come across some references to such things. Actually I have in my possession a Holodisk that contains a certain amount of information that you might find useful.
entries.staple:111: [patiently explaining] A Holodisk contains information on it, but it can only be read by a certain number of electronic devices. I see that you have a PIP Boy. You can use that to decode, review, and store the information that a Holodisk contains.
entries.staple:113: [matter-of-factly] Information is hard to come by in this day and age. I will need to charge you 750 Hub Bucks for the disk.
entries.staple:118: [apologetically firm] I am sorry but I can only accept the full amount for the Holodisk. Please return when you have that amount.
entries.staple:119: [sternly disapproving] I am sorry, but you wil need to keep your pyromaniacal tendencies to yourself. Please leave.
entries.staple:131: [briskly businesslike] Yes, I've heard from Miles and I have the ones he's looking for. They will cost you 750 bucks.
entries.staple:132: [warmly cordial] Here you are, sir. Say hello to Miles for me.
entries.staple:133: [apologetically] I'm sorry, but you don't have enough money. Please return when you have the money.
entries.staple:126: I'm sorry, I don't understand you.  Somewhere I have a Holodisk on learning the English language, if you're interested.
entries.super:101: [with a gravelly growl, sounding official] You're on Unity soil. I'd better take you in.
entries.talus:106: [professionally] That would be the council of elders. More specifically, the High Elder, Maxson. The elders make all the major decisions around here. If you need to speak with them, you'll find them on the fourth floor.
entries.talus:108: [matter-of-factly] No, we are directed by the council of elders. Maxson, the High Elder, would be the person in charge. If you need to speak with him, you'll find him on the fourth floor.
entries.talus:110: [with commanding pride] I'm the Senior Paladin, Rhombus's right-hand man. We're in charge of the Paladins and Knights. Right now I'm supervising training exercises. We're getting ready . . . for anything.
entries.talus:113: [seriously] There are rumors of a large force moving around in the mountains and desert. With the missing caravans and these rumors, we're just playing it safe.
entries.talus:116: [with measured authority] In a hurry, are we? As an Initiate, you are entitled to a few things. I'll put in a clearance for combat armor and three orders for ammunition, bullets of your choice. Just see Michael in the next room for the supplies.
entries.talus:122: [encouragingly] That sounds great. Why don't you start now.
entries.talus:123: [with measured respect] Well, I might be able to make an exception. You obviously have some good training. If you didn't you wouldn't have succeeded in that crazy quest the High Elder sent you on.
entries.talus:124: [with dry humor] Sometimes I don't know if he's trying to get help from the outside, or kill off the stupid. No offense. I'll tell you what. I'm sort of in a tight spot because the scouts I sent out a while back never returned.
entries.talus:125: [with a touch of vulnerability] It was my idea, and I'm sort of taking some heat for it. If you can find out what happened to them, I'll make it worth your while.
entries.talus:127: [sternly] Excuse me, Initiate. Please don't brandish your weapon. Put it away unless you plan on using it.
entries.talus:128: [commandingly] Holster your weapon, Initiate. You're not in a training exercise, put it away.
entries.talus:129: [with exasperated frustration] Would you stop waving your weapon around like that? You should . . . oh, never mind.
entries.talus:137: [helpfully] I can help you with that. As an Initiate, you are entitled to a few things. I'll put in a clearance for combat armor and three orders for ammunition, bullets of your choice.
entries.talus:138: [directing] Just see Michael in the next room for the supplies.
entries.talus:141: [knowingly] Well, we are all important, but I know who you are referring to.
entries.talus:142: [reassuringly] That's not a problem. You should get to know your fellow Brothers well. I know there are a lot of us, and that it can be hard for some to remember us all.
entries.talus:143: [informatively] There's Rhombus. He's our Head Paladin, also known as the Master Knight. Then there's Vree; she's the Master Scribe. And of course we cannot forget our distinguished High Elder, Maxson.
entries.talus:147: [with deep affection] Rhombus is my best friend, mentor, idol, and father figure all combined into one. He's a little rough, but he has to be, to be in the position he's in.
entries.talus:148: [helpfully] If you ever need to talk to him, he is normally in his office . . . I mean room. That's on the other side of this level, across from the guard room.
entries.talus:149: [simply] Of course we do. She's on the second level. Next to the learning room.
entries.talus:152: [with genuine admiration] Vree is one of the most intelligent people I've ever known. I think she was born with the natural understanding of physics and chemistry.
entries.talus:153: [informatively] She spends every waking moment doing research or analyzing and reanalyzing anything she can get her hands on. If you ever need to talk to her, she can normally be found in her room, on the third floor.
entries.talus:154: [directing] She's on the second level. Just go down to the second floor, make a left. You'll see it just past the learning room. I should get back to work. If you have any other questions just ask.
entries.talus:155: [matter-of-factly] As I said, she's on the second level. You can't miss it. It's the only other major room on the second floor besides the learning room.
entries.talus:157: [with respectful pride] Maxson is one tough old man. He's the great, great grandson . . . or was it great, great, great grandson? Well, anyway. He's the descendant of one of our founding fathers. He, of course, is the High Elder.
entries.talus:158: [with measured approval] You've built quite a reputation for yourself. The people I've checked with hold you in high regard. I don't think you need any help, you seem quite capable. However, if you help me with a little problem, I might be able to reward you with something.
entries.talus:161: [irritably] You're getting on my nerves, little one. What do you want now?
entries.talus:167: [coldly commanding] How did you get in here? Get out of my sight.
entries.talus:168: [accommodatingly] I can give you a little more ammunition if you really need it. I'll have it authorized by the time you can talk to Michael.
entries.talus:169: [with slight disapproval] I just gave you some. You should learn to be more conservative with your ammunition.
entries.talus:170: [firmly] Sorry, you've had more than your share for this week. You'll have to make do with what you have. We don't have an endless supply of ammunition.
entries.talus:171: [coldly, with barely restrained anger] I've heard about some of the things you've done and we don't take kindly to child killers. The Elders seem to think that there's something you can offer but I don't want to have anything to do with you.
entries.talus:175: [with controlled approval] You've built quite a reputation for yourself. I don't think you need any help, you seem quite capable. However, there is something I need looking into, and I might be able to help you if you can help me.
entries.talus:179: [with measured respect] Since you were able to survive the wasteland alone, I think you're probably quite capable. However, I do have a problem that I could use some help with and I might be able to reward you for your help.
entries.talus:180: [firmly] No. I think you should leave.
entries.talus:181: [with concern] I sent one of our Initiates out to the Hub a short while back and we haven't heard back from him. If you can find out what happened to him I'd be very grateful.
entries.talus:184: [sharply commanding] I told you to leave.
entries.talus:185: [with finality] Only? I don't think our order will be able to help you. Good day.
entries.talus:186: [dismissively] I don't need to know the whole story. Good day.
entries.talus:187: [warmly] Thank you. I'll remember this and when I've seen that you've gained enough experience I might be able to give you something special from our order.
entries.talus:191: [guardedly] I shouldn't say, but it's not a weapon. It's something that only the elite in our order can have, but since you are from the outside and are in greater need of it, I might be able to make an exception.
entries.talus:194: [knowingly] I think you probably already have an idea. Let's leave it at that.
entries.talus:195: [coldly, with disdain] No, I'm not and I think you should leave, 'initiate'.
entries.talus:196: [with measured authority] Only Paladins wear Power Armor, someday you may earn the right to wear it.
entries.talus:198: [with a sardonic chuckle, leaning back] Well I see we have a bright new addition to our order after all... Don't get cocky with me, Initiate. [sternly] I'm not in the mood nor have I the patience!
entries.talus:199: [with sharp disapproval] I thought you were smarter than that. I don't have to give you anything. You're lucky I don't kick you out of here, right now. I think you should leave, before I change my mind.
entries.talus:200: [reassuringly] That's okay. Anything you might find would be helpful.
entries.talus:207: [warmly, with genuine relief] Hello stranger! I heard you're the one to thank for the safe return of my missing Initiate.
entries.talus:209: [with stern disapproval] We don't tolerate chem users around here. I suggest you see the doctor and clean yourself up.
entries.talus:210: [matter-of-factly] As for your reward, I'll give you the choice of one of the following:
entries.talus:216: [efficiently] I'll key your authorization in right now. Go pick it up from Michael.
entries.talus:218: [with slight disappointment, but accepting] I see someone else already gave you your Power Suit. I was hoping to give it to you myself, but that's all right. I hope it helps you in your quest.
entries.talus:406: [with cautious skepticism] Hmmm, I don't know. You may have proven yourself to be an initiate but that doesn't mean we start handing over weapons to someone that might not be qualified, especially an outsider, no offense.
entries.talus:101: Hello, you must be the outsider initiate. Nice to meet you. What can I do for you?
entries.taylor:102: [with friendly curiosity] We don't get many strangers around here. What do you want?
entries.taylor:103: [brightly, with enthusiasm] Hello, stranger! What can I do for you today?
entries.taylor:111: [speaking quickly and matter-of-factly] I do some trading with them from time to time. Mostly I sell bullets in exchange for food.
entries.taylor:112: [with a warm, welcoming tone] I'm Tine. You have some business to conduct?
entries.taylor:113: [cheerfully] Pleasure to meet you. I'm Tine.
entries.taylor:114: [with genuine warmth] Great doin' business with you. Come again.
entries.taylor:118: [with peppy enthusiasm] Hello again! What can I help you with?
entries.taylor:119: [speaking openly, with a knowing smile] It's a good town. Might be a little happier if the Regulators didn't keep such a tight grip on things. But hey, that's their style.
entries.taylor:120: [conversationally upbeat] Ain't a bad little town. Zimmerman's a fair man, maybe not the brightest guy. And of course we've got Miles, probably the only man in a hundred miles who knows anything about science.
entries.tguard:105: [cautiously] Welcome, stranger. We don't see your kind often.
entries.tguard:109: [suspiciously] Not so fast! This is a small community. We don't see strangers often, and we don't really need them if you get my meaning. If you don't have a good reason to be here, you'd better just keep moving.
entries.tguard:112: [defensively] I wasn't saying that you was gonna. You'd just better leave us alone.
entries.tguard:115: [with a warning drawl] Look, Shady Sands don't need your kind from the Hub, or Junktown, or wherever you come from. We do pretty good by ourselves.
entries.tguard:116: [bitterly] The last trader from the Hub sold us a malfunctioning irrigation pump. [grudgingly] We've had it with your dirty deals.
entries.tguard:118: [skeptically, with a drawn-out] Yeah, right. So you say. Just don't get into any trouble, Ok?
entries.tguard:121: [cautiously reconsidering] Well, maybe you aren't. You do seem a little different to me. [with resigned acceptance] I'll tell you what. You should go talk to Aradesh. He is in the center of town.
entries.theresa:106: [passionately] It's good to hear that. I knew that the outside world couldn't be as bad as everyone says. I mean, our ancestors lived outside, right? [exasperated] But that paranoid Overseer won't let us leave.
entries.theresa:111: [sympathetically] Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. [hopefully] I hope that you're able to find the chip soon.
entries.theresa:114: [scoffing] Hmm. I suppose it was too much to hope that the outside world had taught you to communicate. [dismissively] Oh well.
entries.theresa:115: [angrily] And I suppose he chose you to go outside because he knew that you were under his thumb! [with heated conviction] He really just doesn't want to give up his control over us.
entries.theresa:118: [sarcastically] Hmm. From what I've read, the outside isn't really all that dangerous. [condescendingly] But I suppose that you would know better than I, wouldn't you?
entries.theresa:119: [passionately] I knew that the outside couldn't be too bad. [determined] That's why I've been trying to convince some people to come outside with me. I think that we have a better chance of survival out there.
entries.theresa:122: [thoughtfully] I suppose. I always figured that he just had some sort of power trip. [reluctantly] But I guess that he wouldn't be the Overseer if he wasn't really concerned about our welfare, would he? [with resignation] I guess we should just wait and see if you can find the chip.
entries.theresa:124: [shouting] Oh, come on! Wake up! [angrily] If he thinks the outside is so dangerous, then how come he sent you out there? [contemptuously] The man just has a control complex. You're a stupid tool and you don't even know it!
entries.theresa:125: [sarcastically] Honestly, if he thought that the outside was that dangerous, he'd have sent a whole team with weapons and equipment, not just you. [with bitter insight] But you're his pawn, since he doesn't want anyone to realize what they're missing.
entries.theresa:126: [exasperatedly] Oh, get real! [challengingly] Do you really think that we can live in this Vault generation after generation? Maybe you can find a new chip, but what happens when the next thing breaks down? [with mounting frustration] And the next?
entries.theresa:129: [matter-of-factly] A lot of us think so. [determined] That's why we're planning to take some supplies and head out in a few days. [hopefully] Say, do you have any advice for us?
entries.theresa:133: [angrily, dismissively] Oh, just go away! We don't need the help of one of the Overseer's pawns!
entries.theresa:134: [formally, welcoming] Welcome to our meeting! As you have been picked by the Overseer to go outside, perhaps you can give us some advice before our move to the outdoors as well.
entries.theresa:139: [sarcastically, cutting] Thank you so much. I can see you're going to be a big help. [coldly] Why don't you just leave?
entries.theresa:142: [pointedly] Really? Considering our position, our lack of water, and the original purpose of this Vault, why do you think that we should stay?
entries.theresa:145: [with cautious interest] Well, considering that you have some experience with the outside, perhaps you have some valuable points to make.
entries.theresa:148: [firmly] If you can't give us good reasons why we shouldn't leave, then we're not going to wait here and die of water poisoning. [warningly] Please don't get in our way.
entries.theresa:151: [urgently] It's only a matter of time before we run out of water here. [defiant] But the Vault was never meant to keep people inside forever! We have the people and the supplies to move outside now. [passionately] We have a better chance.
entries.theresa:154: [thoughtfully] Hmm. Perhaps you're right. There are probably other survivors out there, and they could be hostile, too. [reluctantly accepting] I guess we will need to wait for everyone else to be ready.
entries.theresa:155: [confidently] We're well-prepared now. We have equipment and simulator training. [determinedly] A few hazards outside are better than dying slowly of thirst!
entries.theresa:158: [grudgingly] I don't like it, but I suppose we will wait until everyone is ready to leave together.
entries.theresa:170: [urgently, pleadingly] Please hurry and find the water chip. We cannot wait much longer.
entries.theresa:172: [gratefully, with warmth] I didn't think you would succeed, but you did a good job. Thank you for saving us all.
entries.theresa:175: [coldly, with finality] We've been over this before. Leave us alone.
entries.thomas2:101: [warmly, with a slight yawn] Why, hello there. You must be the new Initiate Talus told me about. It's awfully late for a social call, what can I do for you?
entries.thomas2:108: [groggily] What could you possibly want at this hour?
entries.thomas2:109: [muttering irritably] I don't have time for this.
entries.thomas2:110: [exasperated] What? Do I look like requisition man? If you don't even know who I am, why are you bothering me? [more gently] Please leave!
entries.thomas2:113: [tiredly dismissive] Well, why are you bothering me about it? Michael's probably asleep right now, unless Talus has him on sentry duty. Check at the supply room in the morning.
entries.thomas2:114: [softening, with a warm sigh] Well, the Elders said no new initiate training but...sure. You seem like a nice young lad. I'd hate for something to happen to you out there, when I might have been able to help. What are you looking to train in?
entries.thomas2:115: [softening, with a warm sigh] Well, the Elders said no new initiate training but...sure. You seem like a nice young lady. I'd hate for something to happen to you out there, when I might have been able to help. What are you looking to train in?
entries.thomas2:125: [gruffly but good-natured] Why I ought to throw you right out of my room, but I'm a nice old man. The Elders said no new initiate training but...I might be able to help. They probably didn't have you in mind when they said that. What are you looking to train in?
entries.thomas2:126: [with genuine warmth and a chuckle] Why hello again. Nice to see you. Don't be shy, I don't sleep very much anymore. Are you looking for some more training? What shall it be today...I mean tonight.
entries.thomas2:127: [with an affectionate, raspy laugh] I knew you would be back! What're you in the mood for tonight?
entries.thomas2:138: [kindly, with a slight drawl] No problem. Let me know if you change your mind.
entries.thomas2:139: [muttering wearily] I don't know why I'm wasting my time with you.
entries.thomas2:140: [settling in patiently] Yes? Oh, I suppose you're looking for more training. Well, I don't sleep much anymore anyhow, why not. What shall it be?
entries.thomas2:142: [warmly reassuring] Oh, that's all right. As I said, I hardly ever sleep. Come back anytime.
entries.thomas2:143: [with mock-gruff exasperation] Well, stop pestering me then. I'm an old man and I need my beauty sleep.
entries.thorndyk:103: [dismissively, clipped] Sir, I am a healer. You have no need for my services.
entries.thorndyk:104: [dismissively, clipped] Madam, I am a healer. You have no need for my services.
entries.thorndyk:111: [primly] Sir, I have already given you medication. I dare not administer a second dose now.
entries.thorndyk:112: [primly] Madam, I have already given you medication. I dare not administer a second dose now.
entries.thorndyk:119: [curtly professional] Sir, you are injured. I can treat you if you wish. I am a healer.
entries.thorndyk:120: [curtly professional] Madam, you are injured. I can treat you if you wish. I am a healer.
entries.thorndyk:129: [with authoritative insistence] Sir, you are seriously injured. I strongly recommend that you permit me to treat you. I am a healer.
entries.thorndyk:130: [with authoritative insistence] Madam, you are seriously injured. I strongly recommend that you permit me to treat you. I am a healer.
entries.thorndyk:138: [with nasal precision] The Holy Flame commands that I heal people. Its wisdom is incontrovertible, so I obey. [more confidently] I have already learned much about the world beyond the Cathedral.
entries.thorndyk:144: [impatiently] Sir, forgive me, but I have no patience for long conversation. There are other people who may instruct you better than I. Please, excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:145: [impatiently] Madam, forgive me, but I have no patience for long conversation. There are other people who may instruct you better than I. Please, excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:146: [matter-of-factly] For me, sir, it is a place to practice the gift of healing. For others, it is a place where stray souls may be gathered and put on a productive path. [impatiently] Forgive me, but I have no patience for long conversation. There are other people who may instruct you better than I. Please excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:147: [matter-of-factly] For me, madam, it is a place to practice the gift of healing. For others, it is a place where stray souls may be gathered and put on a productive path. [impatiently] Forgive me, but I have no patience for long conversation. There are other people who may instruct you better than I. Please excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:148: [with weary condescension] There were a few wise ones among the ancients who believed virtue is its own reward. That is my belief as well. Perhaps if more people shared this opinion, there would have been no need for the Holy Flame… [impatiently] Forgive me, but I have no patience for long conversation. There are other people who may instruct you better than I. Please excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:149: [with formal coldness] Farewell. Should you need me, I will be here. [dryly] I do hope that you will never need to meet me again.
entries.thorndyk:150: [sharply] This is a service, not a business. And your talent is not one which I would brag about. Now please excuse me.
entries.thorndyk:151: [with patronizing pity] Alas, your injuries may be beyond my ability to cure. It is said that the Holy Flame can guide those who are cursed with idiocy and lead them to redemption; I shall pray for you.
entries.thorndyk:152: [with urgent exasperation] You are injured. Save the casual conversation for later… Please let me heal you…
entries.thorndyk:159: [briskly, matter-of-fact] I am a healer, not a moneylender. The Cathedral sees to my needs, so I might see to the needs of others. Now, let me see to your injury, shall we?
entries.thorndyk:165: [dismissively] Your choice. I will be here if you change your mind.
entries.thorndyk:166: [smiling warmly] Terrible people. I sympathize entirely. [smile fading to coldness] I will be here if you change your mind. You are excused.
entries.thorndyk:167: [nervously, quickly] I'll take that as a yes. Please don't kill me . . .
entries.thorndyk:170: [exasperatedly] I'll take that as a "no". You are excus... uh… [shouting impatiently] You go now. Go!
entries.thorndyk:171: [with droning recitation] It's a very beautiful place, although a little overcrowded these days. It's far to the south of us. We faithful gather to praise our master, the Holy Flame, and to pray for peace and Unity. [curtly] Now, if that will be all…
entries.thorndyk:176: [with bitter certainty] I have learned we are a spiteful, violent and stupid species, unworthy of the Holy Flame. I have seen greed and evil everywhere. And unless we do something drastic, we shall be burned by Holy Flame again…
entries.thorndyk:182: [dismissively] It is indeed, but there are others here who can expound on its glories far more eloquently than I. Good-bye.
entries.thorndyk:183: [snappily, through gritted teeth] You are breaking my concentration! Do you wish to be healed or not?
entries.thorndyk:189: [with fatalistic gravity] Peace is, as ever, forged by war and hardship, as is unity. Alas, my gifts will be needed in the days to come.
entries.thorndyk:194: [with pedantic conviction] The old world was filled with evil and decadence. The Holy Flame destroyed it. We can either fear the Holy Flame, or worship it and attempt to understand it. The Children have chosen understanding. Although we do not wish to see the Holy Flame unleashed again.
entries.thorndyk:200: [coldly menacing] When I ask someone to do something, I do not expect to be ignored. If you choose to ignore my wishes, I can ignore your injuries. Good-bye.
entries.thorndyk:201: [furiously] Who the Hell do you think you are? Get out of my sight, you little thug!
entries.thorndyk:202: [sharply dismissive] You've pried enough information from me for one day. Good bye, sir.
entries.thorndyk:203: [sharply dismissive] You've pried enough information from me for one day. Good bye, madam.
entries.thorndyk:204: [with professorial authority] The Holy Flame is a metaphor for the death of the old world and the beginning of the new. It is the power of life and death. What is more worthy of worship than that?
entries.thorndyk:210: [wearily] This debate has become tiresome. Please leave me.
entries.thsupmut:110: [with gravelly authority] Welcome Oh Punt One. You are just in time to help us.
entries.thsupmut:115: [dismissively patient] No matter simple one. Come with me, and I shall take you to the job.
entries.thsupmut:116: [coldly commanding] That was not a request. Your presence will be made.
entries.thsupmut:117: [with scholarly curiosity] Are you not the one who seeks to bring peace to the wastelands?
entries.thsupmut:120: [speaking as if to a child] We believe that if everyone, mutants and humans, could learn to work together, then a great many problems could be resolved.
entries.thsupmut:124: [with condescending superiority] Everything is perfectly fine. Perhaps it is the limited scope of your cranium which deters your advancement in thought.
entries.thsupmut:127: [with dark amusement] If that is your desire, then you shall have your fill.
entries.thsupmut:128: [growling with satisfaction] Welcome back. You shall now assist us.
entries.tolya:101: [with a cocky sneer] Hello, I am Tolya. Looks like you just wandered in from the desert. Who are you?
entries.tolya:106: [drawling, matter-of-factly] As a raider, I explore the lands in search of new supplies. There have been some towns which have been graced by our presence.
entries.tolya:110: [fast-talking, cajolingly] Come now, Garl tells me never to talk to strangers. You should at least be willing to tell me your name.
entries.tolya:114: [dismissively, with a raspy snarl] Go away, moron.
entries.tolya:115: [defensively, slick] We never steal. We just take the extra that others have and redistribute it among our hungry people.
entries.tolya:118: [proudly, with a southwestern drawl] I've been to many places in the wastelands. The closest places that I've been to are Shady Sands and Junktown. They are very grateful for the trips we make to them.
entries.tolya:121: [coldly, growling] You are starting to become annoying now. I think I will end that slight problem.
entries.tolya:122: [menacingly] We are the Khan, and our leader is Garl. We are the most feared group in the wasteland, and with good reason. We take what we want, and those who get in our way pay the price.
entries.tolya:123: [with a weaselly chuckle] Yes, we go to Shady Sands from time to time. It adds a little excitement to the lives of everyone concerned.
entries.tolya:125: [helpfully, with cocky charm] Why, Junktown is just a little bit to the south of here. Go a few miles, turn right at the dying cactus. You can't miss it!
entries.tolya:127: [irritably, muttering] Do not bother me right now. I am preparing for the next raid.
entries.trent:101: [nervously, speaking fast] Hello stranger. You shouldn't be out here. There's only death out here!
entries.trent:109: [frantically] What do you want! Leave me alone!
entries.trent:111: [breathlessly, voice rising] Big! Big! The size of three men! [panicking] Claws as long as my forearm! Ripped apart! Ripped apart!
entries.trent:116: [trembling] I'm Trent. I'm a guard for the Water Merchants. Our caravan was attacked . . . by a monster! [voice shaking] So huge, so fast. It ate Joe, and took rifle shots and didn't flinch! So huge!
entries.trent:121: [flatly exhausted] Fine. It's not like I need 'em any more.
entries.trent:122: [defensively, rambling] Water chip! I'm a guard, not an engineer! Check with the water merchants at the Hub, they'd probably know!
entries.trent:124: [pleading desperately] What are you doing? Leave me alone!
entries.trent:125: [voice cracking with exhaustion] I . . . I don't know. I haven't slept in so long. Hungry. Thirsty. Tired. I need to get home.
entries.trent:127: [breathless horror] Huge horns, sick red skin, like something out of a story about demons, and it ate Joe in three gulps . . .
entries.trent:128: [voice spiraling into panic] Nobody's safe! Nobody's safe, nobody's safe any more, and what am I going to do . . .
entries.trent:129: [voice squeaking with distress] Are you crazy! I put three rounds from my Desert Eagle into it, and it didn't even flinch!
entries.trent:130: [with desperate finality] I don't care if it's a mutant, an alien, or a demon from Hell, I never want to see another one of those things as long as I live!
entries.trent:131: [defensively, voice cracking] I'm just a guard, dammit! Don't blame me! And they pay me well! I don't have any problems with them!
entries.trent:132: [weakly, almost hollow] How can I help you?
entries.trent:133: [voice trembling through the memory] Death Claws got 'em. I just thought they were stories, but . . . [voice rising] you wouldn't believe how big they are, or how fast. [urgently] First we smelled them, then they came over the ridge and tore into us. We all ran, and somehow I got away.
entries.trent:134: [speaking rapidly, almost rambling] Trent, Trent Barrister. I live in the Hub. Lately work's been getting scarce, and I'm a pretty good shot, so I hired myself as a guard to the Water Merchants. Pay's good, the risk's low - or so I thought.
entries.trent:135: [uncertainly, exhausted] I haven't a clue. That's old tech, ain't it? [muttering] I suppose scavengers might find one, now and a gain, but I wouldn't begin to know where to look. No one uses them any more - do they?
entries.trent:136: [voice shaking with dread] They're huge. Like big lizards, but leathery. Huge claws, and teeth, huge horns and they love the taste of humans. [voice cracking] And fast, God they're fast. I'm just glad they decided not to chase me, or I'd be dead.
entries.trent:142: [whispering haunted] The smell of death, my friend. The smell of death . . .
entries.trent:143: [whispering haunted] The smell of death, my friend. The smell of death . . .
entries.troy:101: [with commanding authority] Congratulations, human. You've been selected to join an elite band of worshippers. Follow me.
entries.troy:108: [growling impatiently] Follow me and you will find out. Or, to put it another way, follow me and live, fool!
entries.troy:114: [threateningly] You should not play games with Lady Jain or the Children.
entries.troy:115: [with menacing calm] You should not insult what you cannot kill. Now, shall you come with me and live, or do you wish to stay here and die?
entries.troy:120: [shouting angrily] You stupid beast! Will you come or will you stay?
entries.troy:123: [growling, irritated] Do not plague me with indecision! What is your answer, human?
entries.troy:127: [with wrathful intensity] Insolent dog! You will die now!
entries.troy:128: [muttering darkly] Do not plague me with your jests! What is your answer, human?
entries.tycho:102: [with measured curiosity] Another new face. Travelers here are a dime a dozen. But you have the look of someone different. Care to join me for a drink?
entries.tycho:106: [dryly] Delightful. I hope you don't mind your drink well-watered - they treat beer here like it's a potted plant.
entries.tycho:108: [with a slight chuckle] Yeah, a drink of water. Never mind.
entries.tycho:109: [settling in] I could ask the same of you. In the interest of amity, I suppose I'll tell first. I'm called Tycho. Came from out east, what used to be called Nevada.
entries.tycho:112: [calmly reflective] Yeah, it was. Decided to take it easy for a while. This place shows some promise, just as soon as someone cleans up some of the scum.
entries.tycho:115: [with quiet pride] Had some pretty good training, and some good weapons, too. My grandfather was a Ranger way back when, and he taught my father everything he knew. Dad passed it on to me. So I know enough not to drink glowing water, so to speak.
entries.tycho:118: [measured and careful] Not my place. I'd rather not cross Killian, after all. He'll clean up this town when he gets around to it. A good man, mark my words. But watch out for that fellow Gizmo. Reminds me of another fat freak my father told me about back in Las Vegas.
entries.tycho:120: [matter-of-factly] There's two grades of scum here. One of 'em's the Skulz, a gang that hangs out in back of Marcelles' crash house. They're just grade-B twerps. But the other ones answer to a fat freak whose name you can probably guess. Runs the casino. Those guys are organized and dangerous.
entries.tycho:122: [instructionally] Yeah, well, my family taught me everything there is to know about survival. Don't drink water that's totally clear and free of insects and moss, for instance. Only poisonous or radioactive water would be that clean in the wilderness. Lots of other little things to look out for, too.
entries.tycho:124: [offering readily] Well, if you've got some time, I could go over some pointers.
entries.tycho:127: [with a slight edge] Whoa, not so fast. We never finished introductions, remember? What's your name, stranger?
entries.tycho:131: [with a respectful nod] Good to meet you. Step carefully, friend.
entries.tycho:132: [calmly firm] Now, now, no need to get impolite. But with that attitude you'd best be on your way.
entries.tycho:139: [with level courtesy] Hello again. How can I help you?
entries.tycho:141: [leaning in, informatively] Well, this is the Skum Pitt, a wretched hive of villainy and all that. Just west of here is Gizmo's, a big casino. Word is the games are rigged. A little south of here is the Crash House, run by Marcelles, where you can get a night's sleep for way too many caps. Past that is Killian's. Killian runs a general store, and he also enforces the law in this town - a good man. Then south of there you have Doc Morbid, whose operation is a little funny, if you take my meaning.
entries.tycho:142: [with understated warmth] I hope that my little instruction course helped a bit.
entries.tycho:144: [with a note of concern] Word out is that you've been having some contacts with Gizmo. I'd step carefully around that barrel of lard if I were you.
entries.tycho:147: [gravely] Fair enough. But watch your back. Gizmo isn't known for his consideration for his employees.
entries.tycho:148: [with cold disapproval] Suffice to say that your employer has caused more than enough misery and strife in this town. Don't expect much help from anyone, least of all Gizmo. Too bad. You might've been able to change this town for the better.
entries.tycho:149: [matter-of-factly] What can I do for you?
entries.tycho:152: [with urgent gravity] Yeah, I'd stay the hell away from whatever made that. Seriously, I've never seen anything like that. I think our best option is to move on, fast.
entries.tycho:153: [with quiet respect] Very well. I must say that it has been an honor and a pleasure.
entries.tycho:154: [warning seriously] Watch out for radioactive hot spots. This place obviously sustained a direct nuclear strike, and secondary cascade radiation may be bad. I'd recommend avoiding this place completely if we can.
entries.tycho:155: [with ominous awareness] Note the lack of any animal life for quite a distance. And the piles of bones. Whatever lives here is a real beast. Keep your weapon handy.
entries.tycho:156: [thinking aloud] A military place like this must have a central command room somewhere.
entries.tycho:157: [with tactical assessment] I bet we could get through those force-field generators with a little hot-wiring, or if we could find the force field control computer.
entries.tycho:158: [cautiously grave] There are many strange tales about Necropolis, the city of the dead. Stay alert, because it could get dangerous really fast.
entries.tycho:160: [matter-of-factly] What distance do you want me at?
entries.tycho:165: [with practical confidence] Pretty good ranger training: I can use a spear, of course, in a pinch; I'm also skilled with small pistols and rifles.
entries.tycho:168: [finally, with determination] Well it's about time. Lead on, my friend, and let's do some street sweeping. I'd recommend knocking over Gizmo, if I may.
entries.tycho:169: [finally, with determination] Well it's about time. Lead on, my friend, and let's do some street sweeping. I'd recommend knocking over Gizmo, if I may.
entries.tylier:101: [in a cold, mechanical monotone] This terminal, 'Tylier', controls Special Forces Operations. Please present voice authorization.
entries.tylier:108: [with flat robotic precision] Voice not recognized. Security systems status: armed.
entries.tylier:109: [mechanically] I am the security system for Blue Level. All systems armed.
