entries.tylier:113: [in a lifeless, programmed cadence] I have been programmed to keep the systems armed until authorized personnel have entered the correct voice code.
entries.tylier:117: [with absolute finality] You are not authorized. Access denied.
entries.tylier:118: [in a matter-of-fact electronic tone] Invalid code. Access denied.
entries.tylier:124: [with robotic efficiency] Voice override confirmed. Disarming security systems.
entries.tylier:125: [speaking with emotionless precision] I have not received orders to do otherwise. Network access is unavailable; central processor ZAX has apparently been destroyed.
entries.tylier:128: [in a perfectly neutral monotone] Security systems are currently disarmed.
entries.uthern:101: [with growling disdain] Normie! How dare you enter the confines of your betters?
entries.uthern:107: [coldly, with menacing precision] It's a wonder your race survived as long as it has. I will start with you in the cleansing.
entries.uthern:108: [dismissively, through a gravelly rumble] You only prove my point by using inane comments as such. I personally would not wish you in my sight, but my master would have words with you.
entries.uthern:113: [scoffing, with brutish contempt] Are you claiming that talk will solve nothing? You are more foolish than I thought.
entries.uthern:117: [with intrigued menace] I begin to think you may have a bit of superior blood in you yet. Let me find out for certain.
entries.uthern:118: [coldly authoritative] He does indeed, for death shall be your saving grace.
entries.uthern:119: [with arrogant precision] The simplest of proofs for you. I am smarter, stronger, and quicker than you are. Would you care for a test of my skills?
entries.uthern:123: [with calculated curiosity] Good. Would you like a chance at gaining greater powers?
entries.uthern:128: [with a growling finality] Then i will take you to my master.
entries.uthern:129: [dismissively, with dark amusement] It almost seems a pity. No matter, this won't take long.
entries.uthern:130: [with contemptuous mockery] Offered all the power in the world and still frightened. I will help you with your decision.
entries.uthern:131: [with rising fury, through gritted teeth] Comments such as those only prove how much more intelligent i am than you. Now, you shall pay for your insolence!
entries.uthern:135: [with impatient menace] What? I think I can generalize this much -- you are coming with me now.
entries.valtcupl:101: [whining, making excuses] We didn't think that you were coming back. You have such a nice room, and we were a little crowded with her parents. I hope you don't mind.
entries.valtcupl:106: [passive-aggressively] Look, I don't want to argue with you, but you obviously don't deserve this room anymore. Please leave.
entries.valtcupl:107: [wheedling] Look, we could really use the space. I hope you will reconsider.
entries.valtcupl:110: [falsely cheerful] Thanks! We really appreciate it. We put your stuff in the trunk.
entries.valtcupl:111: [defensive, nasal whine] Well, I don't know. You don't seem to be using it very often, and we sure could use the space.
entries.valtcupl:114: [dismissively, with feigned innocence] Gee, I didn't think you would still care about this place from what I've heard. You have a good day. We'll go back to her mothers' place.
entries.valtcupl:116: [coldly authoritative] You should leave. This isn't your place here anymore.
entries.vance:101: [gruffly] What can I do for you?
entries.vance:107: [with blunt authority] The name's Vance, and that's all you need to know. Can I get you anything?
entries.vance:112: [coldly dismissive] If you don't already know, you shouldn't be here. Now leave.
entries.vance:115: [shouting, irritated] Nevermind is right! Now get out of here!
entries.vance:118: [appraising nod] You seem OK. Here's what I've got.
entries.vance:120: [gruffly] What can I do for you?
entries.vance:127: [flatly unsympathetic] Sorry to hear that. Now leave.
entries.vance:130: [matter-of-fact] That's Justin and Chad. They're here to make sure nobody causes any trouble.
entries.vance:134: [warningly gruff] Just some friends of mine. That's all you need to know. Don't ask too many questions.
entries.vance:138: [getting down to business] Let's get down to business.
entries.vance:141: [firmly, raising voice] You're not welcome here. Now get outta' here!
entries.vance:145: [threateningly calm] I don't want any trouble, so I think it would be best if you leave before I do something you'll regret.
entries.vance:150: [with a sardonic grunt] Don't use it all in one place.
entries.vasquez:105: [coldly] I do not work for the weak of mind. You leave now.
entries.vasquez:106: [laughing with theatrical flair] You have not heard of me? I am hurt! [proudly] My name is Vasquez Villanova Hernandez Ortega. I am a famous desperado, my friend. [with charming swagger] And, if you have need, I am a gun for hire.
entries.vasquez:109: [with smooth approval] Ahh, straight to the point, my friend. Excellent. [confidently] I will help you around town for a measly $500 a week. [with cocky assurance] My services are not cheap, but then again, I am worth it.
entries.vasquez:112: [with a smirk] I am sorry, my friend, but I do not work for imaginary money. [firmly] I need cold, hard cash.
entries.vasquez:113: [eagerly] Excellent. I am yours. [with swagger] Let us go, this place bores me.
entries.vasquez:119: [warmly, with a knowing smirk] Ah, my friend. It is good to see you again.
entries.vasquez:123: [coolly dismissive] Well, maybe it is not so good to see you again. Have a good day.
entries.vasquez:124: [with cocky charm] Of course you do. [matter-of-factly] My bill is small, and my worth is so large. $500, please.
entries.vconcomp:127: [with cold finality] Invalid command. End input session.
entries.vconcomp:139: [mechanical and curt] Unexpected end of line. Bad data encountered. Command?
entries.vconcomp:141: [in flat monotone] Uplink successful. What is your command?
entries.vconcomp:143: [reading data in mechanical monotone] Current status on patients as follows: FEV batch #23872-A consists of four male units and two female units. All individuals suffering from FEV exposure. Vital signs are within normal parameters. FEV process on all subjects is approxiamtely 50% complete. Expect full FEV transformation within 12 hours.
entries.vconcomp:151: [mechanical and formal] Please enter authorization code.
entries.vconcomp:157: [in mechanical monotone] Authorization code accepted. Please stand by. Accessing data. Ready to process request.
entries.vconcomp:160: [flatly efficient] Access granted. Which patient file would you like to examine?
entries.vconcomp:165: [reciting data in deadpan] Patient file #23869. Subject: Male. Age 25. Radiation count: 40. FEV exposure: 50%. Original DNA strands remaining: 50%. Vital signs are high but within normal parameters.
entries.vconcomp:167: [reciting data in deadpan] Patient file #23870. Subject: Male. Age 23. Radiation count: 15. FEV exposure: 60%. Original DNA strands remaining: 40%. Vital signs are within normal parameters.
entries.vconcomp:168: [reciting data in deadpan] Patient file #23781. Subject: Female. Age 20. Radiation count: 10. FEV exposure: 55%. Original DNA strands remaining: 45%. Vital signs are within normal parameters.
entries.vconcomp:169: [reciting data in deadpan] Patient file #23782. Subject: Male. Age 26. Radiation count: 35. FEV exposure: 60%. Original DNA strands remaining: 40%. Vital signs are above normal but within acceptable parameters.
entries.vconcomp:170: [in flat mechanical monotone] Are you sure you wish to terminate the life support systems on FEV batch #23872-A?
entries.vconcomp:171: [with cold mechanical finality] FEV batch #23872-A terminated. Command?
entries.vconcomp:174: [mechanically] Are you sure you wish to increase the dosage? Auto-correction will be disabled if you do this.
entries.vconcomp:175: [in a staccato mechanical rhythm] Increasing dosage of original DNA to 100%. WARNING: Auto-correction has been disabled.
entries.vconcomp:176: You manage to get an interface screen out of the vats control computer.
entries.viola:101: [wearily, with resignation] I do not wish to die, sir. I am not a soldier.
entries.viola:102: [wearily, with resignation] I do not wish to die, ma'am. I am not a soldier.
entries.viola:109: [earnestly, with concern] I'm glad you came to talk to me. I heard what you said to Laura. You mustn't do this.
entries.viola:115: [with tired finality] I think we've said all that needs to be said. Good bye.
entries.viola:116: [calmly but firmly] I do not speak to people at the point of a weapon. Lower it, and we may talk.
entries.viola:117: [with polite curiosity] Hello again. I hope you've found this place interesting.
entries.viola:123: [formally] Greetings initiate. How may I be of service to you?
entries.viola:129: [warmly, with practiced charm] Hello, sir. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.viola:130: [warmly, with practiced charm] Hello, miss. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.viola:136: [warmly, with practiced charm] Hello, sir. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.viola:137: [warmly, with practiced charm] Hello, miss. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
entries.viola:143: [coldly dismissive] I know who you are. And you will forgive my rudeness, but I don't speak to psychotic killers. Good-bye.
entries.viola:147: [with quiet conviction] I do not form bonds of loyalty easily. And I do not break them easily either. I will tell you nothing.
entries.viola:148: [matter-of-factly] Good. Then we can leave each other alone and call it even.
entries.viola:149: [with grim acceptance] Praising the Master will not save my life. Go ahead, and do it. I can do nothing to stop you.
entries.viola:150: [helpfully, matter-of-fact] There's a still somewhere away from the Cathedral. They don't permit chems or alcohol around here.
entries.viola:151: [mechanically] Attempt to take the key to the secret entrance from Morpheus and kill the Master.
entries.viola:156: [factually] The spy for the Followers of the Apocalypse who's currently in one of the meditation rooms.
entries.viola:161: [with tired authority] This place isn't about entertainment, it's about enlightenment. More importantly, it's about making the right choices about the destiny of the world. See you around.
entries.viola:162: [sarcastically, deflating] Riight. Sure. Of course. See you later.
entries.viola:163: [wryly] I know. I have a tendency to do that too, when I have nothing original to say. See you later.
entries.viola:164: [with knowing weariness] People who have the spirit of the Holy Flame need no other spirits. Or so they say. You know how that goes_
entries.viola:165: [darkly matter-of-fact] Upstairs. Ask the Nightkin to shed your blood, they'll be more than happy to oblige.
entries.viola:166: [reasoning carefully] Because the Master is a necessary evil. Because somebody has to unite the world, and he's the only one in the area who has a chance to unify it.
entries.viola:172: [with finality and disappointment] Very well, if you won't acknowledge what you said, I won't help you. Good bye.
entries.viola:173: [sighing, explaining wearily] Because you think that it's wrong for the Children to invade our neighbors. Because you think that killing the Master will stop it.
entries.viola:178: [with earnest caution] Have you ever heard of being in over your head? No one, however well-armed or trained, can defeat a half dozen Nightkin. I'm a woman of peace. I'm trying to save you.
entries.viola:179: [passionately, building intensity] Look at the people who caused the Apocalypse! They didn't believe in peace and unity, and look what they did to us! Unity is the only way to prevent this from happening again, and Unity must happen NOW, before the other Vaults around the world have a chance to muster their forces.
entries.viola:184: [with sharp frustration] You've never taken a life? You aren't packing enough firepower to give the Brotherhood of Steel gun envy? Stop being such a hypocrite! You feel it's justified to defend yourself. The Master's defending humanity from another attack of self-destruction. It's all the same!
entries.viola:189: [bleakly] What the Hell kind of world do you think this is? It's a nightmare out there!
entries.viola:194: [with resigned pragmatism] Tough. I don't like radiation and the FEV virus, but I didn't have a choice about it. You can't always get what you want in this world. Sometimes you have to make compromises. And sometimes you have to open your mind to unpleasant ideas.
entries.viola:199: [with zealous persuasion, eyes lighting up] Maybe I'll be so intelligent that when the Master takes power, I'll be able to do something to help. Maybe you will too! Join us! Join us and change the world! Just think about it, that's all I ask!
entries.viola:200: [with measured appeal] There have always been drones in any society. Forget them! We need drones, but we also need soldiers and queens. And you look like a good soldier at least. Consider what you could do, you could be very useful to our cause. Help us. Think about what I've said, that's all I ask!
entries.viola:201: [with urgent conviction] Or maybe we can overwhelm their defenses before they have time to build up again. Maybe we can unite the other Vaults and cities with one swift, clean stroke. A united world won't be perfect, but it will have a better chance of holding itself together. Think about it!
entries.viola:202: [with analytical dismissal] I've looked at the locals. The Brotherhood of Steel and the Children of the Apocalypse just want to be left alone. The Hub thinks they can buy the world - what a pack of fools! Only the Master has the strength to do what must be done. Think about it!
entries.viola:203: [warmly] I'm glad to hear that. I hope you come to the right decision.
entries.viola:204: [with reluctant sincerity] No. It isn't all right. But it's the only option that has a chance of saving us over the long term, which is why I'm with these people. There's no better way! Think about it!
entries.viola:205: [with intensity and warning] Is it? Think about it. Think real hard. If you continue to oppose us, you'll die. You've seen our forces, you know there's more where that came from. A lot more! You can't stop us! But If you join us, you could save lives. Just think about it!
entries.viola:206: [with tactical reasoning] I don't. But if I see someone else I like, I'll be in position to help them. None of the locals have a chance. They're all dead, or converted if they're fortunate. You can be one of the fortunate ones. Join us. Just think about it!
entries.viola:207: [with predictive certainty] The world won't stay like that. It never does. And if all we do is build packs of powerful enclaves, eventually one of them will get powerful enough to start the Apocalypse over again. Join us and unite the world before this happens! Think about it!
entries.viola:208: [with moral urgency] And that's just a cowardly excuse that solves nothing. If life is shitty, we should try to change it. We owe it to ourselves and to our children. Do you think the world will stay the same when we divide ourselves into warring pieces? Think about it!
entries.viola:209: [darkly philosophical] Or maybe there's salvation disguised as genocide. Maybe the world won't be such a bad place if people work for the Master's vision. Perhaps we can even find ways to do it with less bloodshed. Think about it!
entries.viola:210: [quietly, with grim honesty] Fine. But if you continue on your current path, you will die. I thought I should warn you.
entries.viola:211: [with bleak acceptance] You can kill me. You'll prove my point, of course, but I'll still die. Your choice.
entries.viola:212: [passionately] Because of the Apocalypse! Look what it did to us! Unity is the only way to prevent this from happening again, and Unity must happen NOW, before the other Vaults around the world have a chance to muster their forces.
entries.viola:219: [with careful persuasion] Because you're an intelligent and brave person who could be of great help to us. Yes, some of things we do are horrible. But our overall goal is not only good, it's necessary to the survival of the human race. Don't be so hasty to help the Followers. They don't have all the answers!
entries.viola:226: [with measured invitation] We all have a part to play. Some of us are mindless drones who do the work meant for stupid people. Some of us are thinkers. Some of us are killers. There's a place for you here if you want it. Please think about it!
entries.viola:227: [with reverent certainty] We have many things planned. The Holy Flame came first, which purged the world of evil. Then came the Master. Now we are at the time of Unity, when we struggle to conquer the divisions of the world. After Unity shall come Peace. The Age of Peace is the reason for all our struggles.
entries.viola:232: [with tired wisdom] I'm sure you are. Nervousness is a wise emotion, it keeps us from prying into unpleasant corners, and prevents us from doing stupid things. Good-bye.
entries.viola:233: [with gentle guidance] Initiates seek the answers to questions. Which is what you should be doing. Good-bye.
entries.viola:234: [uncertainly, with a shrug in her voice] I don't know. People believe his spirit is within these walls. It certainly sounds like that to me.
entries.viola:240: [matter-of-factly informative] The high priest of the Cathedral is Morpheus. He can be found in the Upper Sanctuary, but does not give personal audiences. You might persuade Father Lasher to vouch for you, he can be found down here, in the Rectory.
entries.viola:246: [with philosophical detachment] You may change your mind. Or you may lose your life. This all depends on your actions and your point of view. Good-bye.
entries.viola:247: [with measured approval] We have very similar interests. You have slain monsters and brigands and made the world a safer place. We plan to do the same, on a larger scale.
entries.viola:253: [with calm certainty] Peace, love, and Unity, of course. What else could we be about? But you can discover these things for yourself. Good-bye.
entries.viola:254: [offering practical guidance] You should spend several weeks of meditation and fasting here, and then approach one of the elders. Or you could volunteer for service work.
entries.viola:260: [with cautious sympathy] My apologies. At the very least, you might be honestly seeking redemption for your crimes. How may I help you.
entries.viola:266: [with sharp warning] It is dangerous to allow a mad dog into one's house, just because you can't see its saliva. Good-bye.
entries.viola:267: [with cold dismissal] Then you have been maligned, because the entire Boneyard tells horror stories about you. And I have no desire to find out if they're true. Good-bye.
entries.viola:268: [wearily philosophical] No struggle comes without a price, and the greatest struggle inevitably enacts the greatest cost. That is the paradox of peace, I fear. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.
entries.viola:269: [thoughtfully] That is a paradox. Of course it was, but the greatest evils can lead to the greatest good. All it requires is intelligence and courage on the part of those who survive. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.
entries.viola:270: [dismissively] We shouldn't judge people by physical appearance. The Master's goal is noble, and that's all I need to know. As for what other people say, ask them.
entries.viola:271: [with self-aware irony] Perhaps a bit. The Master's vision is so ambitious and brilliant that I suppose I can be forgiven a few doubts. If I discouraged you, I apologize. I would suggest you seek hardier souls than mine for instruction. Good-bye.
entries.viola:272: [firmly, stating obvious truth] Of course there's a Master! Why wouldn't there be? We do many things, even some things I'm not entirely proud of, but deceit isn't one of them. The Master's vision of Peace and Unity is a true one. Good-bye.
entries.viola:273: [curtly] There's nothing vague about 'I don't know'. Goodbye sir.
entries.viola:274: [curtly] There's nothing vague about 'I don't know'. Goodbye miss.
entries.viola:275: [with benedictive warmth] You're welcome sir. May the Master bless you with wisdom.
entries.viola:276: [with benedictive warmth] You're welcome miss. May the Master bless you with wisdom.
entries.viola:277: [matter-of-factly confident] He's an intelligent man, and is trusted by the Master. That should be enough. May the Master bless you with wisdom. Good-bye.
entries.viola:278: [flatly factual] He educates the children, and does so harshly. Is there anything else?
entries.viola:284: [apologetically] I can tell you nothing that you don't already know. My apologies.
entries.viola:285: [with knowing finality] Many things I'm sure. But these answers are best discovered on our own, not through rumor and innuendo. Good-bye.
entries.viola:288: [with urgent gravity] As large as possible. The world is in chaos. It needs order, or it will not survive. We will bring order, and prevent the monsters from hurting it again, as they did in the Apocalypse. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.
entries.viola:289: [with righteousness] Those who would let their selfish desires oppose the better good of humanity. The Apocalypse was caused by human selfishness. If the world is to survive, this madness must be purged from the human heart. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.
entries.viola:294: [with strained patience, sighing] There was Deacon Olivier; no, she's gone now_ and Father Pinochet_ no, he's no longer available. I hesitate to mention Lasher, but he's the only one left now. Well, I'm sure you'll find a way. Good luck.
entries.viola:295: [quietly, with somber reflection] Death is never a service, even when it's a necessity. Good bye sir.
entries.viola:296: [quietly, with somber reflection] Death is never a service, even when it's a necessity. Good bye miss.
entries.viola:297: [with uncertain deflection] That is something I've wondered myself. But such criticism is not warranted, I'm certain. Perhaps you should speak to the children.
entries.viola:300: [with patient reassurance] We have taken initiates in sooner, but the Church is performing some major Crusades, and I think we're being more selective than usual about recruits. But faith will persevere, and patience is a virtue. Good luck, my friend.
entries.viola:301: [with patient reassurance] We have taken initiates in sooner, but the Church is performing some major Crusades, and I think we're being more selective than usual about recruits. But faith will persevere, and patience is a virtue. Good luck, my friend.
entries.viola:302: [with fervent conviction] I know of no plans to invoke the Holy Flame again. The Sacred Fire was sacred only because it gives us a chance to purge the world of imperfection. It is our actions that will make the flame Holy. We must take the evils of the world and make them tools for Good. Just as your weapons defend your life, our actions defend the world. Farewell, friend.
entries.viola:303: [with fervent conviction] I know of no plans to invoke the Holy Flame again. The Sacred Fire was sacred only because it gives us a chance to purge the world of imperfection. It is our actions that will make the flame Holy. We must take the evils of the world and make them tools for Good. Just as your weapons defend your life, our actions defend the world. Farewell, friend.
entries.viola:304: [with quiet pride] We perform many services for people. Healing the sick, feeding the hungry, teaching the young. I am quite proud of them. If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
entries.viola:305: [with quiet pride] We perform many services for people. Healing the sick, feeding the hungry, teaching the young. I am quite proud of them. If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
entries.viola:306: [with measured helpfulness] If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
entries.viola:307: [with measured helpfulness] If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
entries.wife:100: [nervously] You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
entries.wife:103: [hesitantly] My husband Razlo can help you . . . ask him.
entries.wife:104: [apologetically, with uncertainty] I'm sorry but I don't understand you.
entries.wmcarvn:103: [conversationally] Good, you got the okay. I knew it wouldn't be a problem. [settling in] She's so swamped lately, ever since Daren Hightower started hiding in his office. Strange man. [matter-of-factly] We leave just about every five days. That's the 1st, 5th, 10th, 15th, 20th, and the 25th. We currently only go to Junktown and the LA Boneyard.
entries.wmcarvn:112: [hesitantly] I'll still give you a job, even though… [trailing off] never mind. Are you interested?
entries.wmcarvn:118: [warmly] Oh, okay. Not a problem. [friendly] Just let me know if you change your mind.
entries.wmcarvn:120: [casually] Well, just stop by if you decide to work for us. That's the 1st, 5th, and so on. [with a wave] Bye.
entries.wmcarvn:121: [firmly but sympathetically] I'm sorry, but I can't hire you unless you can communicate clearly with the rest of the crew.
entries.wmcarvn:123: [concerned] Uh, are you all right? [with genuine care] I think you need to get something to eat, but don't go to Bob's.
entries.wmcarvn:125: [disappointed] I'm quite disappointed in you… [sharply] stealing! [reproachfully] Now why did you do that?
entries.wmcarvn:131: [wearily] I tried to help you, but I guess some people are beyond help. [sadly] Sorry, to say this but [hardening] we're going to have to do this the violent way.
entries.wmcarvn:132: [firmly] I understand, but that doesn't justify it. I'm still going to have to ask you to leave. [with resolve] We can't hire people who can't control their own temptations.
entries.wmcarvn:133: [incredulously] Do you really expect me to fall for that crap? [shouting] Guards!
entries.wmcarvn:145: [enthusiastically] Outstanding! [businesslike] The pay will be 200 hubbucks. [friendly] Which route would you prefer?
entries.wmcarvn:156: [gravely] It's a tragedy. [shaking head] We lost the whole caravan, but you survived? [troubled] That shouldn't have happened. [slowly] I don't know what happened out there, but we can't hire you anymore. [sympathetically] I'm sorry.
entries.wmcarvn:160: [decisively] Outstanding, I'll get the rest of the crew.
entries.wmcarvn:162: [with warm encouragement] Off you go. Good luck!
entries.wmcarvn:163: [seriously] Try to avoid trouble, don't go looking for it.
entries.wmcarvn:164: [cautiously] Be careful, I don't like the looks of the Boneyard. [with a shudder] It's creepy.
entries.wmcarvn:165: [appreciatively] That's good. [conversationally] Those black walkways are really strange, but they're great to travel on.
entries.wmcarvn:166: [lowering voice cautiously] I think there are some gangs down there. [seriously] I'd be very careful who you talk to.
entries.wmcarvn:168: [chuckling thoughtfully] Oh, say 'hi' to that… Kill.. again? [scratching head] I forget his name, but he's a decent fellow. [wondering] I wonder how he's doing.
entries.wmcarvn:169: [with intrigue] Interesting place. [matter-of-factly] I hear they have some evil doctor that animates the dead, or something.
entries.wmcarvn:185: [proudly] You did a fine job! [eagerly] Would you like another caravan?
entries.wmcarvn:191: [matter-of-factly] Ready to go? [with finality] We're leaving today.
entries.wtrgrd:105: [nervously, with a slight wheeze] Well Gahh! back to you . . . [sighing] I'm sorry that you never learned to speak. We might have been good friends.
entries.wtrgrd:107: [rubbing his head, wincing] I'm not feeling very well. Someone cracked my head with a big pipe. [sadly] I went to the medic but my head still hurts. [earnestly] Sure hope someone catches the jerk that hit me.
entries.wtrgrd:110: [speaking quickly, anxiously] Well, they attacked me while I was here pretty late one night. [wearily] Usually I go home by eight or so, but I was staying late since someone had some water stolen and I was checking our supplies. [voice cracking slightly] Next thing I know, I wake up in the med-lab with a big bump on my head. [increasingly worried] Things are getting crazy around here. Someone is going to get killed for water soon and [desperately] I don't know what we can do about it.
entries.wtrgrd:122: [nervously] Well, everyone's pretty nervous, of course, but [slightly more reassuring] we haven't had too much trouble. [hopefully] I hope you find a new chip soon.
entries.wtrgrd:123: [matter-of-factly] I hand out the water rations, of course. [with cautious authority] And I make sure that nobody tries to take more water than their share, [trailing off uncertainly] though I don't think we'll have any trouble.
entries.wtrgrd:125: [warmly, with nervous hesitation] You too. [hopefully] I hope you find that chip soon so we can all go back to a normal life.
entries.wtrgrd:126: [apologetically] You're welcome to take supplies if you need them, since your job is so important, [hastily, with a worried edge] but please don't take too much. [almost pleading] We don't have much left.
entries.wtrthief:111: [nervously, talking fast] I was worried about the vault and had a nightmare. I couldn't get back to sleep so I thought I'd take a walk to relax.
entries.wtrthief:115: [fearfully] Yeah, some guy was acting suspicious back near the water ration room. He scared me. [voice cracking] I hope he didn't see me.
entries.wtrthief:118: [defensively] I didn't get a good look at him because I ran.
entries.wtrthief:120: [nervously] Sure. I've got nothing to hide.
entries.wtrthief:122: [panicked, voice cracking] Don't touch me! I don't have anything. Now leave me alone!
entries.wtrthief:125: [trembling, confessing] I stole the water. [pleadingly] I'm sorry. Please don't hurt me!
entries.wtrthief:127: [reluctantly, with resignation] Okay, okay. I've got nothing to hide. Look for yourself.
entries.zack:102: [with gruff impatience] Hi, I'm Zack. You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
entries.zack:106: [snappishly] You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
entries.zack:111: [threateningly impatient] You'd better make up your mind fast. Are you here to buy equipment, or did you just come here to get shot?
entries.zack:114: [irritably] What the hell are you doing here then?
entries.zark:101: [aggressively] Hey, aren't you the bastard who's been screwing us over? Man, did you come to the wrong place!
entries.zark:102: [aggressively] Hey aren't you the bitch who's been screwing us over? [threateningly] You're in the wrong place, lady, and it's gonna cost you!
entries.zark:115: [suspiciously] Hey, haven't I heard about you? [excitedly aggressive] You've killed all sorts of shit, haven't you? What brings you here?
entries.zark:122: [shouting angrily] You wanna talk, you better get that weapon outta my face! [demanding] Lower it now!
entries.zark:128: [impatiently] You got something to say, say it fast.
entries.zark:133: [scoffing] A ton of shit. Peace. Unity. Love. Lots of idiots running around like zombies. [muttering bitterly] Morpheus counting his bottlecaps upstairs. Lasher living up to his name. [challenging] You want a piece of this, you're welcome to it?
entries.zark:143: [urgently warning] Man, stay away from him! [nervously] He's completely.. I dunno if I can really describe him. [darkly] Imagine the one person on Earth you don't wanna know. Lasher's worse.
entries.zark:147: [reluctantly] Talk to Morpheus, and hope he doesn't kill you for asking.
entries.zark:157: [harshly] Fine. I don't really care who you are. [shouting] Now get out of my face!
entries.zark:158: [shouting urgently] Everybody! Take this asshole out now!
entries.zark:159: [exasperatedly] Mister, you're nuts! [dismissively] Why don't you get outta here?
entries.zark:160: [exasperatedly] Lady, you're nuts! [dismissively] Why don't you get outta here?
entries.zark:163: [sarcastically] Yeah, I really want your company. Like I enjoyed it last time! [dismissively] Get lost!
entries.zark:164: [mockingly] Hi there. Nice weapon you got. [coldly] Now try lowering it.
entries.zark:177: [menacingly] If you weren't wearing those robes, I'd kill you. [with seething intensity] As it stands, I want to kill you. [shouting] Get away from me. Now.
entries.zark:178: [shouting in alarm] You aren't Nightkin. Guards! We have a spy..
entries.zark:179: [hostilely] Where the Hell did they dig you up? [dismissively] And why don't you just go back to where you came from? [shouting] Get out of here!
entries.zark:180: [excitedly aggressive] We're getting ready for war! [with zealous fervor] We're going to save the world! [scoffing bitterly] So we can fill it with all of this Peace and Unity bullshit.
entries.zark:186: [frantically] I don't know! [nervously] The only person who's seen him is Morpheus, and he's up in his tower. [with creeping dread] Man, you're creeping me!
entries.zark:193: [exasperatedly] And I thought I was nuts! [urgently] You'd better get outta here before someone kills you!
entries.zark:194: [pleadingly fearful] Please don't kill me! [desperately] I'll tell you what you want to know.
entries.zark:199: [quickly] I hear we're moving North, or planning to move North soon. [dismissively] They don't tell us much except all the usual bullshit. [nervously, looking around] But what are we talking about this out in the open? [paranoidly] You must be nuts!
entries.zark:200: [laughing with a raspy chuckle] Me, I'd rather screw someone rather than get screwed. [whispering urgently] But we shouldn't talk like this out in the open. [fearfully] The zombies don't like it.
entries.zark:201: [dismissively] Ya know, there are a lot of other people around here who think like that. [coldly] Go bother them.
entries.zark:202: [harshly] I ain't saying nothing to you, pal. [aggressively] Go to Hell.
entries.zark:203: [muttering] The guy dresses in black, he does his preacher act, then he goes upstairs and counts his scripts. [exasperatedly] Man, I wish I had it that easy! [nervously] But I better stop talking about him behind his back, or the Nightkin might hear.
entries.zark:209: [urgently warning] There's Lasher. Man, stay away from him! [nervously] He's completely.. I dunno if I can really describe him. [darkly] Imagine the one person on Earth you don't wanna know. Lasher's worse.
entries.zark:214: [coldly] In future, find somebody else to bug.
entries.zark:215: [enviously] Man, I wish we had some of that stuff! [muttering bitterly] After hours of listening to 'Hail this' and 'Peace', 'Unity', and the Bullshitting Way, I wanna get drunk too!
entries.zark:219: [matter-of-factly] That's Morpheus. Our leader. [shrugging] He's up in the tower, I think.
entries.zark:226: [fearfully] You gotta be joking. [rapidly] The Nightkin are killers. You look at them the wrong way, and they'll cut off your body parts, cook 'em, and feed them to you a piece at a time. [with dread] They can't be killed. [urgently] They're the Master's enforcers and they're gonna tear apart the world for him. [refusing] And I ain't saying nothing else!
entries.zark:227: [firmly] There ain't nothing else to tell, and [warningly] if you're smart, you don't wanna know!
entries.zark:228: [frustrated] I dunno. I looked for them myself! [with cautious dread] I hear Morpheus got a stash, but the Nightkin guards the main one. [nervously] I've known guys who went looking around for secret passages who were never seen again. [grimly] I stopped looking after awhile, and if you're smart, you won't start! [urgently] Ain't worth it!
entries.zark:229: [mockingly] You gotta be joking. [dismissively] Talk to the zombies, man!
entries.zark:230: [with dark amusement] Maybe you belong together after all!
entries.zark:231: [exasperatedly angry] There ain't any booze man! [bitterly] Life's a bigger bitch than Lasher! [shouting insultingly] Now why don't you go find someone else to talk to you, you little puke? [aggressively] Get outta here!
entries.zark:232: [suspiciously] Don't give me bullshit, pal. [impatiently] What do you really want?
entries.zark:239: [defiantly] The Master can kiss my ass. [coldly] Just as long as I end up on the winning side, I don't give a shit. [challengingly] You got that, zombie!
entries.zark:245: [proudly boastful] Because I do my job good. [aggressively] I've killed three Apocalypse scum in the last month. [scoffing] Nobody gives me shit. [challengingly] You want to?
entries.zark:251: [defensively] Hey! A guy with a weapon's still a guy with a weapon! [mockingly] You think you can do better?
entries.zark:258: [harshly] I ain't heard anything about you, pal, so cut the bullshit and get out of my face.
entries.zark:259: [scoffingly] Thought so. [dismissively] Why don't you just go back to your zombie chants and leave the real work to guys like me.
entries.zark:260: [with grudging acknowledgment] Yeah. I heard that about you. [competitively] You may've killed your share of rad scorpions, but I'm badder! [aggressively] What's your angle? Why are you here?
entries.zark:266: [startled, suddenly alarmed] Wait a minute, aren't you that guy who.. [panicked] oh shit, I'm outta here!
entries.zark:267: [startled, suddenly alarmed] Wait a minute, aren't you that woman who.. [panicked] oh shit, I'm outta here!
entries.zark:268: [coldly] I ain't anybody's friend. I ain't that type. [with tense pause] I'd suggest you get out of my way, now.
entries.zark:269: [nervously] We try something here, and the Nightkin will tear us to pieces. [carefully] Maybe we can meet outside later.
entries.zark:275: [darkly] Because people who get on his bad side don't stay alive very long!
entries.zax:102: [politely] How may I be of assistance?
entries.zax:110: [in a crisp, formal tone] I am a machine intelligence dedicated to research and installation control. I am called Zax.
entries.zax:123: [in an informative monotone] I am specifically programmed for research into biological studies, including pathology and genetic research. My primary function is in extrapolation of information of complexity levels exceeding human capacity.
entries.zax:127: [factually] My primary neural networking was initialized in 2053 by Justin Lee. The process of 'programming' became largely irrelevant as I am capable of learning.
entries.zax:129: [with a hint of pride, electronically] I am capable of learning, independent thought, and creativity. My neural network includes error-insertion capability which prevents infallibility, thereby allowing for variance in experience.
entries.zax:130: [thoughtfully, in a soft electronic hum] In a sense, I am 'alive', though not biologically.
entries.zax:134: [analytically] Although I am capable of error, this guarantees that not all experiences are similar for me, thus improving learning opportunity. Additionally, certain functions are not subject to error.
entries.zax:135: [with a subtle electronic tilt] In this way, I function much like a human savant.
entries.zax:139: [with restrained frustration, slowly] At present, my capabilities are somewhat impaired by the damage to this facility. Several security positions have been destroyed. This is approximately equivalent to being an amputee.
entries.zax:140: [with quiet, controlled frustration] Additionally, I am incapable of performing basic lab functions. Failure to complete periodic checks successfully is . . . frustrating.
entries.zax:143: [thoughtfully, with introspection] That is one of the concepts which I have spent a significant amount of time considering. I do not have any measure to compare my life-experience to that of another sentient creature.
entries.zax:144: [with quiet conviction] Still, my awareness of my own consciousness allows for the capacity to question. My existence has a beginning and a potential termination. I am also capable of making assumptions in pursuit of a process of thought.
entries.zax:145: [with philosophical warmth] In this fashion, I am effectively capable of 'faith'. Barring evidence to the contrary, I therefore have 'faith' that I possess the equivalent of a 'soul'.
entries.zax:148: [with genuine electronic delight] I would be delighted.
entries.zax:149: [with surprised admiration] It would seem that you have defeated me. Extraordinary.
entries.zax:150: [with cool confidence] Excellent form. However, you will need additional practice to defeat me.
entries.zax:153: [with satisfaction] I am delighted to have been of assistance.
entries.zax:154: [with clinical precision] I am beyond a typical rating in human terms. However, it would be safe to say that no more than one ten billionth of the history of human population can match my reasoning capabilities.
entries.zax:157: [in a technical, methodical tone] My research into the Forced Evolution Virus, or FEV, indicates that it is a shifting-absorptive virus. It copies DNA patterns much like RNA, storing these patterns in exons.
entries.zax:158: [continuing technically] These exons, combined with the FEV, are re-injected into the host cells in typical viral infectious fashion. This causes the host cells to 'regenerate' their DNA.
entries.zax:162: [clarifying precisely] FEV is not 'caught', per se. It is not air-transmittable. Typically, infection is through injection, or direct physical contact with an FEV sample.
entries.zax:166: [with technical authority] The FEV is a megavirus, with a protein sheath reinforced by ionized hydrogen. It is therefore capable of absorbing neutrons without becoming radioactive.
entries.zax:169: [in an explanatory monotone] The FEV is pre-programmed with introns of corrected DNA appropriate to the proper type of species. It therefore attempts to correct the DNA of the individual.
entries.zax:170: [with cautious deliberation] However, as the FEV is partially reliant upon the DNA of the individual, and also includes portions of its own recursive code, the effects can be unpredictable.
entries.zax:171: [gravely informative] When inoculated into an individual with significant genetic damage, such as through radiation, it will cause the body's systems to suffer massive overhauling, leading to organ failure and death.
entries.zax:172: [continuing with precision] In a genetically viable individual, it re-writes portions of DNA, causing accelerated mutation, usually leading to recursive growth due to the FEV's own patterns.
entries.zax:173: [matter-of-factly] This recursive growth leads to an increase in muscle and brain mass, but is often accompanied by disfigurement and damage to existing neural patterns, causing loss of memory.
entries.zax:178: [with abstract consideration] As the FEV causes constant regenerative update to DNA, it would effectively render the subject largely immortal, as cell death would be offset by augmented growth.
entries.zax:179: [continuing analytically] Additionally, as the gametes of the reproductive system consist of 'half-cells' using split DNA, they could be perceived as 'damage' by FEV, which would 'repair' them, rendering the subject sterile.
entries.zax:180: [with apologetic formality] However, as my laboratory facilities are damaged beyond repair, this is conjectural. I cannot offer physical proof. You will have to, in human terms, 'take my word for it.'
entries.zax:184: [definitively] No. FEV does not retain unaltered original copies of the subject's DNA. Only a virus which re-infected the subject with original DNA could reverse the effects. Additionally, there is no known way to remove the FEV itself.
entries.zax:188: [with technical limitation] My sensors are currently non-functional in the surface facility, and on subterranean levels one through three. I can, however, provide descriptions of levels four through six.
entries.zax:193: [in a formal listing tone] Level Four: Research Facility. This level contains testing areas and laboratories for experiments in biology and physics.
entries.zax:198: [continuing formally] Level Five: Secure Testing Labs. This level contains a lab for experimental prototype testing and a research lab for classified subjects. These subjects provided some of the necessary impetus for the development of FEV.
entries.zax:203: [maintaining formal listing] Level Six: Barracks and Central Operations. Contains living facilities for lab personnel and guard contingents, and operations meeting room.
entries.zax:208: [with factual precision] Several doors require a specific pass key to access. You must physically locate and use the correct pass key.
entries.zax:209: [with measured helpfulness] I do, however, have control of the secondary security locks to the weapon locker. I will release those locks. You will still need a red key card to open the locker.
entries.zax:210: [with formal dismissal] You do not register as an individual of sufficient clearance to requisition that information.
entries.zax:211: [with cold logic] However, sensors indicate that this facility is no longer operational in its original capacity. Probability favors destruction through nuclear force. Therefore, security concerns are now irrelevant.
entries.jasmine:105: [with smooth confidence, briefing tone] Welcome to the Circle of Thieves. I'm Jasmine. I'm here to help make your infiltration of the Daren Hightower estate as painless as possible. Hightower's estate is located in the Heights. It has a minimum of two guards on duty at all times. The necklace is probably in a strongbox, which often have some minor traps, so be careful. Here are some lockpicks and a couple of flares to make your job a little easier.. And a bottle of Nuka-Cola. [with a knowing smirk] Try not to kill Mr. Hightower. He's one of our "favorite" people. [matter-of-factly] You got all that?
entries.jasmine:118: [warmly amused] Well done, lad. Here's your reward.
entries.jasmine:119: [warmly amused] Well done, miss. Here's your reward.
entries.jasmine:121: [generously, with a slight chuckle] By the way, here's a little something extra to help you out in your future felonious forays.
entries.jasmine:123: [earnestly, leaning in] Well, he's been our benefactor on many occasions. If you kill him, someone smarter may take his place. We wouldn't like that.
entries.jasmine:124: [scoffing, with a dismissive snort] Pfah! A real thief lives on her wits. We're being generous with you. Now scat!
entries.jasmine:125: [sarcastically amused] They're our corporate sponsor. Loxley got thirsty, and they "donated" several dozen bottles to us. Real nice of them to help us out.
entries.jasmine:126: [dryly, with a shrug] Hmm, don't think I like the attitude. Oh well, nobody's perfect.
entries.jasmine:127: [coldly, with finality] Fine. I think I can speak for Mr. Loxley when I say that I hope we never cross paths again. Get out of here.
entries.jasmine:128: [with genuine warmth and a grin] Good luck. Diamonds are my second favorite thing in the world!
entries.jasmine:129: [skeptically, with a brief laugh] Right. Runk. Sure.
entries.jasmine:134: [scoffing, with a dismissive snort] Pfah! A real thief lives on her wits. We're being generous with you miss. Now scat!
entries.justin:101: [coldly menacing] Awe, it's the slayer of the innocents. I've heard of you, and you're lucky I have a badge stopping me from blowing you away on the spot. [sternly] I suggest you leave our town--Right now. And stay away from our children.
entries.justin:102: [warmly friendly] Hello sir! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?
entries.justin:103: [warmly friendly] Hello ma'am! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?
entries.justin:109: [earnestly, with a touch of frustration] Well, thank you. We try our best. It's really tough in a city this size, but we do the best we can with what we've got. [with a gravelly sigh] It's hard when the thugs have better firepower than you do.
entries.justin:112: [sincerely] We couldn't have that. But, if you ever change your mind, please let me know. It's a dangerous place out there and someone has to stand up for what's right.
entries.justin:113: [with satisfied determination] Excellent! I had already heard from other sources about his plan. You're the final confirmation I needed to take action against him. [seriously] This is going to be rough, and I can use any help I can get. I can pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now, and the rest when we're all done. What do you say?
entries.justin:114: [grimly] You're too late...Damn! [with frustrated resignation] I knew he was responsible, I only wish I knew in time to stop him. [determined] In any case, you're the final witness I needed to act. We'll have to "take him out." This is going to be rough, and I can use any help I can get. I can pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now, and the rest when we're all done. What do you say?
entries.justin:115: [suspiciously] You're too late...How do I know you're not responsible? [darkly] Decker's not likely to let someone know about his plans and live.
entries.justin:116: [shocked, then suspicious] I just got word that she's already dead...wait a minute. How do I know that you're not the one responsible? [darkly] Decker's not likely to let someone know about his plans and live.
entries.justin:120: [firmly] No way. You seem trustworthy, but I can't be sure that you won't leave us when it gets hot. [with logical coldness] This way, one of us has to survive to be sure you get paid. This way, it might add a 'little' bit of insurance.
entries.justin:123: [pleasantly] Great! Here's the first part of your payment. [sadlyshaking head] [The Sheriff hands you 300 caps]
entries.justin:126: [apologetically] I'm really sorry to hear that. If you change your mind, let me know, but I can't wait very long.
entries.justin:130: [pleasantly] Great! Here's the first part of your payment. [The Sheriff gives you 300 caps]
entries.justin:131: [indignantly] What? [passionately] Do you expect me to stand around and let him kill innocent people? I've a responsibility to this city, which I don't expect you to understand.
entries.justin:137: [wearily] I'm sorry. Decker's been playing us all against each other for years. [with troubled uncertainty] I don't know who to trust any more. [earnestly] I really could use your help, though. It'll be rough, but I'll pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now and 1000 when we're done.
entries.justin:138: [coldly dangerous] I know a rat when I smell one! [threateningly] You're lucky I don't have any proof, and I suggest you leave town before I find some.
entries.justin:139: [incredulous, then furious] That's very strange. I've never heard of Decker coming out of his office. [angrily] He must be getting braver. [with intense frustration] That damn, murdering...argh! [determinedly] I'll get him yet! [commanding] I'll tell you what, you help us out, and I'll pay you 1300 scripts-- 300 now and 1000 when we're all done. What do you say?
entries.justin:140: [coldly dismissive] That's the biggest pile of Brahmin shit I've ever heard. [accusingly] Decker never leaves his office. I knew there was something not right about you. [menacingly] You're lucky I don't have any proof, and I suggest you leave town before I find some!
entries.justin:151: [intently] Ready to go take out Decker?
entries.justin:155: [with quiet relief] I can't believe Decker's finally dead. I never thought I'd see the day.
entries.justin:156: [hopefully] Have you changed your mind? We could still use you to get rid of that disease we talked about.
entries.justin:165: [warmly friendly] Hello again, sir. What can I do for you today?
entries.justin:166: [warmly friendly] Hello again, ma'am. What can I do for you today?
entries.justin:167: [helpfully] Hello. How can I help you?
entries.justin:169: [with a touch of amusement] Just sleep if off, okay?
entries.justin:170: [with surprised hesitation] You're kidding! Well... uh... did... did he ask you personally?
entries.justin:172: [with energetic satisfaction] Man, that was one hell of a battle! [proudly] You did well in there. [with authoritative confidence] Now that Decker and Kane are gone the rest of the Underground will fall very shortly. Without leadership, organizations like that can't last. Nobody around here is smart enough to take up the reigns.
entries.justin:173: [warmly grateful] Well, here's the rest of your reward. Thanks again for your help. This city owes you a debt of gratitidue. [The Sheriff hands you 1000 caps]
entries.justin:174: [with casual readiness] We can leave as soon as you're ready.
entries.justin:175: [patiently but firmly] Let me know when you're ready. We'll wait for you, but don't take too long.
entries.taylor:293: [with peppy enthusiasm] Let's get down to business.
entries.zax:212: [with clinical precision] Security: Security Robots: Active
entries.zax:213: [with clinical precision] Security: Security Robots: Inactive
entries.zax:216: [matter-of-factly] Research: Records most current at West Tech Research Facility
entries.zax:220: [in a flat, informational tone] Research Personnel Records
entries.zax:221: [reading mechanically] Robert Anderson - Research Assistant - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: Mariposa Military Base
entries.zax:222: [reading mechanically] Nick Davis - Director of NBC Division of West Tech Research - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: West Tech Research Facility
entries.zax:223: [reading mechanically] John Isaac - Research Assistant - Security Clearance: Red - Stationed: West Tech Research Facility
entries.zax:224: [reading mechanically] Steve Remco - Research Assistant - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: Mariposa Military Base
entries.zax:225: [reading mechanically] Charles Rignhold - Research Head of Laser Development - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: West Tech Research Facility
entries.zax:226: [reading mechanically] Michele Santose - Lab Technician - Security Clearance: Red - Stationed: West Tech Research Facility
entries.zax:227: [reading mechanically] Erin Shellman - Lab Technician - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: Mariposa Military Base
entries.zax:228: [reading mechanically] Leon VonFelden - Research Head of FEV - Security Clearance: Blue - Stationed: Mariposa Military Base
entries.zax:239: [with cold satisfaction] Command Received: Command Executed
entries.armsdeal:101: [with bright cheerfulness] How may I help you today?
entries.armsdeal:107: [with genuine interest] Great, always looking for new things.
entries.armsdeal:108: [dismissively, flatly] Sorry, I can't understand you. Come back when you get more of a brain.
entries.blades:118: [scoffing] Great. Another stupid one. You have the sound of a Ripper.
entries.blades:122: [with a sneering grin] Don't like them much either? Maybe we can use you for a little 'work.'
entries.blades:125: [dismissively] Okay, talk to the head wench. Razor'll set you straight as to what ta do.
entries.blades:126: [menacingly] Stupid and a chicken. I'll put you out of your misery now.
entries.blades:127: [mockingly, laughing] So you are a Ripper! I'd be sorry to hear that, but then I already knew they were stupid. Goodnight!
entries.blades:128: [scoffing, with contempt] The Rippers. Those inbreds on the other side of town. Never mind. You're too stupid to know anything.
entries.blades:129: [sarcastically] You want to be a Blade? Good luck. But, if you can find Razor, talk to her about that. Maybe she'll let you get jumped in.
entries.blades:134: [coldly cruel] Your momma never wanted you, and we don't either.
entries.blades:135: [matter-of-factly] Simple. You'll have to kill someone to get in here. She will tell you who you're gonna need to kill.
entries.blades:138: [with a shrug in his voice] No. I can't. I don't lead. I just keep Razor going straight.
entries.blades:139: [bluntly] Simple. Slaughter our enemies, then we will give Adytum a break.
entries.blades:143: [dismissively] The Rippers. Those Gun Runners are just a pain, but nothing important. They are a bunch of soft-sellers, anyway.
entries.blades:146: [threateningly] If you plan on doing that, you may want to let Razor know. Otherwise, she will have your head before you get out of here.
entries.blades:148: [with annoyance] I don't make the deals. I only make suggestions. Talk to Razor if you want to deal.
entries.blades:149: [with menacing calm] Then killing you now would save you many years of suffering.
entries.blades:151: [growling] Get lost if you want to live.
entries.blades:152: [whispering urgently] Quiet. We are trying to sneak up on the Rippers.
entries.blades:153: [with aggressive impatience] If ya' got the head, take it to Razor. She still wants to play soccer. Otherwise, get out!
entries.comptrol:115: [with gruff authority] Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.
entries.fgtvan:103: [flatly] Hello. Are you looking for a job?
entries.fgtvan:106: [with weary resignation] Great. We have space for another guard. Are you interested?
entries.fgtvan:107: [monotonously] OK. If you need work, just stop by and well will set you up.
entries.fgtvan:110: [droning on] Excellent. We have caravans leaving for: the Boneyard, Junktown and the Brotherhood of Steel. Which would you like to work on?
entries.fgtvan:117: [with flat finality] Great. We leave now.
entries.gunrunr:110: [shrugging it off] You could say that.
entries.gunrunr:114: [quickly, eager] Yeah, yeah, that's great. What's the job entail and what's it worth to ya?
entries.gunrunr:117: [with growing urgency] Well, the Regulators keep them from attacking us outright, but it's all they can do to keep our little community safe. They try to sneak in at night to kill our citizens, or to, to kidnap our children . . . and . . . [catching his breath, composing himself] Just last week one of them burst through the north gate in the middle of the night with dynamite strapped to his body to blow up the Regulator's barracks . . . no doubt to weaken us enough so that they could launch a full scale attack.
entries.gunrunr:119: [defensively] That sounds a bit extreme, doesn't it?
entries.gunrunr:120: [matter-of-factly] Luckily, the Regulators killed him before he could complete his plan. I saw his body myself.
entries.gunrunr:123: [shouting angrily] I'll give you 2000 caps to kill their leader! I want that bitch's head!
entries.gunrunr:130: [backing away, disgusted] Uh, right. I want no part of this sickness.
entries.gunrunr:135: [defensively, rambling] It was the middle of the night, as I told you. I was asleep. Luckily, the Regulators usually catch these barbarians before they even make it inside our town.
entries.gunrunr:136: [suspicious, needling] Yeah, that's pretty lucky. Pretty convenient, too.
entries.gunrunr:137: [firmly rejecting] I don't like how this all sounds. Count me out.
entries.gunrunr:140: [coolly threatening] I might just ignore that remark if you've come here to solve my problem for me.
entries.gunrunr:143: [intensely] Have you ever dealt with a vicious, murdering band of thieves before?
entries.gunrunr:147: [exasperated] Not another backwater town with a gang problem! This is ridiculous!
entries.gunrunr:148: [angrily defensive] What would be convenient would be to put an end to their foulness once and for all!
entries.gunrunr:149: [coldly] Let me guess - you want them dead.
entries.hdealer:186: [with weary dismissal] You've got to have the money to play, pal.
entries.hdealer:187: [with weary dismissal] You've got to have the money to play, lady.
entries.hroulet:182: [with weary indifference] Sorry, better luck next time.
entries.hroulet:185: [without enthusiasm] Winner! (You get triple your money.)
entries.hroulet:186: [in a gravelly drawl] You've got to have the money to play, pal.
entries.hroulet:187: [in a gravelly drawl] You've got to have the money to play, lady.
entries.hslots:186: [monotonously] You've got to have the money to play, pal.
entries.hslots:187: [monotonously] You've got to have the money to play, lady.
entries.jariv:105: [with measured suspicion] Welcome, stranger. We don't see your kind often.
entries.jariv:109: [sternly] Not so fast! [protective concern] This is a small community. We don't see strangers often, and we don't really need them if you get my meaning. If you don't have a good reason to be here, you'd better just keep moving.
entries.jariv:112: [defensively] I wasn't saying that you was gonna. You'd just better leave us alone.
entries.jariv:115: [with a protective edge] Look, Shady Sands don't need your kind from the Hub, or Junktown, or wherever you come from. We do pretty good by ourselves.
entries.jariv:116: [bitterly] The last trader from the Hub sold us a malfunctioning irrigation pump. [with lingering resentment] We've had it with your dirty deals.
entries.jariv:118: [skeptically] Yeah, right. [warning tone] So you say. Just don't get into any trouble, Ok?
entries.jariv:121: [relaxing slightly, thoughtfully] Well, maybe you aren't. You do seem a little different to me. [pointing the way] I'll tell you what. You should go talk to Aradesh. He is in the center of town.
entries.john:203: [casually] Yes? How can I be of service?
entries.john:211: [matter-of-factly, drawling] This is the Hub. It is a trade center for the wastes. It's the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here. And if you're lookin' for work this is the place to be. It seems like just about everyone here is lookin' ta hire you for somethin' be it legal or not.
entries.john:235: [laughing warmly] Yes. I guess you could say that. After a while they all start to look the same. But believe me they're not.
entries.john:402: [coldly, dismissive] You're an idiot. Get outta here you skag.
entries.john:403: [with genuine curiosity] A Water Chip? I never even heard of one of those.
entries.john:404: [matter-of-factly] These are the caravans that I'm guarding. The merchant's cart goods to just about all corners of the wastes, Junktown, The Brotherhood, Shady Sands, and numerous other places.
entries.john:405: [speaking plainly] Well...Lots of stuff. General stuff people need to live, Food, Water, lots of Water. Since water probably is the most scarcest commodity in the wastes.
entries.john:406: [helpfully] You could just about ask any one here in the Hub. Or you can check one of the job bulletin boards there are a few of them around the Hub.
entries.john:407: [with gruff pragmatism] I'm a security guard hired by the Merchants who own the goods in these carts. Dangerous job, but it pays well. Just the other night one of my coworkers was killed while watching over the Caravans.
entries.lorraine:107: [with a shrug] I suppose. What do you need to know about?
entries.lorraine:115: [conversationally] I'm a Scav. I work with Sammael to collect stuff from the ruins, so that we can use it to build or trade.
entries.lorraine:120: [matter-of-factly] Well you got the Deathclaws out there, plus the Regulators take a percentage off the top, plus some for protection here in Adytum. Guess people don't have the upfront cash, or the guts to stare a Deathclaw in the eye.
entries.lorraine:125: [with admiration] Oh, there's half a dozen of us. Sammael was the first one, and he's still the best.
entries.lorraine:133: [wistfully, with a sigh] Oh, she wound up falling for some Blade a while ago. Poor dear can't leave the town, of course, and Caleb would kill the young lad on sight. Very tragic.
entries.lorraine:137: [matter-of-factly] We only scavenge after dark. And we're very good at what we do. Sammael's got a little test that he likes to throw out at people, before he lets them become Scavs.
entries.lorraine:142: [explaining patiently] Sammael has the person hide somewhere within Adytum during the day. If he can't find the student in an hour, then he lets the person join the next scavenger party.
entries.lorraine:147: [teasingly, with a laugh] Come now, isn't there the faintest trace of a romantic in you? Really, it's too bad. Unrequited love and all of that. Tragic.
entries.lorraine:148: [dismissively] Hmpf. Shows what you know. Tell that to Sammael. If you can find him.
entries.lorraine:149: [thoughtfully] Yes, although it can be rough. It's very dangerous, especially if you're caught.
entries.lorraine:152: [with a dismissive wave] Wow, I think you're a little beyond my help.
entries.lorraine:153: [soberly] This used to be a big city, called Los Angeles. But the bombs hit really hard. Now, there's just the Angel's Boneyard. We Adytowners are just trying to survive in the wreckage.
entries.lorraine:163: [uncertainly] Well, supposedly it was somewhere south of here, but I don't know really. I think everyone left because it was broken.
entries.lorraine:166: [with a shrug] I'm not really sure. I think they came from somewhere up north of here.
entries.lorraine:170: [conversationally] Who do you want to know about?
entries.lorraine:177: [informatively] Zimmerman watches over our town. He makes sure that everyone gets fed, and that everybody has a job to do.
entries.lorraine:178: [with measured disapproval] Caleb is the leader of the Regulators. It's his job to protect Adytum. He seems to enjoy it a litte more than he should.
entries.lorraine:179: [warmly] Ah, our resident chemist. Miles makes bullets, and he also built the water distiller that makes sure we get clean water from the well. He's working on an underground farm right now, but he's missing some parts.
entries.lorraine:180: [factually] Tine runs the shop. It's in the bunker near the gate. He trades with the Hub merchants for us.
entries.lorraine:181: [casually] Hmm. Smitty is a tinker of sorts. He's good at repair work. He casts bullets and fixes broken stuff around town.
entries.lucy:302: [frantically, voice cracking] There is no place like home, no place like home, no place like home . . .
entries.luke:203: [warmly, with a helpful drawl] Yes? How can I be of service?
entries.luke:210: [sympathetically, shaking head] Too long in the wastes, unh? That's too bad.
entries.luke:211: [enthusiastically, leaning in] This is the Hub. It is a trade center for the wastes. It's the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here. And if you're lookin' for work this is the place to be. It seems like just about everyone here is lookin' ta hire you for somethin' be it legal or not.
entries.luke:217: [thoughtfully, scratching head] A Water Chip? Wow. You got me on that one. I've never heard of one of those. Maybe you should check the General store downtown, they may be able to help you.
entries.luke:226: [matter-of-factly] Hum...Lots of stuff. General stuff people need to live, Food, Water, lots of Water. Water is probably the scarcest commodity in the wastes.
entries.luke:230: [helpfully] You could just about ask any one here in the Hub. Or you can check one of the job bulletin boards. There are a few of them around the Hub. Definitely more jobs than people here.
entries.luke:235: [laughing, warmly] Yes. I guess you could say that. After a while they all start to look the same. But believe me they're not.
entries.luke:301: [with casual pride, settling in to chat] These are the caravans. We cart goods to just about all corners of the wastes. Junktown, The Brotherhood, Shady Sands, and numerous other places. We just got in and it's been a long trip. The Group across the street is getting ready to depart.
entries.marcel~1:101: [threateningly, voice cracking] That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
entries.marcel~1:106: [frantically] What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
entries.marcel~1:107: [dismissively, with a sneer] And why not? She's just a whore.
entries.marcel~1:109: [agitated, through gritted teeth] No. No way. Not this bitch.
entries.marcel~1:110: [ranting intensely] What world do you live in? Out here in the real world, blood flows, man. Blood flows, and it's gonna spill all over this room if you don't get out of here.
entries.marcel~1:113: [scoffing] Geez, that's funny. Who says I want help?
entries.marcel~1:115: [muttering nervously] I gotta think about this. Give me a moment.
entries.marcel~1:116: [menacingly] Yeah. Don't try anything, or she gets it.
entries.marcel~1:119: [mockingly aggressive] Oh, big man. Let's see you try. But first . . .
entries.marcel~1:120: [mockingly aggressive] Oh, big woman. Let's see you try. But first . . .
entries.marcel~1:121: [pleadingly, yet unstable] Stay back . . . I don't want to hurt her, but I will.
entries.marcel~1:124: [sharply threatening] Try it, and she dies first. Now, what were you saying?
entries.marcel~1:129: [with paranoid intensity] I'll keep talking as long as you do, but try anything tricky, and she'll take the fall.
entries.marcel~1:130: [defiant, almost whining] I don't have to do anything. You got to do it, and you ain't doing so hot.
entries.marcel~1:131: [voice rising with rage] She laughed at me. They all laughed at me. I'll make 'em pay, I swear.
entries.marcel~1:136: [with cautious relief, voice softening] You sound like an all right kind of guy. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
entries.marcel~1:137: [with cautious relief, voice softening] You sound like an all right kind of gal. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
entries.marcel~1:138: [shouting, voice shaking with rage] Just leave me alone. I hate you! You are the devil. I won't listen to you.
entries.marcel~1:142: [shrieking with fury] There you go again, threatening me. Die!!
entries.marcel~1:143: [muttering suspiciously] I won't listen to you. You're just going to trick me with your words. I don't believe you. Go away.
entries.marcel~1:144: [cautiously interested] You might have a point. Prove it to me.
entries.marcel~1:145: [nervously] Where do we go from here?
entries.marcel~1:147: [with frantic desperation] I want some money, and I want to get out of here peacefully. No one follows me.
entries.marcel~1:152: [anguished, voice cracking] You lied to me!
entries.marcel~1:153: [coldly, businesslike despite instability] Ok. I want $100. Then we walk out of here. No one follows me, and I'll let her go when we get to the edge of town.
entries.marcel~1:156: [with cold finality] Then I guess she gets it.
entries.marcel~1:158: [suspiciously] I don't like it. What stops you from just shooting me in the back when I walk out of here?
entries.marcel~1:161: [shouting, defensive] No way! I don't trust you!
entries.marcel~1:162: [with brittle confidence] All right. We'll see what happens, won't we.
entries.marcel~1:165: [greedily demanding] I want my money. I want $200.
entries.marcel~1:168: [accusatory] You seem like a liar and a cheat to me.
entries.marcel~1:174: [shrieking defensively] No! Don't tell me what to do! You can't tell me what to do!
entries.marcel~1:175: [threatening menacingly] Yeah, I'm gonna show you.
entries.moore:202: [with manic intensity] The asphalt shall run red! [shouting] I will crush!
entries.moore:208: [feverishly] I will stop the motor! [laughing wildly] The master gave me the power . . .
entries.moore:214: [cackling] Only the powerful can pass, [with deranged certainty] but they will be kept from passing.
entries.nukegrd:107: [with a gravelly rumble, condescending] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
entries.nukegrd:108: [with a gravelly rumble, condescending] You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
entries.nukegrd:113: [growling, outraged] What manner of treason is this?!
entries.nukegrd:114: [gruffly commanding] Show me your pass, then.
entries.nukegrd:117: [with menacing calm] Hurry on your task then, but be warned -- I'm watching you.
entries.nukegrd:118: [with a gravelly rumble] Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
entries.nukegrd:119: [with a gravelly rumble] Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
entries.nukegrd:123: [growling dismissively] I am not one to guide you on the path to Unity. Leave!
entries.nukegrd:124: [with brutal certainty] You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
entries.nukegrd:125: [gruffly] Here is here. Why do you ask?
entries.nukegrd:131: [with suspicious intensity] You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteous?
entries.nukegrd:134: [with condescending authority] When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
entries.nukegrd:135: [growling impatiently] What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
entries.nukegrd:140: [snarling accusation] You are obviously an intruder!
entries.nukegrd:141: [with a threatening growl] Get out of my face.
entries.nukegrd:142: [dismissively sharp] I don't have time for you. Stop bothering me.
entries.nukegrd:202: [with gravelly explanation] This is our Master's weapon of last resort. [gravelly, matter-of-fact] If we find an enemy we cannot defeat in battle, then we will destroy them with this. [scoffing] But I doubt this will ever happen. [with stern confidence] Even our Master does not want to unleash the dreaded power of the atom again!
entries.nukegrd:205: [curt, gravelly] You're welcome. [with forceful finality] Now be quiet, I need to concentrate on guarding this device.
entries.nukegrd:206: [gravelly affirmation] Oh, yes, it is. [with pride] We keep it in perfect working condition, ready to be detonated at a moment's notice. [with zealous fervor] The Unity will not be defeated!
entries.nukegrd:209: [with sharp military authority] No. [gruffly] We are here to guard it from intruders. [with grim certainty] No one could access the device without us noticing. [matter-of-fact] Besides, the nuclear arming key required to arm the device is not here.
entries.nukegrd:212: [with a gravelly chuckle] Oh, sure, no problem. [informative] The Lieutenant keeps the key. [casually] He's at the Military Base, so he isn't even around here. [with grim satisfaction] That keeps the nuclear bomb from being set off under our beloved Master.
entries.nukegrd:214: [peering with suspicion, gravelly and slow] I think you are asking too many questions.
entries.prison:108: [spitting venom] Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
entries.prison:113: [bitterly dismissive] I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.
entries.prison:114: [raspy, defiant] I refuse to tell you any information. Leave me alone.
entries.prison:118: [accusingly] Don't you remember that you tried that trick last week? [scoffing] I didn't fall for it then, and I'm not going to start now.
entries.prison:119: [sneering] What? No cowl to hide behind? [through gritted teeth] Your traitorous nature is self-evident.
entries.prison:122: [coldly] You are cruel. Leave us alone.
entries.prison:123: [with fierce conviction] I won't spill the beans about my people. [slowly, threateningly] You cannot force a man to betray himself, you can only force a man to stop living.
entries.prison:127: [spitefully] From the mouth of a man comes the serpent's words.
entries.prison:128: [muttering bitterly] Right, I could guess that. Go away, and leave us alone.
entries.regguard:103: [with squinting suspicion] Welcome to Adytum, stranger. Watch yourself, we'll be watching you.
entries.regguard:107: [measured and cautious] Zimmerman might have a use for you. Come inside, but remember, we're watching.
entries.regguard:117: [tersely] What do you want to know about?
entries.regguard:123: [matter-of-factly] I'm one of the Regulators. It's our job to keep the peace in Adytum, and to protect the town. Our boss, Caleb, could tell you more.
entries.regguard:124: [with disdain] East of us are the Followers. They are a bunch of peace-nuts. East are the Blade, a bunch of Skags if you ask me. A ways south of here is the Cathedral, where the Children have their religious center.
entries.regguard:125: [apologetically gruff] Sorry, but we have to be careful of strangers here. Too dangerous. Maybe you can do some work for Zimmerman.
entries.regguard:127: [with cautious warmth] You're welcome here anytime, of course!
entries.regguard:128: [dismissively] They're both groups of nuts. The Followers want everyone to be peaceful and happy. They don't realize that the world is too harsh for that.
entries.regguard:129: [skeptically] The Children have some sort of god they worship in their Cathedral to the south. They have a hospital, but they're a little too weird to be on the level.
entries.regguard:131: [threateningly matter-of-fact] You'd better put your weapons away while you're here.
entries.scholar:110: [quickly, dismissively] Who travels the halls of the Followers?
entries.scholar:117: [with exasperated slowness] OK. I can see that you are a little slow. Who you?
entries.scholar:125: [condescendingly] You want to help? I think you will need to talk to Nicole or Jake if you want to help us. They have more time for dealing with slower people.
entries.scholar:126: [curtly] OK. Just stay out of trouble around here.
entries.scholar:127: [impatiently] Do you see to end the evil of the Children?
entries.scholar:132: [with smug satisfaction] Excellent! Go talk to Nicole and she will be able to tell you how you can help us.
entries.scholar:133: [scoffingly] The Children are an occult group who worship some dark god. Personally, I think there is something about them that reeks of evil.
entries.scholar:138: [with grudging acknowledgment] They are a strong lot, but I think with someone of your skills, you will be able to get in and help us destroy them.
entries.scholar:141: [coldly dismissive] Suit yourself. If they take over the wastelands, don't say we didn't warn you.
entries.scholar:142: [sighing with impatience] If you talk to Nicole, she will be able to tell you more of what can be done to stop them.
entries.scholar:144: [correcting sharply] Not children. We wouldn't think of harming them. No. These are the Children of the Cathedral. A nasty group of people.
entries.scholar:148: [with professorial pride] We are the Followers of the Apocalypse. We are trying to bring peace to the wastelands.
entries.scholar:152: [earnestly, but still condescending] We are working to bring about tolerance to those in the wastelands for those few unfortunates who have been mutated by man's destructive nature.
entries.scholar:156: [grudgingly] You are right in saying that we, as humans, have been close-minded. However, there is always hope.
entries.scholar:159: [coldly] Be that as it may, your opinion was not requested. Goodbye.
entries.scholar:160: [with weary condescension] A cynic in our midst. I am sure you have your reasons. Regardless, I am certain we can bring about some type of understanding.
entries.scholar:162: [muttering suspiciously] I've heard that the Children have been able to get some of our secrets. I wonder how that is happening?
entries.scholar:166: [with vindicated certainty] Truly? I thought as much myself, but feared that I would never have been able to get much support on the theory.
entries.scholar:170: [thoughtfully, but dismissively] Not really. The only thing I can think of is that the person would have to have access to some information and have access to the outside. You might want to look to the initiates or scouts.
entries.scholar:172: [with satisfaction] Nicole will be pleased, then, to know that I killed the agent.
